column6: Good food, good service and good vibe. Drinks have some Chinese twists. Highly recommend!
10/10. Food, ambience, & drinks were all superb. We had the bird's nest to drink which was absolutely fantastic. Everyone should order the pork belly, yuzu shrimp, and crab fried rice.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Food is great! I like how they present traditional chinese food in a new way! Highly recommend
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really cute Asian inspired speakeasy-esqué cocktail bar with some small bites. If you don't have a res, you will have to wait quite a while, so I would recommend that you make a res before coming. I got the HK Kong cocktail drink and it was quite sweet, with a hint of coffee. There was a bit of whipped cream on top and it tasted like a dessert liquor drink! Would recommend. The portion was a bit small but still very cute.
Great ambience and interesting drinks. The Bird's Nest was very enjoyable, I liked the lollipop on top- it actually tasted like birds nest. Great place to chat with friends.

Unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was less than satisfactory. The prices were quite high for the quality of food served. The portions were small, and the flavors were underwhelming. The atmosphere was also quite loud and not conducive to a relaxing meal. Would not return.

Amazing restaurant paired with amazing food. Loan, the waitress we had was really friendly and accommodating through our dining experience, I was visiting New York and she made the experience so much better. Will be coming back next time I'm in town. Menu was large so it makes me excited to try everything else next time.
Food is pretty mid. Nice decor. Service is nothing to really write about - standard nice enough server.
Love the atmosphere here. The decoration is super pretty. Host and waitress were nice, friendly and attending. The food was beyond my expectation! The short ribs literally melted in my mouth!
No comment

Ambiance is exceptional and the service is also great. They nailed it with the Tulum inspiration. We went for lunch and the guacamole & salsas were our fav. I had the chicken enchiladas (my shellfish allergy limits me) & my husband had the octopus, but we should have perhaps tried something else because neither of us were crazy about our dishes. We may go back to try other options from the longer dinner menu.
No comment
No comment

This restaurant is absolutely beautiful inside. Definitely a great place for some amazing photos. We ordered the beet salad, the lobster soup, the red snapper, the chicken entree, and the corn cake. Everything was delicious with the exception of the chicken, they warned me that it was spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all, it was very salty and I could not eat more than a quarter of it. I felt that the chicken should have been deducted from my bill, but it was not. This place should have more staff to help with the service. What should have been a 90 minute dinner lasted a little over 3 hours. It took the waiter 30 minutes just to bring the check because he was so busy. The restaurant is not as big as it looks on Instagram, I would say there are about 20 tables. Therefore, there should be no reason why the service was so slow, I had plans afterwards that I needed to cancel because of the time constraint. None the less, it was worth the wait.

The vibe & friendly waitress saved this place. The food was cool, but nothing that I'll ever need to have again. I received a text a few hours prior to my reservation letting me know that they recently lost their liquor license and they'd only be serving "mocktails", which was unfortunate. All in all, cool ambiance, very intimate, great staff.

Visited during the first week they were open and it was an incredible experience. From the accommodation, to the service of the staff and management, and of course the amazing food and mocktails! As someone who doesn't drink, the mocktails were outstanding, not just simple syrup and sprite mixture which tells me everything on the menu is careful thought out. I had the pork belly guacamole, bone marrow, lobster soup, and the short rib al carbon, and I would order it all again. 10/10 experience. Will be visiting again soon! I wish I could remember the names of everyone who assisted my friend and I, but 2 staff member is Sandra and Isabella who have been incredible every time I've contacted for more reservations! Well done, Tán!

Dining at Tán felt like a mini vacation away from cold NYC. We had the most exceptional all around experience there. The ambiance, food, and wait staff were all amazing. We highly recommend their lobster tacos, ceviche, and snapper. We will be back to try more dishes soon.

I was really excited to try this restaurant and overall, I was very disappointed. The ambiance was ok, the staff was kind, but not prepared for service, the food was very mediocre, but well presented and they don't have a liquor license. The Mocktails were not that great either. We ordered about 16 different dishes, to share amongst 5 people and only enjoyed the Short Rib (so amazing) and Jumbo Prawns. Everything else, I would rate about a 5. It wasn't the worst dining experience, but it was far from the best. Maybe I would return, when they get a liquor license, just to try the cocktails and to order the short rib again. But that's a very strong maybe. Hopefully they will improve, overtime.

Food was exceptional! Easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in NYC. The guacamole and salsas are so flavorful and the corn tlayudas were a nice elevation to a traditional corn tortilla. The ambiance and decor are beautiful and make you feel transported out of the city. If the mocktails are any indication of what the future cocktails will entail, then we are in for a treat! There are endless options if you are gluten free. We were easily able to swap out the flour tortillas for flavorful corn tortillas on the lobster tacos.

10/10!!!! Yes they don't have their liquor license just yet (which seems to be the only major complaint) I would first like to address that issue. Not only are they kind enough in advance with your reservation booking to tell you this but once we entered the restaurant they reiterated this and confirmed we were okie with this. Mind you, I'm here for the food not the drinks. We did order the mock tails and they were delicious! When they do get their liquor License, i know these drinks will be amazing because the attention to detail. Also, just want to add the ice they used is 10/10 love those small ice chips for drinks. Now to the food! Myself and 3 other ladies ordered a total of 4 starters: dozen oysters, guacamole with the crickets, the beets salad and the tuna tartar. The oysters were tasty they seem to be blue point (forgot to ask but based on size and flavor...) the guacamole was good;I would have loved a more spicer version but still great. Please note it doesn't automatically come with grasshoppers that's is an add on! The grasshoppers didn't add much of a change for the flavor just a slight crunch, don't knock it until your try it! For some, I heard the guacamole is of a smaller portion, if it is your only app then yes! However, if you are ordering multiple apps I believe it was enough for 4 or less to a table. The tuna tartar was amazing, so fresh, perfect size, chopped (not minced) the flavors were so tasty with the foam center. We ended our apps with the baby beets salad. Fresh, summer like flavors in the winter very spot on for  the "Tulum" based ambiance. For my main, I ordered the "Red Snapper Mone Style" wow wow wow. Yes the portion was on the smaller end (but I was content with apps already) but the flavors are bold and beautiful. Something, I have never tasted and there is no comparison! My friends ordered the following and rated their meals a 10/10: Red Snapper Tikin-Xic Style, Sea scallops, seafood enchiladas. So from all 4 meals the Mone Style and Seafood Scallops were of smaller portion as stated earlier but never lacked the tonality of flavors. For dessert please order the corn cake! I HAVE NEVER TASTED A CORN CAKE LIKE THAT. I've ordered Mexican corn cake before and thought somewhat of a cake was going to come out but no! This was something beyond; it's texture was of like a crème brûlée. The small ice cream with it add an extra depth when tried together or separate. Over all, I'm excited to come back and continuous try other items on the menu. The ambiance was beyond beautiful the staff was attentive and very kind. Monica if this ever gets back to you thank you for being such a sweet soul!

No wonder this restaurant is booked up for the next 6 weeks. The staff here goes above and beyond to make your experience 5 stars. The food was delicious and beautifully prepared. They are still waiting on their liquor license, but it didn't even matter because their mocktails were so tasty! I cannot wait to come back here. It really feels like an evening out of NYC when you come here. Congrats on an amazing new restaurant!

Really great food and service! The place is relatively new so the staff does their best to accommodate everyone. I loved the guacamole; it's a simple dish but great when you get it right. The ceviche and tuna tartar were good as well but the octopus was what sold me. Everything was creative and tasty and the corn cake dessert was unique and did not disappoint. I will admit it was a bit pricey but honestly, what new york restaurant isn't. They had mocktails and didn't serve alcohol because of their pending liquor license but I loved that since I don't drink! Would definitely come back again for a special occasion.
Literally feels like you are in Tulum - great food and super sweet staff. Not large portions for price.
No comment

Finally a great vibe in midtown! Tulum vibes for sure. Beautiful place, delicious food, super attentive staff.  Because they're new and still figuring things out, there was a teeny bit of disorganization, but I'd definitely go back once they receive their liquor license. My only real gripe was that they pushed mocktails with the same prices as actual cocktails... no thank you. Great place for both dates and groups.

Wonderful happy hour spot! I had such a blast! The bartender was very knowledgeable and patient. Definitely my new happy hour spot in the city. The Burger is so delightful! Nice and juicy. Same with the Impossible Burger! The fries were on point! Check them out!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great service and the Food is unbelievable the Atmosphere is so amazing Pleasant Stuff and outstanding service
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went in the evening and it was SUPER loud. Could barely hear the people at my table. The food was okay but not spectacular. I got the half chicken and it was good but nothing out of this world (3/5). Wouldn't go back back.

The eggplant parm benedict is mesmerizing, I'd have no issue ordering two of them solely for the taste. Get a reservation especially for game days, the community table isn't worth it. The sports vibe is energetic yet classy. The staff and service is nothing noticeably spectacular.

Stopped in for drinks and to watch the games. There are only two TVs which made visibility tough but I always enjoy this bar for the vibe. It's not too crowded or rowdy as many other bars in the area and offers a great selection of food and drinks. It checks the box between sports bar and fancy restaurant, giving the best of both worlds
No comment

I came here on a Friday night with the girlfriends and it wasn't hard to get a reservation but the place was popping! We all agreed that this would be our new fave casual spot to grab dinner and drinks because the food was delish and the drinks weren't too pricey ($13$-15). We all loved the Mac n cheese & the nachos with steak added, the nachos were incredible!!! The portions were great and everything could be shared. For my entree, I got the branzino and I could go there every day to eat this meal - it was that good!
Delicious clam and toast!! Their new menu is to die for. Love the ambience and service. I know i'll be back to try the rosemary fries...

This restaurant is located on a busy street corner which I personally didn't mind-- despite sitting outside, the noise level wasn't bad. One critique was that the outdoor chairs were particularly uncomfortable. With that said, our waitress was exceptionally kind and helpful, snd the food was generally acceptable. The burgers were greasy (nothing special), but the kale salad was quite good. I'd say the salmon was a touch undercooked. You have to get the cast iron cookie if you eat here.. its easily the best thing on the menu!
Love this place. Friday night, sitting outside. Great social and food. Drinks, food, service in the city, can't beat it. Great night. We will be back.
No comment
No comment

We loved their burgers and service! Great staff. Only giving a 3 star for their cookie skillet ( sorry haha)-- just want them to know it could be improved. It tasted very "sandy" rather than like a soft gooey cookie that I would have wanted (&most people expect). I'm sure it can be improved! Still recommended people go to this place for the other food!! :)
Fish tacos were super yummy! Also got the spinach and kale croquettes and was soooo good will definitely have to go back to try some new things on the menu
No comment
No comment
No comment

GREAT spot for fun drinks with friends. Fun atmosphere and great menu and you can actually have a conversation with someone. Drinks were reasonably priced and the rosemary fries were delicious. Our waitress was also very attentive which was refreshing for nyc bars.
No comment

The menu has a really nice variety. I've been for brunch and dinner and all the food I've tried has been great. Specialty cocktails are also awesome. The whole staff is relaxed, friendly, and always on top of things without feeling overbearing. I also love the ambiance. The size of the restaurant is pretty large for the neighborhood so you don't feel cramped. Outdoor seating is great along first street separated from foot traffic by a little sidewalk garden. I'm definitely turning into a regular here. The bar tender Ash is also so fun to chat and hang with while sitting at the bar.
No comment
No comment
Great food and service. Super fun spot menu has something for everyone. Totally recommend :))

This place was great! My sister and I were in the neighborhood and wanted to get brunch but needed to sit outside because she had her dog. We went to two places prior. The first place was a 2.5 hour wait. The second place wouldn't let her bring her dog in. So we walked a block down and saw Boulton & Watt and they had brunch and outdoor seating available. We sat down immediately. They even offered a bowl of water for the dog, which they brought in an actual little dog bowl. Clearly they are dog friendly. The food was fantastic and the coffee was awesome. I had "The Hangover Sandwich" with rosemary fries. It was amazing. If I'm ever in the neighborhood again we will definitely be back!
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The food is incredible and the drink menu is inspired. I love coming here and having a drink outside on the patio. The staff is so amazing and friendly.
No comment

I had always heard about this place being a fun spot so I decided to head over with some friends to check it out because we were in desperate need of food and drink. We arrived on a Friday night around 6:30 and we had made a reservation at 6 and the place was empty. We got great seating and pretty good food ( the fries are deliciously seasoned). My one complaint is how crumbly the burger was but that could've been my own fault for opting to not get the cheese (which was probably the glue that would hold it together). Besides the crumbly burger it was still good and our drinks were great! Loved the fun names. It definitely started to get crowded by the time we we left and if you wanna go to get food for dinner on a Friday night I would suggest calling ahead of time to reserve space.

Came here for the second time today.  It's a pretty big space so we were seated immediately around prime brunch time (1pm Saturday). I ordered a bloody mary which was just ok and my boyfriend got a mimosa.  For entrees, the hangover sandwich & a burger. My sandwich was BEC meets BLT + avocado, onion and a creamy chipotle sauce and it was amazing. My boyfriend also swears (for the second time) that this is the best burger he's ever eaten. He customized it with mushrooms, jalapeños and cheese and he was super happy with it.  I was happy to see that they had a sour beer option so I got the du claw strawberry sour which I enjoyed as well.  Overall another good experience and we will continue to return.

Fantastic portions found here at brunch! You don't normally get that in NYC, so a big big plus. Our server was so friendly and he was so much fun (he had an accent couldn't remember his name), and was a sport when we caught a bee and trapped it under an empty cup. I ordered the French toast and it was so delicious and rich! It definitely satisfied the sweet tooth, along with the mimosas.
No comment

Nice spot, very busy when we stopped by Saturday late afternoon. They have outdoor seating and a large bar. We grabbed drinks near the bar at a high top and was told we only had the table for 1 hour since they were reserved for a birthday party. Service was ok- we only ordered a side of fries which were good, although some of the girls didn't like the rosemary flavor, I didn't mind! Would like to try more food options and come back for brunch!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food here is pretty good and the restaurant is in a great location if you plan on bar hopping afterwards. However, considering the prices the staff could be a bit nicer. On a few occasions, the staff was cold and mean unprovoked. We felt rushed, and judged for our selections, and were met with eye rolls and attitude. This is place won't see me again.
No comment
No comment

Absolutely amazing. Food, cocktails, service, was all unbelievable. Make sure to ask for Simone, she is absolutely amazing. Could not have been more helpful with food and drink recommendations. Easy 5/5

The restaurant has a really great vibe with large portions. I had an impossible burger with a large helping of fries, and it was delicious! I also liked the ambience. It was an overall great experience with good service. Highly recommends

So the servers were super nice to comp my meal since computers were down and they totally screwed my burger order, but I was kinda underwhelmed? Everyone was nice; it was 'fine' I guess, and it was a rainy mid-week day so maybe I went at the wrong time? But yea...I'd go to other spots for a casual burger or brunch...
No comment

Was super impressed with the food from this place. I must have passed by this place over 1000x and I'm so upset it took me this long to try this place the food was amazing. The burger was cooked perfect and it was delicious. I wish the chicken sliders came with more of them. Next time I will have to have 2 orders of them. The cauliflower gratin was a surprise home run. 100% will be dining here more often.
No comment

This place has awesome food/drinks/service. Every time we go our waiters are incredibly friendly and checked in a perfect amount of times. The brunch menu is amazing, and they have great coffee. Their buratta is also amazing. Drinks were solid, unique, and fairly priced. Happy this place is open!

Great happy hour! Cocktails are great too and I really enjoyed this lavender drink I had. Menu options are solid both for small plates and larger entrees. I had the braised shortrib toast that was delicious. Since this is near my job I'm sure I'll be back.
No comment
No comment
How does a bar run out of their $5 shots and provide no substitutes? Definitely not cool...

So delicious! Many places in Manhattan are all somewhat similar to one another, but this one is different than the rest! Absolutely delicious, fresh food, good choices. It was so good... we came for brunch & came back at night for the Cast Iron Cookie! recommend.
No comment
No comment

We almost skipped going in as so many places look just like this. What a mistake that would have been. The food was on point from the perfectly cooked eggs, to the sauces and house-made sausage and bacon. I ordered the short rib and bone marrow benedict, my best friend ordered the cheddar grits with poached egg and chorizo. Both were so good! Service was just ok, as we were ignored trying to get drink refills, but we would definitely go back. You can also make a reservation on Open Table.

From the exceptional service to the perfectly developed food constructs this place is winning...which means my nutritionist is officially losing. I wish they had the fried green tomatoes available on the menu but that may be a seasonal thing. However they did have the various forms of stone ground grits and cheese options. And my friend had something that looked like the dream state of texas toast. Either way, it was all good and yummy. I recommend everything but the skillet cookie with milk, which registered as a bit bland to me and with slightly too much baking powder.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Cool place! Came here on a Sunday for brunch and they had $6 bloody marys, $6 sangrias, and $6 mimosas. The vibe is nice and cozy and the fries are delicious. Crispy and perfectly seasoned! Would come here again.
No comment
No comment

I loved the interior wood theme so I scheduled a cmb brunch date and I scored a table near the window. It was a fun seat! I ordered the veggie burger with cheddar grits. The veggie burger tasted better without the bun. The bun was too big and just added unnecessary carbs to my breakfast. The patty was more on the dry side so I was hesitant to let my date try my burger because I didn't want his first experience with a veggie burger to suck. He tried it and wasn't so fond of it. He had the steak and eggs and enjoyed his meal a great deal. How were these grits? Better than my first experience with cheesy grits in NYC but still not comparable to southern cheesy grits. I'm not sure what the south does to their grits but those are something to crave for.
No comment
Great food when open - but as of 7/13/20 this place is still closed. No updates from their social media accounts either and rumors have begun to circulate.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday. Mac and cheese and side of bacon were surprisingly delicious, and I have high standards for Mac and cheese. Eggplant benedict was not impressive. My friend ordered the cauliflower soufflé and it was very watery! Watts mimosa was great and strong. Waitress was nice, but the place is understaffed so the service was slow. The place is pretty rowdy.

Came here specifically for the cookie. Was a bit hungry so decided to try the Mac and cheese before having dessert. The Mac and cheese was good, nothing special, a little over priced for the handful they give you. The cookie was also nothing special. Looks good in picture though especially when you pour the milk over it. When it comes down to it, it's just a cookie. Save your money.
No comment

No comment

The burger was really good and I loved the chopped thick bacon that I added as an extra. I wasn't a huge fan of the bun it came on, it was dry and the bottom section became soggy after a few minutes. The fries were also great and really well seasoned.
No comment
When here on a whim while in NYC on a trip. Food did not disappoint. Staff was super nice and very helpful. The vinegar and herb fries were out of this world!!!

Met some friends here for dinner. We each enjoyed our meals. I had the Crispy Quinoa and Kale Salad with chicken and it was delicious. My friend enjoyed her Baked Goat Cheese snack with flat bread. Only con was music was too loud and I couldn't really hear my friends talk.

I booked a Wednesday afternoon for 11 people (pre-wedding family brunch!). The long table in the center was PERFECT! Even though there was only one person on staff, we still had fun and excellent service. The food was great - something for everyone. My family really had a great experience, as most are not from NYC.  I had the avocado toast and calamari. Not heavy and very tasty. The cocktails were excellent and diverse.

Awesome place, the food here will leave you wishing you had two stomachs. My wife and I had the fish tacos and fish and chips. Boulton and Watt is probably known for burgers, but you need to try both of these dishes, especially the tacos. Good beer selection too, cheers.

The drinks in this place were made just right. Not sure if it's always like this but I'd come back here and try again. Their Mac and cheese with bacon bits is a must do!! Dinner was ok but I really enjoyed their fresh fries so I can't complain. Casual place with a very welcoming vibe.
No comment

We came for brunch and did not disappoint. The corner restaurant with all open windows, cool interior decor, outdoor seating and awesome waitstaff complement the amazing food. The rosé sangria was awesome and perfect for summer. The Mac and cheese with bacon was perfection and the stone ground cheese grits rival anything in the south (and I live in the south and eat grits weekly and it is my favorite starchy side). I could have spent hours hear just having sangria or mimosas and obviously they agree with board games people can play!  I bought a shirt I liked I that match (mind you they don't just sell them, but did sell me one ) one of my favorites

I always come by on off hours this is the first time on a crowded Sunday. Everyone is very nice a tad slow on the service but not the worst. Ordered the quinoa salad with shrimp and the eggplant Benedict's  tasty and decent quantity too. The bar has good beer and spirits this time around we rolled with cerveza ! Good selection. The food rolled out quickly which was nice made up for the wait time. Overall good spot gets crowded average age 25ish on brunch days. I like the senior citizen hours in this place. Always quiet and no wait time.  One thing fried green tomatoes should be on all the menus lunch and dinner!!!!!!!! Saturday thru Sunday!
No comment
No comment

Karlene is the most awesome waitress in the LES!  Superb atmosphere and drink list... and don't forget the rosemary fries!  Ya can't go wrong with the punch bowls and def sure to come back for more esp on Sunday when Karlene is working!
No comment
Bathroom was somewhat dirty. Mac N'Cheese was great. Fries and ranch were good too. A good bar overall.
No comment

No comment

Loud, but good. Nice beer selection. Very tasty food. We tried pickles, Brussels, steak tartare and spaghetti. All exceptionally tasty. With great friendly service. Atmosphere vibrant but it was very loud and hard to be heard.
No comment

Insanely friendly and helpful staff and great snack plates! We came here on New Year's Eve with our 3 year old, and we were immediately seated in a huge booth, just the 3 of us, that could easily have been a 6-top, and then our daughters order was promptly taken and brought out for her. The waiters were also incredibly attentive and brought our kiddo a free dessert! Such nice guys! Love this place and will keep on my list of good food/good for kids places!! Thank you fellas!!

Made a reservation, pretty packed for a Sunday. Great spot to watch a game and for large groups. Service was fine. Food was delicious. Only negative here are the bloody Mary's. Worst I've ever had. Don't bother. Even for $6... still not worth it.
No comment

Matthew Is the salt bae of drinks. Not only does he make a mean cocktail but he loves his craft. Just watching him make your drink is entertaining. Ben here 3 days in a row since I moved into the neighborhood. I have to give the food credit too! Everything on the menu is amazing!
No comment
The brunch was fantastic! I had the special salmon Benedict and they gave a hefty portion of salmon. The eggs were perfectly cooked and the atmosphere was a lot of fun! Would definitely recommend!
No comment

No comment

Great bar and brunch spot. Highly recommend the poached eggs and bone marrow on toast for brunch. Great burgers too. Place can get very busy on weekends. Only negative can sometimes be that the bartenders are a bit snarky and don't have the greatest attitudes. Servers have always been delightful though. Great interior and exterior seating and decor!

Not 5 as in 'you'll never eat a better meal', but a 5 in the 'you are going to get exactly what you expect and maybe a little more'!  Fast service, big portions, fresh ingredients and fries that are the way fried are supposed to be (if you like thin and crispy rather than fat and mushy!).  We had burgers and the chicken salad... no complaints.  Sat outside and we were even treated to a rainbow, come on!  Ok, the rainbow added a star for sure!
Solid spot that is open late, even on holidays.  Good drinks, good food and great service.  They have an excellent location as well.

One of my favorite drink and brunch places in east village NYC.  The cocktail options are original and include unique ingredients.  The decor I can only explain as sort of a rustic almost machinery warehouse type with various old antique tools and other artifacts.  The fans above are my favorite part!  They have a jalapeño tequila drink that is out of this world called the Mexican revolver!  Probably one of my top 5 favorite bars in NYC!

The Wild Mushrooms and Green Bean Gratin was       a-fucking-mazing, the Fried Green Tomato Caprese was excellent and my burger was top 10 burgers I've ever tried. The Beer selection was decent, and sunce they had one of my go-to beers  I was good.

My personal favorite local happy hour/dinner spot. Located on Essex and Avenue A. Great outdoor seating in the summer, great ambiance, great staff and really well run. I love this place totally Ocean approved:))
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Ending up going to Boulton & Watt for brunch and really enjoyed the experience.  They take reservations, which is a huge plus, and sat us very fast.  The food was very good and the prices were a bit high, but not unreasonable.  I wish they would have had a regular Eggs Benedict, however I understand that they want to serve unique items.  I ended up getting the Cheese Grits and I thought it was great!  The serving was so large that I had a hard time finishing it all.  I look forward to coming back here to try out their lunch and dinner menu!

Had the burrito bowl and added chicken. It was loaded with flavor and a large portion for $18 by NYC standards. BF got the chicken tacos which were packed and very tasty. Only downside was it was very loud and hard to hear one another while sitting very close but restaurant had good beer and good vibes.
No comment

Mexican revolver is where it's at - jalapeño, agave, champagne, and lime. Came here for drinks and it's got a fair amount of space for large parties.  Service was good and would check this place out again if I'm in the area.
No comment

If you head to Katz deli and find a line a million miles long and are too hungry to wait, I hope you as lucky as we were to find this spot instead! Relaxed sophisticated pub with amazing food and fabulous friendly service. Highly recommend the Bibb leaf salad and The Burger. Quick delivery of food to table but no rush to leave- one of those places be glad to hang out for hours. I'll come back here for sure.

My friends and I had dinner and drinks here and it was amazing. The rum bowl was really good..there was a lot of ice in it though. We ordered a bunch of small plates, the kale dip, lobster Mac n cheese bites and chicken sliders. It got more crowded later on and the vibe was fun and casual.
No comment
No comment

The portions are HUGE. I got a burger (added blue cheese) and fries - fries were AMAZING! The rosemary oil they use is to die for; the blue cheese was very good quality too, perfect texture and flavor. I ended up only being able to eat half the meal, so I took the rest home. Beau got his burger with bacon (it was the bacon cubes, not slices...meh, fancy decision but not sure it was the right one...and yes foodies, I know there's a proper name for the cubes, can't remember it now and opted not to google in the middle of my review)...and selected Brussels sprouts instead of fries (small up charge). The Brussels sprouts were some of the best I've EVER had. Perfectly crisp on the outside, yet still tender on the inside and bursting with flavor. I would come back just for these.

No comment
No comment

Boulton & Watt's desserts are SO GOOD (5/5). I've been to B&W ~15 times, and I'd say about 12 of those times were just for dessert.  The actual food is also pretty good- great burgers (4/5). The servers are great. The atmosphere is cute; very rustic. Only cons-the place reeks of beer (in the summer i prefer to sit outside), and is generally really, really loud (also why I prefer to sit outside). Overall, I can get over the smell and the noise for their rocking desserts!! Everyone needs to try the cookie skillet (gooey inside, crisp outside and comes with milk) ASAP.

Came here for an early NYE dinner with the family. I knew that I wanted the Quinoa & Kale salad and maybe the mac & cheese because the rest of the menu seemed too heavy for me. Wow!! Was I wrong. Everyone was so thrilled with all the dishes.  The cozy atmosphere and attentive service made the night extra special. We started with the mac & cheese, burrata, bone marrow toast, and brats in a blanket. I'm not a big meat eater but the brats in a blanket were absolutely delicious. We ordered the beef Wellington, squash spaghetti with eggplant meatballs, fish tacos, gnocchi, and of course the Quinoa & Kale salad. I wish we were hungrier; I wanted to try the butternut squash raviolis too.  Oh! And the hot apple cider hit the spot on a chilly night.  Thank you to the staff for a wonderful experience to help ring in the new year!
No comment

Love this place! I live right down the street and I love bringing my dog here and sitting outside. Some of the best French fries in the city! So good! Great prices and overall fun atmosphere. Love coming here for and end of the night pit stop.
No comment

Threw a little get together here on a Saturday night and they were great! Attentive staff (she literally managed 5-6 tabs out of a group of ~20ppl), reasonably priced drinks, the food looked good, and the music was downtempo and so chill.  Lots of rnb and some alternative music (think lykke Li or little dragon), which was perfect for 10-11pm. I honestly couldn't have asked for anything more!

Got a burger for a late lunch on a Monday afternoon.. Couldn't have been better.. it was nice out and the breeze coming through the building made me feel like I was on vacation. There were two guys working and they were quick, friendly, and welcoming.. the burger was perfectly cooked and I asked for bacon on my burger. The little bacon cubes were a nice touch. I'll be back for sure.. probably tomorrow.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
We just ordered the chicken pot pie for delivery and it is so salty. Will not order this again.
No comment
No comment
It's a cool place to hang out with friends. I just wanted to try the cookie and it was just not what I expected. The cookie was just ehh...
No comment

I haven't been here for quite some time but decided to bring some friends of mine to check it out since I've always loved coming here in the passed..as soon as we walked in we saw how packed it was, thankfully we were able to find some spots by the bar. Everyone who worked there was very helpful and kind, our bartender was Josh who truly rocked our night! He made killer drink recommendations as well as food recommendations (the croquettes were to die for) even though it was extremely busy he was very attentive to us and service was impeccable all around! This place will continue to be one of my favorite spots to go and I'll definitely recommend this place to more friends, the food, the drinks and the staff are all a 5/5, can't wait to come back again!
Went for happy hour and ended up getting dinner there too. The food was so good! Try the salmon! I was pleasantly surprised. The service was ok but the food made up for everything!

Came here for a birthday dinner with 16 people and the service was really on point especially for such a busy place. Unfortunately, that was the only good thing about this place. The food was very blah. Had the chicken pot pie and truffle fries but it was nothing special. Tried the brick chicken though and it was the best dish of the night. Cocktails were nothing special either although I know it's not exactly a cocktail bar kind of place. Had the Mexican Revolver so avoid that.

I can't comment on the dining in here since I only ordered  takeout. I had the steak frites and it was absolutely delicious. It comes with delicious baked garlic and sauce. The fries were also really flavorful and crispy. The price is also reasonable for the quality you are getting.
No comment

The service was pretty good despite the wait for my cocktail.The Warm Kale and Artichoke is a great starter and the Amish Chicken is highly recommended and the Steak Frites.Since the weather was nice it's great for curbside dinning.
No comment

Went here with friends at 11:15 PM on a Sunday. We asked if it was too late or inconvenient to get some bites and a bottle of wine. They were so kind and accommodating. Luis, our server was fantastic and friendly, despite a late Sunday night crown as well as another person who might have been another server or possibly a really hands-on attentive manager. The food was delicious. Calamari, croquettes, Brussels sprouts, burrata. All delicious and interesting. If you need a delicious late night wine and dine on the LES, look no further.
No comment
No comment

This place is awesome. The hamburger came out perfect. It was juicy and full of flavor. Not to mention the french fries. Definitely try their green beans. 5/5 for sure. Oh and you have to go there for lunch! The special is a steal. $15 for a sandwich drink and jar of pickles
No comment

Good service, nice venue inside and out. Been for after work drinks and brunch and both are good. There's a few outdoor tables for brunch which we snagged and was great. Veggie burger was delicious. Drinks specials from 10-4. Would recommend this place for both brunch and after work drinks!
No comment

After the winter from hell in Boston, eating dinner outside in April during a weekend jaunt to NYC was a freaking dream. We shared the goat cheese, the incredible beet and kale salad (OMGGGGGGG so good), and veggie burger. I wish we had room for dessert but that'll have to be next time.
No comment

column3: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment

Safe bet on restaurants in the area, especially in your in this area of Manhattan. Good bet is the hamburger with sea salted fries as a good staple. The barkeeper's are talented at making the right cocktails of your choice. Start our with the pickle options. I'm a big fan of the beets, brussel sprouts and pineapple, not in any particular order.

Came here for Easter brunch and was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. My only warning though: do NOT order dessert. It is bland and a waste of money. The entrees though are wonderful! I had the avocado toast and devoured every bite. Four other entrees were ordered by my group and they all were enjoyed. I'd DEFINITELY come here for brunch and if they could up their dessert game this will be a five star spot!

I visited this restaurant for a book club meeting. It wasn't a good choice of place simply because he music was kind of loud and it was hard to hear each other. This is a mixey spot. I think if you're trying to have w fun night out you would have w good time here. The menu is, in my opinion a little overpriced. I had a spinach and riddichio salad. The saad alone was $13 I also opted to add shrimp that was another $6. It was pretty good. It had apples and nuts in it. The waitstaff was not very friendly though. I would not return to dine here.

Food was pretty average for a brunch but had some interesting options for different types of eaters. The staff was accommodating although they did mess up a bit but nothing that couldn't be fixed. Overall, great experience and pretty affordable.

Came here on Sunday for my birthday brunch and was blown away by the service and food! This place is great for groups. The atmosphere is great, but not too crazy.. perfect brunch spot! Couldn't have picked a better place to celebrate my birthday.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The best French onion soup I've ever had. Friendly attentive staff but did not hover.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great great food and service! I had amazing mahi mahi tacos. Just don't come here for new years if you want to dance.... slow rap and nothing you could sing to! Also, the $30 meal and $70 drinks can be found at other places for cheaper. Only reason im not giving a five star is from the disappointment from new years.

Came for drinks on a rainy night for a party - had the inspector Clousseau (bourbon based) and Orange is the new Orange (gin based). Both tasty but lacking in alcohol content - especially the bourbon cocktail. Very loud bar to be in after 10, especially on weekends, but the staff here are really cool/chill (especially Devin) and that makes it all better! I love the feel of this place - very open and airy when the doors are open, and the high ceilings help with that!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Friday night for dinner.  Good atmosphere and crowd.  Everyone's food was delicious.  Had the soft shell crab special, which I recommend.  Only negative was the service.  We were a party of eight and two people's drinks didn't arrive until after food was served, despite asking politely 3x.  Servers had sass.
No comment
No comment

I've been here for brunch multiple times and keep coming back because the staff is so nice and I've never been disappointed in the food.  The most recent time I came for brunch most of our party was running very late.  Instead of giving up my reservation or making me stand and wait, the hostess sat me down at the best table and I was given a complimentary mimosa while I kept myself company.  I really appreciated how nice they were, and literally every item I've ever ordered off the menu has been good.  I think my favorite dishes are the braised short rib benedict or the crispy quinoa and kale salad if I'm feeling healthier -- I realize the last one doesn't sound super flavorful but it definitely is!
No comment
No comment

I was very excited to come here for dinner because their menu is so different and everything sounded amazing. Came in here on a Friday night with a large group of 15 for dinner/drinks after watching a play. The ambience was cool but very very loud. Hard to speak to the person across from you. They were very busy when we got there. From their creative menu, I was in between ordering the veggie burger or duck confit carbonara. Needless to say, I should have ordered the veggie burger. The duck was so salty I couldn't even eat it. I ended up eating around it but even the pasta was lacking creaminess. Not a fan at all. My coworkers nicely gave me half of her veggie burger which was delicious! (Dammit I should have gotten that!). Their fries had a weird perfumy after taste. My friend ordered the steak frites and the steak was lacking major flavor. Pricey place too. Overall it was kind of a let down. Probably won't be back
No comment
Great place with an industrial motif. Good draft and bottle/can craft line up. Has the chix sliders. Very tasty

E started it to visit another location which was booked for a private party.  We walked across the street seeing this sign and gave it a shot.  Host was nice and sat us directly. Then Olivia our server showed up. She was "Spectacular "!   Took our order and followed up on service with us through out the meal. Salad and Fish n Chips were great as well as the drinks.  Even more, since our arrival this was the most physical room we had at a table!  Finally no one else sitting so close like they were touching me!  In the end  great experience!!
No comment
No comment

We came in during a slow lunch period. The waiters were really slow and not so attentive which was odd to me because of the time of the day. They missed a few specific requests that we had for our meal. For example, my friend asked for a fried egg on her burger and it didn't happen. Despite all of this, the food was pretty good. I have the crispy chicken sandwich. It was on point. I would probably come back but hopefully the waiters won't be as slow!

Came in here for a late night bite on a Friday night and it was great! We ordered the burger and the Mac and cheese small plate and both were delicious. The service was great and we did not have to wait for a table considering it was a Friday night. Overall, I'm glad we stumbled across this spot.

Great selection of pub food. The fish and chips were well battered and fried. We also got some tasty appetizers that were popular among the group. Would recommend their hummus and taquitos. Good selection of beer and overall a good experience. The only thing we didn't like about this place was the music selection. It was pretty clear someone was sitting in the corner DJing on their phone. Justin Bieber to Bruce Springsteen to Lady Gaga to U2 is a very strange mix. Leave the music alone!

One of my favorite brunch spots in the city. Cheap brunch drinks and consistently good brunch food and never has a wait. If you can snag a spot outside on a nice day you have prime location for people watching. Everything on the brunch menu is really good-- try their twists on eggs Benedict, all tasty! Their pancakes are just above average and were my least favorite thing I've had on their menu. They have a great burger if you're a burger person (disclosure: I am a burger person). The service is fast and helpful. Love eating here on a sunny Sunday
No comment
No comment

We've been wanting to go here for a while now. Went this past weekend for Easter. As the weather was in the mid 80s outdoor seating was a plus! Good menu selection. I decided to go with bacon and gritz. It has a weird name & typically comes with sausage. It was really good except I did not enjoy the reddish sauce. It tasted a bit curry like- a tad spicy. My bday had the French toast. The flavor was delightful but the texture was not for either of us. Way to gooy and slimmy. The brunch cocktails are only $6. Huge cups of coffee. The waitstaff were friendly- even left my cc behind and went back to retrieve it without a hassle. I would prob try it out for happy hour and dinner.
No comment
No comment

Fell in love with Boulton & Watt on my first visit! Amazing brunch spot with a very hipster spot. They offer board games too! I ordered the lamb braised omelette, eggs benedict with pork sausage, caramelised grapefruit and brownie in a jar. I will definitely be back! I'd recommend placing a reservation to secure your spot, but I got lucky last time with available space at the bar.
Thought this place was great. Atmosphere is awesome. Food & drinks were also really good!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Solid food at reasonable prices. Excellent service. Kale and quinoa salad was very good.

i'm a total ho for pickle back shots and a quality veggie burger, so this spot gets me. sundays are a good vibe and there are tv's for all y'all football freaks. if you want my esteemed opinion (c'mon i know ya do!), the evening scene is rowdy and fun, but this place really is more of a restaurant than an evening, drinks-only spot. haven't met a bartender here that i didn't like.
Great food and great beers. I had the tuna blt amazing  sandwich with a nice left hand beer.
No comment
This place was a plan B after plan A at Sweet Chick fell thru. Nonetheless great find.
No comment

I've been here a few times for drinks and brunch and it's always such a pleasant time. The servers are exceptionally nice and friendly, the atmosphere is great for groups or dates, and the brunch portions are really large for decent prices. One of my go-tos in NYC.

The food here is enjoyable. Love brunch and the cookies and milk for dessert. Wouldn't be my first choice to come back to in the area because the staff treats you like they would rather not have you in the restaurant. I've been here three times and service got worse each time I came back. Plenty of other great restaurants in the area to put up with grumpy servers and diva male bartenders
What can I say about this place?  It's a lot like Cooper's except there's no TV's.  Generally, this place tends to get a decent looking crowd that stays fairly late.  Good place for a pick up!
No comment
No comment

Great food for a bar! I highly recommend their Mac and cheese! A decent selection of beers as well. My only complaint is that it is rather dead during the week considering it is the LES/ East Village area.
No comment
No comment

I came here for dinner last Friday, July 19th. This place is great. The food, ambience, and staff were terrific. I had the steak with fries and it was delicious. Even though it's a bit pricy, it's still worth it. For dessert, I had the cookie skillet w/milk. No words could describe the size of the smile on my face. Not only was I stuffed, I was unbelievably happy. I highly recommend everyone to try out this place. Make sure you have a reservation prior to coming thru tho.
No comment

Nice place to go with friends for drinks in LES. They had outdoor seating, our server was great. The maitre d' was pretty weird, she had weird facial expressions and seemed a little hostile. Other than that, I would recommend this place. Very spacious.

I just have to say how much I love this place. The drinks are great and the food even better. If and when you go you have to get the pickled pineapple, insane! If you're lucky they will add the gnocchi dish to the menu permanently. The best texture in gnocchi I've ever had. They were like orgasmic pillows of love that gently massage your palate while eating them. This place is a gem. It does get loud on the weekends, but it's the weekend so who cares. Can't wait to go back.

I'm all for gastropubs and high-end beer and bar food, but this place fell a bit short for me. The rustic decor is pretty cool, the total opposite of what was once Nice Guy Eddie's. There's 10 craft beers on draft and 8 bottle selections. Happy hour prices were solid, 5 bucks for my beer. Didn't try any cocktails but I've heard good things. As far as the food, the fried calamari was wayyy too salty for me. I had to drench it in lemon. I have low sodium eating habits, so that could just be me. The bibb lettuce salad was small and kind of sad looking considering the price. Same with the artichoke ravioli, it looked pretty but tasted okay. Overall, it was okay, a little pricey, but I enjoyed my beers. Maybe I'll come back for brunch.

I stumbled upon this place for a Saturday brunch. It has a nice atmosphere and friendly waitstaff. We both were in the mood for something both savory and sweet, so we decided to split two entrees. We split the spinach & sriracha egg benedict as well as an order of the french toast. Both dishes were delicious. For drinks, I tried a citrus beer and my friend had a mimosa. Unfortunately, our table was wobbly and our drinks spelt quite often. However, we informed our waiter of this and the manager came over and removed the drinks from our bill. Great customer service! Would definitely return to try the chocolate chip cookie.

Had the chicken and my wife had the burger. Both were delicious, the only complaint and the reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is because it is very noisey. Loud music, loud place. Food though is a home run.
No comment

Sat down. Table was dirty. Went to a new table. That table was dirty. Went to a third table. Was also dirty. Had to ask someone to wipe it down.  My corn appetizer came out cold and they never checked back to see if everything was good. Wanted to order a side of mashed potatoes but she said the kitchen was now closed, usually we get a heads up in case we wanted desert or something. Then a 8 top walks in and they let them order food when she just told me the kitchen was closed.  Also no soap in BOTH of the bathrooms. Food wasn't that good. Disappointed
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had the brick pressed chicken and it was absolutely delicious. Our table was extremely off-balance and they were really nice about fixing it. I also thought the vibe/decor/scene was great. Can't beat 6 dollar drafts and wine for happy hour. I'll definitely be coming back.
No comment
I was impressed with this place. Had the burger and got a helping of their pickles. Sampled a few of their drinks as well. All was good. The venue is pretty neat as well. Check it out.
No comment

Came here on Sunday morning because the ambiance looked good, but the restaurant seemed overwhelmed! Sat at the bar and were crowded by Jersey Shore lookalikes, bartender was a little all over the place and when we got our food it was ok, not phenomenal.
No comment

This place is a fire brunch spot. I tried the French toast and my GF got salmon benedict. Both were really really good. And I was surprised how quickly it came out. Also it was great that they had outdoor seating. I came with my dog and sat out on a perfect day.
Fantastic destination for a casual evening with standards for atmosphere, food and service. All are wonderful at Boulton & Watt. Great veggie burger.

Had a group event at Boulton & Watt, which is down the block from Angelina Cafe, one of my favorites.  The waitress was very helpful and attentive to our group.  The place is loud and it was crowded on a Wednesday.  Drinks were average Manhattan price with a wheat beer going for $8.  Many people in the group got cocktails, and they were satisfied.

Great selection of beers and cocktails. The food was very good- highly recommend the chickpea fries (so unique and delicious)- we ended up getting a second order! The calamari came with more fried (hot) peppers than actual calamari which was a little disappointing, and the service could have been a little better, but overall was a nice experience, and a unique atmosphere to bring out-of-towners to!
No comment

There was a hair in my friend's water glass, a hair in her food, and a hair IN MY STRAW that I sipped up (barf). Waitress was so cold and actually rolled her eyes at us today just because we said we were still waiting for a friend. Food was decent but served cold. Got one of the Benedicts and the egg did not run, it was overcooked. Sangria was flavorless. Bathroom was dirty (no paper towels and the soap was watered down which made me weary). Only thing I really liked was that it wasn't too crowded so we could hang out there for a while (although is emptiness a telling sign?)

Really good food, friendly service, great location.  The only thing is it's REALLLLLLLY loud.   Like, don't come here if you plan in having a conversation.  It's not really their fault but just a warning.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I ordered the burger with the french fries.  The french fries were over seasoned with something and I felt like I was eating a christmas tree.
Awesome spot with evening sun, happy hour till 7pm, fast service, and great guac and cocktails!! ($8 during hh). perfect for friday after work!!
No comment
No comment

Great brunch service. It was easy to make and alter the reservations. The host and wait staff were warm and welcoming. The food and drinks were amazing. I had a refreshing and pulpy mimosa and the cast iron egg skillet with farro and kale. The food was flavorful and all around delicious.

We never give bad reviews and very rarely provide any reviews unless we were impressed on many levels. If you are in the area we highly recommend B&W. Great industrial vibe to the place and very good chef driven menu. Great menu with diverse options. Incredibly creative dishes. A must do!
No comment
Love the cookie in a skillet! So chewy! The portion is huge so I suggest sharing it with someone! ;)
No comment
No comment
No comment

For those of you that didn't give this place 5 stars....I dont know what you ate. Because I think i ate almost everything on the menu and it was all Great! Nice ambiance & service was very good. Very reasonable prices and portions are plentiful. And the sauté Kale is the best thing almost ever!

After doing Escape The Room, my friends and I had brunch at Boulton & Watt. We were seated  earlier than expected, which was nice, and appreciated the chill atmosphere there. Now, for the food. I ordered the Short Rib Benedict with a mimosa (which is not your average mimosa) and was perfectly satisfied. The food is relatively inexpensive compared to other brunch spots in the area and does not compromise its quality at all. I would recommend this spot to anyone!
Loud, full of bros, sub-par food, mediocre service and trying too hard with the decor. Hard to find much to make me want to come back.

A tentative 5 stars as I haven't really eaten here yet (or tried the cocktails).  My husband and I came in on Christmas and had beers and that delicious cookie masterpiece.  We went 20 minutes out of our way for it and it did not disappoint. My only criticism would be the milk being served in a small pitcher.  We poured a little milk on the cookie and it ruined it by making it soggy and sopping up the flavor.  I think the milk is best drank on the side, but maybe that's just me.  The bartender was busy, flying around making cocktails and such so we can't really comment on service either although it appeared he had things under control.  The menu looks delicious.  I want to come back and try the food!  Cool, industrial vibe, too.  Very on-trend.
No comment

This is one of if not my favorite spot in Manhattan. The managers there treat you very well, wait staff is great, really good beer and some interesting cocktails. Setting is so great with all the wood and a very cool ceiling fan system haha. Then the FOOD. Pickle jars every time. Curried cauliflower is the best. Brunch items like pancakes and their benedicts are so awesome. And it's all reasonably priced. Couldn't recommend this place more highly.
No comment

I live right across Boulton & Watt and the service is usually great. It's the only sports bar near my apartment known for viewing games, so my friend and I came excited to watch the World Cup. However, when we were seated at the bar, we were instantly met with sarcasm and hostility from the bartender. He was incredibly rude and judgmental from the start, acting as if he didn't understand what we were doing there. Multiple times throughout our meal he made unnecessary comments and rolled his eyes throughout serving us. Incredibly disappointed and disgusted with his attitude and the service here because Boulton & Watt has other amazing servers. The bartender is definitely not one of them and lacks any sense of professionalism. Do yourself a favor and sit at another table or take your business elsewhere.

Wow - I was blown away by the quality, flavors, and creative menu at Boulton and Watt.  We ordered the mac and cheese (yum!), the burrata (oh so good!), the fried green tomatoes caprese (loved it!), the quinoa salad (awesome!), and the veggie burger (I was less excited about this but my friends loved it).  We also tried to order the warm kale and artichoke fondue, but sadly they were out of it - sigh - guess I'll have to go back :).  We ended the meal with some very tasty desserts: brownie batter in a jar, chocolate banana bread pudding, and mini-ice cream cones with salted-caramel ice cream.  All so, so good.  I also liked the industrial ambiance and large open space.  Looking forward to coming back for more!
No comment

This place has great food.  I do have a small complaint about service.  My party sat at one of the community tables. Our cocktails and water glasses went empty for quite a while.  We ended up having to flag down servers to get refills, which is not good service. Good servers keep an eye on how their tables are doing and anticipate the needs of their guests.  If the servers are too overwhelmed with tables to accomplish this, then management needs to assign fewer tables to each server.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Disappointed.Though the Kelso IPA was good and the bartenders friendly and attentive, the burger was tasteless and the fries were overpowering awful.  Also, a mid-range pub like this should have a TV or two.
No comment
No comment
Great food, better service. Karlene was the best waitress I've ever had. The owners should shake her hand!
No comment
No comment

We took a tapas approach and ordered a number of Snacks to share family-style. The Snacks were heavy, but very tasty. Stand outs included Guacamole, the Fries, and the flavorful Robiola but we really enjoyed everything. Extra points for not charging a fixed-price menu on New Year's Eve!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Decided to come here last week on 2/13/18 to grab drinks and ordered a Pumpkin Hummus. Ended up being food poisoned, sick for days and currently still trying to recover. Not sure how your kitchen staff handled the food while prepping for it, but I'm really disappointed at this place considering this was my new favorite chill spot with friends.

This place had me at $5 mimosas. There was so many things on the menu I wanted to try. This has to be one of my favorite brunch spots!! I was 100000 percent satisfied. The food is delicious. All of it !!! Def a place every one should try. Love the Rosemary fries too !

This place seems to be a girl magnet.  Modern decor; sort of upscale.  Lots of seating at the bar plus plenty of tables.  Attracts a younger crowd - maybe two girls for every guy. Not something that I see very often.   I stopped in briefly on my way to an event down the street.

Came here the other night with some friends for dinner. We shared the fried calamari and the chips and guacamole, both of which were good but nothing extraordinary. I went with the Wild Mushroom Bolognaise which was delicious. It had pesto, ricotta cheese, and a little bit of a kick. A bunch of my friends got the fish tacos which they seemed to enjoy and another one got the Artichoke and Goat Cheese Ravioli. Overall the food was pretty good and our waitress was very nice. It was just a little pricey for the amount of food we got.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Walked into this joint randomly with a friend for a drink and was instantly greeted by the staff. We were seated at a high top and our server Suzy was gracious and attentive. I got a gin and tonic and my friend a craft beer. Really cute decor,clean bathrooms and great service! Would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment

I come to B&W about twice a week with my cousin. Admittedly, we are pretty easy to please with food, but not easy to please with service. Both of us would like to say Brian is without a doubt the best bartender ever. Although he also serves as our server (as we elect to eat at the bar, and not a table), he pays attention to what the customer wants, and how they want it. Sean (could also be spelled Shawn) is pretty freaking great too. This week, we met Lee, and she was fabulous and just as sweet as the rest. I think the manager's name is Paul. They have a great team! Lots of changing specials food-wise. Check them out!!
No comment

No comment
No comment

The blackened chicken is one of the best chicken dishes I've ever had and the homestyle mashed potatoes with bacon put it over the edge. All the food here is good but I would highly reccomend the chicken.
No comment
Excellent food! Amazing starters and delicious desserts! Lively atmosphere. Will definitely come back!

Tried this place for the very first time with my friend. Because of the packed and reserved environment, we had to sit at the bar which turned out not to be bad at all other than them in a must of having big fans or air conditioning. At the bar we were greeted by our server Freddy who is really nice and awesome! We ordered the infamous cookie skillet, traditional breakfast (bacon, beans, mushroom, potato cake, and egg), and salmon benedict. Food overall is pretty good and the most important thing was that the egg was cooked how I like it which is not runny at all.(Hate me for not liking runny eggs. -.-). All in all we liked how the interior looks like , the mood of the restaurant, and how well-mannered the customers and staffs are! :D Not only that but Freddy treated us to the cookie skillet which is double the awesomeness!
No comment

I've heard great things about the food here from a variety of sources and finally came in for brunch.  My experience with the food was a mixed bag.  We got a couple orders of eggs Benedict at $14 each-- one with kale atop butternut squash(delicious) and one with spinach atop homemade sausage patties (didn't care for that one).  The eggs were cooked perfectly and our waitress was very pleasant.  The breakfast potatoes were slimy with grease and basically not worth touching.  For the steep price, I would have expected a bit better accoutrement.  The kale/butternut Benedict would be a great dish in the Fall but I'm not sure I'll be back for much else.
No comment

Awesome spot for drinks, not too loud that conversation is impossible. People are generally friendly and open to meeting strangers. It's very dimly lit, so make sure you get a good look before exchanging any numbers :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Most amazing crunchy kale salad with quinoa I've ever had!!! Must try!!! Cool hip place! A really unique selection of pickled items to choose from such as pickled pineapple with habanero peppers. Excellent guac with freshly made chips.

Probably the worst food in NYC.  You know that scene in Kitchen Nightmares where they zoom in on the one guy in the kitchen putting out disgusting food and looking frazzled?  Yup, that's Boulton and Watt's situation.  I sent back a steak bc it was well done when I asked for medium rare and what the plopped down twenty minutes later was a massive gristly blob of carnage smothered in A1 sauce.  Utterly deplorable service, the waiter asked me if it was any better and I said no.  He just smirked and walked away and sent another waitress over who threw down the check.  I paid and left and am never coming back.  Plus you can't hear yourself sneeze in here it's THAT loud, seriously, hire a sound engineer and fix that sh*t.

Poor service. Owner verbally harassed woman in our group and inappropriately touched another

Came here for a couple glasses of wine with a few friends. We wanted something low key but that still had a decent amount of people. Boulton & Watt was exactly what we were looking for. Great drinks and decent selection of wine and beer. The crowd had a great vibe. Everyone was friendly and not intimidating. We sat at a communal table and ended up making good friends with the group sitting next to us. Cant wait to come back.

Loved the food, ambience, and drinks.  I highly recommend the artichoke ravioli and the Bibb salad! The toga toga is on par and the rest of the drink menu is equally good. The pineapple jar is amazing!!!
No comment

Three of us came here for dinner on a Sat night after happy hours near LES, B&W was our alternative after avoiding to have to wait for over an hour from another restaurant nearby, I like the fact the menu and bar offered an extensive lists of options, two of us opted for burger and my gf went for their fish of the day.  I liked my burger, it was cooked just as i asked for it, I also like the fries it came w it, the portion is definitely generous, then again, it came w its price tag as well.  I had to say the service was quite terrible, the only two times we saw our sever was when she took our order and when she came to clear our plates, it was difficult to get our drinks filled in between, not to mention this place is overtly loud, it's good for group seatings but impossible to hear each other without yelling on top of your lungs.  I'd probably revisit only for drinks!
Great food and atmosphere. The service was great and i was stuffed. Highly recommended.

My friend and I met here at 1pm on a Sunday for brunch. We thought it'd be crazy due to Mother's Day, but we were seated at the end of the bar where it was fairly quiet. The bartenders were prompt and made fantastic bloody marys! The food was great. We'll definitely be back!

This place has great happy hour deals!! Everyone that works here is super nice. The Mexican revolver cocktail is on point.

Love the rustic/industrial chic interior. Make sure you look up... they had the coolest copper/patina ceiling. Great service, took a little long but they were very accommodating once they realized we were sort of in a rush. The music got louder during the service and it got pretty busy around 11am on Sunday, so maybe reserve via opentable if you don't want to bother with a wait. Food was good! I totally overlooked their homemade pickle options... I have to go back for that! Between three people, we ordered the braised short rib and bone marrow (pretttyyyy rich! so if that's what you're craving you will get it), the cheese grits (which come with a poached egg and chorizo in the dish), and a side of seasonal fruit (great mix of fresh berries, pineapple, and melon). I would gladly visit again on my next trip to NYC.
No comment

Love this place! The steak and eggs were very tasty and I had food envy on everywhere dish I saw come out. I wish I ordered something more adventurous now. The place was packed with hot girls brunching on a Saturday afternoon, the staff were great too. Nice spring day with the windows wide open and the breeze blowing through. Places like this is what makes me love New York.
Came here for brunch - it's lively, drinks are good and cheap, and their juice is fresh! Pretty good brunch selection. Service is a bit slow.
No comment
Solid drinks and brunch! Trust this place :) definitely get the milk and cookie!! Old rustic industrial look on the inside. Food is the same with amazing chef touches.

The place has a sort of carbon copy setup of what a "hipster" spot should be. They have the cool exposed mechanical ceiling fans, suspender-clad wait staff, tarnished worn-in table tops and stools, and "Williamsburg-ish" appeal. The place was our setting for Sunday brunch and we were pleasantly greeted as well as seated within minutes after arriving. The $5 brunch cocktails were good, but I can't imagine anyone complaining about that. I'm not a huge fan of their BBQ Bloodies, but I'm just not a huge fan of BBQ flavored items. The food was slightly above average and the portions were solid. I did especially enjoy my meal here and I think most would too.
No comment

I've come here a few times, for brunch and today for lunch. Atmosphere is very chill, good crowd. You would think prices were extreme being where it is. It's moderate, especially with how the food taste. For brunch (no bottomless) but they are known for how amazing their Bloody Mary's are! I also think the price of the carafe of wine is reasonable ($20 for at least three glasses. The steak and eggs are on point. For lunch they have happy hour specials, I was going to get a carafe but the waiter was kind enough to tell me it's cheaper to get a $6 glass of wine, which you never hear a waiter helping you out with prices. My boyfriend got a special: you get a sandwich, picked jar & a cold beer for $16, when we actually were only charged $15 for (I think because they didn't have the beer he wanted). Overall it's a great place to hangout with a small group or large. I will definitely need to try dinner there soon!

Travelled into NYC to catch a friend making his debut in a comedy improv show.  After the show, a group of six decided to get drinks and some late night dinner.  We stumbled upon Bolton and Watt. What an AWESOME find. We hung out for hours and ate and drank.  Our server (Alexa ?) was wonderful.  She suggested drinks and apps, checked back frequently and was a pleasant change from the service we have received at other neighborhood establishments.  I recommend any and all of the starters.  We shared about 8 of them.  Thanks. We will be back.
No comment

The food here rocks!!! Atmosphere is great, bartenders are cool too.... but when the owner greets you and buys you a shot and tells the bartender to take care of you... the place is a keeper! Definitely coming back...had a great burger and bushel sprouts that were awesome!!

Very crowded and full of young adults/college students if you're into that scene.  Food can take forever to order and come out, but the Mac and cheese hit the spot for me.
5 stars for the pickle backs!!! Cannot review anything else because I only went to take a shot of the whiskey and pickle back and left. Delicious.
The mac and cheese and the skillet chocolate cookie were great!
No comment

I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked in but man was it worth it. The one fault they have is the seating space, your a little too close for comfort when there are big parties here but the food certainly makes up for it. I had the bacon wrapped tenderloin with side of fries and for dessert the cookie and milk. The prices are average for a place of its kind so if you live in the area or are partying in the area and looking for some good food that's filling I highly recommend stopping by.
Im sitting here waiting for my check for 35min. Oh yeah, ordered 2 veggie burgers for 2 ppl. 1 came. Waitress missing since. Help me. Or help this place

Bad service in here and negative vibes every time I come in. Spilled my drink before I even took a sip and they charged me for it. Pretty average food compared to the rest of the area.
Amazing place! Great food, great atmosphere and INCREDIBLE service! Eric the bartender is the best!

This place has all the trappings of being my go-to spot in the area, but for some reason, every time I come here I am just underwhelmed. The exterior and interior are both really nice, the menu is interesting and they have beautiful food. But the general consensus both times I've gone is that everything just tastes "whatever" and is not worth the prices. Drinks are blah as well. Want a nice atmosphere? Then this is the place. But don't necessarily come for the food alone.

This place is awesome- I came here for dinner last night and got the tuna tacos tempura style, as recommended by the waiter. They were very delicious and filling. My friends got the burger and gnocchi and were satisfied with their meals as well. We all split the cast iron cookie which was definitely the highlight of the meal- it comes out warm and gooey with milk on the side. SO delicious! The interior is relatively large and got pretty loud towards the end of the night, but there was plenty of space which was nice.
No comment

Randomly made ressies on president day mon. Needed a spot for lunch/brunch w eggs all day.  Awesome service.  Yummy original mimosas.  Cool staff including Karlene Grinberg.  Super cute and friendly. Jenga to boot.  Solid day off.

This food is a bit mediocre here, could have been better & fresher. The waiter was also rude & seemed if he'd rather be elsewhere. If your looking for a good restaurant in the area, go to Root and Bone.

Everything we ordered was terrific. Mac and cheese was a favorite. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Interior space is beautiful.
No comment

Came here for drinks last night. The waitress was really nice and attentive. They have cool beer and shot combos that complement each other and the prices are reasonable. For what it's worth, the wings looked really good. It wasn't too packed for a Saturday night. I'd come back for sure.

The waiter confused our orders twice. Food wasn't all that terrific. I couldn't stand the Mexican corn but perhaps it's just because I don't usually eat sour corn. Brussel sprouts were decent though. Guac and. Chips were okay. Chips are really thick and crunchy and the consistency of the Guac was hard to soup onto the chip. Had this interesting walnut/apple salad though.

No comment
No comment

This place is perfect for a casual night out with a group of friends. Great selection of beers and great food as well. I went with the mahi mahi tacos and they did not disappoint. The atmosphere is great, music is played at the perfect level so you're not shouting at your friends. Service is great as well! Will definitely be back again & again :)

So long story short, I went to the NY to visit and met some awesome locals and they showed me this spot. It has a nice vibe from the moment you walk in and the food is amazing. Great quantities and not even close to being overpriced. When I go back to the NY this will be the first spot.
Fantastic atmosphere, service, and most importantly, food! Honestly nothing to complain about. Solid pricing for Manhattan considering the high quality and great atmosphere. Will be returning!
Great brunch spot! Quick service, fun atmosphere! $6 drinks and yummy food. Can't go wrong with it! It's great for bigger parties.
No comment
Great bar. Love the bartenders and the space. Great chill crowd too. Only downside is that the bar gets crowded and tight. Im a fan!

We were heading towards another bar when we happened to pass Bourbon & Watt. What prompted us to stop by was the smaller crowd, music and sport bar feel. I ordered a milk stout that was very good ($8.50) and my sister ordered a lighter beer that she enjoyed it as well. I definitely want to stop by for their happy hour and food.

Everything was really good!!!  So glad we stopped here. Found it by chance. We had intended to go to Katz's Deli, but after the line outside, lines inside and the ridiculous prices we headed over here. So glad we did!!

I held a surprise party here on Friday night and the experience was absolutely wonderful! I communicated with Paul via email prior to the event and he was a tremendous help when it came to all of my questions. The atmosphere is cozy and classy, the food is delicious and the service is fantastic. If you are looking for a place to hold an event or a bar/restaurant for a fun night out, this is THE place. Thank you so much for everything, everyone had an amazing time. Would recommend to everyone.

To be honest, I was underwhelmed. The Mac and cheese was fine, but just that. The menu options were all over the place. I came for the cast-iron cookie and again it was fine, but just that. It was smaller than anticipated and it didn't taste like the dough had been fresh. Not my first choice in the future.
Really really good food & vibrant atmosphere.. Only downfall is that even on a dead wait, the waitors take too long to check up on you.

Such a fun atmosphere with excellent food! Made a reservation with two friends for a celebration dinner, and everyone enjoyed their meals and had a great time. Brats in a blanket appetizer and the papardelle entree were especially good! I arrived to the restaurant a bit before my reservation time, and I appreciated that they still seated me at the table early while I waited for my friends. (Most restaurants in NYC make you wait for your full party to arrive before seating you.) Would definitely recommend for a meal or just drinks, and will definitely be back!
