Wasn't very impressed here. When we first arrived the host told us he would seat our group of 3 but he did have a reservation coming in 'in a few hours'. Not sure if he was trying to imply for us to eat fast or what, but it set a weird tone from the beginning.  We ordered some pickles, and we're thrown off when they weren't what we thought. For example, we thought it would be cucumbers picked with jalapeños, not actual pickled jalapeños. Would have appreciated an explanation from our server. Our service was slow and was able to see our server chatting with other servers at the hostess stand and near the kitchen. Entrees were good, but nothing spectacular.

Came here with a group of 7 on a Friday night made a reservation which was definitely needed. Only complaint is the seating, Sat in barstools with no back (but expected for the atmosphere). Split a bunch of apps got the Mac and cheese which was amazing along with the fried green tomato caprese...balsamic was delish. Also got the kale and artichoke dip, it was alright nothing crazy. Can't wait to come back again to try the dessert menu. Just wish this place was closer to home!

Came here for brunch.  The oatmeal pancakes are delicious!  The macaroni and cheese was good as well, the serving size was a bit small though.  The atmosphere in this place is great, it's laid back, but clean.  The staff very very nice, however, I found they disappeared for large swaths of time- which sucked because they didn't bring me my syrup with my pancakes, and it took forever for them to show up again.
No comment
No comment

Dropped in for a quick drink after we saw a show at Mercury Lounge. The bartender, Jeremiah was super friendly and very knowledgeable about drinks. He suggested a rose cider that was delicious. Very cool atmosphere!

I've been back to this place so many times - it's really good! I first came here to try their pickle backs. They have the best pickle backs, bar none, that I've ever tried. Of course, they're also the most expensive pickle backs, but at least they're worth it. The food is amazing. The guac and chips is so good - perfect, really. I've tried the fried cauliflower souffle - really good. And the drink True Romance is very tasty. The Mexican Revolver is strong, but if you're into that you'll probably like it. I still need to try their famous cast-iron cookie. If the smell is any indication, it's the best dessert ever.
No comment
No comment

One word. Chimichanga. After coming in for a quick brunch on Saturday afternoon, I left delightfully full and satisfied. Please search Instagram for proof of their immaculate conception they call the Chimichanga (it isn't actually on the menu, and is typically a special.) In addition to the food, the environment is really neat and rustic and if you take a look around you'll notice the intricate ceiling fan mechanism and several other interesting pieces of art. I will definitely be coming back many more times!
No comment
Bone marrow braised pork on an English muffin under a poached egg with house made hollandaise sauce. Go
No comment

Great ambiance, service and happy hour prices are nice as well! The vibe of the place is rustic chic and other than wishing the stools were a bit more comfy, we had a great time. Perfect for a casual date and the food is nice as well. We shared the fish tacos (tempura style), mac and cheese, fries brats in a blanket, and pineapple pickles. I would try other items on the menu next time, but still a cool spot to have a drink and snack in the LES.
No comment

Came here for brunch today and was a big fan. Typically I'm disappointed by the food but I ordered the Mac and cheese with bacon and it was awesome. Reminded me of Mac and cheese from the south that I had. Drinks were pretty good as well, my favorite being the sangria. I would 100% come back to eat here again.
One of the best Gastropubs in a city which is currently full of them. I especially like the veggie burger, rare for one to be this good. Happy hour and brunch specials make it very affordable.
Fantastic skillet cookie. Not in the best in the world. But it was worth the trip. A cool hip place to visit.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing restaurant!! Really cool interior and great location. The food is incredible, definitely try the Mac and cheese and the fish tacos for dinner. For brunch try the special crepes. Good for brunch, dinner, drinks or a good date spot.
Excellent food and reasonably priced drinks of a decent selection. It gets loud in the evening, but overall a fun night out. Highly recommend splitting a bunch of the small plates--they're delicious.
Great space with cool ceiling fans. benedictions are yummy. Like their housemade provisions. Bartender during brunch was super nice.

Amazing, we only actually ended up in here as the queue for Kat'z was huge! We're visiting from England both had steak and eggs which came with fries, all completely cooked to perfection with immense flavours and the most friendly staff as well. Quite busy but they made sure we were seated as quickly as possible, desserts were also beautiful! My boyfriend believes his dessert was the best he's ever had (brownie)! Highly recommend if you're anywhere near there.

This place was super yummy and super trendy.  I suggest only coming here as a twenty-something. This is a local watering hole (but the prices aren't cheap). We came here for food and it was delicous. My favorite was the quinoa salad. Half the quinoa was toasted/fried so it was yummy and crunchy. It also had kale and papaya. Be prepared to spend about thirty bucks if you're getting a drink with food.

I was here with three friends on a Thursday night. Decent food, nothing incredible though my friend did say his burger was tasty.  Drinks were likewise pretty decent but not inspired, especially not for the prices. Atmosphere was nice, love exposed brick and big windows, but it was so LOUD in there we could barely hear each other. Id opt for elsewhere in the area.
FAVORITE SPOT IN NYC HANDS DOWN!!!! Drinks, food, atmosphere, service, all amazing! Owner is super sweet and staff are extremely attentive.
No comment
No comment

This place is very stylish and trendy but I must say I am a little bit disappointed by the food. I had the steak and eggs; it was good but the fries were cold. My friends had the English breakfast and really didn't like it, it was tasteless. We had bloody Marys and these were lower than average. Like too much alcohol (yes it's possible!) and no nice spices. Of course the place was getting very crowded and noisy so it can be hard to get everything right. But overall my brunch experience there was disappointing. I will go again and try dinner or weekday lunch.
A little loud but terrific food.  Younger scene at night. Great burger, sprouts with bacon, steak frites and fish taco.
Atmosphere is amazing. Beer selection is okay. Food is hit or miss bar food - mostly miss. Service is bad.

This review is purely for the brunch. Came with a large party and the service was pretty average however the wait times for the food to come out of the kitchen was quite long, I guess that was understandable since they were busy? I was able to taste from quite a few things and the cheese grits. Pineapple pickles, cast iron baked eggs and traditional breakfast were good. Some of the other stuff such as the cauliflower thing and veggie burger not so much. The drinks were average but I will say I did like the atmosphere inside the restaurant, very industrial and raw vibe.

I don't know what you're doing with your life if you haven't had their chocolate chip cookie. Their brownie batter is also high on my list of things I'd like to eat all of the times. This place does get a little loud, so be prepared to project your voices as if you were a Shakespearean actor. Otherwise, it's reasonably priced and the food was great. I'm a fan. I plan to go back and order pickles by the jar.

The first time I came here the service and the food was amazing. The waitress was so helpful with the menu and the quantity of food given was more than enough. I went back recently since I loved the place. The service was terrible. The glass on my table had dirt on it so I asked for it to be changed and the second glass I received had a lipstick stain. I ended up picking up a glass from a near by table. The waitress did not come around to check on us nor did she explain the menu when asked. The food was overcooked, the portion was smaller and I ordered avocado on my burger, which was missing but still got charged for. I don't know if I'll be returning here again.

As promising as it seemed, this bar was a tremendous disappointment. Upon ordering, another bartender asked what we wanted and we said that we just ordered vodka tonics. When the bartender brought is our drinks, another brought us the same. He accused me of "never ordering a drink before" and literally grabbed my drink from my hand and dumped it. Meanwhile, I was charged AND TIPPED the other bartender. When I asked the other bartender about my drink, he purposefully ignored me. Only when I went to a sever to explain did the situation get better. Never before have I been SO insulted by a business.

This is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in the city.  The food is amazing!  The decor and atmosphere is even better!  Their Sunday Brunch is out of this world!  Great place to go with large groups!
No comment
No comment

A+++. Came to B&W for a quiet early dinner with my girlfriend and had such an enjoyable time. Loved the dishes, the way they were laid out, and the vibe. The single rubber belt which drives all of the fans inside of the restaurant is the coolest thing ever. Keep your eye out for that

My party and I had a lovely evening here for my birthday! we meant to grab a quick bit and a drink but stayed for over 4 hours. Our waiter Billy was awesome! Even though we were dining outside we never felt overlooked or had to wait for service. He was so attentive to our needs and whims. The food was excellent. We highly recommend the pickles (the pineapple and the Kirby cucumbers were our favorites). We will definitely be back again!
Most of the food I've tried here has been sub par, but the cookie skillet is SO GOOD. Like it's addictive it's so good. We go for drinks, stay for the cookie skillet.

I like it here but I'm never ordering delivery again. Wait was quoted as 45 minutes on seamless, took 90 minutes. I called to try and see what was going on, the woman on the phone "couldn't hear" me and I had to call back three times before I could have a conversation with someone to see where my food was. Ridiculous.

So I try to go here with a large group. I was the one person from out of town. Anyway long story short the bouncers are complete jerks. I showed bouncer 1 a tall black guy my ID mind you I'm 23 and he  immediately said it looked fake before scanning it and bent and partially broke my ID. But he was cool and said sorry I'm just doing my job and was very understanding. But than bouncer 2 a classic East Village woman who clearly didn't know what she was doing then said she'd get a second opinion from another bouncer, bouncer 3 next door. As she walked back she said "oh this doesn't look good you probably aren't getting your ID back." So I walk over to bouncer 3 a Hispanic guy who immediately gives me attitude and says he doesn't want to talk and if I want my ID to call the cops. I do and of course there busy with really problems and send me to a different help line that gave me a dial tone. After 20 mins bouncer 3 who has been nothing but rude says hey I don't have your ID. So I go bad to bouncer 2 the woman and she's trying to give be some crap that she's not allowed to give me ID back. FINALLY another guy who I assume was the manager comes out and hands me my ID and says here just leave. Well I know that was a lot but just know that this place for the most part has crap bouncers that will try and show there power by acting like jerks.
No comment

Sooo I went back to Boulton & Watt, as promised, and it seems to have turned into a frat house :/ it was absolutely packed (around 11pm on a Saturday night, so I guess that's not surprising) and the crowd seemed to be mostly 22 y/o preppy-ultra-drunk college dudes. I've been here two other times (both during week nights- once for dinner with the girls, once for drinks/ date) & I had great experiences, so I'd give B&W another shot before writing it off... Though I would probably stick to a school night, given the difference in the crowds.

A great little hangout in alphabet city! A nice change from your typical dive bar or sports bar. The sangria and wine options here are my favorite- I've tried the specialty cocktails but they're not for me. Get the 3 dips on the appetizers- SO GOOD!

Great brunch. Great atmosphere. From the time I was seated, the wait staff were attentive and explained items on the menu. The food was great and reasonably priced. Who can argue with five dollar drinks?  Thumbs up.

Went here last night with a group of friends and loved the food. They have great happy hour (which includes cocktails, normally $12 for $8, and $5 drafts and $5 glasses of wine). I wish we had gotten there a little earlier to take better advantage of that (it ends at 7pm). I had a burger there and loved it -- and would go back in a heartbeat.
Love this place! The rose cider is a great drink. They have roasted Brussels sprouts that are to die for! Service is great and staff is very friendly.
We had a great birthday dinner for a party of 14 during the Friday night rush and we had excellent service. The food and drinks were very good, but the stellar service made them taste even better.
Another pretentious so called gastro pub to open in the east village. Well worth skipping. Service is terrible and the food is average (if it even comes correct the first time )

Really didn't enjoy this place much. I had some beers and some appetizers with my gf. It took forever to be served and we just got some snacks. The Brussels sprouts were under cooked and very oily. the cauliflower was underwhelming as well.
I love this place. Have been there 4 times and the food and service was always amazing! And the bread pudding is unbelievable.

I have been here numerous times - sometimes it's completely packed and sometimes I'm the only customer! So if you ever don't feel like waiting in line for a great brunch on the LES, check this place out! My favorites are the french toast (so fluffy) and the brownie batter in a jar. I've also had the mac n cheese, the burger (too salty for my taste), the cookie in a jar (a must-try) and the short rib eggs Benedict  (which was great though the potatoes were spiced a bit too much in my opinion).
Good, though a bit loud, place for breakfast/brunch. Mainly LES crowd. Nice breakfast cocktails and really good gastro pub grub.

Food was good, the decor is really nice and the waiters were very friendly. The down side was that it get's pretty loud in there. My friends and I went to catch up and we ended up having to yell at each other most of the night. Overall, good experience though.

The food is GREAT, the service shy but on point, and the brunch drinks specials are awesome. The only reason I removed a star is because of the blistering sound level. It's like a crazy campus sports bar with terrific food. They need to decorate with some puffy things to ease the din on the diners who are not screaming. Still, the steak and eggs is the bomb and the healthy options are also very tasty.
No comment
Just had drinks and apps with a friend.  This place had a fun vibe the bartender is really nice and informative.  Food is yummy

Another downtown bar that I like to describe as "rustic industrial".  This beautiful bar/restaurant is great at all times of the day - from a weekend brunch, to a weeknight dinner, to a late-night eat, Boulton & Watt is for every occasion.  I came with a small group on a Saturday night around 11pm and we found a table to sit at quite quickly.  We ordered drinks and some fries and pickled brussels sprouts for the table.  The drinks were tasty and the snacks were delicious! I can't wait to come back here for a meal.  Prices run around $12 for drinks and around the same for food items.
Great whiskey selection. The marrow and short rib app was solid as well. Not a destination spot but a good afternoon/early evening place for a bite and drink of you are in the area.

Love this place. It's got a great atmosphere, though does get really loud. Food: mmm, everything I have had here is good. Most recently I had the bibb salad and it was particularly flavorful for a salad. Really it's all good. Drinks: Get the 32oz jug if you and a friend are getting the same beer (or if you plan on having 2 beers) because it's a great value, it's actually a little more than 2 beers.

Got our table on time which was great considering how crowded it was- apprently it was busy due to a engagement party. We ordered our food and a bottle of wine- appertizer arrived before the wine did. Waitress came over to tell us there was an issue with our food, so gave us pickle back shots to compensate. This was a Wednesday night, so we didnt actually end up drinking them. When the bus boy came to clear away our plates he split the pickle juice all over me! He mumbled an apology and scuttled away. The hostess gave me another glass of wine- but didnt really make up for my purse and clothes still smelling this morning. The food was good though

Was alone with my teenage daughter over the weekend and decided to check out Boulton & Watt. We wanted to see if it was a good place to come with her friends on her birthday. We were seated immediately and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. The music was great, and the menu had variety. We started with the Fried Green Tomato appetizer and it was delicious. My daughter ordered the burger on a brioche roll with carmelized onions and guyere cheese and she enjoyed finishing the whole thing. I ordered the Brussels sprouts and the Kale because I wanted to leave room for dessert. Both were really good, and I don't even like Kale. For dessert we ordered the cast iron chocolate chip cookie and it was divine. We wanted to order the brownie batter in a cup but we were just too full. Enjoyed our experience and especially spending time with my daughter. Had a casual and cool vibe.

Yesterday the bartender with the blonde hair was so nice even though the place was very busy and he was the only bartender. Go you! Great food & good drinks :) I wish I got to spend more time there, but I had to catch a movie at the sunshine.
Perfect spot for lunch during the week. Big windows, sunlight, space, great bartenders, cocktails and food. Love the mellow vibe during the week.
Loud loud loud and unfortunately now a jock bar. Big mistake for a date. Pls move to Sullivan street in the west village.

We came here to try the cast iron cookie everyone was raging about but it was such a disappointment. I thought I was eating the "spring version" or whatever with the strawberry milk but I just got a regular cookie with plain milk. Honestly is not even a cookie it's actually a cake with chocolate chips. I'm not sure if the center was raw or if it's supposed to be like that but it's a damn cake, not a soft warm cookie. The milk didn't do much for me. Other than that the food was good and the drinks too but nothing out of the ordinary.
No comment
No comment

I got the chicken dish. It was delicious. The chicken was cooked to perfection. So moist and tender. It also comes with mashed potatoes and the seasoning was delicious. It has chunks of Brussels sprouts and bacon. The bacon was a little too much for me but the Brussels sprouts were delicious. Highly recommend. I also had the salted caramel ice cream. It really is bite size and so delicious.
Great brunch-decor- service and food -- delicious eggs Benedict--I had the short ribs and bone marrow. F'n in the bathroom good.  Bloody Mary's were outstanding.  Great place-I'll be back!!

GREAT food. We got the Kale and Artichoke fondue to start. Then we split the vegetarian spaghetti and meatballs (which I could probably eat everyday) and the mac n cheese (you can eat this for dinner - its heavy, cheesy and delicious). The drinks are great too! My friend got this summer sweet drink and I got the Mexican Revolver. Both strong and excellent! This place is a MUST. Awesome service too! Thanks!

I came here with a group of eight for a girlfriend's bachelorette. It was a busy Saturday, but our waiter was attentive and overall the good was quite good. Order the mac'n'cheese, the fried green tomato caprese, and of course the Mexican revolver cocktails!
Tasty food and very good service. If you are in the mood for low key bar food, this is the spot.

I've done both my birthday brunch and my boyfriend's birthday brunch here and everyone had a fantastic time both times! The food is great, drinks are good, and every single staff member is friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is also really nice with an industrial vibe inside. It was lively but not so loud that it interfered with us talking at our table. They also were so flexible with reservations and didn't require us to put down a credit card or deposit for a large reservation like most other restaurants do. I can't wait to go back!

Either a) this place cuts their liquor, or b) they don't bother rinsing out the chlorine from their liquor glasses. Ordered my standby, straight. Tasted off. When i pointed it out to the waitstaff, they said no chance, charged me for the full amount, and brought me a new glass of similarly crappy. Go somewhere where they don't rip you off.

3.5 - we came on a slightly busy but not jammed packed Friday night in the rain. The hostess was a little overwhelmed but we weren't sure why as there weren't any people waiting. They ended up helping us making two spots at the bar to eat because we didn't want a table. The bartender was great even though he was busy. Food was really good slightly higher then typical bar dinner. Fish tacos were tasting but tuna was a little over cooked. I probably won't come back for dinner as the burger and tacos weren't that good but I'll give it another try for brunch.
No comment

What a treasure, the food was just delicious. The waitress was a little difficult to hear for the specials, but the food and experience were so good it barely mattered. We went on a double date and it was just the spot. I would love to go back.

B&W is a cool place to meet up with friends after work or to grab some drinks as the cocktails are well made and moderately priced. The downside here is that the entries are just ok and though the servers are all nice, it seems like the place may be understaffed as it takes a while for you to get service.
No comment
great burger, also the veggie burger is amazing, loved it.
No comment

Cool vibe, Indifferent to bordering on rude hostess and servers, food was pretty good. We had the fried calamari and it was without a doubt the best I've ever had. Served immediately to us, piping hot (one thing I'll say is they don't let the food sit around cooling off before they bring it to you) and delicious. I had the blackened brick chicken with the mashed potatoes/Brussels sprouts, a delicious comforting plate. Which I needed because the staff was so chilly and the noise in the place was so bad I literally felt like I was dining alone. Any attempt at conversation was impossible, so I recommend trying to get seating directly next to your companion as opposed to across from. I might go back again as the food was pretty good, but I'll steer clear of the witchy hostess stand and seat myself at a bar table. The rating is based on 4 stars for food and vibe,1 for service.
Food is amazing here! Have come for brunch and dinner and both times it hasn't disappointed. The Mexican revolver is the best cocktail on the menu!

It has it all. Brunch is delish in nice quietish surroundings, NEW YEAR's WAS LOUD AND FUN and everything you'd hope a party could be. The staff has ESP when a glass was empty she was there. I know working a holiday can suck, I've done plenty and certain amounts of yuck in a person can be expected but wow the staff was ON and energetic and smiling THANK YOU for the pro and fun attitude. The food is always good and I am thankful for that when we want a nice treat out, its a TREAT! Can't wait for green tomatoes to come back in season LOL :)

Mac N Cheese. Order it and prepare for heaven. The best mac n cheese I've had in the city. Most of their dishes are amazing with a few that are just mehh. When the breakfast wrap is available (a limited special) you must order it! They have delicious sangria and a tasty drink menu. It's a nice open space, perfect for a Sunday brunch. Plus they have several different pickle back shots to choose from!
No comment

Sometimes in the endless, rough sea of Manhattan douchery you find a place of solace. A small island with a warm fire and a place to rest. The old fashioneds I had at Boulton & Watt were that very place. Clientele on a Saturday is your typical bros-n-hos-night-out but their eats and drinks are top notch if you need to hang somewhere "nice" in the LES but without the pretention of a lounge.

Love the ambience in boult and watt! I'm from the west coast and this place has a great laid back and rustic vibe. The food is amazing! Highly recommend the quinoa kale salad and the veggie burger! This place has the best veggie burger I have ever had. I always take my out of town visitors here!
Chill spot for some late night drinks! You can also get some beer of your own to pour out for your table which is nice. They also have a ton of pickles for the pickle lovers out there.
No comment
Not what I was expecting on a Saturday night - way too crowded and it took a long time to get an expensive drink.  I'd rather go down the block to a divey spot with fun bartenders any day.

This place has a really great, late-night vibe. The snacks are a bit pricey but everything was delicious. We started off with the fresh, homemade guacamole and their specialty salad of the day. The salad had a ton of flavor and I was very impressed!

5 Stars for the Blackened Brick Amish Free Range Chicken! I normally never order chicken when I dine, but the food Gods inspired me to choose this dish and i'm so happy I did. I cannot describe how flavorful this chicken was. Paired with the potato with brussel sprouts and bacon, this meal was a dream.
Quite possibly my new favorite Happy Hour place in the city. Perfect cocktails $8 between 5-7pm and really good fries. The quinoa salad-I would definitely eat that again and again. Yum!
No comment
No comment
No comment

When I first stepped into this place I just knew there was gonna be pickles and handle-bar mustaches. The steampunk ceiling fans were my tip-off. I was wrong about the mustaches but so right about the pickles. They have a whole section of the menu dedicated to it; pickled green beans, brussle sprouts, cauliflower, peaches, pineapples and pickled awesome. The rest of the food? So far so so good. Some of the best eggs benedict ever. They put the eggs on brioche, the hollandaise sauce was great, the pork sausage patty was delicious. I've also had the burger here and it was one of the better burgers I've had in NYC. When it gets busy though the quality of service gets tricky. Maybe understaffed this one time or an overwhelmed server. I would definitely recommend this place but it gets crowded.
Its definitely a fancier place price wise and the staff are great. Everything is good quality. We went by on a quieter Sunday night and got served immediately with prompt food.

When you're looking to get away from the VERY early 20's crowd that can sometimes be the East Village, Boulton and Watt is a good alternative. Whether you want to grab a bite to eat before your night out, or stop for a drink, it's a solid place. It's very bar / restaurant, with tables on the outskirts and a decently sized bar area. The food is pretty darn good - my friend got a beef burger last night and I got the veggie. I'm always hesitant with the veggie - I've had very good and very very bad, but this falls into the good category. It's topped with tzatziki sauce which is CLUTCH. The fries are to die for. Perfectly seasoned and crunchy. Does B&W play great music? No, but the food and age appropriate (at least for me) crowd, are a plus especially in this city.

Good food, great beer selection and decor, but it is way TOO LOUD.  Everyone is yelling to hear themselves over the loud music. I've been here a few times because it's close by, but every time I come home with ringing ears and a sore throat.  I don't even know why they blast the music - it's not a night club and people aren't dancing.

This is one of my new favorite neighborhood hangouts.  It's a very industrial themed gastropub with what looks like an amazing menu (I have not yet eaten there) and incredible drinks.  My personal favorite is the Lady Ashley (applejack brandy, lemon, honey, egg white, ginger beer) which seems mild until you've sucked down a couple and it hits you.  The egg white foamness with the sparkle of the ginger beer and the sweetness of the brandy make you feel like you are drinking alcoholic apple juice (yes please!).  Highly recommend this place.
No comment
No comment
Food was fabulous. Atmosphere was enthusiastic and fun. Great for a big group. Very accommodating.
Terrific food, great cocktails and awesome atmosphere! Jason and his staff could not have been friendlier and more accommodating. If you're anywhere near Avenue A you have to hit Boulton & Watt.
No comment

Pretty design.  Lots of exposed brick and comfy bar stools. The Irish bartender had it going on with good cocktails.  Over cooking the calamari costs them a star, and the pickled cauliflower was a real small serving for the high prices.

It was crowded on Saturday night, but we got a great seat by the windows. The fried green tomatoes appetizer is amazing. I could have ordered four and had it as an entree. I had the incredible veggie burger, ended up taking half of it to-go, and enjoyed it just as much for lunch the next day. The service was attentive but not obtrusive. Also our waiter was kind enough to pack up the leftover bones from my friend's lamb dish -- it was a weird request, but my cats certainly appreciated it.
No comment

Great place all around but hands down my favorite spot for brunch! Awesome menu selection and brunch cocktails are only $5 and served until 4pm. Love the atmosphere here- especially with all the big open windows. Definitely a go-to spot.
On vacation from Indiana and stopped in for lunch. Best meal we've had in Manhattan. Atmosphere is great, staff is helpful and funny, music is good, and food is phenomenal.

The drinks aren't out of this world and kind of over priced. The place tries to hard to look olden and kitschy but it just looks/feels very artificial. I came on a Sunday night and it was very easy to get a table.  The food was pretty good, not your standard greasy bar food (I enjoyed the quinoa salad with kale butternut squash and pomegranate). To me I equate this place to spitzers corner, a rustic looking place which is primarily a bar but has food. I just prefer the atmosphere, crowd, food, and beer section better at spitzers. Sorry.
Great new addition to an abismal corner.  Chef David is amazing and the food is great - amazing mac-n-cheese, the various "pickles" are deelish, and the ambience is cool yet not too cool for school.
No comment
No comment
Solid all around. Enjoyed the space and atmosphere. Really warm and welcoming. Great location in Alphabet City. Well done!!
No comment

I have been wanting to try this place but am never in the area. So, when I saw they were offering lunch via uber eats I made sure to partake. Unfortunately, the salad they had advertised was completely different than the salad I received. The chicken tasted like it was cooked last week and left on the counter, uncovered, lacking any kind of char. I had to search for the lettuce/kale in my salad. No pomegranate seeds, no golden beets- that's pretty much the majority of the "salad".  After reading the description on their website, I found out there was also supposed to be mint in it. Honestly, I am thrilled that I did not make the trip to the restaurant! Saved me an evening of hangry.

I highly recommend Boulton & Watt.  The restaurant is beautiful - large windows with a beautiful view, exposed brick walls, and unique decor - and has a great vibe. More importantly, the food is delicious.

Of course most yelpers would give this 4-5 stars because it's new and a novelty esp. for the bridge and tunnelers. But having been around, nothing esp. about this place. Giving it a conservative three stars since my experience there does not evoke a 1-star or 2-stars. Friendly service, ok food and drinks, just a bit trying too hard on being original in the cocktail side. Very loud esp, after around 10pm. Try not to be here, or anywhere in the neighborhood, on a weekend night, since it's mostly bridge and tunnelers and tourists, and loud, unless that's your crowd. Better established bars in the Lower East Side, a few blocks away. I'd like to see the reviews here 2-3 years from now, if they're still around.

This is a great bar with exceptional food and cocktails.  The ambiance and design of the restaurant is also really nice. I would highly recommend the fried oysters, kale dip, rubiola, and the short rib and bone marrow toast.  For dessert their mini cheesecakes are amazing!!!!

I have been privileged enough to eat this amazing new place not 1 but 2x. On the corner of Avenue A and Houston it's industrial revolution themed bar/restaurant really gives the neighborhood a new vibe. The staff is super friendly and very knowledgeable on the menu and the mixologoy of drinks. The Mexican Revolver by far is my favorite drink there followed by the MAC and Cheese ( a must have!) . They have a great assortment of pickled asparagus, radishes and pineapple. To die for! Definitely check it out.. Also a great to watch sports as the TVs come out of the hidden panels behind the wall. Love!
Good burger and really liked cubed bacon chunks and rosemary fries! Casual bar atmosphere, attentive staff, nice in the summertime when they have all the windows open.
No comment

Great for large, loud parties who want to drink and get bar food.  Definitely not a romantic/date night spot. Sitting indoors is so loud you can't hear your date.  Sitting outdoors is not much better due to busy intersection. Avoid, unless you enjoy drinking and yelling at each other. Food was nothing special and quite random, actually.

This place would go from 3 to 5 stars immediately if they took out the TVs. They need to decide if they want to be a cool gastropub or just a sports bar. Can't have it both ways. There are lots of sports bars in Midtown. But they've spent a lot on a really nice interior and location here in the East Village so I hope they make the right choice. Meantime, it fills up with the kind of people who go to bars to watch TV.
Lunch was great! Eggplant sandwich with rosemary fries  wonderful choice. Service was just as lovely. Highly recommend.

Great food but bad service.  Slow unfriendly waitress and cranky manager (can't remember name started with R?) . My friend's eggs came out wrong, she explained, the waitress took them back, then the manager came out. I thought he'd apologize but he actually made her feel worse like she'd ordered the wrong thing! My friend was specific and not on the least bit a pain.  She just doesn't like undercooked eggs. They came out fine second time, but we were pretty upset at the reaction.  Other than that, food good and interesting variety.

We found this place by luck the last day we were in NYC. The service was perfect and our meals were awesome. I took a special meal with house made pork, spinach and poched eggs, it was crazy in my mouth! :))
No comment

I live very close to Boulton & Watt and have been wanting to check it out ever since it opened, but FINALLY made it in this past Friday night. The place was pretty crowded by the time my friend and I arrived, but we were sat immediately even though we just wanted a drink. We met the owner Jamie who was an awesome, friendly guy. Cocktails were delicious and so was the skillet chocolate chip cookie!! Great addition to the neighborhood. I will definitely be back.
No comment

First time in New York! Super friendly and the food was even better! Must stop if your ever in town. Thanks Ryan for your hospitality and superb services! I highly recommend this welcoming and friendly restaurant/bar. Thank you...
The fact that you need a reservation at times is a bit ridiculous considering theres open tables at all times, but the food drinks and service was Absolutely great for the price you pay
Went here for brunch with a big group. Food was a mixed bag for our group but the ambience, service and $5 brunch cocktails were standouts for sure. Definitely a great place to come with a group.

This was a restaurant chose based on the location and positive reviews.  It was a Saturday night and we had a 9:30pm dinner reservation.  The place was beyond packed and very loud.  We ordered drinks from the bar before we were sat and it felt very crowded.  We asked the bartender for recommendations off their drink menu, but he wasn't helpful in the least.  He made every drink sound terrible.  I ordered the Mezcal cocktail and he was right...I did not like it.  It was really smokey and strange.  I don't like returning drinks, so I suffered through it.  Once we were at our table, we ordered a mix of appetizers and entrees.  I had the quinoa dish with chicken and I was really happy with my choice.  It was delicious.  I don't remember what everyone else got, but overall everyone seemed satisfied.  My main complaint is the place is so noisy that it was hard to make conversation.  I enjoyed dinner but wouldn't go out of my way to return.

Had a great time as a group of 9 on a Saturday night, with an 8pm reservation. highlights were the free range chicken and fish tacos - i had the salmon which was good but couldve used some flavor. Drinks were great too - go for the franklin my dear, trust the serpent and the mexican revolver.

A new favorite. Had my first visit to Boulton & Watt tonight and I will definitely be back. Great cocktails, great food, great service, great music. The pickled dishes were terrific and so were the specials. Loved the decor -- the wall finishes, the windows, the lighting, the fans running on interconnected straps. Looking forward to football season there as well -- the screens for watching sports were well integrated and not obtrusive.

On our flight from LA to NYC, we read the recommendation in the Food and Drink section of the American Way magazine of the Waimea Bay drink and pickles. So after we got off the plane, we went straight to Boulton and Watt in East Village in the lazy mid-afternoon and order two drinks, three jars of pickles ($2 each during happy hour), calamari, and fish tacos. We were pleasantly surprised with both the pina colada-like drink and the snack and food.  The place is uniquely decorated and the service was excellent.  After the waitress found out we are out-of-towners, she spent 15-20 min with us recommending various places to visit.  We thoroughly enjoyed the food and conversation and came out refreshed and energized with a fond first impression of New York.

Good stuff. Had 8:30 reservation here Friday. Got there 8:45 and place was loud and packed. Very loud. Cool spot but def not an intimate place. Had a drink at the bar, they have some good cocktails. Waited a while for table, I think they forgot about us because he seemed surprised when I went to see what the status was. But they seated us shortly after and had the waitress bring us over a complimentary bottle of prosecco for the wait, which was very unexpected. I had chicken under a brick which was great and she had the pot pie which was very good too. Very young crowd and not a fancy place but I'd go back.

Was a little busy for a weekday night, but still got drinks in a timely fashion and food. I had wine, although a short list, had good options and all the cocktails sounded very good. The atmosphere is nice, but was very loud mostly because of people. Seems like the hip spot to grab a drink with friends and catch up. I had the blackened chicken for dinner and that was the showstopper! It's a little pricey for chix  $20, but all the prices are midlevel around there, so seems like a good deal for upscale casual NY restaurant and the portion was huge. It was THE BEST chicken I've ever had in my life. The skin was blackened with spices, not Cajun not sure what, but was perfectly crisp and seasoned, while inside was perfectly cooked through, the chicken was piping hot the whole time that's how I knew it was fresh and cooked right. It all came on top of mashed potatoes with Brussel sprouts and bacon and a jus gravy sauce that was perfect. The menu is small but everything sounded super good. The bartender was very hospitable amidst being busy making drinks. Will definitely come back to try more!

This place might become one of my new go to brunch spots! The food was excellent! Friendly wait staff and plenty of seating. Great for big groups or just for two. The macaroni and cheese was was SO good! Any of the Benedicts are also recommended!

I have never encountered a bar with a more rude staff. A man, I assumed to be a manager, needed the table my friends were sitting at because it was reserved. Ok fine - however when my friend asked if there was another table available, the manager responds by saying, "No. Every table in this place is reserved. We take reservations just like every other restaurant in this city." Not only was this rude, he said it with an attitude and that's not even a correct statement. I've been to plenty of bars and restaurants that don't take reservations. When asking the hostess, who was dressed in sweatpants, how long a wait would be for a table, she responds, "do you see this list (pointing to her iPad) all these people are in front of you. So it would be at least an hour." Once again, another rude response from a staff member. Maybe they were stressed, maybe an off day, but I have no desire to return.

I tend to walk past this area of town later at night amongst all the lower east side debauchery so I've often walked right past this spot. I came here after work on a Thursday to find it calmer than I would expect but still a decent crowd. Most people were huddled around the bar area so we were able to find seats pretty easily. The beers on tap were phenomenal. Some of the best selection I've seen in that area of the city. The service was pretty good given how much the servers probably had to duck around the crowd up front. I got the steak frites which were so-so but my friends seemed to like the burgers they got. Overall good standard gastropub atmosphere perfect for afterwork and game nights I'd assume.
Good place to watch a sporting event, fun gastropub, food was good as well.  The seating situation in this place is cool.  Chicken pot pie was awesome.  Also in a great location.

I really wanted to love this place. I have been on a cocktail kick lately. The Thursday that I was (a few weeks ago) there was fairly busy and a just loud enough to be fun.  The place certainly looks great.  Unfortunately all four of us had sort of mediocre cocktails.  One drink have a violet liquor in it and I mean TONS of violet. Somebody else had the exact same cocktail and it had much less violet flavor and was much better.  I will come back for the vibe, but I might stick to beer.
No comment

Too bad that some drink/food established forget that they open not only to make money, but to make patrons happy and bring them back. They could definitely learn hospitality from Boulton & Watt. Went there yesterday, Thursdays night. Place was busy but i still could find a place at the spacious bar. Bartender was very attentive and made great beer suggestions. When food arrived i was kinda disappointed. Octopus was chewy and when i asked a bartender if i can send it back, within 5 seconds i had owner/manager talking to me. They apologized and quickly substitute it for a great tuna tartare. Guys did a great job including the fact it was happening after kitchen closed and i really hate to be "THAT table". I work in a kitchen myself so i know how staff feel about last second orders. Also they were super generous and gave us a round of beers. It was a great "going out" experience, we left in a great mood and definitely will be back soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is undoubtedly the best bar in the city for great drinks backed by great service. No matter how busy, these guys take care to treat you right. Sit on the bar near the door for Frankie and Meemo....Great guys/ great bartenders/ great people. Can't stress that enough; Everything on the menu is phenomenal here.

Delicious food, crappy service. We were enjoying ourselves until our waitress kept taking away plates and ($12 drinks!!!) that weren't even finished. So annoying! We felt like we were completely rushed through our meal. Very disappointed.
Came here today for brunch.  Their mimosas were so weak and food was nothing to rave about.  Service was slow. Waited about an hour for our food.  I will not be back unfortunately.
No comment

There were seven of us for brunch on a Sunday at 12:30. Cool venue, alright food. I had the egg frittata and it was a little dry. The bloody mary may or may not have had alcohol. Felt a little rushed at the end even though we kept ordering tons of drinks after we finished eating. I probably won't go back.

Stopped by this cozy friendly spot with my daughter, who lives nearby, and sat at the bar. Fabulous chicken breast under brick!!! Crispy flavorful skin,moist chicken..served on delicious smashed potatoes with Brussel sprouts! Comfort food at its best!

We went here for drinks after having brunch elsewhere. It was later in the afternoon and the place was not at all packed, but the bar was full. We set our things at one of the common tables as we tried to make our way to the bar. The hostess was unnecessarily nasty about it not being the bar and that we couldn't sit there. We definitely did not stay and I have certainly changed my mind about trying their brunch, it's not worth it when the staff antagonizes their customers.

If service is king, this place is royalty.  We were just looking for a quick bite and the menu posted outside looked great.  We walked in and asked about the soup of the day and the person behind the host stand told us that they don't do soup for brunch but he could arrange it for us.  Great!  I am getting over a cold and just wanted some soup.  The same person came by our table as we were looking at the menu and offered more good advice and was extremely helpful and friendly.  When our waiter came by, we mentioned the soup and he said he'd have to ask but we pointed to the person who seated us and he said 'Oh, that's the owner!  If he says it's ok, then it's ok!'  My husband got the veggie burger.  Both were great.  The soup (potato leek) was creamy and tasty.  The veggie burger was so good that my husband informed me about how much he was enjoying it after every bite.  We also got fries.  Man... These fries are great.    Perfect.  I'll probably dream about them tonight.  The owner came by to make sure we were enjoying our food and was sure to tell us to come back.  In case I didn't convey how great the service was, just go and see for yourself.  What you'll also find is a creative menu, tasty food and a comfy atmosphere.

Great location. Sat right by the window. Came here for brunch and ordered the french toast with poached eggs. My french toast was a bit soggy but still yummy regardless. $5 mimosa and bloody mary specials with brunch. Seating could be a bit tight with the high tables. A large group sat right behind me and kept bumping into me when they were getting up. Overall, decent place. Will try it again sometime.

Came here with a group of 10 or so friends on a Friday night.  The food was great - I got the Blackened Brick Amish Free Range Chicken and shared the Kale and Artichoke Fondue.  Both were delicious.  We ordered several bottles of wine and the bill was still very reasonable.  I will be going back.

If you want to feel happy in a restaurant this is the place to be. I went there for the third time and once again left with a smile on my face. So far I have had the brick chicken, steak and more recently their hamburger and fries. Besides the food being absolutely delicious, each time I am surprised at how sophisticated the food detail is for such a casual fun place. I must add that this is not just a restaurant for the younger generation. Each time I go one of the chefs or owners stops by the table to see how everything is. They also have one of the best wait staffs in town. Save room for one of their delicious creative desserts. My favorites are the mini cones and their brownie sundae.My one comment would be that if you don't like rosemary like me request that they leave them off your french fries. They are crisp and delicious on their own and a great portion.
I was only there for a short time, had a couple of beers. I am writing this review to say that the guacamole is the best I've ever had!!! That's all.

Boulton and Watt has become my new go to.  I've been on a Friday night and during Sunday Brunch.  Both times the place was packed and lively. Great atmosphere although it can get a little loud.  Their guacamole is fantastic. Also, really loved their spaghetti squash with eggplant meatballs.  I would definitely suggest making a reservation.  Great neighborhood spot to go and just grab drinks any day of the week.

Tried out this new place for dinner a few days ago. Interesting atmosphere and delicious food. In hindsight I should have tried the burger without bleu cheese first to get the full flavor, but it was still good nonetheless. The drinks looked interesting, but I didn't get to try any this time around. My only complaint is that the stools at the high table area, while interesting, are extremely uncomfortable; my legs kept falling asleep as I sat there. I'd recommend sitting at a table or the bar instead. In any case I'll be back this week to see how round two goes.

Really 3.5 stars, but I'll round up.  This is a loud, crowded place right on Houston.  Gets more of a LES crowd than East Village.  The food was alright, the duck confit carbonara was good, but nothing to rush back to get again.  The chicken look pretty good, would get next time.  Beers are a little on the expensive side, but they have a great selection and in full pints.  Overall a good place if you're in the area.
No comment

One of my favorite NYC spots to eat! Great food all around, no matter what time of day. And of course the best drinks as well! It's typically a go-to of ours even though the East village has so many great restaurants. This one has its own unique atmosphere and the best servers and bartenders. Never disappoints!
OMG..... Had a great time at Frames NYC.... The people and music was great (Naomi the bartender)....
Excellent spot. Great food and drinks. Great Bartender there by the name of Richard..if you use his favorite word "hodgepodge" he'll give you a free drink.

Great food, good service, nice atmosphere.  Had a surprise birthday here on a Thursday night (I showed up and my girlfriend and 6 friends were waiting for me, SURPRISE).  They were super nice about letting everyone linger and just have drinks while waiting for me to arrive.  We ordered nearly everything on the menu (no joke) and all shared. The group and myself all commented that everything was delicious.  I really liked the atmosphere and the decor as well.  A super fun time!

This is a classy establishment on the border of Alphabet City, East Village, and Lower East Side. The decor is classy, reminiscent of The Wren or Wilfie and Nell. Refurbished wood and industrial steel set the mood, and the conversation level is usually at a medium din, louder on weekend nights. Came here for a burger and drinks with a friend...the fries were uneven. Half were crispy, the other half soggy with the right amount of seasoning on them. The burger was also pedestrian for the neighborhoods standards. The bun was a bit ....damp...if that is the correct word. Also the meat was prepared as asked however was devoid of any flavor really. Service at the bar was spotty with about 5 people there but the bartender only checking in on us after we stood up and started getting dressed to leave. Another minor caveat that I had was that my drink tab was less than the $10 credit card minimum which they didn't tell me until after my friend already paid. First, these minimums are technically illegal in NYC and secondly if there was such a minimum we should have been told that so we could have combined our tabs. Put a damper on the end of a night. This place has great date spot and group potential with a moderate atmosphere that says classy without being pretentious about it. It looks great but didn't think the food and service lived up to expectations. Would be willing to stop back and give it another try however.

As much as I would like to promote Boulton & Watt, I won't do it because of a poor experience that I had when it first opened. I have lived in the surrounding neighborhood for years and wanted to bring business to this establishment when it first opened. I used to run a happy hour once a week with a bunch of co-workers and friends. We work in the finance industry and are always happy to get out and spend a little bit to have a good time. We were also combining charity donations along with our drinking fun. I contacted the manager, Jaime, and explained that we were interested in hosting a happy hour at Boulton & Watt and wanted to know if they had any interest in contributing a small percentage of our final bill to a fundraiser that we were running for homeless youth in NYC. He was very enthusiastic and committed to it over email and then I stopped by the bar to introduce myself. I promoted the happy hour(s) and fundraiser to everyone and brought a rather large group that evening after work. We had a nice table in the corner near the window. The other people stood near the bar and we had a nice time ordering both food and drinks. People weren't shy to order more because they knew that a percentage was going to charity. Jaime and I had agreed to take a look at the final amount of the bill at the end of the night and he would donate a percentage based on the amount. At the end of the night, he was no where to be found and the bartender advised that he left for the night.  I emailed, called, and stopped in a few days later but he stayed out of sight and dodged my emails and calls. It was unprofessional and left me with a sour taste of the place. Since then, our firm has not done any happy hours or business with Boulton & Watt. We never ended up getting any type of small charity donation for our endeavor. I walk by it very often but will not stop in. It's unfortunate. Good drinks but don't count on them to stick to their word!

AMAZING service. Especially the guy who seemed to be the manager. There was NO shortage of other helpful staff, including the hostess who helped us keep our reserved space while other people hovered in the hopes of stealing it from us. The menu looked great, but unfortunately the food wasn't amazing. However, what was lacking in taste was absolutely made up for in service. In fact, our waitress misheard a part of our order, but just let us keep the wrong thing she brought and then brought us what we actually ordered - at no charge. Thanks B&W for making my brother's birthday so fun!!

As a regular patron at Boulton and Watt, I was appalled by the way in which both the bouncer and the manager handled my service last night. After having spent several hours there for a friend's birthday party, as well as running up a tab of over $70.00, I tried to take the empty growler that I had actually paid for already. As I exited, the bouncer literally grabbed my arm in a violent and forceful manner, and informed me that I needed a top for the growler. I tried to comply by going to the bartender for a top, and the bartender refused to provide a top. The manager then came over and referred to me using several expletives. I left without the growler, and I will likely never return to this abusive institution.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Happy we popped in here for dinner, seemed like a happening spot and the food didn't disappoint, though the menu wasn't the most appealing to me. Best bite had to be the Brussels sprouts, I'd say not to be missed, but was also happy with the burger.
No comment
I have been to the Tavern a few times and loved it each time.  Always great food and atmosphere.  Perfect for either large gatherings with friends or an intimate dinner for two.

Ok, no exaggerated review from me - Can't miss this place.  The atmosphere in the White Oak Tavern in the West Village is NiiiiiiCE. - Has a small pub feel with a true romantic feel.  Screams NYC flavor.  The food and drinks are top notch, pub style.  Ciara (bar tender) has a world beater smile and personality.  The food is exceptional and exceeds typical NYC pub - You won't be disappointed!!!!
solid fish and chips and friendly bartender. had live music sunday evening and half off bottles of wine (sparkling excluded).

We were driving past this and couldn't stop looking at their Christmas decorations so we stopped in and had a late dinner. And I'm so glad we did! We only had 2 people so they sat us away from the tree at a 2 top but there's a gorgeous tree in the middle of the bar. There's booths in the back as well so it's perfect for 4 to 6 people to come here. I got the chicken pot pie and my party got the beyond burger which was done so well she said it's the best beyond burger she had in the city (we are not tourists and we eat burgers often) and my chicken pot pie warmed me up as I had almost no food in the day and I was starting to shiver at night this thing filled me up to the brim and I was warm again. I will definitely come back here for some drinks and to try their famous vegetarian lasagna.

Just a few steps from Washington Square, the white Oak Tavern is a great stop for drinks and food.  We stopped for brunch on a Saturday Morning with no reservation.  While the drinks were quite pricey, the quality was high. As a bourbon fan, I couldn't decide between the Manhattan and the Old Fashioned.  Luckily they had a cool cocktail sampler!  The noise level was pretty high as the place was pretty popular.  The decor and ambiance was excellent and the wait staff was stellar.   The biscuits and gravy were top notch even by a southerners standard!  I was not expecting a gem, but this place was a find!
This place is by far the best food in the Village. The Chicken pot pie is not like any other!!!!!!!!!! The burger is amazing! Honestly, just go here.

Short walk from Washington square. This is a gem. Great drinks, great food, great service. The college crowd flocks to this place on the weekend no surprise as it's classy, chill ambiance could keep you there for hours with a nice group. Highly recommend for quick drinks or eats for the area.

White Oak had very nice holiday decor and a nice bartender but I ordered two beers and it cost me $28 before tip. I'm no cheapskate but that seemed a bit unreasonable to me. Maybe the food is good but it's hard to stomach extra pricey drafts!

Beware of alcohol "up-charges" which are not stated on the menu.  We paid $3 and $4 extra for each martini or gimlet(5x).  The manager informed me that the $16 and $18 for drinks listed on the menu was the base price, and that they added the upcharges because martinis(very small btw)have more alcohol.  THIS WAS NO WHERE TO BE SEEN ON THE MENU AND WAS NOT MENTIONED BY THE WAITER. The manager, who was very gracious, said he would tell his wait staff to inform customers of the extra charges.  He also told me that it is an "upscale establishment"; which is not an excuse for not properly listing his prices.
No comment
No comment
Cute spot. We loved the decoration and bar layout. They have a good happy hour selection and delicious margaritas.
No comment
No comment
Great food and drink here. The service is also very good. It has a nice big double sided bar and plenty of booths. I would imagine it gets crowded on the weekends as it is in the heart of NYU.

Absolutely fantastic place for a happy hour. They're very reasonably priced and tasted great. But I have to say the best part was the amazing bartender, she was so friendly and appreciative of us not rushing her (which I think is the bare minimum someone can do on a very busy night)- I believe her name was Kendra (she was at the bar on opposite side of the entrance on Valentine's Day). She walked us through the happy hour menu and gave us awesome suggestions! I also really liked the vibe of the restaurant, it was so cozy and warm. I'd love to go back!

Ask for their whiskey Bible! Lots of fun options to try. We enjoyed their menage a tois flight of cocktails and their angel's envy flight. They couldn't find the last angel's envy pour (cask) so they got me a whistlepig 12 yr rye. Perrrrfect replacement in that it was incredibly yummy.

Wonderful spot near NYU. Certainly a college bar but seemed like hard students. Families too. Good music, great old school yet modern design with nice touches. Nice bar menu, but elevated. Good quality riffs on things like Mac and cheese, chicken sliders, and burgers. Great spot in the area if you want relaxed yet still nice.
Yummy food and many options from salads to burgers to salmon and more. Good service with a large group of 8 people, and good drinks

I visited from nebraska and had the "new fashioned" and it was very good but without clear ice this place isn't over the top 5 starts, probably 4.5. It's a great place and I'll be back but if you are an over the top bourbon aficionado you might be let down. I'll give it to them, the glass was heavy and large and the staff very friendly.

Came here for a company event and I was surprised at how un-accommodating this place was. The ambiance and food were fine, but staff was rude and unprofessional. Never have I encountered something like this. Will not be coming back and would not recommend for any sort of organized event.

I came here for exactly one drink but I really liked the vibes. The bartender was very friendly, we got here early so there was plenty of room to sit and felt comfortable. I had a great espresso martini!
No comment

This place is a local gem, hands down one of my favorite bar/ restaurants in the area. It's more than just a pub or bar they have great ambiance and food. The service and staff are fantastic, and they show games such as the Euro Cup. The fish and chips are awesome, as is the burger and chicken sandwich. They have a great Happy Hour, with a ton of options. I usually get the margarita, it's fantastic.

First time here for brunch and highly recommend. The outdoor and indoor vibes are super chill (playlist is upbeat and relaxing without being too loud) plus the location is a block from WSP so provides for solid people watching. Food was really good (bacon cheeseburger and construct your own omelette) and service was perfect (thanks Denise!). We will be back.

A Greenwich village/NYU staple. Their boozy brunch is unbeatable and underrated. The brunch burger, nova benedict, and banana bread are all to die for--not to mention the bottomless mimosa flavors. If you want to get a table, definitely request for the waiter Topher who is incredibly charismatic and amazing. If you want to sit at the bar, request to be in Mondy's section as she is truly the sweetest. I need to stop by for the chicken pot pie during the week... stay tuned!
Solid restaurant choice within walking distance to the PATH train. Only thing I had I didn't like was the butternut squash soup, which was aggressively underseasoned.

Came here during pride weekend with some friends visiting from out of town.  Wanted to show them a good time and regretted coming to this place. Drinks are overly priced and watered down.  Food was under cooked. We weren't gonna complain about it but then we saw that it was almost 30 bucks for the burger so we decided to send it back and get a new one cooked. Food came out at different times for everyone. One side of the table got their meals first while the others watched and waited.  Staff was not attentive and at times had an attitude when we asked for our food to be cooked well. Save your money and go somewhere else.
No comment
No comment
The food was fine, the service was friendly, and the place is decorated so it's a delight to be in. Really nice looking spot.

Not a bad stop for dinner. We shared the onion rings, super tasty. They were so light and perfectly crispy. I had the fish and chips. I probably wouldn't recommend it since the fish was frozen and it ended up being pretty mushy fish and chips. I'm just used to fresh fish on the west coast. However, I sampled the chicken pot pie and bangers and mash. Both were tasty. Not a bad stop overall.
everything is great but don't eat the fish and chips. three people I know reported severe food poisoning from them last week.

Made reservations for 2 at 5:30 on a Saturday (the day of) and they had availability. We arrived early around 5 and they sat us. Very pretty ambiance and decor. The place was not packed but everything took very long. The kitchen staff seemed to be slow I feel like we waited for a long time in between the appetizer and main course. We ordered the mini crab cakes as an appetizer they were good but were lacking something. We both ordered a bacon cheeseburger. The food was not bad but everything was pretty bland. Overall, it was not that bad of an experience but I feel like it would be better for drinks with friends.
No comment
No comment

I had a great dinner there last night and the food was fantastic, I ordered the fish and chips, also has the Bangers and Mash which taste really delicious. The food was amazing, decent and truly good quality. The staff served the promptly. The service is great and on-point.
No comment
We were a little disappointed, they did not have some bourbons that were on the menu "The Bourbon Bible" so many places in New York so little time. Cozy atmosphere, worth another try.
Love the vibe - old English tavern. Great service, reasonably priced. Great drinks. And a lot of indoor space
No comment
Great place for a bit or beverage. Great vibe with just enough monitors to keep up with the games.
No comment

Super yummy food! Burger was on point and the fries nice and crispy. The food came in a timely manner which was important because we were with two toddlers. Chef came to check on us and was super nice! Doubt I'll be back because hardly in that neighborhood but will definitely recommend to anyone in the area!
Amazing brunch! I loved my bacon cheeseburger! It was very delicious and pretty big! Bloody Mary was on point too! Our server, Ekatherina was so attentive and friendly! Very very good experience

It's so cute and homey! I happened to be there in the night where there were hosting live music, it was beautiful! When the sun goes down, the gorgeously decorated outdoor seating area was lit up with lights. The food is INCREDIBLE!!! My appetizer blew me away and the main course was jaw dropping. I cannot wait for White Oak to reopen so I can bring literally EVERYONE I know here!!
No comment
No comment

Came here to get some drinks and catch up with a past friend last evening. I got the bacon cheeseburger and a draft beer. Even though the place was at maybe 1/3 or half capacity, it felt like service was quite slow and we had to wait maybe 30 mins before ordering our food. It wasn't too bad though because the inside atmosphere was nice and the dim candle lighting created a romantic mood - not that that was what I was looking for. When our food came, I was quite happy with the burger and fries I got. I could tell the fries were freshly fried and the burger was cooked to a perfect medium rare as I had requested. It was definitely on the pricier side for a standard bacon cheeseburger but I guess thats standard for places like this.
Joined the Whish(e)y club at The White Oak Tavern. Mrs K went for an espresso martini. I know they're "en Vogue" at the moment but this one is a belter. Not too sweet, good crema. Thanks, Eli!

Peter was a top notch bartender. On his game with mixing drinks like a magician, and offered suggestions on local places for us to check out while visiting. He offered fantastic customer service to his patrons! Highly suggest, to sit at at bar! The food and atmosphere were great, and we will be back!
Good American fare, standard prices for the area. Solid food, diverse drink menu, and even live music when I visited. No complaints at all.
No comment
Good for a burger very close to Washington Square Park. Waitstaff was very friendly and did great. Good for kids too.
One of my favorite spots in the Washington Square area. Really solid sit down place, great deviled eggs.

Amazing food!  Bartender (Eric)  greeted us with open arms and not only made the best drinks but also recommended the most amazing burger!  Thank you for changing the path of my not so great day to an amazingly positive night! Please continue being you and enjoying life.
No comment
No comment

The small plates burrata and the entrebacon cheese burger was DELICIOUS! The service was great. The apple crumble was OK, could've used another scoop of ice cream. It was super hot in there but who knows with this humidity we're having. Not sure if their AC was broken.
No comment
No comment

Stopped in to have a drink and found a nice bar with a comfortable environment and friendly bartender.  My husband decided to take a peek at their Whisky Bible and ordered the First Class Flight, it did not disappoint!
Average food, not a lot of options. Setting is fun and the place is pretty. Service was not great.
Had Sunday brunch here yesterday, very happy -- good food, good service, nice ambiance and decor, reasonable prices for NYC.   Good place to know about.
No comment
No comment

Fun place that has a "locals" vibe to it. Everything we ordered was great. We started with roasted Brussels sprouts, and I had their gourmet grilled cheese. My husband had the veggie lasagna and loved it. Food came out quickly, the staff was busy but attentive and friendly.
Everything you would want from a gastro pub!! Great food, great staff and good selection of craft beers. I highly recommend the shepherds pie! Enjoy
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Had a quiet lunch there on a Monday. Staff was very friendly and attentive. The Steak Frites was well worth the money. Definitely will return to try more dishes!
No comment

This was one of the 3 options my friend were looking at before we did our trip into the city. Happy that this was the victor, as it was the perfect spot before our 2nd leg of our day trip. The service was great (not too overbearing or sparse), quick service (both in bringing food and drinks), and quaint atmosphere (perfect for the young hip crowd as well as well as the mature quiet group). Definitely planning on coming back when it gets warmer out for brunch (definitely recommend doing so, the menu for brunch is great, and their small, but perfect, variety of alcohol for brunch is great (its 25 dollars for unlimited pitcher of a certain alcohol (mimosas)). The BLT was pretty good, but the fries were my favorite, no lie.

Great menu. Lots of really good brunch items and they have a nice bottomless brunch special. I believe it was $25 for 2 hours with an entree. The service could have been better, it took a long time once we finished our food to get the bill. But before that they were good about checking on us and getting food and drinks out fast. I'll definitely go again if I'm in the area.

Had birthday brunch here and it was fantastic. Food was good, service was great, shout out to Marina for doing an amazing job. It was really easy to get a reservation. The aesthetics are also fantastic.
The brunch was just ok! A pretty limited menu (especially if you're veggie!) and the mimosas were a bit weak. The service was great though, our waitress was attentive and friendly.
No comment
Loved loved the Rose Sangria! Really a great place. Service, drinks ambiance and food were excellent!

Nice place with pretty standard bar food and good beer selection.  I also had their mushroom ragu, which really rich and great for a winter night.  Their happy hour goes until 7, which is nice.  It was quiet on a weeknight, but I bet gets more crowded and lively during weekends.
No comment
No comment

A great place for brunch, lunch, and dinner.  I have tried a lot of their menu items since  I've been in the city in August, and I've come to love the Rose Sangria as my favorite drink.  I love the burger and the steak the most whenever I come, but I also enjoy the salmon and the mushroom bolognese too (before the menu adjustments).  Kendra and Christian are always amazing bartenders whenever I'm there and missing Alda (if that's the correct spelling) since she went on her own venture. The customer service is always on point whenever I go for a no fuss meal with some fun conversations throughout the stay.
No comment
No comment

We have stopped in two times in the middle of rain storms and now this is a must when we are visiting our NYU son. Impeccable service, cold beer in an upscale but comfortable setting. There is a large menu and lots of wine and cocktails but we just had some deviled eggs for a snack. They were perfect. One of our friends has been trying poutine at all restaurants and this is the best! Burgers looked great also. Next time!

4 stars is based on the Burrata appetizer and drinks! Came here before a comedy show and did not get a lot but the atmosphere was great and so was the service! I would like to come back and try more of the food to really be able to give it a more accurate rating! But definitely worth coming to if you are in the area!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went to White Oak for NYE dinner.  Holiday ambience was spot on..The drinks were very good, but the crispy Brussel sprouts were the bomb!  The bangers and mash was also excellent.  Would definitely come back!
No comment

I just love the atmosphere here. I love the old, timeless vibe of the dark wood and pub essence that's brewing under dim, incandescent lighting. The place is relaxing and wraps you up in warmth of it all. Great place for cocktails and cozying up to someone if you wanna nice date night. Great drinks! I love the whiskey cocktail flight since it's my favs all in one: sazerac, Manhattan and Old Fashioned. Can't wait to go back and try more drinks soon! What a lovely place!
No comment

Best burgers I know of.  Excellent homemade soups.  Interesting daily specials.  Kind and accurate service.  Nice atmosphere.  Fun for us older folks to watch (and listen to) the middle-aged sports fans.
No comment
No comment

OMG what a gem.  My friend and I came here for cocktail hour. We were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome, terrific service and just overall wonderful experience. This is not my go to place when I'm in the area. The drinks were wonderful. We didn't eat there but Next time we will. If the food is half as good as the drinks and service, we will feel that we totally hit the lotto. If you're looking for a nice place to have a cocktail, this is your place.
No comment

We found respite from the hot crowded streets during Pride here, and charging outlets, aaand more drinks, because Pride! The bathrooms are downstairs and they were very friendly about letting people use them without making a purchase. Thank goodness because there weren't any public bathrooms anywhere around the parade. They happily pointed me in the right direction and I went and stood in line with the masses. Meanwhile, my buddy who was waiting for me snagged me a seat at the bar. When I got back, I was able to plug in and have some water and another drink before we went back out. They were more than adequately staffed to handle the crowd and very friendly. They were fast, fun and didn't miss a beat! Yes, it was crazy, but they had everyone's backs and then some. Thanks for supporting us!

It was our first time in this place and service were really great. The bread was just a bit too hard.
No comment

Decent place with great decor, good service and drinks. The ménage à trois was pretty great- a flight of old fashioned, Manhattan, and Sazerac. The presentation was very cute-Manhattan came in a mini martini glass. For sides, we ordered the Coconut curry mussels with fries, and the brussels sprouts. The coconut curry was tasty and went well with the mussels-there was enough of the sauce that it could be drunk as a soup or sopped up with the abundant shredded bread pieces. The fries were nice and thick. Brussels sprouts were also good. My apple crisp salad was almost exclusively lettuce- barely any of the apples, nuts or cheese advertised. Salmon dish and fish and chips were meh. Great atmosphere and decor though, service was fast and friendly. I'd stop by here again and try a combo of some other orders.

Fantastic neighborhood spot with cozy digs and delicious American / New American elevated bar fare. Come here for a comfortable, intimate evening to enjoy good food and drink in a relaxed atmosphere. This is a great spot to duck away from the crowds in the West Village, sporting reasonable prices and friendly staff. Burger is great, mac n cheese phenomenal, friend chicken sliders savory.

I really liked this spot. It was a long day and at 3:30 pm realized I had not had breakfast and lunch. Well I had coffee several times. They open at 4 and have adequate outdoor dining. They were cool with us sitting at around 3:45, but would not take order until 4ish. Ok... good steak frites and burgers. Beer list was odd not a single Irish beer.
