No comment
No comment

Nice holiday themed ambiance and decent menu items for brunch. Food was good and the drunken donuts are delicious. Seems like a nice place to spend a morning or evening with friends. Typical brunch drink options (coffee, mimosa, Bloody Mary) but they'll also make you a Irish coffee if it's not on the menu.
Came here w our study group. It's a nice spot for chilling out. Drinks will not surprise you but good enough. definitely try the devil eggs.
No comment

Needing a break from walking around the city, we stopped in white oak tavern. We requested outside. The hostess was friendly and accommodating. We had chicken sliders and fries with dipping sauces. The sliders were tasty and the fries were very good. I also tried the rose sangria, it was very good. The food came quickly and was very hot. We were not rushed. The server was very friendly. The restaurant was also very clean. It was a nice spot to sit outside on a gorgeous day .
No comment
Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. Loved the decor, especially the rest rooms, and the song mix. The staff was super friendly and the salmon and sweet potato fries were delish.
No comment
No comment
Nice place located near NYU campus. They also host alumni events. Good atmosphere.
Critical part of the neighborhood. Best Pot Pie! Great ambiance. Always friendly service. DJ on the weekends. Generous drinks. You can't go wrong.

Found this Tavern while exploring Greenwich Village. Had brunch with my family and the food was delicious. My wife said the piece of salmon she had on her salad was one of the best she ever had. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the Wait staff was top notch.
No comment

Brunchy, brunch, brunch for this Sunday is White Oak Tavern...What a great place! We love attention to detail, atmosphere and good food and this place has it in abundance. Jose was our server and he was great, making us feel at home and making sure we had everything we wanted. The mushroom Bolognese has tons of chorizo in it. #YummyChorizo   Btw, If the drink of your choice isn't on the menu just ask - they're sure to have it! #WhiteOakTavern #WhiteOakTavernNYC #NYCFoodie #FoodBeast #Zagat #OpenTable #Resy #GoodFood #Eats #CBSJoe #NewYorkCityEats #NYCEats #Nomnom #Food #EatWell #EatingWell #FoodPorn #FoodGasm #HealthyFats #FoodGram #Brunch #SundayBrunch #BrunchFood #Gourmet #Nutritious #Delicious #Café #FoodCulture #DevourPower

I have been here for Sunday dinner and brunch. It may be one of the best kept secrets. The food is amazing and for the area the prices are so reasonable. My favorite dinner item is the fried whole cauliflower and my fave brunch was egg and cheese
No comment
No comment

We decided to come here for our NYE. I'm so happy we did. In our "old age" my husband and I (as well as our friends) wanted to make sure we had a low key night where we could talk and have a place to sit while bringing in the new year. Our friend found this place and picked it due it having a live band that night. It was great! They played a nice mix of jazz and instrumental versions of famous/ classic rock songs. The service was amazing! We had a couple of rounds of mixed drinks as well as a flight of whiskey for tasting. They do know how to make a great drink. I loved my bourbon peach iced tea the best! We had some small bites to eat after the clock rang 12- deviled eggs and some fries. The fries were great! They came with 3 different types of sauces and they were all delicious. I'd love to come here on a random night as well to just hang out. The seats were comfy and the service kept us comfortable too. Winner in my book.
No comment

Thank you Peter for hosting our late-night, spontaneous Valentine's Evening! We were so lucky to stumble into such a beautiful place with DELICIOUS food and cocktails and five star service. The New Fashions are on tap and dangerously good and the baby back ribs, cheese n' mac and popcorn chicken were equally drool worthy. Started our trip here and ending our last night here. Cheers Peter!

This is truly a hidden but not so hidden gem in New York City. The customer service is amazing! The bartender Peter was extremely kind and attentive but not over bearing (that's important). The second part, the food! The food was some of the best "bar bites" I've ever had. The portions are a great size and taste delicious. When the check came I was expecting a large bill but it was extremely light. I'd recommend this place to any and everyone!

Burrata with truffle honey was amazing. Good drink selection; I will be back.
No comment
Had a lovely after work dinner meeting with my PR and as he raccomended to get a cheeseburger o listened and didn't regret! Cozy vibes and a great location with extra friendly bartenders!
No comment
Amazing atmosphere! Love love love! Service was great. Friendly & fast. Food was presented nicely and tasted great!

Absolutely fantastic!! The whole experience: the atmosphere, the really great service, and the super good food. I went there for brunch last St. Patrick's Day and am looking forward to going again when I can get into the city next. Personal favorite: Scotch egg.

During the most uncertain of times, right before the forced bar and restaurant closures, White Oak Tavern was generous enough to welcome my small wedding after party into their bar, last minute, with all our leftover food and decorations in tow. Their service was impeccable, they treated us so warmly and I was so thrilled to see a few sour beer options on the menu (my favorite)! My family and my husband's family had a lovely time chatting amongst ourselves and with a few of the other neighborhood patrons about the wedding. I can't wait to go back and patronize White Oak when this virus nightmare is over!
No comment

Met a friend last Wednesday night on a rainy evening - the dark and warm vibe welcomed us in from the drizzle and it was perfect.  We gave a stamp of approval to the beverage program - loved the Penicillin and the wines by the glass had some great options.  Brussels and Deviled Eggs were pretty good, nothing amazing but definitely solid offerings.  The Burger was incredible and honestly the salmon with green curry and forbidden rice was probably the best salmon i've had in YEARs.
No comment
I have eaten here twice and both times the food is delicious, the atmosphere is unbeatable and the service is incredible. It's become a go-to spot for me now!
No comment

WHITE OAK TAVERN!!!! You blew me away during my visit last month, a whiskey 'bible', so many food options, incredible interior design, and amazing staff members? We happened to walk by White Oak Tavern on the way to our destination of the day, but it caught our eye so we decided to have dinner before we'd go home. I ordered the Baby Back Ribs (hoisin bbq sauce, cilantro, lime) They were some of the best ribs I'd ever had, moist and a perfect crust. SO much flavor. We also ordered the 12 oz. NY Strip (French fries, haricot vert, smoked almonds, garlic & herb butter) Again, they knocked it out of the park! I ordered the Smoke Show (tequila blanco, grapefruit, agave, mescal spritz) Almost forgot about the dessert! A cookie sundae, warm fresh cookies, and some delicious Van Leeuwen ice cream to go with it. I'll be back, SOON!

I think this is my new favorite restaurant for American food. Honestly, I have only positive things to say. The food was delicious, particularly the brussels sprouts which honestly might have been my favorite brussels sprouts I've ever had. The ambiance was so calming, but also cute and decorated for Halloween!!! Plus the noise level was the perfect volume and the service was quick. I am so thrilled with my experience here and glad I brought my guests here. I will be returning to try other items on the menu!

Cute little spot for food and wine. Wine selection is good. Food is really good too, especially cheese plate and Brussels sprouts. Sauce on the wings is good but they came out undercooked. The waiter had no problem taking them back and bringing us some that were more well done.

Our second visit to this bar. I ordered the Blood orange margarita and it was amazing! I wish it was bigger. Was served in a low ball glass, so maybe 6 ounces to drink. This place has never been too busy when we have come in. The bathrooms are single stall with three gents and three ladies in the same open area and shared hand washing sinks.
No comment

My friend took me here right after flying in to visit! I was starving and the White Oak did not disappoint. We were seated right away on a busy Thursday night. I loved that were had a vibrant bar scene and extensive cocktail list. We both went with a glass of wine and ordered the burrata to share. She went with the salmon as her entrée and I decided on the cauliflower. Wow - everything was delicious. You can never go wrong with burrata but at white oak, they serve it over grilled tomatoes. So tasty! I enjoyed the cauliflower so much. It was served over tahini with roasted cashews. It had so much flavor! My friends salmon was cooked perfectly.  Our waitress was very attentive and sweet. Looking forward to coming back next time I visit!

No comment

I took my galentines to White Oak Tavern tonight and I'm so glad I did! The place is lovely and I can't compliment the service enough. Our waitress was wonderful. I had the Pinot noir and did starters for my main, the Brussels and fried chicken sliders, and both were delicious. I can't wait to go back and try other stuff on the menu. Perfect spot for a little midweek get together.

Food was amazing, and we got hooked up with a plate of donuts for my birthday, would recommend!!

As soon as we walked in, the bartender welcomed us. The restaurant is beautiful - lots of dark wood and many different types of lighting and cool chandeliers. I'm a pescatarian and my wife is not, and we both found many options. This is our 2nd time here, and both times I ordered the mushroom bolognese (vegan), which is awesome! So many different flavors going on (kale walnut pesto). Wifey got bangers & mash on our first visit and the salmon on her 2nd, and both were SO delish (according to her!). I did have some of the salmon - medium rare with black rice - perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. Now to the drinks. The bartenders are top of the line. I'm a vodka martini girl, and Kelly made the perfect "up, very dry, with a twist" martini. Bonus - they play great music!

I ordered a beer with ribs and fries. I have never had such a magical experience eating ribs. They were tender enough to eat, but had texture to make sure they do not fall off the bone and make a mess. 10/10

I was here for dinner back in January pretty good food. The fish and ships was reasonable price and portion. I would come back. A bit dark inside but good choice of Beers and spirits. Came around 830 and not crowded on a Saturday night.

I met up with some old friends here this past weekend. What a gem! Very cool ambience, awesome food, very friendly staff, loved the donuts. Just a very cozy, cool place to eat and drink with friends. They also had live music which was the cherry on top.
No comment

This place is amazing. We had a reservation at 6 and we were sat down right away. The service is amazing. A must try are the Brussels sprouts and I had the chicken pot pie  it was the best pot pie I have ever had.

Cute little tavern in Manhattan- serving good hearty bar food with some healthy options mixed in. My friends and I went here and I got the salmon it was really good! Drinks were good, setting was good, service was good! Good later night spot.
No comment

Perfect location across the park. I just got takeout of the pork hash. I don't like eggs but they were needed because it was dry. I hate drowning food in ketchup but what I wouldn't do for aujus or a sauce. I would return to try other things, but def dry hash if you opt no eggs

I have mixed feelings about this place. The atmosphere is great: it's a large space, with quite a bit of room between tables and very comfortable seating. There's a rustic yet chic feel, and a nicely lit bar in the center of the restaurant. The food however was very so-so. The items are rather standard - things I feel like I could find at any bar in the area. I would definitely come here to hang out and grab drinks, but it's maybe not the best place to go for a nice meal.
No comment
Quaint location. Good was pretty good. We had fish and chips and the steak fritte. Pricey, but it's NYC.
Loved the ambiance in the bar and the service. The bartender, Peter, was great and made our evening! Look forward to making this a regular on our list of places to go in NYC!

We stumbled upon this place after shopping at The Strand. Good diverse menu with traditional items such as burgers and some unique items , as well. I had the kale and cashew pesto flatbread - delicious!

The coconut curry mussels were to die for . I loved every bite of it. The fries and deviled eggs were cool as well. A bit on the salty side for me but the mussels definitely!!! I would definitely return there again.

Feels like early America; dark wood, bookshelves with books, saloon light fixtures, comfort gourmet, great music, full (lovely) bar, delicious food, free wifi, a block from Washington Square.  Okay for well-behaved kids but caters to professionals & students.
No comment
No comment

Was there just for the drinks didn't eat anything,  order some beer first and a margarita after that, the margarita was delicious perfect mixed, I only not giving 5 stars because the service wasn't the best it took long after I finish my beet for the waitress to ask if I wanted something else, but overall great ambiance,  have to go back and try the food

Food was great, service was fast, mac n cheese was the cheesiest cheese you will ever cheese, bacon cheeseburger was amazing, deviled eggs were phenomenal, great place a must see place when visiting New York, and if you live here in New York then this is a great place to come to for a date or with the family!

No comment

Love the ambience, coziness, and that obvious tavern vibe of this restaurant.  We just stopped by for lunch after hanging out at Washington Square Park.  Only had salads but they were both great and waitress was very friendly.  Bathrooms are downstairs.

The White Oak Tavern is a great location for live music, great cocktails and beers and even better food. They offer a wide choice of beers from tap. The small selection of cocktails is not a standard one you can find everywhere. We shared  butternut squash with goat cheese and kale and mussels in coconut/coriander sauce as starters. Our mains where: Portobello (Vegi) Burger with salad, Bacon-Cheeseburger with fries and Pasta with duck. All dishes where really good. The service was also very friendly and courteous. Even though the White Oak Tavern doesn't have the prices you would expect from a Tavern or Pub, it's a great place for a night out with great food and drinks.
Great comfort food but they also have more sophisticated dishes. Crowd was lively and the place has a great vibe. Great service also.
Good spot for a pint and a bite. Very rustic feel. Good service overall, though I was surprised that the bartenders didn't know some basic drinks. Maybe it was his first day tending bar!
No comment
No comment

Good cozy place by Washington Square Park. Interesting mix of ppl since it's by NYC. Lots of parents taking their kids out for dinner and lots of kids throwing back shots. Good music, solid food (nothing so out of the world creative but nothing is bad). Good place to have a drink after walking the park.
No comment

Happy hour = a fantastic surprise 5-7pm, incredibly high end cocktails for $8. Go early and it's not busy, not loud, old world decor, super clean and comfortable. This place is expansive and perfect for groups. Irish bartender friendly, efficient and has a fun long beard. Two big ass thumbs up.
No comment
No comment

My friend and I were looking for a budget-friendly place for brunch and this is it! We both got the avocado toast with a poached egg and it was delicious! Very tasty bread and really hit the spot! Great service and cool atmosphere. Highly recommend for locals or tourists!

I found myself here late at night one weekend and needed a bite to eat and a beer. The beer selection was fine-no complaints there. The food on the other hand left something to be desired. We decided to order off the bar bites menu. I can say the menu is named appropriately because the chicken sliders I got were truly one bite each. At $11 I was fairly disappointed. We also got some wings to split and a few of them came out cold. Overall I wouldn't write this place off because it does have a relaxed and intimate vibe. However, avoid the bar bites menu.

The best. THE. BEST. From 10pm, after the first rush of people meeting for a drink, and then the second wave of diners (who are probably paying too much for dinner, given the restaurants that are around), it becomes an absolute oasis of calm, pleasant drinking. Even the bartenders noticeably exhale. Gorgeous holiday decorations, too, and often a good upstate beer on draft - Ithaca or Ommegang.

Nice place. Enjoyed the special cucumber drink I ordered. It was very refreshing. We got there around 11, therefore the kitchen closed otherwise I'd love to try the food. The bartender was very nice and loved the Irish accent

One of my favorite happy hour places! The ambience is incredible. The decorations are gorgeous and yet it's fairly casual. The drinks are great -- I always get the peach bourbon tea drink, even though I don't usually like bourbon, the taste hits the spot! You can also get a bottle of wine for $20 during happy hour, heloooooo. I will say the food portions are deceptively small and the service isn't great -- you can tell waiters have to cover a surprising number of customers. But if you're looking to camp out with a friend or a date, you really can't go wrong here!

My husband and I came here while on vacation because a friend from NYC recommended it. We had a great time! Grabbed some drinks at the bar. Great decorations, homey vibe, friendly, and our bartender (Peter) was friendly and knowledgeable. Drinks were unique and the whiskey bible was cool.

Solid upscale tavern in NYU neighborhood. Had the Pan-Seared Scallops, Duck Flatbread and Grilled Octopus and nothing disappointed. Ordered for two and had enough to eat for both of us, at about $30/person before tip. Not bad!

we got the coconut curry mussels, fried chicken sliders, chicken pot pie and deviled eggs. Either I was unknowingly hungry or alllll four of them were yum! Definitely going back :)

Came here Sunday afternoon for some drinks and appetizers. After being pleasantly surprised by amazing live music and enticed by a taste of the homemade sangria, we settled on Irish coffee and a bottle of wine (half price Sunday evenings). It was the best Irish coffee I have had. We will definitely be coming back.

Came in at 7pm in a Friday without reservations and were sat immediately. Tried two different cocktails, both were delicious. Ordered a few apps, enjoyed them all. Great service, will definitely try again.
Their grilled cheese changed my life. It was made with a French bread, had jalapeños on it and bacon, and was served with a fire roasted tomato sauce. Me gusta.

Great village spot off wash square. THEY POUR A GREAT DRINK. One of the better burgers on NYC. Great atmosphere, an adult place. Prices are Manhattan. Staff was wonderful, food very good. Will be back visiting daughter at NYU!!!
Wonderful evening....drinks food and music.  The drunken donuts sound better then they were.  I suggest the mussels. Yummy
Amazing ambiance and great bartender (Peter). The cocktails are great and beer selection is top notch. Five stars will be back.
Great place, friendly and welcoming staff. Great for intimate dates or parties. The food and drinks are very food too. Definitely going to find my way back to this place.

Cozy downtown manhattan bar located close to Washington Sq Park.  The ambiance is upscale pub, lots of wood, warm lighting.  The food was better than most pubs.  My bangers and mash was pretty good and the  soup and salad combo was delicious.  Nice selection of beer but could have a hard cider on tap.  The price is a factor.  Yeah, it's new york but with appetizers, drinks and tip, the bill came to about $50 a person.  That's pretty expensive for a bite at the pub!  I recommend for a special occasion.

We had such a wonderful evening here!! I had a bourbon whiskey ale and fried chicken, which were phenomenal!! The service was perfect and the ambience reminded us of the pubs we went to in London. We had such a great time and definitely recommend White Oak!

Went here recently for a girlfriend's birthday. The atmosphere is great- soft lighting and lovely decorations. The food was quite fresh and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening. The service staff was very nice but could have been a bit faster so I gave it a 4 overall instead of 5.
No comment
No comment

We hosted a casual hangout for most our guests who travelled out of town to come to our wedding the night before the wedding. White Oak is very lenient and nicely set us up in high table area where people can just mingle. They had great selection of great drinks and the bar bites has the essential bar must bites. Our bartender - she's super friendly and accommodating! Recommended for hosting casual large group event

Met some friends here the other night for drinks. Everyone who had cocktails really enjoyed them- the rose sangria was really tasty! I also had the deviled eggs, which were solid- not too fancy or overdone. More upscale than the typical college bar hangout, I'd suggest this before a show or for a more special occasion.
Great ambiance on a cold NYC day! Valentine's Day in the city with a great bottle of wine and company.

Very cozy environment and the food was good too. I highly recommend the deviled eggs. Yummy!

Horrible mac and cheese. Very little crumbly cheese and the pasta was not even macaroni. Tea came in lukewarm. Not worth going.
