Great place.  Service was top notch. Our appetizer was solid (deviled eggs). Our entrees (pan chicken and grilled cheese) were excellent. Great food, service and environment. Can't go wrong
Great food, fun cocktails, and atmosphere was classy and warm.
No comment

I ordered the Hangar steak, menu never mentioned it would be sliced or I would have never ordered it! And why slice a steak and then serve it on a cold plate? Warm plates people! The Prosciutto was sliced way too thick for the Flatbread. Our server kept wanting to take plates and our beers that we were still drinking. I don't get the 4 and 5 stars yelpers, I found it very mediocre .

What a great find!!!!  This is a traditional Irish style pub with absolutely fantastic food!!!  We enjoyed great service from our server Ryan.  We ordered the chicken pate small plate (incredible with bacon marmalade!!!) ,chicken pot pie and the new duck flatbread with goat cheese, lemon and leeks. OUTSTANDING! We also enjoyed the Kentucky bourbon barrel ale that was delicious with this heavier fare and finished it all with a boozy chocolate bourbon filled donut!!!. Wish we had time to go back!!!!

I enjoy coming to this place, some good happy hour deals and cocktail pitchers, the food I've had has been solid, and it's a nice atmosphere without being pretentious. Had a Green Ford cocktail last night and it was delicious.

Very cute spot.  Lovely happy hour specials.  I believe it's $7 for the selected drinks on the menu.  Because it's cute and it has a happy hour, this place was bumpin' on Friday afternoon.  So much so that it was hard to have a conversation with anyone  without having to yell over the crowds.  It's crazy how loud it got in here.  My friends had some food and from what I saw, it looked tasty.  Sadly, I only tried the drinks.  The sangria was very nice and the margarita was decent as well.  It's definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood.
No comment

A few weeks ago, my friends and I all came here for Sunday brunch ... and everyone that got the avocado toast got horrific food poisoning hours later. Coincidence that three of us starting throwing up within hours of each other after we ate the same exact thing at brunch? I think not! We had no other interactions before/after together that could be the culprit. Wanted to love this place, it was cute, the food was delicious at the time, and we enjoyed our brunch, but man the afterwards was soooo not worth it. I had to pay a lot of money to change a flight I had scheduled, because I physically could not get on an airplane the next day as I could not stop throwing up for a full day after I ate here. Clearly something was wrong with the poached eggs or the avocado, would encourage the restaurant to check their kitchen practices ...

This is one of the best places for "cheaper" food in NYC-Greenwich Village. It is a block and a half away from Washington Square Park, which is great for people who are visiting NYU and are searching for great food. I had the caesar salad with grilled chicken to start and the fried chicken with scallion waffles and kimchi... an asian fusion of one of my favorite American classics. The food was quite tasty and a decent-sized portion. The restaurant has a very homey vibe with antique-like furniture, woodwork and thick curtains on the windows. The only thing I have to comment on is the slow service and treacherous walk down to the bathroom... a very steep flight of stairs. Other than that, please add White Oak to your list of Greenwich Village hotspots it's now on mine!!
No comment

Walking by and handed a flier for a free drink.  Took a shot and was pleasantly surprised.  From the minute we sat down, our amazing bartender Pete took good care of us.  He had the kind of personality you wish all bartenders had (take note hipsters!) he approached with a smile and a handshake and engaged with us on drinks, food and friendly conversation.  Apps were good and drinks were amazing!  Will definitely come back.

Be Aware of Food Poisoning! Last Sunday I came here for brunch with several friends. The service was good, and the food was good, but afterwards 4/5 of us became violently ill. Three of us had the avocado toast and were throwing up for days. The fourth had some type of grain bowl, but had similar stomach issues. Be very careful with this place. Clearly someone in the kitchen didn't wash their hands and contaminated the food, or they didn't wash the avocados thoroughly. I would not want anyone to experience the illness we experienced after eating here. This place needs to take more precautions.
Too good. Rosé sangria is fantastic, fromage portions are generous, and the appetizers are authentic. Cozy place and kind servers- will not disappoint!
The food and drinks are great! I went there on a date and would totally go back.
No comment
Great lighting, warm ambiance, creative and well-balanced cocktails, with good food to match.

Delicious food, great drinks and amazing atmosphere. What more you're looking for? Had an night experience before, but just stopped for a lunch break and had an incredible time!! The ambiance is super charming and the vibes during the day really makes you wanna stay. The bartender Laura gave great advices about the menu and was very knowledgeable about her cocktailsended ordering the Mac and Cheese and the Steak Frites... simply amazing and totally worth the price!!!

Loved it. So many reasons why but let's start off with the ambience. It was a beautiful rustic vibe put me in the mind of the show Cheers but dimmer with Christmas decorations. The host was pleasant I didn't need a reservation walked right in and was able to sit. The entire menu looked pretty good I had the chicken pot pie and it was beautiful my only con about it was that the chicken pieces were to large but other than that really no complaints. My sister had bangers & mash which was like a pork sausage in an onion jus with mash potatoes it was also amazing. It was comfort food perfect for a brisk evening. The cocktails were great the one that caught my eye was the rosé sangria and I like it my sister had the Peach Iced Tea with Bourbon it had more of a smoky taste to it not your traditional spiked tea but still good. They offered us dessert unfortunately we didn't take them up on the offer but I'm sure it's just as good as the main course. I may go back tomorrow to try the Brussels that we kept smelling! Most certainly will return, the music was great, food was great, drinks and service were superb.
Hidden gem. Such nice people- host, bartenders, waiters! Food is excellent!!! So happy we found this place!
Great service and great food! We needed to rush in and out and the waitress was so sweet and very attentive.

Met friends here. They were running late but restaurant was very accommodating. From cocktails to dessert, everything was delicious. Service was just right. The noise level made conversation difficult but, all in all, I'd go back.
Beautiful place. Good food and right near NYU. Really liked it a lot. Diverse enough menu to please everyone in your party.  Solid choice.

I love White Oak. It's on campus and is a great go-to after class, my friends and I are always meeting for drinks or bites. The atmosphere is super cozy and inviting,  it's always warm in the winter time. They have a great happy hour too and I am a huge fan of their small plates, in particular their flatbreads and brussel sprouts. If you're looking for a Sunday Brunch White Oak is also a fantastic option - they offer low prices and pitchers that are delicious.
Great atmosphere and fantastic food!  Had dinner here with the family and the service was top notch.  The chicken pot pie and burgers are the best.  Ribs and ricotta appetizers were amazing.
Always a go to when we visit our daughter at NYU.  Love the atmosphere and ambiance, the drinks are great and the food is always good.  A great place to hang out.

The happy hour cocktails here are great! I've met a friend who works in the area here several times before. They happy hour is reasonably priced and the cocktails are creative. It gets kind of crowded after work so make sure you get there early to get a seat! It's usually a mix of students and young professionals who work near NYU. It's very well decorated, not just your standard pub!
No comment
Many screens for sports games, good local draft beer.
No comment
No comment

Gorgeous decor and ambiance. Had the Greene Ford cocktail--a delicious gin and rosemary concoction. My friend ordered the burrata and it was super smooth and creamy. Overall, impressed. Will definitely come again!

The hostess was a twit and turned us off enough we almost walked out after being seated. But it was raining so we stayed and were glad we did. Cocktails and brunch were very well done and the service staff was good.

This was a great place to get a late lunch and drinks on a cold Saturday afternoon. The pub had a cozy feel and I could tell it was place that local neighborhood customers go to often. We got two seats at the bar and the person sitting next to me recommended the grilled cheese sandwich with bacon. This sandwich was so different from the norm. The bread was thick and crunchy and filled with leeks, pickled jalapeño, fontina and gruyere cheeses, and tomatoes. It also came with a piquillo dip that added another dimension to this already mouth watering sandwich. Since this place is also known for their whiskey, I had the peach bourbon iced tea which was a combination of Jim beam, peach puree, and lemon iced tea. So good that I ordered a second!  Our bartender was so sweet and very helpful and knowledgeable with my whiskey questions. They had a boozy brunch going on so the place was packed and everyone looked like they were having a great time!  Definitely recommend this place and hopefully will return soon!

I was in the neighborhood waiting on a friend and decided stop at this cute classy wine n food bar. I did have a hankering for the taste of beer so I tried the one of the beers on the happy hr menu not really a beer drinker so it didn't matter just as long as I never had it before. It was nice the bartender was welcoming and attentive. I ended up staying for dinner. I had the roasted squash w brown butter which was delicious light and creamy the almonds gave it a nice crunch very tasty, also had the French fries fried to perfection with three homemade dipping sauces , and then I had the Siracha lime butter popped corn, it was ok I guess they didn't warm up the butter much so it was cold on the popcorn and not sure if it was popped fresh didn't seem so I'll pass on that next time. And yes there will be a next time!  3 glasses of pinot Grigio later I had the drunken doughnuts for 2 ( wine makes me hungry) which were amazing. The chocolate is my favorite. Bill came to around 65-70$ not to bad.

I've been several times and have loved almost everything I've tried. Great booze-y donuts. Drinks are fantastic. Staff is on top of it. Love the interior - it's pretty and spacious, but not overly fancy.
Fantastic bartenders. Excellent whiskey selection (they have a whiskey bible). Good beer choices too. Nice place to get away from the the crowds.
No comment

I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere of White Oak Tavern. The service was great - and the happy hour Pinot was great! I loved the relaxing vibes here. A charging outlet and the wireless password was given to me as well :) Lovely!
No comment

This place is awesome for brunch on the weekends, no crowds, great normal food, friendly staff, wifi. It's a hidden gem, in the fact that it's comfortable and no wait.  They have no problem doing substitutions or changing anything within their sphere of influence. The staff remembers your usual and are attentive to every need.  There are plenty of restrooms which are kept clean and spotless.  There is a full bar, I can't believe this place isn't jammed.  Give it a shot, the eggs Benedict, potato hash, brisket hash , are all delicious.  Try the cocktails, some great bourbons and spirits, they even bake their own mini muffins.
No comment
This place always hits the spot. Cozy. Good happy hour. Bartender Peter is one of the fastest, best, most welcoming bartenders I've ever sat across from.
No comment

They were clearly having an off night - our server was very sweet and very inexperienced - We explained exactly how we wanted a drink and when we got it it was awful - When we tried to explain it to her for the second time, she looked so confused I went to the bar myself to tell the bartender what we wanted - The bartender ended up also being the general manager - when the drink came back, it tasted exactly like the first one - that is because she brought the same drink back - we know this because the bartender was calling her from across the room saying that's the wrong drink - we ordered mac & cheese - it came out cold and she said that's the second time that has happened tonight - We asked to speak with the general manager and he brought out a hot mac & cheese - We ordered deviled eggs they never came - we ordered diet Cokes they took forever to come - We enjoyed the chicken pot pie very much but the chicken sliders were so chewy it was comical - Our first server stopped by to tell us she had to go to side work and someone will be taking over the table - We then got our second very sweet but very inexperienced server - Because we are apparently gluttons for punishment, we asked to see a dessert menu - she brought us drink menu and it took us forever to flag her down and ask for the correct menu - We shared an ice cream sundae, which was very good - The general manager came over and told us the one dessert was with their compliments, since they had all been suffering from "turkey brain".  We really didn't want anything for free - we just wanted a good meal - but if you are going to try to make up for that many mistakes, comping one dish of ice cream does not seem sufficient - In fairness it's a pretty room - in our neighborhood and we have had good food there before - we will probably give it another chance.

This place seems to be on point in an area where businesses come and go quickly. Their menu is amazing and I can't wait to try so many things. I had the wings and the prosciutto flatbread and they did not disappoint. Cocktail menu also looked great. Semi-unisex bathrooms were a plus as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant was really nice and the staff was great.
Great experience here! Good food, good service! My hubby had an issue with his food, and they quickly took care of it. Dessert menu looks amazing, but too full to indulge!

Even if you are not a huge fan of pubs like I am, you will love this one! We enjoyed great, friendly, attentive service...absolutely charming and memorable. Then, we had 3 delicious, expertly prepared cocktails and entrees that are typically 2-3x the price at pretentious places. My strip steak was astonishingly perfect! The sauce was amazing! The tahini cauliflower was nothing but scrumptious, as was the burger. And then to our amazement, they didn't even want to charge us for the steak because I asked for it to be sent back for a bit more cooking, which they did happily! Do not waste your time at pretentious, rip offs..I wish I could name places. You know them. Just come to the White Oak Tavern!

One of our absolute favorite places! Always hopping of a Friday night but not so overcrowded that the experience is lost. Food is amazing, drinks are delightful! Great selection of whiskeys. The staff are amazing especially Jules, Pete, and Johnny!

Only a block away from NYU Stern, White Oak is a second home for many students!!! I've dropped by before/after classes/meetings for drinks. There's always a good crowd- not so packed and loud that you can't hear your own voice or get a drink, but not a ghost town. They have your typical NY drinks on tap and some surprisingly yummy cocktails as well. I tried the Penicillin ($12.50) last night and really liked it. It's light, refreshing, and comes with a dried ginger candy.
Love this place! Great service, ambience, drinks, and food. Make sure you get the crispy caramelized Brussels sprouts and the alcoholic doughnuts!!
No comment
No comment
We stopped here based on yelp reviews  and they didn't disappoint!! We loved the beer, atmosphere and friendly service ! My son didn't like his food but we did ! Great chopped salad.

Nice place. Was interested to see if it had the feel of a british pub, having been in nyc for a whopping 2 months now! It was more than half empty but my husband and I were told by the young guy at the door we could only be seated at the bar or one of the high tables. Still he wasn't arsey about it so we sat at the bar. The whole time we were there no one else came in and even the girl who served us was surprised we hadn't been offered a table. This was a Sunday @1300, so maybe they were expecting an influx. Food was good. We both ordered mains, and wings to share. Wings were on the sweet side. My husband orders wings in most bars so he was a bit disappointed by that. Beer good. Bar itself has a nice vibe to it. Would def go back.

This place is fantastic. Had the grilled octopus, the coconut curry mussels, and the fried chicken sliders (all recommendations from our awesome bartender Ruth) and they were amazing. Some of the best food I've ever had. Ruth was super friendly and helpful. We will be returning!

I came here with a friend after a campus visit for NYU. I love the dim lighting around the dining room and the uplighting on the bar. The restaurant has a classy but not stuffy look. I ordered a draft beer, mussels, and fries. The mussels were small but acceptable for the price and the number mussels in an order. The sauce was absolutely amazing. It was a bit of a tangy, buttery, curry taste. I even dipped my fries in it! The service was friendly and timely.

So my previous review was 3 stars for being charged for ice tea refills.  Decided to go back as it was close by. I mentioned the tea fiasco to the barmaid and she says no we don't charge for tea refills, so we ordered tea, grilled cheese and bacon, and salmon. All of the food was great (as mentioned in previous post).  Let's just say they took care us this time .  Will be back when in town, and maybe before I leave.

Not convinced. I often have to go there because it is close to work and people find it easy to just cross the street. Our place to go used to be Apple but closed down. Drinks at Whiteoak are ok, nothing remarkable. I am a tequila and mezcal drinker and was not impressed by the selection. I have not eaten there but the food does not wow me, and wouldn't eat there anyway because of the ambience. The place cant decide whether it is a pub or a restaurant.

I stopped in here on a whim after reading about the burgers.  (It's close to my office.)  When I asked the bartender, she said that they could be a life-altering experience.  I was sold.  Let me tell you something: they are.  There was something magical about the combination of the bacon and that mustard that I don't think I can really describe.  What I will say is that you should try it.  Then again, you should check this bar out for no other reason than the "whiskey bible" which is kind of awesome in itself.
A nicely decorated space with good food and decent service. It gets busy Friday nights. The fish and chips are delicious.
We had dinner Saturday night. Cool room. Crazy good whiskey cocktails. We ate a bunch of apps and each one was tasted. Our server was Chloe and she excellent.

This place isn't bad just your average "New American" pub. It is well priced for what you get and its got a nice atmosphere during dinner time, yet during lunch it's basically empty. I would come back, but try a few other places in the big apple first.

Made a reservation, went there and was told by someone the computer said you have 36 minutes before a table is ready but your on top of the list. I asked when we would be seated. The person was not capable of answering the question.
We had chicken pot, pork belly, steak and pasta. All very good. I will recommend pork belly and chicken pot. The server is very nice, always with smiles.

Saw this place as we were walking around in the village. We saw they had oysters and being from the gulf coast we had to check it out. This is a very neat and classy establishment with very good oysters. A must visit if you are in the area.

What a great find! Stumbled across this place while in the neighborhood thanks to Yelp. Really great atmosphere, excellent food and reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone in the area, and definitely plan to go back myself. I had a delicious burger, and some great appetizers as well (brussel sprouts and a squash dish I believe). Really great spot to grab some drinks and dinner.
Well crafted cocktails with excellent service and delicious food.  What more could one want.?
Fried chicken sandwich was amazingly moist with the perfect balance of light crunch, fresh bun, and sweet, tangy slaw.

The location and ambience of this place is great. The craft cocktails are amazing. The appetizers especially the popcorn are great. The game changer for myself was the duck flatbread..... Who would have thought it! Excellent staff who are very friendly and helpful.

I hadn't ever heard of White Oak but to my surprise my cousin and I had one of the most phenomenal cheeseburgers of our lives. They also have a pretty unique list of beers to chose from. Definitely a place I'll be coming back to.
Ambience is great. Service is a bit slow but friendly, and good selection on the menu.

a beautiful bar. aesthetically i'd give it five stars.  and the fact that they have kentucky bourbon barrel ale on tap is a big bonus.  just don't order any mixed drink that's not one of their specialty drinks, because the bartender that served me doesn't seem to know what goes into a whiskey sour.  i knew i should have changed my order when after i asked him if they put raw egg white into their sours and he said "sure.  how many eggs would you like?"

4 stars for a nice atmosphere, good service from a very friendly staff, and overall a great experience...but the 5th star is for the best chicken pot pie I've ever had in my life.  I'm actually kind of shocked how uncommonly delicious it was. Nice job folks, will definitely return.

This review is for brunch which was excellent. The place is very spacious and can accommodate big company, even with kids. Not loud, very classy looking. And their brunch menu is very extensive, for any taste. We had all different egg dishes and were very satisfied. My Eggs Benecdit were in very interesting presentation and so tasteful. I will definitely come back there.
No comment

Met a few friends here after work the day before New Year's Eve which is why it was probably a little on the quieter side. The cocktails were amazing, The Natural was my absolute favorite! Great ambiance, bar snacks we got were great, too. Definitely a gem in the NYU area.

Great place, we stooped there for quick bites before Blueman show. The bartender was very professional but friendly. The drinks and food came out quick. Awesome Brussels as our bartender suggested and Ribs appetizer are so yummy. Definitely recommend !

A very nice spot for Sunday brunch. Wasn't crazy busy, but the food was good and service professional. Charming in an old-timey pub way, but not corny at all. I had the pulled pork hash, which has a bit of a kick to it.

Extremely friendly staff willing to explain any of the craft beer or any questions about in general about the drink menu. Came in pretty late so we weren't expecting anything - but the bartender was great.. even if it was nearing the end of her shift!

Went there last night after Caroling in Washington Square Park.  The place was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  We ended up sitting at the bar for dinner since it was a bit crowded.   Overall a great night.
No comment

Tasty cocktails, friendly staff, expectedly bougie eats. We were a party of seven and we didn't get a table until about an hour after I arrived (although some of the folks in my party were running REAL late so it didn't matter much). We enjoyed ourselves, it was a lowkey place to meet friends and would be great for a date too.

I stopped in White Oak Tavern after a concert at le poisson rouge. My friends and I didn't order any food but got cocktails. The drinks were reasonably priced and the bartender was entertaining. This is a nice addition to the neighborhood.
Beautiful ambiance! Cozy and romantic. Only had drinks, so don't know what the food is like. But would love to try it sometime.

This is a really great (fairly) new spot in the NYU vicinity for casual dining and drinks in a very cool old-world atmosphere. I've come here several times since starting at NYU, and have always been pleased with my meals here. It's one of those great local places that I was glad to see open up in the area. The interior is beautifully decorated- dark, but in an antique and charming sort of way. The bar itself is also beautifully set up. Totally love the ambience here, and I would say that the food does it justice. I've had several things here from salads to burgers to waffles at brunch, and have never been disappointed with the food. Everything is very tasty. I recommend the chopped salad, fried Brussels sprouts with bacon (delicious!) and pretty much any of their burgers. The food is great, and it's just a really nice place to hang out and have a good time. Definitely recommend.
Nice, old school but refined interior and good selection of beer. Knowledgeable waitress.

Food, drinks, Irish accent. Check-check-check. Great bar in the area that feels more geared towards the young professionals in the area, not the college kiddos. I love supporting White Oak Tavern because they are great people, and local.

This is a great bar that also has top notch food. It's an oasis of adult classiness in NYU-land--but it's also a perfect date place for the aspiring young student who wants to impress that special someone.
No comment

Damn good beer selection. Good happy hour specials, good food. Great place to go. Near NYU, close to the 9th street oath, convenient, but not overly crowded with wasted college students. Great vibe. The burger and smuttynose pumpkin beer are winners!

This place is pretty spacious and our bartender was awesome. I had the rose sangria which was nice 'n sweet (love my drinks with st germain in 'em!). Great spot to check out that's right across from NYU!

Great neighborhood bar/restaurant! Feels like a British pub and has a solid selection of whiskeys and beers to back that up. Surprisingly good brunch is worth checking out. Lots of plugs under the counter to keep your phone charged. Helpful and friendly staff!

Stopped in to treat my daughter and her friends to a early dinner.  Great beer choices (cold).  Had a great meal.  Great music.  Around 5pm (Sunday) two guys started playing very cool soft rock tunes.   We will be back
Happy Hour on Saturday. Very nice. A really tastie crock of onion soup to warm up on after walking.

I am giving this place four stars just because this is the third restaurant in that location that I've seen in 10 years, and it is the first I've been compelled to enter. That block is such a no man's land that this alone is a feat. But they actually aren't bad as a pub, either. I had a pot pie of some sort and a beer and some Brussels sprouts. They were all competently prepared, and service was attentive and professional. All in all, I hope they keep it up, because I cannot handle another Murphy and Gonzalez-type abomination.

The white oak tavern Is a new addition to this vibrant area.  That being said I think it supersedes any other spot around.  The food is on point, there's not one thing on the menu that can be ranked above or below any other as the standards are high across the board.  the beer selection wide varied and freezing.  But the staff are attentive without intruding and warm.  Over all amazing
No comment

This quaint pub has a lovely ambiance and great food. Our foursome ordered 3 bacon cheeseburgers that were cooked perfectly and the flavor was outstanding! The chipotle mayo was an amazing addition to the burger. The BLT was delicious and the fries were terrific. A trip to the restroom was an adventure. While not handicapped accessible the bathrooms were so cool and reminiscent of a speakeasy. The entire place was beautifully decorated and the staff warm and friendly. The entrees were reasonably priced and we will definitely return.
We stopped in for a quick drink Friday. Love love loved the bar and bartender. Great ambience, very chill atmosphere.
The food and drinks were awesome. The brussel sprouts appetizer was delicious. The rose sangria was great. The service was wonderful. Highly recommend.
No comment
The best hamburger cooked to perfection and worth every penny. Very attentive service too. Def coming back next time I'm in nyc.

Arias like Darius without the D is the bomb. By far the nicest bartender I have had the pleasure of meeting in nyc. Will purely come back just for banter with her. Arias is an asset to your establishment!

We visited this place on Easter for brunch. The decor was beautiful and homey and the Brunch was delicious though the drinks seemed prepared by an amateur.. We love this area as it is slightly off the beat and track and a quieter place around NYU. We asked for the salted caramel sundae as a sweet end to our meal. They were out of the said ice cream, but they brought out a delicious sundae of vanilla ice cream with caramel and chocolate sauce. It was yummy. We decided to return for Mother's day and try dinner, well what a disappointment. I ordered the flat bread pizza. For 13.00 I got a 5x3 flat bread with sauce and a dribble of buratta, here and there. I mean, where was the cheese? My family found their meal ok. We ordered the Salted Caramel ice cream sundae again and that was completely different. A schmear of an icing like chocolate around the middle of the bowl, the ice cream plopped in the center and a sprinkle of popcorn on top. That was no Sundae. Sorry to say, we will not be returning. Their food and preparation should match the care they took into the decor of this place. Such a disappointment.
Super cozy inside, really friendly staff, and just an all around cool place to hang out and get some drinks.

I actually enjoyed this place a lot more than I expected. We came here for a quick meal before a Rangers game. I loved the vibe of the place it had a very welcoming staff and feel. Ordered chicken sliders (loved!) mac and cheese, ribs-delish! Brussels sprouts And bangers n mash. I'm not a bangers n mash fan but my bf was pretty happy with it. Of all things the mac and cheese was the biggest disappointment. It was extremely bland. Also the Brussels sprouts were super good BUT also drowning in whatever oil was in the sauce. Overall it was a decent meal and what we were looking for at the time. I'd give it another shot in the future.

Dimly lit. If you can get there before about 6:30pm you'll miss the happy hour rush. Well if you're looking to mid it that is. I enjoyed a prosciutto truffle, cause I can't pass up either ever, and it was tasty! Enjoyed a solo quick bite. Service was a little slow it took my server/bartender a few minutes to come by to get my order. (I was surprised since there were a few people including myself sitting right at the bar accessible but maybe too early) I would go again!

On Monday evening, 7/22, between 7 and 8:30 p.m., on a VERY rainy night, my umbrella was lifted by someone leaving the White Oak Tavern. It is a unique umbrella: Sage green background, pink flowers scattered about (like Old English wallpaper) with a curved, blond wood handle. Thing is, I'm 86 years old and need to use a rollator-walker, and that was the ONLY umbrella I can use--long enough to hold while allowing me to grasp the walker; a curved handle making it easier to hold onto walker. IF YOU'RE THE ONE WHO TOOK IT, PLEASE RETURN IT TO THE WHITE OAK. No questions asked. This was no accident. Yes, it was raining, but if you needed an umbrella there was a selection of ORDINARY ones there. This one is special; I got it in London 15 years ago, and it's the ONLY umbrella I can use now. Oh yeah, I'm a regular at the White Oak, so obviously I like the food, the ambiance & all. Until tonight, that is. Don't like the thieving clientele.
Wonderful food- burger melted in my mouth!  Fries were perfect. Atmosphere was lovely.  Julia, our sever, was beyond helpful and kind!  Can't wait to go back!

We had dinner at the White Oak Tavern Saturday night and really enjoyed it.  The restaurant is like being in an English pub, the wood bar and woodwork is beautiful.  The menu has a lot of good choices, we went with the burgers and they were delicious!  All of the staff were really nice & helpful.  Our server was Andrea who was great!

Great environment (super clean and cozy), great food (had the spicy margarita with fish and chips , awesome beer selection (too many to list)  and fantastic service (very attentive but not annoying).  What more could you ask for?
Relaxed atmosphere, mellow jazz, good drinks, and a hilarious/attentive bartender.  What more can you ask for in a bar after a long Wednesday?

We only ate here to escape the rain but we stumbled into a great restaurant!  We had the French toast, mac and cheese, salad and the grilled cheese.  Everyone was happy with their meal!  Plus- the service was great.
Good happy hour drinks. Nice appetizers. Try the grilled peppers. A little overpriced for the quality. Good place to know about. Nothing special given the neighborhood.
No comment

NYU buildings loom in the border of this, "Hey, are we in Jekyll and Hyde, because it's really dark in here" kinda place. The food was not remarkable, but it was decent.  My husband and I had salads, burgers, and some drinks.  I ordered the "ancient grain" salad and it was not overly generous with the tasty ingredients (avocado, almonds...) but the tamari dressing was "I think I would try to duplicate this at home" good.  The Burgers were alright, not enough toppings or enough meat, in my opinion, and served on a wooden plank in an effort to make everything look bigger.  We were initially seated at a dinner table, but after waiting over fifteen minutes for someone to take a drink order we got up and ate dinner at the bar.  I don't think I would bother going back here.  The laissez faire attitude of the staff and what we received for the price do not justify a second visit-- NYC has better offerings.

Waiter was really nice but i was very unhappy with my food. We ordered muffins and they never came. Also my main course took forever to come out, was served cold, and had extra ingredients that weren't on the menu that I actually can't eat. Sent it back right away of course. I then ordered Mac n cheese which was way more spicy than promised, so I couldn't eat that either due to my stomach problems.

Closest thing to a cosy North London pub that we've found in NYC. Not a "studenty" place, despite the location so close to Washington Square Park. Good selection of drinks, and everything we've tried so far from the well put together food menu has been great.

I went there with some family visiting from Scotland. The pub had a great atmosphere with all the wood decor and candlelight. We all ordered various dishes and you know the food is good when everyone is stating, "You have to try this." Excellent staff that are very knowledgeable about the food and beer selections. Great place!
No comment
Authentic and cozy place. Have a walk in the park and relax with good food,  cold drinks and a very friendly staff.

Extraordinary service, reasonable prices and really good happy hour drinks are the big three attractions of this NYUberhood gastropub. Add to that free and awesome wifi and - this is a big plus in NYC - totally private toilets! All around terrific experience on a consistent basis. A rave fave!

Came in with a few friends as it was our first visit. We loved it.  The food was delicious, service friendly and great drinks.  A triple play for us straight down the line.  Looking forward to our next dinner here.  It's a must try for all.

I came here recently with some friends and can only speak to the drinks, but the cocktails were tasty and the drink menu had solid selection range. It wasn't too crowded or loud here, either, which was nice.
No comment

Had previously only been here for drinks, but tried dinner this week after catching a matinee performance at the nearby Public Theatre. Everything we ordered was fantastic! I highly recommend the Chicken Pot Pie and an order of the Brussel Sprouts!

Stumbled upon this place with a girlfriend of mine, we're very picky and had been wandering the streets looking for a nice dinner spot. I was instantly attracted by the ambiance, perfect place for a date. Reasonably priced, great service and the fooood! I've been twice now and their pies are phenomenal, also tried their burger and that was a palette pleaser! I'll be going again and again and again!

Great location a block from Washington sq park. Decor around Xmas time was very nice. $8 happy hour cocktails were reasonable, and a wide variety of drinks to choose from. Highly recommend the Brussel sprouts, delicious sauce. Grilled cheese with jalapeños was also good. This yelper come back.

Great spot for delicious food in a cool yet cozy venue. Service attentive and plenty of eye candy! Good wines by the glass from someone who is very picky about wine... Doughnuts are to die for!!! Hubby signed up to their whiskey program which is quite quirky - always interesting to see what fun new things the New York restaurant/bar scene comes up with!
No comment

So... Two Marine Corps combat vets walk into a bar.... The white one gets the attention and gets to order while the Asian one gets an completely ignored and has to order through the white Marine. Amazing in this day and age this sort of behavior still exists but I guess the management saw fit to hire these two racist morons. Unfortunate. Was simply too tired to give a shit that night but will speak with the management if this sort of horsefuckery happens again.
I was really impressed with the cozy setting, the phenomenal food and the great service.  The ambiance is really quite delightful and comfortable.  Excellent all around!

Stopped in for brunch with a group.  Food and service were top notch. Lots of great choices on the menu and our server Jonathan kept the drinks flowing and was always there if we needed him. Highest recommendation.

Ordered delivery. The salmon was perfectly cooked - so tender and buttery in texture. Also ordered fettuccine and beet salad which were also great. Food arrived quickly and I was overall very impressed.

Great spot! My boyfriend and I had made a dinner reservation here and since they were running a bit behind schedule due to lingering parties, they offered us each a drink on the house. Cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food (love that it's all local, too); will definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

Wow, just wow.  I had brunch here recently and I had such a wonderful experience.  The staff were attentive and friendly and the food was phenomenal.  I got the burrata with grilled peaches and it was fantastic.  I also decided to get one of the boozy donuts based on some other yelp recommendations;  it was good but I do agree with other reviewers that more filling would have been better.  Still, it was very good!
I used to love this place. But the new menu is boring.  After a non inspiring meal I think I will go home and make popcorn.

My wife and I ate at this establishment last evening. We both enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was outstanding. However, the food was just ok...we shared the eggplant slider appetizer and an order of fish and chips. While I have nothing negative to say about the fish the eggplant was lacking any form of flavor. Additionally, the sangria was excellent and they feature a nice beer list, I was happy to find Kentucky Bourbon brew on tap.
Hosted a small group gathering here. The staff was super accommodating and flexible and the food was GREAT.

The food here is best described as classy pub.  I had a grilled cheese with jalapeno peppers that was just the right amount of spicy.  My party mates all had some form of sandwiches as well that they all raved about.  The bar seems like a good time as well, with many people standing around with friends on a Saturday morning having brunch drinks.

I've been here a few times, and really like this place! The waitstaff are very nice and super accommodating.  Great whiskey  selection and and and an all around good vibe with an awesome atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place!
Great space, friendly service but the food was sub-par. Nothing was very good and the artichoke dip wasn't even really a dip. Would come back for a drink but never for dinner.

Found this gem in NYU neighborhood on Yelp. 4 of us went there early New Year's Eve for preshow (Joe's Pub) dinner.  From the craft beers and sangria, thru the sliders and ricotta jar aps to the salmon, short ribs & fish 'n chips entrees, it is spot on! Our waitress(apologize for not remembering her name) was professional, lovely and attentive. I will return when I'm in the area and recommend it without hesitation!

I've been eating lunch here twice a week, and stopping in for the occasional drink at the end of the day since they opened.  It's so nice to have an adult place to go near NYU.  Good food, nice atmosphere and great staff.
our favorite go-to pub.  food is delicious with upscale farm-to-table menu. great and friendly service.  friends who visit always want to return with us.
Great ambience, excellent customer service - we were at the bar and the bartenders were friendly - specially Brendan. Highly recommend this place !
Fantastic brunch near Washington Park! Gavin and Jonathan looked after us from mimosas to cappuccinos. Highly recommend the avocado toast for brunch.
This place in great! Walked in and got seats at the bar. The Homemade Ricotta Jar and Eggplant Sliders were AMAZING. Also loved the Rose Sangria. Had a fabulous time!

You've seen the other reviews .... Yes ! This place is wonderful. I loved the food and the dark cozy England suburb feel. Chicken pot pie for a mid size appetizer or brisket for entree- just fabulous. Don't miss out - just go.

The White Oak Tavern serves excellent bistro/gastropub food with a friendly bar and waitstaff.  They serve two of the best burgers I have had in NYC to date.  The salads are excellent and the lamb nachos (with goat cheese) are a nice addition.

When Greg Baxstrom first opened Olmsted, he intended it to be a neighborhood restaurant, but (lucky for him but not for us), it succeeded so well that it was impossible to get in.  This latest venture may finally be the homey local yet high-end restaurant that we need.  Only in its second week, the food and service are up to the high standards we expect from this group.  Started with Fried Cornichons and Escargots en Croute, then Mussels a la Bouillabaisse (with side of Duck Fat Fried Potatoes) and Coq au Vin Cavatelli, and finished with Profiteroles, of course.  Perfect, from start to finish!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Meh. Uninspired decor and atmosphere. Mediocre food. Ordered my burger rare, and when it came medium-well, was told "It's hard to cook a burger rare." Really?! Loved Maison Yaki, still love Olmsted. But was extremely disappointed by this new restaurant. So boring and mediocre.

This is a 'stickless' version of French yakitori Maison Yaki, with some kept interior, but also an updated menu. Named after his furry friend, Spud (chefs just love to name their establishments after loved ones), expect bistro influences, such as small plates of escargots, duck liver pâté and French onion soup, moules, crêpes, steak frites and of course duck fats fried potatoes. Surprisingly, desserts consist of Italian profiteroles and no creme brulee. Condenses cocktails list and a short wine list to pair with meal. This is a neighborhood French bistro without the stuffy French waiter outfits, but a more lowkey, butcher paper on  white table clothes kind of place.

Absolutely delicious. Phenomenal service, excellent creative touches that you can expect from Greg Baxtrom make classic French dishes both perfectly-executed, yet exciting. Sat at the chef's counter, and one of them was kind enough to share his soft fried egg recipe after he overheard me saying how delicious my salad lyonnaise was (...the salad has bacon dressing btw). Only possible area for improvements might be the ambience/decor and a strangely Eminem-heavy playlist ;)
Came here for drinks and snacks at 5 pm on a Friday. The cornichons and frites were delicious and the vibe was great as well as the service. Can't wait to come back and try it for dinner!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Food is great, vibe is great, service is great. Good for big groups 8+. Place is new and well worth a try!
Food was delicious, service excellent, great ambiance.  Love the small plates and Mediterranean food is so good for you so we splurged and shared.

I went for a friend's birthday, the atmosphere was beautiful and relaxed. A hidden little gem in the chaos of Ave A. Ordered a bunch of things but my favorites were the mussels in green sauce (the broth was amazing), ravioli, croquettes and cavatelli pork cheek ragu. Highly recommend for a girls night out, date night or just by yourself so you don't have to share.

Absolutely loved our dinner here on a quiet Tuesday after the holidays.  Standout dishes were the broccoli rabe and the squid ink pasta paella and panna cotta.  I so wish this gem of a restaurant well.  Fabulous service!
Service, food and drinks were amazing. Also, the place is beautiful and I loved the vibe. Will be coming back!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Amazing food and great service. For the quality of food, Kobo is not overly expensive. The pasta's are going to be the best bang for your buck and are all extremely tasty. Burrata was also very good.
Every single dish we ordered was absolutely delicious! Lovely wait staff too. I can't wait to come back and try more!

Food was sooo good. Pastas amazing, appetizers awesome and restaurant is beautiful. Overall phenomenal experience. Love all of Chef Ruben Rodriguez's restaurants. This might be the best yet! Will definitely be a regular at Kobo.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's been a while since our last visit but I am so glad we stopped by today. This family run business is so warm and inviting. They truly made us feel welcome and were very helpful in offering suggestions on what to order. My husband and I shared the bulgogi Korean bbq platter and a side kimchi stew. The bulgogi was nicely marinated and the side stew made me want to try their stews next time we visit. One thing to note is that the kimchi stew has a nice kick. If you don't like spicy foods try the miso stew instead. Serving sizes are generous and great for sharing. The kimchi is homemade and so good. What stood out were the owners' attention to customer service. They made sure to check in on all the tables for anything needed throughout the evening.

Food tasted very good, and the addition of the side dishes was awesome. We did expect the portions of the dishes to be slightly more since we ordered in like a family style for the table. But other than that the service was quick and hospitable and we had a great time. The music and setting would be good for a date even though this time I went with a group of friends. Forgot to take photos this time, will take next time I'm back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was craving Korean Food on this frigid day and was not disappointed! Service was great with the most l friendly staff! We ordered the seafood pancake which was our crack as well as a couple of stews and soups! Every dish was amazing and we left lethargic and stuffed! Will definitely come back because we had such a great experience!
No comment
No comment

Korean food near flatiron! We were in the area and decided to stop by here. We got the bulgogi fries, and I got the bulgogi entree and my bf got the pork belly ssam both of which came with a side soup. They gave us free fried potstickers as an appetizer and also had side dishes. Food was very good and came quick. The portion sizes are hugeeee!!!! We had leftovers enough for dinner. Especially the fries- it was a big hefty bowl. Service was friendly and I would def stop by for lunch again when I'm in the area.

I came here for dinner and got the Kimchi Jigae. It was very yummy - perfect amount of flavor and softness in the tofu. They also gave a good amount of meat. I wanna come back to try their cheese teokbokki which seems to be quite popular!

Awesome place! Food was super flavorful, the spicy squid was probably my favorite. Very much recommend the bulgogi fries as well (it's huge!). Between four people, the 3 menu items were a perfect amount. Sadly we were too early for happy hour (5-7pm) but the drinks on the menu looked really good!! Service was quick and friendly and bathroom was super clean. We had a great time!

What a great and delicious dine-in Korean restaurant!! Service was amazing, the restaurant is owned and operated by a Korean family who went above and beyond in their service for a table of 10. Since it was also my birthday, they were also so kind and kept wishing me a happy birthday, and they also brought out soju for the table. Their quality of service and food make this experience so special. Would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just a outside of k-town, Mr Mista Oh is a good value spot for korean food in the middle of Manhattan. The restaurant didn't feel too crowded and it was a good noise level to still comfortably maintain conversations. After getting seated, we were given some traditional banchan to split. I then ordered the dolsot bibimbop with beef, which was a very hearty portion that came in a sizzling hot stone bowl. The bibimbop was pretty good though the bulgolgi was somewhat dry and crumbly. Overall, it's still a solid wallet-friendly place to really fill up on some korean food.
No comment
No comment

Came here for a weekday lunch and from the outside, it seems like a very hole in the wall kind of place, especially in comparison with nearby places, but it had a very cozy vibe inside! My friend and I both ordered the pork belly, which came with white rice and a choice of soup, we both got the korean miso. The pork belly was really good, would recommend wrapping it with the lettuce that it comes with for the best taste! The soup was thicker than I thought, almost like the tofu soup that you usually get at places like 5 senses and BCD, but still good! Good lunch portions and came with all the little sides like kimchi, etc.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
LOVED this place. everyone was so friendly and the portions were sooo generous. cannot recommend this place enough omfg
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love the ambiance of place - very cute and colorful! The food was very very good and quick service too. The only complaint would be that when they add Tofu to food they should season it well as oppose to just adding them to the dish bland. However, the other food items were very tasty!
I can only speak for the seafood pancake and soju, but the seafood pancake is so good. We came here for happy hour and light food after work. Get the seafood pancake!!!!

I made a reservation for a Tuesday evening at 6:15 pm. When I got here the restaurant was empty, except for one other party. The interior has these cute flower walls great for taking photos while you wait for your food. The server promptly came with our side dishes and hot tea and water. We got a few things. My favorite was probably the Bugolgi fries: served in a generous amount in a huge bowl. Beef was tender and marinated well. The budaejiggae was a little saltier for my preference, but it came with a bowl of rice to help with that. The spicy squid rice was also pretty good. It came with a generous serving of squid which was tender and seasoned with a spicy sauce. The chef also gave our table a free order of the fried dumplings which was a nice touch. By the time we left the tables were filling up. Seems like people come here more for the food than the happy hour.

The food here was delicious and the inside of the store was so cute. We got spicy squid, seafood pancake, & soju. Although everything was a little pricey overall, the food was spot on and the sides were delicious as well, especially the Kim chi! Food took a little while but they seemed pretty busy that night. Staff was super friendly.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I initially found this place on Seated (the app) and then cross-referenced it with Yelp and it had plenty of great reviews so I decided to check them out. The decor is very light colored and nice with lots of lighting and even greenery along walls. After I ordered, they gave me complimentary fried mandoos which were sooo frickin crunchy i love that sht its like they read my mind. Then they brought out the galbi jjim I ordered and wow the portion was hugeeee for one person. It came with some banchan, kimchi, and a bowl of rice too. As for the galbi jjim, that stew was TASTYYYY. It had great flavor being slightly sweet and the actual short ribs were maddddd tender and soft. This was my first time ever trying galbi jjim and I'm glad they broke my galbi jjim virginity :D
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a gem! I ate here before a show at Madison Square Garden and it was everything I hoped for! The Bulgogi was delicious as we're the accompaniments. The outdoor area was also fabulous. Quiet, heated, and private. The perfect place to rest and refuel!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good food. Slow service. Smidge pricey. Not a huge menu to choose from. We were able to walk right in.

I came here for my friend's birthday on a Friday night with a group of 5 people. We ordered the seafood pancake, the fried chicken wings (sweet and spicy sauce), the bulgogi kimchi French fries, the LA kalbi (comes with kimchi jjigae and rice), and the spicy squid rice. They also gave us complimentary dumplings which was nice. The portions were larger than I expected especially the bulgogi kimchi French fries. My favorite dishes were the fried chicken wings and the seafood pancake. The chicken wings were large, juicy, and the sauce had a good kick to it. The seafood pancake had a lot of seafood and was very crispy. The bulgogi kimchi French fries were tasty too since there was a lot of bulgogi. Service was fast and friendly. They didn't rush us like how it is in other restaurants in Koreatown. I would come back to try other dishes.
No comment
A true hidden gem. This is my go-to Korean restaurant in the city. Excellent food, generous portions, and great service.

Great food!!! The stews and honestly all the dishes we got were delicious. Probably better to come as a group as the dishes were quite big, so it's good to share for variety. Will be back for sure! Such a good find outside of the hustle and bustle of K-town.

Everything was yummy! We started with the soy garlic chicken wings. My husband then had the galbi, daughter had the dolsot bibimbap, and I had the spicy squid rice. All were very good!  We liked the bottled sparkling sake, too.

Yum!! Came here with my cousin. We ordered the japchae and bulgogi. The bulgogi came with rice and soup. We finished everything up! The outdoor seating area was nice and the service was good. I recommend this restaurant!
Very good food and really large portions! Got the bogging fries and expected a small plate and turned out to be a huge bowl!
No comment

Although the food was good, the wait for the food and drinks  was really long. I believe we ordered around 6pm and we didn't get our food and drinks until like 6:45pm. Honestly, maybe they were short staffed or something but the food was good quality!

Probably my new favourite Korean restaurant in the area! Good food for sure, but it's the vibes that really do it for me. They brought us a free order of dumplings (which were really good btw, a really good fry on them) and then later brought over free chocolate desserts. It feels a lot like you're with family/friends who just want to feed you in a really relaxed atmosphere.
No comment
Meh.  The bulgogi was ground beef which seemed a bit cheap.  The beef ribs were pretty good but a very small portion size.

This place is awesome, definitely would come back if we are in the area.  Very friendly hostess and server, cute decor and clean setting.  My daughter and I devoured fried dumplings, japchae, and truffle bulgogi rice  (FYI the rice plate could feed three people)  SO SO GOOD

There is nothing special about this place.  A word of advice on your items with cheese... it is a good thought to use real cheese but don't let it turned the whole dish to be stuck together soon after getting to the table. How do you expect your customers to pick apart this cluster f*ck using only the cheap chopsticks provided?  Either use the correct type of cheese or give us forks and knives.
Great spot for lunch! I had the galbi lunch box and it was delicious and very filling. The seafood pancake was also really good!
Great place to go for some delicious Korean food. I especially like the doenjang-jjigae from this place. Very flavorful and so delicious. It's a hearty meal to have on a cold day.

The soups are super filling and affordable. $14 for a spicy beef soup was so worth it!! Definitely faster service and cleaner than the busier restaurants in ktown too!! Have already gone twice in 2 weeks whenever I stop by flatiron!

We came at around 6pm, absolutely empty, but filled up to a near full capacity at around 8pm. My favorite was the Doenjang Jjigae with the spicy option + beef. It had a spicy kick and a delicious soup which was perfect with the rice. The kimchi cheese fries were really good as well. Would definitely recommend the Doenjang Jjigae because of it's savory miso soup flavor. Comes with different meat + vegetarian option and either hot or mild flavor.

We came here for restaurant week excited to have Korean cuisine. We did the $59 dinner and the portions were huge, the food was delicious but the drinks and service were a completely different story.  They didn't ask a few of us for vaccination cards, they didn't know how to make a single drink on their cocktail menu and they took forever to get our order and bring our check despite the restaurant being basically empty. Definitely took away from the experience but see for yourself, maybe you'll have a better server!
We came for a late lunch. Friendly service, very tasty food and large portions. Something on the menu for everyone in the family. Even my picky son.
No comment

I got takeout during restaurant week and had the pork bulgogi lunchbox with doenjang soup. Everything was very good! I especially liked the doenjang jigae, which is a savory miso tofu stew. The pork bulgogi was sweet and tender. If it weren't for the prices I'd be back all the time, but the restaurant week menu was a great deal!

Both the food and service were excellent. Food came out quickly and was delicious. My friend said several times, "oh, this is so good." I sat and laughed with a friend for hours and I appreciated that we were never rushed to finish up. All employees were incredibly kind and attentive.

Ordered takeout for lunch this week. Fried pork mandoo were good but standout was the Spicy Cheese Haemool Tteok Bokkeum. I didn't find it too spicey, lots and lots of seafood included, delicious. I'm still thinking about it days after
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I dined here on a Saturday night and I have to say the food was good, but I think the service needs a little work. I never felt like our server was attending to us fully, and it was hard to get her attention. To be fair, I think they just opened up, and with the COVID-19 pandemic, I'm sure that also complicated things with staffing and what not. I didn't want to give a lower review because of this, so I looked past it. It just seems weird that we weren't given any water and we had to ask for it even though we were given little cups (which we poured our beer into). The kimchi fries were good, and I believe we also ordered a gyoza platter? I'm not too sure. When I'm back in New York, I'd like to eat here and dine outside.
So goood! I love the Korean food here! Came to NYC to visit from the west coast. Came here on a whim and it so glad we did. Good size portion, food was fresh, and it's such a cute spot.
No comment

This place is so delicious, and the portion is huge! We ordered bulgogi and it was almost too much for two people! The beef was so delicious and tender, waitress was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Amazing food and staff. Holly (CEO and co-owner) was the one to greet us and have us seated. The menu may seem condensed at first glance, since everything fits on a single side. However, don't let that fool you or make you hesitate when choosing a place to eat. There is a great variety of food available and even good vegetarian options on the menu. My partner and I ordered the seafood pancake, samgyupsal, galbi, and grilled mackerel. The spread was amazing and the food delicious. The soups that came with several of the dishes were served in nice stone dishes that kept them so warm and hot despite us not getting to them until later. The rice was served in a covered container that kept it warm and so amazing. We ate so much more than we expected. It was just so good. We got plenty of take out containers to take everything home in. Food is still as amazing the next day (ate it for breakfast). Definitely plan on going back.

Went there with little kids around 3-4pm. The staff and the owner were so attentive and caring for kids. I ordered YukGaeJang, Steamed mandoo and chicken skewers. They were all spot on with generous portions. Especially the dumplings seem to be handmade. The taste and quality were excellent. When I need a quick good Korean food, I will definitely come back.

We were super pleasantly surprised by this restaurant and how big the portion sizes were. Be prepared to have leftovers! Our favorite item was the chicken skewer appetizer - the meat was so flavorful! Next time we go, well try to kimchi fries because they looked amazing (and HUGE!).
So cute on the inside and excellent service. Food was delicious and staff was so friendly, really made our lunch enjoyable!

I went with a friend for restaurant week on a Thursday afternoon. The decor is beautiful and the service is amazing. My friend ordered the japchae for the appetizer, Mukuenji Samgyupsal Jjim for entrée, and chocolate cake for dessert. I ordered the fried dumplings for the appetizer, Osam Bulgogi for entrée, and cheesecake for dessert. The entrées came with a bowl of doenjang soup and a bowl of rice. This was way more than enough to fill us up and take home leftovers for dinner. The entrées were so delicious. I was so full but kept wanting to still eat more. This place had such good vibes and atmosphere. It was a great place to catch up and chill with a friend eating great food.
No comment

This restaurant is amazing! It's a family run business and all the staff provided great service and are very kind. We ordered one kimchi fried rice and one veggie tofu bibimbap. The meal also came with pickled veggies, tofu and kimchi. It has nice outdoor dining and a nice ambiance. Highly recommend going here for Korean food and supporting this business!
First place I ate at in NYC today. We had bulgogi fries and bibimbop. Very tasty! The portions are large so I'm glad I shared the food with my boyfriend. Good service.
Loved the chicken wings and fried calamari! Would highly recommend the LA chicken as well . The staff is super nice and the ambiance is very romantic and cool with nice music. Definitely recommend!!
The food is incredible! The service and ambience is fantastic too. The bulgogi beef and kimchi soup special is ridiculously yummy!
Great bulgogi fries! Tasty, good portion size of meat, and crispy, tasty fries. Will definitely reorder.
Everyone here was so nice and accommodating- they went above and beyond for my family. The food was also really good but it's the warmth of the people I won't forget.

OVERRATED. The place charges prices I'd expect to pay for a real Korean BBQ in Koreatown, while the food here is more like fast food on pretty plates, nowhere near the standard set at real Korean BBQs. The bulgogi was served room temperature! The dumplings are perfectly cooked but bland. The kimchi has no pungency. It tastes to me like Korean food watered down for an American palate. The service was really nice, but they brought all our courses at the same time. Just as well; nothing was hot anyway. Meh.
No comment

Found this spot randomly while visiting NY, their customer service is so amazing. We didn't have a reservation but they still got us a seat, and gave us so many wonderful "on the house" surprises! I will def be coming back when I'm in New York

Food was perfect - crispy, spicy, sweet and chewy when it needed to be. The staff were lovely and very observant. They noticed that our baby loved the potato salad and gave her a little container of her own to take home!
Authentic and fresh!! We got the bulgogi fries, kimchi fried rice, and galbi and all tasted amazing.

This place is seriously so good. Bulgogi, Dumplings, and Doenjang Jjigae we're all incredible, and came with some fantastic side dishes. Good selection of soju, and great service. Best Korean restaurant in the area.

Yum!!! Go here! They have such a cozy/festive outdoor dining hut with an awesome system where you press a call button when you want to order/need anything else. Very attentive and fast service. Everything we had was great. The little side dishes/banchan were so tasty. Loved the spicy pork BBQ which came with rice and soup (choice of kimchi or miso). And the bulgogi bibimbap came out sizzling. The spicy pork was so good I had to order another to bring home for my husband (and leftover lunch for me for tomorrow... I can't wait!) I'd come back here in a heartbeat.

Mista Oh is a wonderful new spot for Korean authentic comfort foods. Especially in the cold weather, I was hoping for a filling and warm meal. Mista Oh has created a lovely outdoor space (3 tables of 4) with heaters and air filtration. There are call buttons for each table so staff can come outside when you need assistance. I ordered soondubu with beef and steamed mandu. My meal was fresh and came out hot. I was surprised that my food even came with complementary steamed egg that was mixed with some vegetables. My meal was so filling that I didn't even need to eat dinner and had leftovers. The prices were also reasonable. Highly recommend!
No comment
LOVED this Korean spot. The spicy pork and kimchi fried rice wereSpicy Pork BBQ fantastic. Also the portions are huge. Will definitely be returning soon.

Ordered delivery via Grubhub.  Had the kimchi chigae and bimbimbap.  Both were great!  Well packaged and portions were enough.  Came with some banchan that were super yummy.   Highly recommend getting your kfood fix here.
No comment
Sat at the bar on a Saturday night; their bibimbap was generous and pretty good.

I went to Koreatown, and sat down at a Korean restaraunt. Sure, it had korean ingredients, but the experience has been neutered from tradition. I get trying to do something new, and trendy; but if you take away the good parts of it it doesn't evolve the cuisine. Anyhow, I was curious about Mista Oh because it seemed like a. It of an outlier. It was a walk from Koreatown, but I felt like walking. Here, they maintain elements of tradition and also modernize it in a tasteful and effective manner. I was served banchan, korean appetizers/side dishes, and it was just a few items but still satisfying. The pork belly was succulent and cooked and seasoned well and the kimchi-jigae paired well with it. I left satisfied and appreciated the good service.
Food is awesome and so the Service is. All the waitress are very lovely and up to speed! We Head a great time and definetly come back!

Decided to give this restaurant a try tonight. Disappointed. I ordered their Kimchi Fried rice dish. I noticed on their website that they offer it with either Bulgogi beef or with vegetables.  When I arrived at the restaurant I looked at the menu and it only showed the Bulgogi and the menu once had a Shrimp option but that was crossed out directly on their menu.  I inquired to the server and she said oh yes we do offer it with Vegetables.  I then asked what type of veggies and she replied "assorted ' veggies.  I proceed to order it. Once it arrived it had no veggies other than diced scallion which is just a Garnish and not assorted vegetables.  I then asked shouldn't it come with a fried egg on top and she replied oh since you got the veggie Kimchi fried rice I assumed you don't want egg.  I am a vegetarian not a vegan. There is a big difference!   Only vegans don't eat eggs.  She said oh well.  I paid $18.99 for a bowl of rice.  Totally disappointed and would never recommend this place to any of NY friends
Amazing wings! We got the spicy sauce, delicious! For the entrees we ordered the bibimbap and truffle bulgogi rice, both amazing! Definitely recommend if you're in the area.
Delicious vegetarian bibimbap! Sat outside in their covered area and had a great lunch

New favorite spot!! Really good food, amazing service and the cutest outdoor setup! Each table had a button you press to call for service where someone will come out very quickly to answer any questions you may have and to take your order. Will be recommending this place to all my friends! Super safe outdoor setup during COVID, with dividers between each table. Also there's heaters!

Absolutely love the Korean food here! All their dishes tastes amazing and the service is truly family like. It's definitely a hidden gem. They have outdoor heating , which is a great plus! This is one place I don't mind or worry when having to eat out, literally. I really recommend this place!

Stopped by for a drink after dinner.   The owner and the server are great.   You can see that they are just nice people.   Even though we only ordered a few beers, treated us very well.   We eventually ate some small dishes and they were excellent!  and when we were leaving, i saw a group who overstayed the restaurant hours but the owners just patiently waited.
No comment

This place is so clean and cute! The workers are so nice and even gave us free gyoza as a complimentary appetizer from the chef. The food portions are huge and worth for its price. I love their korean fusion food, the kimchi and everything is fresh and so good!! Highly recommend.
Delicious food and welcoming people here - the chef is super friendly and always remembers us. Definitely recommend this place!
No comment
Everything was amazing. Delicious food, great service, super friendly staff. Great ambience, inside and outside. The Bibambap was so good!
Amazing food, kimchi fried rice is spot on, chatted with the exceedingly lovely owner. Couldn't be happier

Stopped in with seven other co-workers for lunch today, and couldn't have been more impressed! From the moment we walked in the door, we were treated like family. We didn't have a reservation, but we were sat immediately. Our server came over in a very timely manner, got our drinks out to us extremely fast, and had taken our order. This was by far one of the best lunches I have had in a long time. The portions were large, the taste was unmatched, and I left 100% satisfied. They have a customer for life! Thankfully I only work four blocks away, but I would travel over an hour to go back again!

This place has incredible OG Korean food. Every dish on the menu truly represents Korean food extremely well. Tasty as ever enjoy the food with some soju and beer. It's great for date night or for a bigger gathering with friends. I recommend this place 10 times out of 10. So go and give it a try, you won't regret it!

Mista Oh is pretty stellar. Phenomenal menu items, friendly staff, beautiful atmosphere - what more could you ask for? You can tell these guys use quality ingredients. The employees were very pleasant, smiled a lot, felt genuine. Got ta love Mista Oh.
Got Bibimbap with bulgogi and it hit the spot! Ordered takeout for pickup and it was neatly packed and ready when I arrived. Big portions, very tasty, and reasonably priced. Will definitely be back!
Great food! Portions were plentiful -  especially for the price - and I was surprised to get several banchan with my meal! Definitely will be back.

Simple place but "oh" such great food and service! We were there to celebrate my nephews win at the US open wheelchair tennis tournament. He is a big fan of all things Korean. Mista Oh's Kelsey and Holly went out of their way to make his evening. Thanks!

GO HERE... the service was the most friendly homey service I've ever had. Our waiter was adorable and super helpful. They gave us 3 complementary items just because we couldn't decide what to get. The food was delicious. I could not recommend it more.
This is one of my new favorite NYC spots! Holly, our server, was a delight! A great, family-owned spot that is great with service and the food was amazing! Will definitely be back!

The food here was absolutely delicious and generous portions for the price. Both Holly (our server) and her mother were a true delight! Everything felt very COVID-safe and sanitized/distanced as well. Can't recommend this little place enough!

Came across this lil gem restaurant a few weeks ago during my lunch hour & fell in love with it!  The food is delicious & the staff is super friendly & accommodating.  I am very thankful for their outdoor seating area.  It blocks the cold wind and they have really strong heaters that keep you warm while enjoying your food.  This is my 3rd time coming in and felt the need to give them a review for their excellent efforts, especially during these hard times. Thank you, mista oh!'
Absolutely delicious eats, very nice service, great covid protocols. The food is just out of this world! Don't think about it, just go.

They have an authentic Korean food which is really good! I tried several menus so far, all the foods that I had are so good. The restaurant atmosphere is kind of cozy and clean. They just opened so not many ppl know about this restaurant yet. I would recommend to try delicious Korean foods here! My favorite is Galbi which is Korean beef bbq!

Great food and service. Came for lunch during a weekday and it wasn't too busy at first but people started coming in around 12:30 PM. I had the bulgogi lunch box and it was both tasty and plentiful (with all the usual side dishes). Looking forward to being back soon.

I have been this restaurant  a few times. I really enjoyed  the Dolsot Bibimbob ( rice with mixed vegetable on the hot pot ) . It is authentic  and had a good combination of different vegetables. And  Seafood Touf soup was very tasty  because  there were   generous seafood.   I will try other dishes next time!

Great service, authentic Korean food, a perfect place to fill yourself up with delicious healthy fare.  Will be back for the japchae, dengjang chigae, and grilled mackeral which were all on point.  Highly recommended!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: SOOOO good !!!! staff was super friendly upon entry and so helpful and kind. food was amazing, definitely recommend the bulgogi fries and teriyaki chicken. the decor was so pretty and the atmosphere was overall super comfy and welcoming.
Amazingly delicious. Started with the green salad, tried the kimchi soup, bulgogi rice pot and the (listen up) the Daeji Galbi. Seriously get some. So bomb! So good!  Will be back. Thank you!
No comment
No comment
No comment

It gets very packed during dinner so there was a bit of a wait time. The inside could get crowded but it is an intimate space. We ordered the Fish in Homemade Pickled Cabbage and Vegetarian Dry Pot and the food came quickly. The food was delicious but it is pricy because it is in the city.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love love this place! Top tier Chinese food. The restaurant itself is so beautiful and the servers are the sweetest. It's like no other! I will be back...again and again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow in love with Uluh, perfect the modern take on Szechuan dining! We came on Superbowl Sunday so was seated immediately upon arriving, but I've heard wait times get long. The ambiance is sleek and dimly lit, absolutely love the unique silverware and dining dishes here too. One of the highlight dishes was the colorful soup dumplings, which not only looks super cute but each color has a different flavor skin to it. They definitely play into Szechuan cuisine in making spicier flavors like chili for the red one and wasabi for the green one. The drinks here are to die for, especially the hot rose sake and oolong cocktail, which comes out in a tray/mini pitcher/cup set, reminiscent of tea ceremony vibes. Didn't get to try any of the teas here, but they have an authentic selection of high mountain oolongs that look amazing, they even label the elevations of each tea on the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had insanely high expectations coming in because everyone dubbed Uluh as one of, if not the BEST Chinese restaurant in New York. All the vegetables we ordered were extremely salty and the portions were small considering the price. The only dish that was worth it for me was the glazed pecking duck, but even then it did not come with enough buns/wrapping paper.
No comment
