No comment

Absolutely delicious! I would highly recommend the cabbage and glass noodles and the peking duck! Everything had just the right amount of spice and I left wanting more. Portion sizes were also very decent for the price. I went on a Tuesday night and didn't have to wait at all! The service was also great! Am definitely coming back again.

A bit of a late review but ate here a couple weeks ago on a Friday. They don't take reservations so we waited about 30-45 mins to be seated. The restaurant was packed & there was a decent crowd waiting as well but it was worth it- We got the Peking duck, truffle fried rice & garlic eggplant to share + drinks! We all thought the food was really flavorful and the drinks were great (passion fruit margarita, peppercorn margarita- unique & good!, & rose sake). Would definitely recommend others to check this spot out!
No comment
No comment

All I can say is WOW. This place gives me the flavors I'm looking for when I crave szechuan food. They had a perfect level of spicey in their dishes, enough to feel a mild sting but not too much to where you can't taste the other flavors. If you're a hot chili oil lover like me, you'll love their dishes. For our entrees we ordered the fish in hot chili oil, beef tripe in hot chili oil, eggplant in garlic sauce with woodear, and sweet and sour pork to share. For dessert, we got the rose lychee panna cotta and mango juice sago pomelo with mochi. The mango juice sago tasted fresh, and the elements in the rose lychee dessert complimented each other so well- that one was my favorite. It was rose ice cream with lychee and sweet cream cheese. Amazing. LOVED this place! I walked in here with two friends on a Friday night and although it was busy the wait was only about 20 minutes. Good service and beautiful fancy decor as well.
No comment

Seriously delicious dim sum! Came here with two friends for brunch today, and we were a bit worried at first because we've heard about how popular this place was and didn't want to wait too long. Thankfully, 1:45 pm on a Saturday seems like an off time for them, and we were seated immediately. We ordered the scallion pancakes with beef slices, the har gow, the colorful soup dumplings, and the crab tofu. All the dishes were tasty and hearty, and we left full and happy. Specifically, I was blown away by the crab tofu: this is soft and silky tofu drenched in the most gorgeous crab and egg yolk sauce. Overall, highly recommend this place!
No comment
The short rib with black tea soup hits the spot. The stir fry okra was a satisfying addition. Their tea and dessert selection is the cherry on top. Make a reservation or come early bc it gets packed.

Come here for lunch when it's less crowded given they don't take reservations. Loud clubby kinda music and minimalist black slate design with great lighting makes this attractive restaurant a great dining experience. The fish with spicy broth and pickled what nots was great. And I've never had a crab tofu like that. Our only complaint is the soup dumplings were served broken - the soup fell out! So that was no fun. But the service was fast and smiling and the food was otherwise great.

Another fabulous Chinese Szechuan restaurant in Lower Manhattan! I loved the atmosphere inside - it is very clean and classy with all on point decorations. The food was also very delicious. Highly recommend the cucumbers, mini pumpkin puffs, and fillet in chili oil. The mini pumpkins have a salted egg yolk filling and the texture was crunchy and chewy. So so good!

Came here at the recommendation of a coworker. The food was pretty good, but I expected a bit more for the price. The duck portions were pretty small, and some of the meat was a bit dry/tasteless (though other parts were great, oddly enough). The skin was super crispy though which I definitely enjoyed! The tea was really expensive -- $16 for a pot that could only serve 2 people -- and they didn't fully steep it before serving, so I'd recommend waiting for a bit before pouring it. The service was great though and they played some pretty good music. My friends enjoyed the food a lot, so maybe i'm just picky

Definitely recommend the crab tofu, black truffle pork soup dumplings, and the stir fry pork belly with egg. They do not take reservations and the wait is notoriously long, but you can track your progress when they send you the waitlist link which is a plus, so just be sure to plan accordingly.

I was suspicious when entering the restaurant because it was spacious and didn't have many customers on Saturday afternoon. We were seated right away. The interior was modern and unique with minimal lighting. We ordered crispy duck, crab meat soup dumplings, and mapo tofu for three of us. I would say the portion size was reasonable to maybe small. Everything we ordered was great, but my personality favorite is mapo tofu. It was just the right level of spiciness and tofu was soft with tangy texture. You have to order rice bowls separately, which I would recommend doing because food is strongly seasoned and could be a little salty without rice. I would recommend this place for special occasions  but probably not for everyday hangout or quick bite, as it is more on the fancier and pricier end.

The RARE 5 star seal of approval for Uluh & their entire team! First of all, there are so many articles claiming that Uluh has the best brown sugar Peking duck -- those articles are NOT wrong! The Peking duck here is truly 10/10 -- everything from the perfectly crisp duck skin, to the tender juicy clean cuts of dark & white meat are beyond phenomenal. To take a quick second and grade the 5 major buckets (ambiance, service, cleanliness, food & price) all of them were perfect perfect perfect, hence the rare 5 stars!!! Of course, no meal is complete without soup dumplings & har grow so naturally we had a few of each as well! The "colorful" soup dumplings came highly recommended because they have a variety of each flavor (so we obviously got two orders so we could share) -- inclusive of a standard soup dumpling, salted yolk dumpling, crab meat dumpling, super spicy dumpling (second favorite), yam dumpling, wasabi dumpling, shrimp dumpling & my absolute favorite the black truffle dumpling!! Other than the standard sides, we also got mushroom dumplings, volcano rib & sichuan spiced lamb ribs with bones -- this was by far one of the tastiest rib combinations I've ever had -- irrespective of cuisine, truly one of the best ribs out there. Everyone comes for the Peking duck which is incredible, however the spiced lamb rib was a hit on the table & my personal favorite! I cannot wait to bring more friends & family here, to the entire Uluh team -- thank you for your incredible service, patience & kindness, we will be back soon!

The drinks are really pretty. I would come back for the drinks. The soup dumplings were a total miss. They looked so sad... took a bite  into it and there was no soup!!!! Dumpling skin was so thick and the whole dish  literally looked like blobs of dough with food coloring. I have had better soup dumplings in Chinatown for a fraction of the price . The Peking duck was good. Duck was crispy and tender. Pumpkin puffs were good, crispy with the salted egg yolk inside. Crispy chicken was sad. Lots of peppers not much chicken. Chicken had no meat. Crispy fish with five spice was a pass. Fish was bland and had no taste. Vegetable dry pot was too oily, the veggies were drenched in oil. Scallion pancake with beef was pretty good as well. Crab tofu complements the white rice. Dan Dan noodles were okay. Lychee shrimp balls is a pass. Taste like minced shrimp battered up  in hot Cheetos.

Delicious Chinese food. Great variety of dim sum and larger meals. The price point is a bit expensive but this is a more upscale spot, which justifies the price for me. The wait times can be incredibly long but the service itself is quite efficient. They have a nice bar with some solid cocktails (one offering is basically a bowl of beer with some spices and perhaps some soda but it tastes absolutely delicious). You must order their brown sugar glazed duck. Their crab tofu is also delicious. String beans have an incredible seasoning, the fatty beef is divine. I wish they didn't get rid of the sticky rice shumai because that was my favorite for takeout : ( but I'll continue to come back. Love Uluh--perfect for groups of four to optimize sharing.

The dishes are very authentic, and the taste of the seasoning reminds me of the taste in Chengdu. It is less spicy and salty than domestic Sichuan cuisine, and the taste of pepper is still very strong. I really like it!

We came for the duck. It did not disappoint! Overall food was good but not life changing.. service was good but a little awkward at times. Also they did not mention the pork baos also contain shrimp... which was an issue for an allergy in our party.

Had really high hopes for this place and was looking forward to trying the crab tofu. I got sick of the crab tofu pretty quickly - while it was nice, I felt the crab flavor was too subtle and the dish overall ended up being pretty unremarkable. We also had the truffle dumplings, string beans and Sichuan chili fried chicken. Out of all the dishes the only one I'd order again would be the Sichuan chili fried chicken, but this dish alone wasn't enough to have me running back. It was more breading than chicken and all though the spice level was great (I like it really spicy) at the end of the day it was a bowl of chilis with the occasional nub of chicken rather than a bowl of chicken with chilis accompanying it. Great flavors, but overpriced for what you get and considering the amount of amazing Sichuan restaurants in NYC, I'd look elsewhere first.

Absolutely loved the food here!! The food is so authentic and the quality of each dish was exceptional. My fiancé and I loved everything we got. The Peking duck skin was perfectly done, paper thin, crispy, and melt in your mouth dipped in a little bit of sugar. The meat was so tender and juicy and the crepes were also perfectly thin. The minced pork and pickled string beans with rice noodles were excellent! The portion was huge and the rice noodles had such a great bounce to them. I will say though the mala and chilis in this dish are no joke, so beware if you have a low spice tolerance! I also loved that the sauce was thin and light, yet so flavorful from the pickled string beans. We couldn't stop eating it even though we were both dying! We also got the scallion pancake with beef, which was sooo crispy and flavorful. I also loved how each piece had a dollop of sauce on the bottom of it already! Only wished it had a little more beef in it. The salty egg yolk mini pumpkin was great and definitely oozed out fast! Would highly recommend if you've never had anything with egg yolk lava custard before but I tend to eat the bun version of these a lot so might not get them again. We ended our night with the peach gum in birds nest soup. This delicate dessert completely neutralized all the spice at the end of the night! Loved the classic combination of red dates, dried longan, and goji berries. Can't wait to come back to try their other dishes!!

Love the crab tofu here although I don't know if it's actually crab or just salted egg yolk/crab paste as there were no crab bits. The staff was always very attentive and food came out timely. Some of the dishes are a bit overpriced for what they are but others are worth it for something you can't replicate at home. Also be sure to use the restroom there is a fancy badet and heated toilet seat. The atmosphere of the restaurant is sleek and trendy. It would be impressive for a date

It wasn't spicy and the fish was soft and flavorful. My least favorite dish was the spicy lamb. The lamb was too gainey for my taste. The Peking duck was okay, nothing special. Elevated Chinese food. Everything we got here was so good.  We got the crab tofu, cumin beef, soup dumplings, and brown sugar Peking duck. The crab tofu def tastes better than it looks. That was prob our fav thing we ate. But the cumin beef was also amazing even though most of it was peppers, the meat they used was so tender & flavors were a 10/10. Peking duck was good but the skin wasn't as crispy as I would've hoped but the duck meat was still juicy. The soup dumplings were decent, they had good flavor but some of them were missing some soup. Overall great Chinese food. I would skip the $10-12 drinks such as the soy milk with jelly.

Delicious food, great ambiance. On the slightly saltier + smaller portion side. Service was attentive and spoke english and mandarin. XLB was juicy and duck (small) was just right for two. Would recommend!

Best chicken soup in town! The crab tofu is also awesome! But the short ribs are really bad...

If you are looking for authentic Chinese food with a mixed of Szechuan, Cantonese and Northman Chinese food, this is the place you should go. The fatty beef in sour soup was very flavorful, perfect with rice. I loved the crab tofu as well and this is one of the best crab tofu that I tried in different places. The only downside is that the restaurant is really crowded. I needed to be very careful not to hit the dishes on my neighboring table when I walked out from the seat. But it's a great place if you focus on food.

In the sea is Szechuan in the village it's sometimes difficult to stand out but Uluh does so in more ways than expected. The unassuming facade of the building leads into a gorgeous upscale dining room. They have a dynamic menu that was delightful for my g/f and I as we are vegetarian.  The vegetarian mapo tofu was very flavorful.. spicy but not overwhelming. We had the pumpkin puff dessert and it was outstanding. Not too sweet, extraordinary texture, flavor & presentation.  We will definitely go back to try their broad selection of teas.

cozy, dimly lit chinese restaurant with modern spins on Sichuan food. good customer service, food came out fast, and dishes were nicely plated. the mini pumpkin puffs were fairly unique with a crispy, mochi-like exterior and a sweet, savory salty egg yolk lava interior. the peking duck was moist yet crispy. the pork trotters were soft, chewy, and spicy, and the beef paired very well with the hardness of the cilantro. the char siu, egg yolk, and maple syrup combo perfectly balanced each other in terms of smokiness, sweetness, and texture. in general, all the dishes were very flavorful, authentic, and numbingly delicious.

Definitively one of the most authentic Chinese food in NYC. We particularly liked the beef noodle soup and sautéed string beans. No comment
No comment
Boneless pork trotters is really good and has pretty big serving as well. The black sesame soup dumpling is actually a dessert instead of a dish, its also pretty good!
No comment
The pig feet is great!! Soft and flavorful. The rice cake in the black truffle shrimp is chewy I love it. Definitely pay it a visit when your in the area
No comment

The food here is amazing. Boneless pork trotters, crab tofu, and lamb ribs are my favorite dishes there. The crab flavor in the crab tofu is very strong. The lamb ribs are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
No comment
No comment
Everything about this place is so amazing! Not a huge fan of the soy milk with mochi but the food dishes we got were all amazing!

Hands down my favorite "Chinese" restaurant in the city. I put Chinese in quotations because there is no such thing to designate a regional culture with centuries of history behind each province's specific cuisine, but Uluh manages to have the best examples of my favorite dishes from the Sichuan, Beijing, and Shanghai regions! Don't miss the fried duck, the roasted duck, the spicy pepper chicken, the tender fish fillet soups, the differently-colored soup dumplings...I could eat here everyday, if only my waistline would allow!
No comment
really good, their fried rice roast pork is bomb as fuck and then they had this like soup thing and that was bomb too and then their kung pao chicken was fire
Amazing food at Uluh! We got the table straight away on a Sunday night. All the food we ordered were amazing! I love the pig trotters and the fish with pickled cabbage
The best La Zi Ji I've had. It was also the spiciest, so if you like that sort of thing, they bring the heat here. I will definitely be visiting again the next time I'm in NYC.
The food was great and the atmosphere is really nice! The service was also top notch! Would definitely return!

I think it's kind of overpriced, to be honest. My favorite was the spicy pig trotters, I just couldn't stop eating them! And the fried pumpkin pudding was addicting too. Portions are large so order Chinese-style (share dishes). Drinks are expensive but interesting. I would not get the chashu (weird combo with duck egg, and overcooked rough meat) or crab tofu (super popular but I have no idea why, it's tofu that's bland in a sea of duck egg oiliness. It's exactly what you'd think it would taste like, just weird?) again. The soup dumplings were good!
Its the best peking duck in the city. We found the steamed sea bass and pork trotters to be excellent as well. Really seems like there's an endless amount of great food here. Nice environment.
Just amazing food. Good service! But waiting until 30 mins can get food  they seems so busy during weekend. You better come around at 5-7pm to avoid in long lines.

I like to stick to Queens for my Sichuan food, but this place didn't disappoint I think they offered unique dishes that you normally don't see on a sichuan menu. The idea of incorporating a tea house was also very creative but I felt that it was very expensive to pay $10 for an individual tea not even a full pot. However the quality of the tea was superior.  My favorite was the pig trotters because it was boneless that's usually my main issue with it. The flavors were spot on a slight ma la flavor with some savoriness too. For people who don't like that strong numbing flavor this is a good dish. The Peking duck is also a solid dish the skin was extra crispy and it is served Beijing style not the Cantonese way with buns.

Such a good experience. Came here with two friends who really know authentic Chinese food and they were impressed too. We ordered Uluh Dim Sum Platter, woodear mushroom salad, vegetable fried rice, and fish in green peppercorn. All of it had so much flavor and definitely tasted high end. Really not one bad thing to say about the food or the service. I'd say an 9 out of 10.
The Beijing duck here is so flavorful and moist! I really live the food here. It tastes authentic!
No comment

My boyfriend and I ordered the scallion pancakes, vegetable fried rice, shrimp dumplings (spicy & sour) and the beef chili oil. The vegetable fried rice and shrimp dumplings were AMAZING!! The beef chili is SUPER SPICY - the three chili peppers really mean it is hot. The scallion pancakes were a little too oily but the sauce it came with was a nice compliment. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.
One of my favorite restaurant in East Village. The crab tofu and pork trout are my favorite. Definitely try it out!

One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the city. When NYC was going through the covid pandemic, I loved coming here since the tables were always well spaced out, the ambiance was always delightful, the staff was very courteous and careful, and the food has always been excellent.
No comment
Decent Chinese food!! Love the black sesame soup dumplings!! Service is just mediocre, the server did not refill my water and ignored our request to order a bowl of rice.
No comment

All the food here are unique! We enjoyed everything we ordered. They were all flavorful, large in portion, and we'd order them again the next time we come. The rice cake was Hulu shaped which is really fun.
Food here very good. I can say I love almost all the one I order. The waiting time for table kinda absurd cause no reservations available for weekends.

This is a trendy Chinese restaurant in the east village.  The Peking Duck is respectable, with the proper amount of potato chip thin duck skin crisp.  The crispy shrimp has a little kick to it and is a plentiful amount of prawns with heada.  The shells are crisped to an edible texture.  The chicken and jelly fish salad is refreshing as are the iced teas.  The lychee ginger in particular was tasty.  I think the rose lychee panacotta needs some work thiugh. Its hard texture was difficult to eat.  I would come back for the duck and to try some of other interesting dishes like the trotters and veggie dishes.
Authentic and numbing in my mouth.  Flavorful and not overly salty.  Will come back to try more dishes!
No comment
Best Chinese food I've had in New York, hands down! We had the fish with cabbage, Peking duck, and crab meat soup dumplings. Everything was fantastic!
Very authentic and tasty!  We also tried the tea which came in a nice set.  On the pricey side but worth it.
I achieved the super foodgasm here today. Thank you for the food we will def return. I achieved the super foodgasm here today. Thank you for the food we will def return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely terrible service for front of the house.  We've visited a few times before and while the food is decent,  many items are unavailable on the menu; the staff service also left much to be desired. We walked in at 5:30pm and ask for a table for 5 (they don't take reservations). The hostess told us there's a table available now if we're all there and can keep the table for us for 5 mins.  I immediately got my family in while my husband park the car across the street.  I even told her it's okay if she can get us a table for 4 and can certainly order for the party while my husband parks the car. The hostess keep insisting that I calm down in a condescending tone and said she have no table for 4, only five. Once we gathered the party (no more than 3-5mins) she refused to seat us, arguing it was "about 5mins already" and already gave our table away, without any warning even though we stood in front of her the entire time. She clearly didn't want to service us and was being as difficult as can be to make sure we can't dine there.  Management needs to devote more time and resources to better train your service staff, or replace them with more experience professionals esepcially given the competition in the area.  There is no reason we need to endure such unprofessionalism and absolute waste of time. We definitely won't be visiting ever again and all potential patrons should know what to expect from Uluh before they decide whether their food and service is worth their time and stress going through the ordeal.
Waited for two hours and did not get in. Although the food is great, I don't recommend planning to go here
The food tasted authentic and the presentation was great. We liked the ambience, fusion of New York and modern Chinese. Service was excellent. The staff were very polite and attentive to our needs.

I don't know why they sat me.... I arrived at 9:20 asking about having dinner, they sat me immediately.  I spent 5 minutes looking at the menu, and then another 5 minutes waiting for the server.  I ordered a cocktail, appetizer, and the Peking Duck, so with tip around $100.  She said she would need to bring it all at once, which I said was fine.  She then told me that I may not have enough time to eat, they close in 30 minutes.  It was very loud, she was wearing a mask, so I was a bit confused.  I asked what happens in 30 minutes if I am still eating, she said we close in 30 minutes, and again said that I may not have enough time to eat.  I asked her if she would prefer me to leave, she said, well we close in 30 minutes.  She was incredibly rude.
I ordered the Kung Pao Chicken and it was to die for! The flavors were phenomenal and the chicken was so tender and juicy. 10/10 recommend!
The dine-in experience is great. Peking duck is sooo good as well as the boneless pork trotter.
One of my favorite restaurants in New York! Very authentic Chinese food but elevated. Definitely recommend the Beijing duck, the stir fried cabbage, and  pan fried mini pork bun.
Boneless pork trotters& Duck blood in chilli sauce& Uluh soy milk with ice jelly and mochi. All of these three are super super good！Very spicy and special！Best  Szechuan food in the town！
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is our first time to visit Uluh! In city! They definitely retain good reputation among Asian community. Peking duck is pretty authentic and delicious. Beef belly with soup is a must try. In additions, they have some special food in their menu and those are the must try in my next visit
Super authentic Chinese restaurant and one of my favorites in the city. Highly recommend the boneless pig trotter!
Good food and service. The wait was long, so I would recommend putting your name down then go somewhere and come back if you don't want to wait.
Came to this restaurant for so many times! Always get the pecking duck,  the boneless spicy pig feet, so delicious! This time ordered some thing more. Love their egg-yolk pumpkin balls, so tasty!
Delicious trotters and truffled shrimp rice cake - no wait and spaced out with good service

Love the boneless pork trotters. Highly recommend. The food came very quickly and promptly. The waiters are very professional. This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city, can't really find faults with it. Highly recommend coming here with a group of people as the drinks here are also pretty good.
The duck is crispy, tofu is tasteful, the waiting time is a bit too long, but acceptable in general.

So good. Duck skin was crispy, just wish they cut the duck in wider slices. The pumpkin was one of my favorites. Also the truffle rice cake and shrimp. Crab tofu was also phenomenal, the tofu was so silky. The other dishes weren't as memorable but there are definitely other dishes I'd like to try next time. Will be back!

Everything was delicious and flavorful to the point. The drinks selection was also very interesting and presentation was very well thought for everything here. The ambiance and seating was comfortable. If you are looking for some very tasty Chinese food in a comfortable and nice restaurant this is the one.
So so authentic and come in huge portions. The spicy fish in green peppercorn packs a punch. The mini pork buns are so chewy and juicy.
No comment

Pretty solid but nothing extraordinary. Enjoyed the Peking duck and snow pea shoots. My date loved the crab tofu but I personally thought it was just okay - the grainy crab bits in the sauce were a bit off putting to me.

The tea is pretty tasty! Other foods too. The environment is clean and safe. I would like to come back again!
No comment
It is really delicious for everything we ordered. Wanna eat again. Some of them are spicy which are yummy too！If you like spicy，you can come！

The most unfriendly place ever, ESP zero empathy towards customers with babies. They canceled our reservation when they didn't reach out to us. I explained that their waiting list system is confusing and we are literally across the street. Then the waitress was so rude and said that we will have to wait all over again, when we waited for over 45 minutes. The sense of entitlement from the waitress is crazy and this is the second time this happened. I know you guys have a line and it's popular but your rudeness is what's going to destroy your business and we will never be back again and will tell all our friends about it.

The best pork skin ever! Great savory and the spicy sauce, the addressing is pretty. We ordered tomato noodle too, very sweet and tasty. Will come back again.

Very good highly recommend the peking duck. Best restaurant I've been to in a long time.
The fish soup with pickles was fantastic!! Our other dishes were all great, but that fish soup had so much flavor and a lot of different textures.

Hands down the best Chinese fusion cuisine in town. Have been to so many Chinese restaurants in the city but this is the favorite of all time. Not just me but also my family enjoyed the meal here like every single time we're here. Great service and great food!1
Beautiful place. Food is delicious and really good service! Crab tofu is my favorite!

Fifth time here now in the last two months. Food was not too spicy, definitely recommend the crab tofu!
Best Chinese restaurant in the city. Zangzang drink is my favorite, and a lot of great dim sum
Worth to come. Really traditional Chinese food. Nice place in East Village, and will have temperature test when entering for indoor seating
This place is very authentic! So delicious! The environment is well designed, the staff is very friendly and recommends very good dishes!

So good.  We were in NYC for a visit and were looking for good Chinese, and boy did we find it here.  We ordered a bunch of dim sum.  The chicken soup dumplings were outstanding.  The shrimp dumplings equally as good.  The string beans - wow.  And the corn shumai - unique and so tasty.  Everything we had was great.  And the outdoor seating (if you can get it - not too many tables) were really nice.  We'll definitely be back.
Very good food. Presentation is amazing. This is a good spot if you like spicy food. The ambient is nice and not too loud. So worth the price. They also definitely follow the indoor dining protocols.
The new "slow cook pig stomach & chicken soup" is a must try. They keep it very safe and decent dining environment for COVID situation
So good!! Love the xiaolongbao. Decoration so good. Music is lounge. It's very dark. Good for dating
This spot was my favorite Chinese place. It maintains the same food standard and looks ver clean. Feel comfortable in-door dining here.

We ordered the crab tofu and it was delicious! I asked if it could be made spicier and they gladly accommodated.
We ordered the most famous boneless pork trotters, very delicious! Other cuisines are good too.

The first dish, 夫妻肺片, tasted really good, but it was also the only dish that I liked for the whole night. What I also liked a lot was the service, all the waitress were very considerate, which I think makes the whole experience a lot better, but I guess I didn't order the ones that are most delicious here, especially the Dan Dan Noodle, I don't think that is the way it is supposed to be cooked, but maybe I'm wrong.

We had the pecking duck for two and it was everything. It's always a challenge to find a spot with some good pecking duck. The waitress staff were very professional, and quick. Plus they adhere to all covid regulations which made us feel safe. I'm coming back for this duck!

Excellent food and service. Will come back for my birthday. The food is really spicy but if you can handle the spice it's amazing. i got some to-go and the food tasted as good at home.

Amazing food, great vibes. This is my 3rd time at Uluh and it has not disappointed. Everything here is amazing. The Peking duck is exceptional, the black truffle and shrimp rice cakes are unique and awesome, and the soup dumplings are super flavorful. Honestly you can't go wrong with anything.

The decor and general vibes are awesome. Food / everything we ordered was delicious and quite authentic. Pre covid was very packed and crowded and was nice with the extra space during covid times. Look forward to going back soon.

Great food and drink, recommend the Yasmine sake. The okra salad has large portion and is fresh. The pork is soft and delicious.

Have been meaning to check out this place and was happy to finally get delivery from them! For starters, the portions of each item are huge, which is a nice surprise since I was under the impression that this is an fancy upscale (read: tiny portion) kind of place. The Boneless Pork Trotters was definitely the star of the show! Cooked to perfection and seasoned well. Fatty Beef in Sour Soup is spicier than it looks - which I like a lot!
Food is good, and authentic Sichuan food. Good environment and spacious that is enough for a big group of people.

Great cabbage and spicy fish. Would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for authentic Chinese food

Very nice servers and outside seating area with heaters inside but that's about it brown sugar glazed Peking duck has absolutely no flavor for price of$68 at list season it

Uluh had some really tasty food! Brings me back memories of the food in China that I ate
Haven't been here for some time and the food was amazing as usual. My all time favorite is their boneless pork trotters. So happy to be back at indoor dining!

Great restaurant, great Chinese food. Service is impeccable. Especially like the beef scallion pancake, the flavors and textures remind me of a simpler time, when I was eating at the farm with my mother in the days of yore. Thank you for this blast to the past.
No comment

We had an incredible experience at Uluh. We're huge fans of soup dumplings and Sichuan / dim sum, and it's hard to find a place that has a unique approach to the food and executes flawlessly. Uluh not only does both but provides an elevates the execution. The flavors were precise (truffle soup dumplings .. really? Yes!). The dumplings had wonderfully thin skin without splitting apart. The meat filling was plentiful and the soup was light and airy. Even the pumpkin puff, not our usual flavor profile, was special. You can't go wrong!
No comment

If you're looking for some Szechuan food in Manhattan this is the place to go to. Came on a Thursday night around 6pm. Was pretty busy but we got seated pretty quickly in one of their large tables where you are seated with other parties. Order the pu'er tea to accompany my food; it wasn't anything special, tasted like every other tea you get in any Chinese restaurant. If you're looking for a non spicy dish the The crab tofu is a good choice. There was plenty of crab and the sauce was flavorful. We got the fish filet in oil sauce and it was very authentic in terms of the spiciness. If this is your first time having Szechuan food, it's know for the spice as well as the numbing effect on your tongue. The chili oil went well with the crab tofu if you want tons spice the tofu up a bit. The Peking duck was some of the best Peking duck I've ever had. The skin was crispy and slightly sweet. You need to eat that dish quickly as the wraps can get cold and hard quickly. The dark was moist and tender and wasn't oily at all.

Dining in the bubble tent is an interesting experience. The food is good with great portion. Roast duck is the must try. The duck skin is so crispy. The duck meat taste a little dry. The crab tofu tasted so good, but the shrimp favor more than crab.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great place to hang out and chill with friend. Environment is great, doing a good job for social distance
Really good food. Our fav would be spicy pork trotters brown sugar duck. and osmanthus oolong cocktail is a must try as well!!

Really yummy spot for Szechuan. I had a great first time experience & later took my boyfriend there during lunch for his birthday. Lobster Mapo tofu, Sichuan Chili Fried Chicken & Stir Fried Cabbage with Soy Sauce were my favorite.  They also have fantastic desserts & I would recommend the Rose Lychee Panna Cotta & Mini Pumpkin Puffs.  Based off of food alone I would give 4 stars however my experience there for my boyfriends birthday was a little disappointing.  We went during lunch & the restaurant was quite empty but were seated pretty close to the entrance door.  We didn't notice how cold it got till later when there were many people going in & out of the restaurant for delivery orders. We also tried to order the Mini Pumpkin puffs but was told they were unavailable but was still charged for it.  We called the restaurant a total of 3 times & have yet to receive our refund.  My one bad experience shouldn't deter anyone from trying their delicious food, I just wish to receive my refund as it has been over a month since I requested it.

Worst customer service and worst food. Rushing no reason and waiter talk like shit. Food are trash too . Please avoid going because this is the worst internet famous restaurant. Worst restaurant of the year that l tried .
No comment

There are a lot of Chinese and Chinese-American restaurants in New York and they all serve different constituencies. Uluh is a true Chinese restaurant serving excellent regional food from Sichuan and Hunan (so expect some heat). With a cool decor in the East Village, the crowd skews younger together with a few others who appreciate really good Chinese food. Uluh has a great selection of teas and tea-based drinks. With no liquor license you need to bring your own. We have been to Uluh for both brunch and dinner and enjoyed both. The dim sum are excellent. There is also a section on the menu titled,  "The New Yorker" with a small selection of typical Chinese-American dishes.

Really good and diverse Chinese dishes. They have everything from Beijing roast duck to dims. The restaurant employees are all really nice and attentive. The portion sizes are good and the food is presented very nicely! Tried the Dan dan noodles, scallion pancakes, soup dumplings, and shao mai and it was very filling for a group of two.
No comment

This restaurant is pretty great! The food is delicious and the restaurant is upscale. The food came out really quickly. It's a popular spot so try to make reservations if possible. After a certain time in the evening they don't take reservation and it's first come first serve.

Decided to eat here after a number of delicious Uber Eats orders from here. The pork trotters and crispy shrimp with ginger are divine, but the salty egg yolk pumpkin pudding and mini pumpkin puffs still take the cake as faves; hope these aren't seasonal. Soup is also decent. The dim sum platter is just okay, but all of the other tasty dishes easily push this restaurant into 5-star territory.

The peking duck and boneless pork feet were the best in town! Cool atmosphere & friendly staff, strong recommended.

Delicious truffle fried rice, peppercorn spicy fish fillet, stir fry pea sprouts and chrysanthemum tea. Make sure to reserve a spot ahead of time because it can get busy. I would come back again. 10/10
Food was amazing! A little pricey but they have difficult dishes that you might not normally find at common Chinese restaurants. Pork trotter is my favorite dish. Be prepared for your numb tongue!

Made a reservation for the two of us at 5:30pm and when we got there the place was already 80% full. The food is a bit to the pricey side but I think they are worth every penny. The crab tofu is sooo good, and the pig stomach& chicken soup is very big portion and exceeded my expectations. Will definitely come back again.
If you want to find the most authentic Asian food on 2nd Avenue, you need to check this place out. The flavor is unforgetable

Finally, we have the opportunity to try this restaurant. Their food is so rich in flavor and serves a big plate. If you like spicy food, you can try order chef recommend. Thank you Ying to bring us a splendid dinner.

We waited for 50 minutes on a Monday night, to give you a sense of the popularity of this restaurant. We got the vegetarian dry pot to share, which had one of the better flavors of dry sichuan hot pot that I've had honestly. It was quite spicy (4 peppers) so I would beware if you can't handle your spice. The waitstaff was attentive and the portions were good. I'd like to come back and try other dishes!
Everything is super fragrant and delicious   the black truffle soup dumplings are the best

Really great modern Chinese spot with an extensive menu. My party and I ordered the soup dumplings, pork trotters, veg dry pot, and also ordered their drinks. Overall a great place and I will definitely be returning.
Horrible food. Synthetic Chinese. I can't communicate how bad this food was to eat. I couldn't-- threw it all in the garbage.

1st time here.... nice decor, excellent & attentive service.... good food...can't miss !!! Will definitely be back
I have to say this is the best Chinese food in NYC. It's a little pricing but worth it. I'd would like to recommend this restaurant to all my friends. And I already did. Lol
Both the dishes and the environment are excellent！The roast duck and pumpkin snacks are highly recommended!

column6: It's good their Peking duck for me. The restaurant I know to eat Peking duck. However, The crispy tofu I didn't like. They decor is modern.

Saw this place everywhere and didn't think we could get a table the day of just thought to give it a try and do not regret it at all! The food was amazing too. All the dishes we order were fantastic and did not disappoint. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Uluh is by far one of the best Chinese restaurants in East Village. Tasty food, great presentation, helpful staff, modern and sleek restaurant.

The steamed chicken with chili oil and the sweet and sour ribs were excellent! Interior is very modern and comfortable. Food is authentic and tasty.

Always astounded by the quality of the food at Uluh. Had an amuse bouche of sweet and sour ribs, scallion pancakes, and to top it all off, these delicious sesame soup dumplings

Food was amazing! I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time. We got the Cumin Beef, Cabbage in Soy Sauce, and the Crab Tofu - all which were really flavorful and declicious. Would definitely come here again!

Amazing food and place at Uluh!! Everyone keep social distance here and the best Chinese food I tried in East Village.

Amazing meal! I have been here multiple times, the food always hits the spot. My favorite dishes include the pork trotters, stir fry cabbage, sour beef soup. But honestly, everything i have ordered from the restaurant is excellent.

$140 for 2 ppl eating 1/2 Peking duck(with 6 paper-like thin bo2 bing3) cucumber salad, 8 second beef, braised pork hands, some weird ginger drink. Peking duck is being processed in old method except brushing extra brown sugar on the skin, which on the one hand, have better immersed feeling with sauce; on the other hand, stimulates too much so that it is hard to continue after 3 serves. The beef is post-spicy, which means I fel spicy after sewing 2 seconds. I finished cucumber. Nice. I didn't finish pork hands. Same reason: first bite: amazing; second bite: decent; third bite: enough. Maybe it's because of rich spicy oil(I guess).
Food is amazing! My favorite dish is the pork feet. Peking duck is also delicious! Would highly recommend to anyone into Chinese food. A must try!

Tried their crispy bass fish. The food was kinda good(but pricy) in the beginning, but gets saltier as the time goes(super salty for me). Left entirely half of the fish because it's too salty to have a second bite. I cannot believe how much salt the cook had put into my dish.
Quite close to the original taste I had in my hometown. It's good to have a restaurant like uluh in NYC.
We loved the diversity of menu items - there was something for everyone! The sticky rice shu mai was great. Also tried the sesame soup dumplings - what a unique and delicious dessert!

Peking Duck was amazing. Glass noodles were packed with flavor I could not believe it. Atmosphere was intimate although the restaurant was packed (good reason). Whenever I'm in NYC again I'll make sure to come back!

So amazing food! Really great nighttime vibe with fun loud music and edgy, but elegant, interior design. The food is great portions and full of flavor. Love the spicy chicken and pineapple!! Would definitely recommend. Also their cheese foam milk tea pairs great with the spicy flavors
The pecking duck here is very good! We also got the sour beef soup and string beans. Everything came quickly but the wait does get long so get here early to put your name down!
Food is great! Probably one of the best Chinese restaurants I have tried in NYC. Authentic and delicious. Great ingredients. For sure will be back often.

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: This is such a restaurant for high-end Chinese food. All the utensils are so exquisitely made and the drinks are all quite interesting. While the portions may not be big, they leave you wanting for more. Note that on weekends there might be a long line, so I would try to arrive at 11:30AM sharp, when they open.

Such a big disappointment, I came here with my crew expecting a nice gathering after the covid but most of the dishes are super salty. And it's way too hot inside during the summer. Wouldn't recommend.

Very authentic Hunan food, definitely recommend this place for both tourists and locals. Price is also very friendly. Must visit!

Really great food, my favorite was the stir-fried pork and green peppers. Soup dumplings were delicious as well. Bit of a long wait for a table (~40 minutes) but we were a party of 4 on a busy Sunday without a reservation.
High recommended! Really good food! They adjust the spicy level for u. Food came really fast

Best and authentic Peking duck you can ever get within New York, other dishes are good as well

I have ordered millions of times from here and it's still one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. My favorites are the pig feet dish and crab meat tofu. All other dishes are very authentic and worth trying! We used to dine in pre-COVID and we loved how they decorated the restaurant. Both inner design as well as their China plates show good taste of the manager! Highly recommended if you like Chinese food.

Great authentic Chinese spot in the village with delicious meals.  Tried the Peking Duck, cabbage, sweet and sour pork, pot stickers, scallion beef pancakes, and cumin beef.  Everything was delkcious and we've we've actually been back a second time since.  Will keep returning!
One of the best Chinese restaurant in New York. Highly recommend the peach oolong, Peking duck and pork feet!
