No comment

We ordered in. Perhaps it was owing to the fact that we ordered the generic Chinese dishes but I was a little underwhelmed. It's ok. Not that much better than your nextdoor Chinese if you're getting general tso or Kung Pao chicken. I've certainly had better fried rice.

The duck was served cold, the skin of it was not crispy at all, fat, salty and not crispy ( which is very important for roasted duck). Other dishes were even worse, overly salty as hell. No customer service at all, even we already told 3 different people that we afraid we couldn't accept the quality of those food. Overall, do not believe the 5 stars review which looks like ads.

Love this restaurant! Everything was delicious and very flavorful - we got the boneless pork feet, steamed fish with tofu, vegetable pot and duck soup with Ginseng. This is definitely one of my new favorite restaurants in New York City!
We got right in on a Thursday. The soup dumplings were good, but not best ever. Same with the service. You do have to flag someone down to help you, but they're nice and helpful.
Absolutely delicious! Highly recommend the Peking duck and stir fried cabbage with glass noodles. Fantastic experience.
No comment
Great food, great vibe, great services, came in fairly late at night, still got to order all the foods we wanted. It's a must try in east village!
It's not typical for me to find a Sichuan restaurant of this caliber, as most tend to be similar for my tastes. The pecking duck, sweet and sour ribs, cucumber salad, were all fantastic.
Very good experience dining in! Love the food here. Very authentic. The environment here is very beautiful and quiet. The food here is authentic Chinese food with a creative twist.

We are in a bubble! Uluh was a nearby spot offering bubble seating during the last snowstorm and we were craving dim sum. For our party of 3 we ordered the colorful soup dumplings, Shanghai pork soup dumplings, and salted egg yolk dumplings. Can you tell we LOVE dumplings? Our waiter actually suggested this might be too many dumplings, but there is no such thing. We also got the mini pumpkin puffs and HOLY CANOLY (or should I say holy pumpkin puff?) these things were gooooood. We ended up getting 3 more (they come in a set of 2). Just try them and thank me later. We also had the purple sweet potato pancake and the brown sugar glazed Peking duck. All of it was fabulous, from the bubble to the colors of the dumplings to the bright orange crunch of the pumpkin puff. I will absolutely be returning. The only reason this is 4 stars instead of 5 is because our first dinner experience (about a year prior) was not near as good. The Szechuan chili fried chicken was less chicken, mostly just chili's. Absolutely recommend going for dim sum though!
Very Disappointed! Food are super salty! Way to hot inside for the summer. Not recommend
Best Peking duck in NY. Get the soup dumplings too.  The stir fry pork with egg is perhaps one of the best dishes I have ever had in the city. This place has got the recipe down...
really delicious, has pretty much the taste of hometowns. The environment is wonderfully too.
No comment
My friends and I really enjoy this dinner! We ordered fish, pork, noddles, vegetables. It's a nice experience and every dishes taste good!
This is a good restaurant. The pig feet and crab tofu are so good! Very delicious! And there has free green tea!
No comment
Dishes are super nice as always! Love the pig feet and duck blood. And the Tsingdao mojito is fantastic!
2nd time here and the place still doesn't disappoint. Pan fried mini bao are a must try
What a gastronomy!! Everything is phenomenal. Will definitely come back. The mini pumpkin puff is a most!!

Great food! Excited to come again. We got the Crab Tofu, Fish in Green Peppercorn, Scallion Pancake, Soup. Dumplings, and Crab Tofu. Everything was cooked to perfection- definitely have to come again to try more dishes here. Menu is very expansive
No comment

Ordered 4 dishes today: Peking duck, dry vegetable pot, boneless pork trotters, and fatty beef with sour soup. They each arrived very fast and the taste for each is all delicious. I think the price is reasonable because their serving size is pretty big. We also got their soy milk with mochi drink and the sweetness level is perfect, it reminds me of a similar drink in China. I saw these dishes from a well known app so we gave it a try today and it didn't disappoint!
Great meal, very authentic. The sesame chicken was very spicy and tasty. It's hard to find spicy authentic Chinese food in New York, will definitely come back.

Came to this place starving for food. The staff was wonderful to my party of 3 and place was clean. We ordered some delicious food and they were cooked to perfection. We will recommend this place to anyone and everyone
Great place and I love it. The color dumplings is very special and have eight different flavors.
Amazing taste! Love the ambient, tea , and  food!  Def come back ;)  highly recommend for people who looking for authentic chinese cuisine.
great ambiance and excellent service! Will be coming back. Very popular and worth it :)

Fancy Chinese food, the portions are all fairly small but it's tasty and delicious. The restaurants fairly big and they have rooms for bigger party's as well. Not the best pecking duck I've had, even in NY, but it's still pretty good!

Uluh is incredible. One of the most delicious, consistent, and unique restaurants in New York. The pineapple schezuan chicken is a must-try- spicy and addictive!! We crave Uluh every time we go!! Get the pumpkin buns for dessert- YUM!
the food in this restaurant is very good～the food areally delicious and pretty...I have a really good experience here. And also the service really good...
The wait is quite long so make sure to plan early. Otherwise the food is tasty and very authentic.
The best Chinese food in NYC. Great environment for getting together. Try the Tsingtao mojito, it's soooo good.
No comment
Dinner at uluh! This is my third visit, it have never disappoints me and my friend. Especially the Brown sugar duck, it's a little pricey but  definitely worth it ! The staff are very nice as well

Didn't expect it but, Uluh was really something else. Rates are absolutely reasonable. We are so glad that we have ordered Shanghai Pork Soup Dumplings, it was really excellent. The staff was really welcoming and service is perfect. Would 10/10 recommend and will certainly be back soon.

Finally they updated the menu with more exciting items. Can't wait to try. I'd say they always exceed my expectations. It's a great option for family reunion, friends hangout and all kinds of date. My cousin and I had a wonderful time.
Delicious and quick and a great atmosphere! I highly recommend the outdoor dining at UluH!!
This place is amazing！！The food is sooooo good and the service is great. Highly recommended!
One of the best Chinese spots in town. Beautiful decor, huge menu, and everything executed well. I don't know how they do it. Reminds me of places in Hong Kong.
No comment

An upscale Chinese restaurant that's sure to impress your date or friends from out of town. Definitely on the pricier side but everything I tried was delicious, even the tea. They have everything from dim sum to peking duck, so you will definitely find something you want on the menu if you like Chinese food. The atmosphere is very cool -- the lights are dim and they play hiphop and R&B music. I would highly recommend trying this place out.
Phenomenal food and ambience. Crab tofu and chicken chili oil complement each other and chicken is cooked to perfection. Omg the duck is foodgasm.
You must get the Peking Duck. The skin is so crispy while the meat is tender. Just get it.
All the foods are great! The environment is really nice too. The tables are separated apart so it's quite safe. Would deal revisit!!
Amazing food! Everything we ordered was spectacular, can't wait to come back and try more.   The oolong cocktail was one of the best I've had, not too sweet but complemented the meal perfectly.
Curious on whether they are still opened now? I really miss their dishes！remember their pork feet, roasted Peking duck, crab meat bean curd are all super delicious (and spicy too)

Great food, attentive and very friendly service. Menu have many authentic dishes with some local Asian flavor as well. Will highly recommend other to try out Shanghainese dishes here. Love their plates presentation. Well done chef...!!!
This place is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. The food is so fresh. There are really spicy heavy dishes and lighter but still flavorful dishes, so it's perfect for several food moods.

Very nice restaurant and very local taste. The taste can be the best in my heart. However, everything is a little bit salty and they don't have any bottle of water or soda. The tap water in this restaurant is little bit taste chemical, I don't want to have it since it might not be good for health. When I'm asking them a bottle of water or soda. They told us they don't sell them. And all their drink menu are making by tap water.  Hope you can change it since you are not allow customer bring their own water to enter the restaurant.
Like the pork feet and Beijing duck here the pork feet is not very spicy it has a little sweetness into it
Nice dishes and service, recommend pig feet and sweet rice. Close to the station!!!!!!!!
Food was great but service was a little slow. Good portion for the price. Would def come back to try the pig trotter and other dishes.
Great food great service. Love everything about this restaurant. The boneless pork trotters is heavenly.

The food is beautiful, delicious and clean. The service is excellent and the waitress who took care of us was extremely attentive and helpful. This was my first experience at Uluh and I can certainly say I'll be back again. I also live nearby so I'm looking forward to ordering in from here soon!
I went here 2 year ago with my friend. They consistently offer great food! Two must have: brown sugar duck and pork trotter!
No comment
Came here because one of the friend recommended us this place. It surely didn't disappoint us. Food here is very good & authentic. Will definitely coming back here for more.
No comment

This is our first time at Uluh. We sat outside and it was very enjoyable! The food was delicious and our waitress was so accommodating. She made the experience here wonderful. I am very excited to come back and try more of their soup dumplings!
Have been a loyal customer of Uluh for so long that we will consider eating at Uluh every time we come to East village. So I just want to give a good review to show appreciation.
The Peking duck and soup dumplings were delicious. The chili fried chicken was a bit too oily for me. Overall, really good.
Very good place to relax and eat with your friends. Great restaurant to take your date!
This is our four time come here. Exceeded all expectations once again! Amazing food with great service! Can't wait to come back and try more!
Amazing food and environment! This is the second I come here and I'll def com back again:) 100% recommend

The food looks yummy and it tastes even better . Uluh is probably my favorite restaurant for Cantonese and Szechuan cuisine. I've been to many Chinese restaurants in NYC during my five years stay. Uluh can be the only restaurant that I would like to try out everything on the menu. 10 out of 10. A must-go!
This is my third time here, the best spicy Chinese food I've had so far in the city. Pork feet is the must have.
It's great to have an authentic joint with good ambiance in the neighborhood. Wish they'll eventually take normal reservations though.

This place is a hidden gem. When you walk in the ambience is calm and welcoming, everything looked clean and well put together. The Peking Duck was super crispy. The Crab Tofu was delicious; the tofu just fell apart. Everything was delicious
The restaurant is amazing!! Definitely one of my favorite places in NYC. The spicy boneless pork trotters are beyond great.
Nice place for a small party. It's more like a fusion style of Chinese food. Recommend to try the peking duck and port feet.

Food was very great, the service was exceptional.All of their staff follow the COVID 19 policy and wear masks and take temperature for every customer. The salty egg yolk dishes are great! Peking and the salty crab are amazing. The Dim Sum platter was excellent. Definitely recommended!
The peking duck, pig trotters and black paper mushroom beef are the best. The rose lychee panta cotta is also really good.

Really amazing Peking duck. The rest of their food was ok... pretty pricey. Service is fine. Inside is really bougey - bathroom has toto bidet and heated seats. Good for some genuine, good quality Chinese food.
Amazing food and great portions for the price! I recommend the eggplant, steamed sea bass, and pork blood.
No comment

I went here for lunch with my friends around 12 but there was a long line already! We sat in after 30 mins waiting and trust me they have the best Chinese food in NYC!!!! Strongly recommend the crab tofu and the matcha zang zang tea.
No comment
No comment

High quality food and service, classy environment as well. Definitely recommend coming here for dates and birthday dinner. Crab tofu and sour beef soup is the must to order! Also, the desserts are very good.
No comment
Went because it seemed to be really popular. Found it to be overhyped and overpriced with mediocre (and oversalted) food.
No comment
My favorite chinese restaurant. Spicy, amazing and delicious food. Also, nice and friendly service. very reasonable price given a nice food here. No reason to miss this place.

Great atmosphere and interior, with cute and modern but quite elegant decorations and designs. A few tables and for bigger groups I do recommend reservations but it's not really that necessary. Definitely on the pricier side but once in awhile it's worth it. The service is good and food is delicious. The tea is really good too, not overly sweet but you can definitely taste the fruit and sweetness but a bit of the tea's bitterness. Really liked the Rose and Peach Oolong Tea with Hand Whipped Cheese Foam. No it's not actually cheese but it's dairy based and a bit sweet and savoury, balance out the tea so I really enjoyed it. Brown Sugar Glazed Peking Duck is really good so is Uluh Dim Sum Platter. Not a place I'd frequent but it's definitely a place I'd recommend and I'd come back to from time to time. Decent quality and mostly healthy ingredients, and not too greasy but flavourful and pretty light on the stomach. Not too hard to find and pretty convenient with some bus stops and the 6 train at walking distance. There's also the yellow line but it's another block further than Astor Place's 6 train.
Amazing Chinese food in the city!! Not typically one to leave a review but this place was so stellar it merited a rave review. The crab lobster and pig trotters are unlike anything else!!

I came here for the soup dumplings, which I thought were just pretty normal, except for the black truffle ones, which were pretty good. The other ones.... Just ok. However, everything else we got was pretty good. The duck dumplings, wonton in chili oil, crab tofu, iced soy milk with jelly and stuff was pretty and tasted pretty good also. Their desserts were really good too. We got the rose lychee Panna Cotta and the grapefruit and pistachio mousse.... Which was pretty good. I would definitely go again, just not for the soup dumplings. Everything else was
Just love the food here. The roast duck, egg yolk fried dumpling, pig trotter and pepper chicken soup are my favorites!
My absolute favorite Chinese place in nyc. Get the pig trotter, roast duck. & their milk tea is so good.

The best Chinese restaurant here in manhattan with very friendly staff and amazing food. The boneless pork is amazing and they have very authentic Chinese soup. I had ducky ducky and chicky chicky soup, very tasty. The pickle fish is good too, but little bit too spicy for my Cantonese stomachs. They also have all kind of liquors to choose from.
No comment
No comment

I can't believe how diverse and tasty uluh's dishes are. It blows my mind. Please try out the new dishes!!! By the way, you can't miss the desserts there. The ingredients in the ice creams all come from France and Japan, really authentic.

A friend and I were looking for good Chinese food around East Village and we stumbled into Uluh. What an absolutely delicious surprise. We got the Dan Dan Noodles for an appetizer and the Peking duck for our entree. Both were delicious. Looking forward to coming back here to try the rest of their menu.
No comment
My new fav Chinese restaurant in Manhattan! It's on the high-end side but def worth every penny. Love their teaware for the oolong tie yuan yin tea that I ordered. Highly recommend.
Pretty authentic food, loved everything I had. Went there for the Peking Duck and didn't disappoint.
No comment
My boyfriend took me here and all the food was very good! And a free beer'!!! My fav Chinese food in New York As far! Thank you my boyfriend xoxo
Fabulous!!  Fish w green peppercorns was especially delicious and fiery; loaded with chilis, fermented cabbage, enoki mushrooms, ginger and shirataki bundles.

The food were amazing! The dim sum platter is a must and the pumpkin custard bun shaped like oranges. The taste really hit home for me back when I lived in Shanghai, especially the seaweed wonton soup. The desserts and drinks we ordered were alright but they were super cute for pictures!

It is a great dining experience here. I would definitely recommend their Peking duck and especially the pig trotters. So good. Service is great too. A little pricey but I won't complain too much considering the food and services they offered.

This is my second time to be here. The crab tofu is so delicious that I will order everytime here. The taste is just like or beyond the crab tofu I tasted in my hometown, China. Love this restaurant! Nice environment and good taste of food.

The food here is so-called Malaysia style Chinese food, it is slightly different from Chinese food but still has the authentic taste. Highly recommend the 8 seconds beef. Environment is really nice, love the interior style of this restaurant.
No comment

It is a good place for friends to hang out. The atmosphere is nice. Every dish was good. I liked the pig feet and the tofu best. The drink/tea was great! The dessert is just ok but the sticky rice is recommended.

The sugar pecking duck is good but nothing special and they only gave you 5 pancakes. The mushroom and Pork trotter are jokes . The Fish is really mediocre. The dry pot is so so. The only thing I like is the beef scallion pancake. I would never come to this restaurant again!If you like pecking duck go to Decoy their duck is beyond everything. If you want Sichuan spicy food go to Sichuan mountain house! If you like fry hot pot go to Mala Project! I paid 250 USD for this meal and it doesn't even taste slightly good .
It's one of the best Chinese restaurants,  great vibe, reasonable price,  excellent taste.  The pork and seafood dishes are exceptional. Must go place for a party of 6+
Nice decoration! Fully recommend the crab tofu and pork trotters. For two people the waiting time is only 10-15 mins. For me It's like the authentic CHINESE food!

Highly recommend the boneless pork trotters dish. The spicy and numb flavor is very distinct but still very enjoyable. Overall, I would describe this place as Sichuan food with a creative twist. The ambiance is nice but way too loud. However the wait time was not long and the dishes came fast.
No comment

If I could give zero stars I would. My husband and I had decided to order pick up from this restaurant. We were looking forward to try this restaurant based off the reviews. However, our experience with a simple take out order was nothing short of a NIGHTMARE. We had originally planned to have an "in restaurant" meal but due to the long wait (an hour), we decided to order pick up through the restaurant's own system because it said that pick up would be 30 to 35 minute. We placed our order at 7:00 p.m. The restaurant system told us that our order would be ready at 7:31 p.m. . We traveled by car and arrived at 7:30 p.m. Once we entered restaurant, we were told that the wait time is incorrect online and that the typical wait time is instead 45 minutes to 1 hour. We understood that sometimes online ordering has the incorrect information and we patiently waited. Throughout this entire time we had our 2-year-old child with us. Anyone who has children know, that children have a certain period of time that they are calm but after that period of time they become cranky and upset. We live in the upper east side and had the restaurant told us that it was eventually going to be another 40 minutes. We would have brought our child back home but there was NO COMMUNICATION at all! We eventually had to end up waiting a total of 1 hr and 40 minutes for our take out order. We were only told after this time that some of the items were not available. We waited for such a long time and did not even receive the meal we ordered. Half of the food items were cold because they were probably sitting out while the rest were being cooked. During this entire process, there was no communication between the staff or management and my family. There were no apologies. When we were finally handed our takeaway bag, We were told that they had removed some of our order and did not let us know until that moment. We are very upset with the service and professionalism of this establishment. Unfortunately even after trying the food, we were disappointed. The soup dumplings were depleted and cold. The tofu dish was wrapped incorrectly and had made a I do mess in the bag. And the soups were all cold.
Great vibe, great service, and great menu. I loved the food! Finally, Pecking Duck in the neighborhood - it's a must try.
Amazing Chinese food! Very modern as well. We took the Peking duck and the crab and we didn't regret it! The atmosphere is really great and the waiters are so kind!!!

I came here for dessert after dinner on a Monday night.  They are open pretty late until 10:30 PM even on weeknights.  We ordered the rose goldfish oolong tea.  The teabag was in the shape of a goldfish and there's a pole you can use to move it around which was cute.  The tea was light and floral.  We ordered the matcha chiffon cake and the rose lychee panna cotta.  I liked the rose lychee panna cotta more since it was unique and light.  The frozen lychee inside the panna cotta was a surprising treat.  I didn't really like the thick cream that came with the matcha chiffon cake.  Chiffon cake is such a light cake so the heavy cream didn't go with it.  Service was very fast and friendly.  Overall, the experience was a bit pricey, even pricier than Cha An Teahouse which is like one block away.  However, this place is bigger and has more tables than Cha An.  It was a cute place to try and if Cha An is too crowded, I would come here instead.
No comment

Service is smooth and gets better after initial visits. The food quality is excellent. Fresh ingredients used in each dishes we tried. Most excellent tea selections offered (but not cheap) some dishes could be very spicy just be aware before you order. Otherwise, the restaurant has a nice pleasant ambiance and excellent authentic food and drinks!

A new favourite place to have authentic Szechuan food in the village! With a modern interior and great, attentive staff, the dining experience is phenomenal. When I came around 8pm with a party of 7, we had to wait around 40 minutes but we were able to get drinks at the bar to wait. Once we were seated, service was quick and the food was served relatively quick too. Our group really enjoyed the Fish in Green Peppercorn, Truffle Fried Rice, Stir-Fried Cabbage and the Soup Dumplings! Went back a week later as a party of two in the afternoon and we were seated right away. Ordered the fish again along with the Peppered Beef both of which were delicious. One of the most authentic Szechuan food experience in NYC that I have had so far.
No comment
Loved this upscale Asian restaurant. Chinese food with attention to detail and cooked exceptionally well
This is such a great East village gem! They have the best fried rice and Dan Dan noodles and the atmosphere is such amazing vibes. I would bring anyone here!
No comment

The food is amazing!!! It's much better than what I expected. We ordered small Peking Duck, black truffle soup dumplings, zha jiang mian, pancake with beef, all of which are delicious. The major reason that it's 4 star instead of 5 is we are ahead of someone else. But the waiter let other sit first.

Stopped by to get tea and pastries with my girl friends on a Sunday morning! Loved this charming new spot on Second Ave - the decor is both modern and zen, like an updated version of a traditional Chinese tea house. and the tea sets are amazing. I got the mango green tea and my friends got the chrysanthemum tea - all of it was tasty. We ordered lotus pastries, which were good, but the more memorable pastry was the bun with sweet egg custard. Great place to relax and catch up with friends!
Great food, especially the soup dumplings. Hip, casual ambience.

Modern Chinese restaurant with new and traditional Chinese dishes. Great ambience. Loved every dish we were served. We wished if they could make them less salty as in the end the flavour was too heavy that we had to order another bowl of rice.

Highly recommend the crab tofu!! Amazing restaurant :) They have a lot of options, spicy dishes, non spicy dishes, good looking dessert. We ordered a spicy fish with green pepper and picked the fresh fish. It is very tasty. If you like spicy and fish. Go for it!
This my favorite Asian restaurant I've been here. So delicious, highly recommended Peking duck, pig feet with boneless and delicious stir fried cabbage
beautiful environment. Food with good quality! Peking duck is very good. I love the spicy pig feet without bone! Service is very good as well
No comment

Great Chinese food just pop up in my area. It is an upgrade Chinese restaurant.I love spicy. Food was great, fast service and decor also very pretty. This place do not take reservations just so you know. It might be a little wait as it was crowded most of the time.

We came here during a weekday for dinner. The food is pretty decent, and I would say it's a little overpriced. For example, the tea pot per personal with one tea bag cost 13 bucks. My favorite dish would be the Peking duck. The skin is very crispy and tasty. The crab tofu is also pretty good
Really good food and the restaurant looks amazing recommend the soup dumplings and Dan Dan noodles to start

Great food, great service! The soup dumplings and scallion pancake were great. We also got the crab tofu, fish and green peppercorn, both delicious! Highly recommend this restaurant, very authentic food in east village.
Great food! Nice restaurant! Good place for friends gathering! Highly recommend purple rice, pork trotters, brown sugar and brown sugar roast duck.
No comment
No comment
Ordered Colorful soup dumplings, Crab Tofu, pig Trotters, and Salty Egg Yolk Pumpkin Pudding. Highly recommend all of these. Were phenomenal, unique, and in large portion sizes!
Except the long wait, this place is very nice. The spicy dumplings and pecking duck are very good. Worth the wait.
Coming with my friends! Good place to eat! Nice environment! Really clean! The waitress is really nice!

I think I found my spirit restaurant! Love everything here. In Chinese Uluh is a totem of good luck and wealth. The design of this place is A plus as well. Me and my friend ordered tea and it came with individual little cute teapot that you can serve yourself. Truly a bring-you-home experience. The service experience was good. Restaurant was quite and clean. Overall, would definitely recommend more friends here. Native Chinese foodie approved
One of my favorite spots in the city and they make the best Peking duck in my opinion. I wasn't a big fan of Peking duck until I tried their Peking duck. The rose panna cotta is also excellent!
Came for lunch and the food was delicious. Elevated Chinese food and authentic. Definitely get the pumpkin buns with the runny salted egg yolk!
Great atmosphere and absolutely delicious food! Service is really good too. The crab tofu is AMAZING! Nice experience here. Definitely will come back next time
The food is really good as well as the drinks! especially the peking duck and peach oolong milk tea!!! would definitely recommend to all of my friends:)
food is good， yamuy ，delicious , uluh offers a modern edge to traditionally crafted dishes from the many regions of China and Asia, including an array of the finest globally sourced teas

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: The environment is good and foods are good and beautiful. Servers are friendly and helpful. Strongly recommended!

This is a place i find myself returning to over and over again. One day i was walking  around saint marks and was looking for a good place to eat and saw this place. The food tasted very delicious. The service was phenomenal. The drinks were also very good. Now every-time i am in the area i always go to eat here. I will definitely be eating there again and again. Cant get enough of there Lobster Mapo Tofu.
Too much MSG, but the cold drinks are kinda refreshing and help you balance the salty taste. Average Chinese cuisine, but you can find more authentic ones in NYC.

If u want real Chinese food, it is a good place, but just worried about if they can satisfied western stomachs. Four of us ordered two rounds, both of them r super good, it is like what we eat in China. I saw some negative reviews below, I guess they just have never live in China or try any food there.
The food here is amazing! Dishes were served in a timely manner; Service was also excellent, and the waiters were attentive.
one of the great Chinese restaurant in NYC I love it. I eat uluh almost every week! If you are looking for the Chinese restaurant in nyc this is the one !
Legit. Soup dumplings, wantons in chili oil, Peking duck, all insanely good. This is a really good spot. Go now before it's run over with tourists.
We got the Peking duck, pig trotters and pork dumplings for lunch, which were all delicious. Service was attentive too.
The service is great and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is preserved even during covid times.
Rose oolong tea is sooooo great! Peking Duck, mushroom, eggplant, beef pancake and pork feet are all very good!! It's worth to try!!!
This is a wonderful place with good environment and delicious desserts! I like it a lot.

It's a great modern take on Chinese tea house, the dims sun are nice and in small portion but somehow the service are bit slow so the the dishes are not as hot as they should be when they arrived . The Tea bag are really interesting visually and provided in a zen like feel to it. The space are not crowded as a New York tea house I expected.
No comment

This is one of my favorite restaurant. We ordered Boneless Pig Trotter, salty egg yolk pumpkin pudding, fish fillet in chili oil, and eggplant with pickled chili plate. OH MY GOODNESS. This place is amazing! Pig trotter is super tender and fatty. I couldn't really feel the spiciness because our fish fillet was spicier haha. And salty egg yolk sounded weird at first but still my friend ordered it. And I do not regret ordering one. Crispy outside and taste like salty side dosh with creamy texture. Eggplant is just a perfect dish to eat with fried rice  just go there guys I think it is one of my fav restaurant now
Great place to try Chinese food.  Native taste,  Peking duck is great.  We love the jasmine tea. Enjoy the lunch
Very delicious food. Will come to Uluh again definitely. Especially I like the fish dish here and the noodle here.

Tasty Chinese food at a price. Peking duck is one of the best in the city, maybe the best. Pork rib soup is delicious. So is the crab tofu, though there's not much crab. Cumin beef and eggplant both really good. Excited to come back to try out more!

The Sichuan chili friend chicken is incredibly delicious! Ambience, cleanliness, service, everything worthy of the utmost respect. I love this restraint and would eat 3 meals a day, 7 days a week if I could!u

The dishes are delicious and the service too bad！！！！Came to here too many times, later won't go again! because the reception desk a girl's service too bad ！！this is Restaurants that are not worth a tip
Very modern and hip atmosphere. The food is amazing as well, especially the peking duck. Most customers seem to be young chinese students.

Taste is good but a little bit over-priced. I ordered Beijing duck, crab Tofu and pig trotter. The duck is crispy and nice served, the tofu is very tasty and the price is not high. The pig trotter is cooked thoroughly and  delicious.
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant and love the pork feet and crab tofu. Highly recommend it!
Great deco & set up. Food is good but more for testing menu. If you are hungry it may be too small servings. Prices are on the high side.
Way too expensive, a ton of rich price-insensitive Chinese kids here. Cheaper options with better food in less crowded areas

My friends recommended me coming at uluh and it was the best decision ever. Food is very good and dessert is so cute. The server there are friendly .We had a great dinner here..We ordered sweet and sour ribs, wonton with spicy saucer, egg noodle,vegetable...
Great food and really lovely and attentive staff. Nice calm and modern interior. Perfect lunch spot for modern Asian cuisine. Peking duck particularly good, as well as the shanghai dumpling.
No comment

Waiting is ridiculous, make sure you have an hour to spend on waiting for a table of 4/6. Also, They texted me saying table is ready, when I arrived they said n additional 30 mins  wait??? I have no idea what they are doing.

This was a beautiful meal that was thought out out impeccably through out. The meal began after a wait, with reason. This type of meal is not one you want to rush through. Rather, it fosters the use of all your senses and reminds you of the humanness behind food and of course, my favorite, lighting!!
One of my favorite restaurants in New York. Super nice environment with delicious food. We ordered a lot and finished them all!!! Highly recommended!!
Nicely decorated restaurant with great food. They offer some dishes slightly different from ordinary Chinese restaurants, would recommend to all friends.
pork feet,  cabbage glass noodle and Mao due wang.  Like the food and the service.  great
Came because of word of mouths, but had an disappointing experience. Food took over 30 mins to come, kitchen might have forgotten about it. The curry dish is alright, salted duck was good

Amazing food, good service and the place is beautiful! We ordered the crispy shrimp with ginger which is surprisingly good. I don't think I had it before.  Also we had the black sticky rice with dried fruits for a great ending!

Very popular Chinese restaurant in the area. We came here a few times before. It was really good in the past. However our most recent visit is a bit disappointing. Both fish and beef dish were a bit bland. Overall service and food are still decent.
Amazing staff. Delicious food. I recommend the peaking duck. Would recommend friend to come eat for dinner.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: great food and large portion. Good environment and good service. Best Chinese food around NYU.
They put mushroms in the beer mojjito! So  interesting! Love this place
Quality Chinese food in NYC. Traditional dishes from a variety of different regions, plus some homages to NYC Chinese food (general Tsao etc.). Excellent 麻婆豆腐 and 麻辣香锅
No comment

AHDJKFEHH so good would highly recommend. amazing food with good service. food so good i could cry, would recommend you to try the jasmine pudding it's MUAH *chefs kiss* would come back with friends 10/10
I like the duck in the restraint. It's amazing!!! The drink in here is good as well. I especially like the musics in this place by higher brother.
Love the beef scallion pancake. It's crispy and juicy, and highly recommend it. The Beijing Duck is very authentic.

This is def a MUST TRY place for all you foodies out there! First, the environment for this place is amazing! It's the type of place that you would go with your bestie/coworker/lovenes, for either a cup of tea or a full on meal. The food and drink here are delicious but NOT OILY AT ALL! The food that are marked as spicy are really spicy! For those of you who love spicy, it's going to be amazing for you but for those who love it but can't tolerate that much, it could be a little too much! If you come here, please do yourself a favor and order the fried pork bun! You will not regret it. Eat it while you drink a nice and beautiful cup of tea! I cannot begin to tell you how beautiful their tea cups and tea pots are. The tea here are so authentic, none of that bubble tea store stuff! And please do check out their bathroom as it is super nice, clean and comfortable! Hahahaha HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR ANYONE WHO IS ALIVE!

We came in on a Friday night, which was very crowded and kept us stuck in line for like an hour, but definitely worthy it! The food we ordered are Brown sugar glazed Peking duck (5 out of 5), eggplant in garlic sauce (4 out of 5, too spicy for us), wild pepper beef (5 out of 5), and Lobster Mayo Tofu(5 out of 5, tangy and tasty ). Basically it's hard to go wrong with anything on the menu, I would definitely come back in the future.
No comment

I would give a 5 for before pandemic uluh. It was my favorite Chinese restaurant in nyc. But right now, 3 only. Fatty beef in sour soup: very thick, over-cooked beef in salty soup. Pork trotter: very thick oil. (Terrible dish, especially when comparing with past ones). Vegetables: overcooked.

It's wayyyyy too overpriced for dim sum. Things like dumpling cost like $10 when you can normally get the same amount of small dumplings for $3-4. I can accept sumwhere middle range but that's too much for a dumpling. And a milk tea cost $10-13. That's seriously overpriced for something that doesn't taste supper good.
Excellent food and great atmosphere! Might be a bit of a wait to get in on Friday nights, but definitely worth it! Highly recommend mapo tofu and soup dumpling!

The food is okay but the waiting staff was horrible. They watch you to give the tip instead of helping to pack up the food. I'm willing to pay a proper tip but I really hate to be watched especially when the default tip shown is higher than I expected to give.
No comment

It seems that the most delicious dishes are all served as lunch specials (M - F 11:30am-5pm). We came on Sunday and asked for 6 dishes based on previous reviews and pictures but were told 5 of them were not available. The spicy pork feet we had was pretty good. However the restaurant seems to be understaffed and each dish takes 20-30 minutes of waiting time.
No comment
This is a really great restaurant in manhattan.The bear are extremely good.Worth coming.I order the boiled fish  chicken and lobester.Definitely will come next time.
Good as hell, good as hell!! Try it right now, recommend it for everyone, great restaurant come and try!!
Very delicious, and nice looking. Must try if you love Chinese food. Tofu and duck are their featured dishes, both are great
I've came to this place for several times. Their Peking duck and pig feet are so good! And I enjoyed having their dessert as well.
Excellent service and excellent food. Would definitely come again and recommend Uluh to everyone who loves Chinese food!
Great environment, very creative dishes and services here are amazing. Tasty and authentic Chinese food! Highly Recommend!
No comment
The deserts are pretty good! We ordered some cakes, ice cream and tea. They are yummy. Next time we will try their main dishes.

Really bad service. One of the waitresses was really rude. Been there 3 times didn't expect to be this disappointed. We ordered Peking duck and the pork trotters and everything was ok but waited so long for the trotters. I tried to ask the waitress to rush the order. She was saying she doesn't speak Chinese in a really bad attitude which I don't know here come from cuz we all spoke English all the time so what's the point??? And she told me no trotters today and I was like then you should've told me when taking the order?!??!!?? She's having really bad attitude. Never come to this restaurant again. Go ask your servers to be respectful like your customers are :( or you will never expect me coming back again.  3 stars for the food
This is probably the most authentic and delicious Chinese food in NYC. Expensive but definitely worth trying.
It's an amazing experience - great food, ambiance and service. I would recommend it for professional/business hangout. Well and also for those foodies, you wouldn't want to miss this place
Beautiful decor and interesting interior design. Dim sum and Peking duck are not conventional but still delicious. A great place for fate

Very happy with the experience...good tea with good food, actually very good food. The tea experience is classy, with decent selections and proper setup, though not as exotic as some tea rooms. When paired with the excellent food selections, and of generally excellent quality, this place is a winner. Very comfortable environment as well.

We order the brown sugar Peking duck and steamed sea bass. The duck is okay. BUT the fish has a weird fishy smell. And there's also a LOT of scales on the fish skin. The sea bass is just so terrible. I will give negative rating for it if I can.
Very cute, recommend pumpkin custard bun and stir fried fatty beef with cilantro, and vegetable dry pot. The milk tea was also very nice, and the milk foam is especially rich.
Their spicy fish is very spicy ,but enough to taste good. and their okia this dish is quite palatable! So I give them five stars.

Couldn't give less than 5 stars!! This place is so amazing. My friend suggested me to try this place because I am a big fan of desserts. To be honest, I haven't seen desserts menu like this before. Not even the taste is perfect but also the decoration is super marvelous. The best dessert place I would recommend.

I have the dinner with my friends! The food is super delicious and very tasty! I like all the dishes! It's very creative! The environment is fantastic. I think the dishes there tased very traditional. The waiters are nice too. The food came fast and we didn't wait for a long time.

A high end Chinese restaurant! From interior decorations to plate setting is well designed. We ordered rice noodles and appetizers. I have to say, the flavor is too complex, and deviates  from dishes original taste. We were a bit disappointed on that. By giving a four-star, I want to support more chinese restaurants who pays attention to details and makes efforts to the presentation. Also, it's a great place for the tea,lots of selection on tea!

Delicious food, delicious tea. Their brown sugar duck and black truffle dumplings are a must! Love their plates/bowls and serving dishes. The place is beautiful and super clean (reminds me of being at a restaurant in Tokyo).

Definitely the best Chinese restaurant ever in Manhattan. Peking roast duck is legit and remind me of the duck I tried in Beijing. The duck skin is just right, not too dry, not too greasy. It is a tip of heaven if you put the crispy duck skin with sugar. Definitely better than Decoy who claimed that they are expert on Peking Duck. Other dishes are also amazing and I encourage you to try everything on their menu. Drink and dessert are also thoughtful and delicious.

This is probably my favorite Chinese restaurant in NYC. The dishes are all very authentic, great service and really nice atmosphere. The decor is also terrific and a very nice change from the stereotypical chinese restaurant vibe. This is definitely getting added to my regular restaurant rotation.

This place is very chic and has amazing service. We ordered the brown sugar glazed roast duck noodles and it's the best thing I've ever placed in my mouth. The broth is smooth and perfectly seasoned. The sweet and sour ribs are out of this world. Would definitely recommend!
pretty good restaurant  ! Nice environment ! Will go againn

This is my new favorite restaurant for Chinese food. Great for friend gathering. Peking Duck is the best!!! Great atmosphere. Also Great for people who like spicy foods. The dishes are very good, definitely will come again!
Delicious and very authentic Sichuan food. Love the Peking Duck and spicy pig feet. Highly recommend
Really nice food. This place is a good choice to hang out with friends. It does not take reservations on weekend, so it is better to come early. Enjoyed it!
Best Chinese food ever. Highly recommend pricing duck. Very delicious . Highly recommend to try their dry pot.
This place is great. I like Beijing duck and tea.The environment is beautiful. The tea is very amazing
No comment
This place is great! Delicious desserts on their menu, and it's turned into a tradition to come here with a specific friend group.Highly recommend Spot

Don't know why it's so popular, waited for about half an hour. Ordered popular dishes like pig trotters, crab tofu. The taste is about average, but the portion is relatively small. anyway, it's just an average place, not really delicious...
The food was Okay, but the service there was horrible! I will never go there again. Terrible experience!!!

Love the spicy pig feet. Fried chicken wings are pretty good too. The atmosphere is very nice and ambient. Tea is a pleasant surprise. Service was great and appropriate amount. I would go back again for the food. Great for friends chatting or casual dates.

It's rare I give a Chinese restaurant 5 star since I'm Chinese and honestly 99% Chinese restaurants in NYC are not Chinese/delicious enough for me. This one is unique. Industrial and yet Chinese decorations. Attentive but well organized service. Beautiful and tasteful plates pots etc. but most importantly tasty and interesting food. Highly recommended pork leg, roasted duck, tea. Will go back to try more on their menu.
No comment

We came for a full dining experience. Every dish was absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. The service, the dedication of the staff, detail, and attention they gave me made this one of the best meals I've ever had. If you need an experience to top your last. I highly recommend going here.
This place is very nice and service is very good. Waitresses are very nice and have a good smile, food is also great. I really like duck and soup dumplings. I will come back again.

First , before going into the restaurant, the big "B" health score in front had been a warning sign. It showed that the restaurant had hygiene issues. Since I had come this long to get here, I just wanted to give a shot. A huge mistake! The food was so salty, almost inedible. The pork trotters was soaked in soy sauce, I couldn't taste any other flavor  except for the bitter soy sauce. It seemed like the pork trotters had been cooked long time ago and stayed in refrigerator for a while. It didn't taste fresh, "一股腥骚味". Also I didn't  think the quality of the meat was good either. The portion was generally small. The red bean soup came with so small cup, the taste was not right. It was supposed to use "Chen pi", instead they just threw orange peel inside, at the end it tasted weird.
Waited more than an hour! Yet just soso. Crab tofu has a bit smell, not recommended. Peking duck is better, yet different from that I had in Bian Yee Fang in Beijing.
Great meal, pig feet was tender and just the right amount of spice. The tofu goes very well with rice.
Food is very delicious and I like the decor here. The Peking duck is one of my favorite. If not considered the wait time, I will absolutely come more frequently.
The atmosphere is nice: dim lit, fun music and cheery crowd. Appetizers particularly are super nice... and lots of cool specialty teas on the menu.
Look no further for the best Chinese right in the heart of East Village. Place is awesome!
Very cozy upscale restaurant. Pecking duck is a must...very crispy skin. Service is good too.

This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in New York. Two dishes I would definitely recommend are Peking Duck and Beef and scallion pancake. The Peking Duck tastes even better than what I had in Beijing last summer. If you want to try Chinese cuisine, DEFINITELY try Uluh. It will impress you.
very good place to eat also the food it's yummy ,the best thing i like is the service its always good!
They changed the chief! Worst experience ever! This is my second time visiting this restaurant but the food tasted completely different. Won't come back again!
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Manhattan. The dishes are very creative and delicious. If you and your friends has no idea what to eat, I recommend this place.
Z XX- Best dim sum spot in town! Right down the road and always the best service!!! Love it here :)
Great food. Great ambiance. Horrible service. It took two hours to have 2 orders of dumplings, duck and noodle. Extremely unorganized. Wished they had better management.
The management is a disaster. They only have tables for two and if u are a party of 4, then the waiting time will be forever.
Had higher expectations since the pictures looks so good. Maybe it's better for afternoon tea (the have a good tea selection) and desserts . Dishes are ok but taste is on the heavier side.

We actually discovered this place by accident. It was a very cold day and  we were looking for another restaurant but I was so cold, I could not walk another block. So when I saw this restaurant, I just walked right in.  The restaurant has a nice decor and we were ushered to our table. We ordered the Peking duck, a hot and sour soup and soup dumplings. The Peking duck was the best dish. The duck was cooked and prepared perfectly and it came with a small dish of dipping sauces. My only complaints were the steamed buns that was supposed to be paired with the duck was not good. I love steamed buns but they didn't get the buns right. It was slightly sweet and it was chewy but it didn't compliment the duck. My hot and sour soup tasted overly sweet. I do believe that the chef mixed up the sugar and salt. The soup dumplings were tasty but the skin kept falling apart so the soup leaked out before you could sip it.  I would go back for the duck, the Peking duck is just as good as decoy's. If they could get the steamed buns right then it would be better than decoy's.

Tastes so good, ordered the sweet and sour ribs and mini deep fried tofu with 7 spices, and the tofu is so delicious. Also it's great that the menu category is so clear to know what you want. 5 stars!

Very disappointed with this place, not because of its food but because of its service. Come on, can't you make your service match up with the food and the interior decorations? I came here with my friend for a dinner on a Friday night. Earlier in the day, I called and wanted to make a reservation but this place does not take same day reservation. So I came here a bit passed 6 pm. There were only two groups of people ahead of us, but it took us more than 45 minutes to get a table. This is insane. This place is definitely very short of waiters and waitresses, like the owner is trying so hard to save money on waiters and waitresses. Also, after we sat down, I asked for a cup of hot water but the waitress totally forgot it and brought me cold water.  For some reasons, it took forever for us to get our veggie. Getting the waitresses' attention is difficult! OMG, I was having disappointment after disappointment.  This place needs to work on improving its service and hire more staff. Before tonight's dinner, I was considering to bring my husband here for his upcoming birthday. But after tonight's bad experience, it totally change my mind! Seriously, you are in New York City, where there are many other places that offer both good food and good service as well as good ambience.

The restaurant's policy is very unacceptable. They don't take any reservation, and their phone number listed is wrong. Waited in-line for one hour and you only have 40min to eat even though you have a group of 6. One suggestion for those who want to try: come only when there are a lot of empty spots.
The food is average and we found a weird plastic strip in our food...the most ridiculous thing is that they gave us dessert before our main course...
Seems to be a popular Chinese restaurant. The food is mostly hot and spicy but delicious. The place is a bit pricy but it worths having a try.
This place is great. Great vibes and good food. The decor was on point. Would definitely come back here again.

Me and my friend went in with a cup of coffee in my hand, we sat down and ordered over $100 worth of food. Then the waitress came over my table and took my coffee away and told me no outside food was allowed. She said she would give it back to me after we eat and she never did. Sooo rude and doesn't make any sense because I saw another table came in with a bottle of water and they never took it away. No comments on the food and will Never go back again.
I've never ever had such sauerkraut Peking duck, all dishes were too salute and overpriced. I shall never come back again.

The ambience was fantastic - came here with some friends and we had a great time. Food is spectacular, love the vegetarian dry pot. Careful if you can't handle spice- make sure you let them know your tolerance!

An amazing restaurant. Great vibe with entertaining music. The service is better than anywhere and I will 100% be back. The eggplant w/ pickled chili is one of the best appetizers. I would recommend the black truffle fried rice for the entree. Any of their drinks are amazing as well.
The jasmine pudding is a must try - absolutely the best dessert I've had in this city. Love the trotters too! Also I hope they have more than one restroom... the line was pretty long.
As good as I had last time! We ordered beef soup, fired pork, crab tofu, and pork feet, all are great!
Among the better dim sum that I have had! Our group of four loved everything! Very friendly! Outstanding atmosphere! Possibly best tea ever! Will definitely be back many times!
nice place， and the tea there is very good.  food is not expensive. But, customers were talking too loudly.

Accidentally found this place, didn't expect much but the food was surprisingly good! I personally love the lotus dessert, pork chop bun and the pig trotter rice noodle! The pig trotter was the best I've ever had in NYC. The lion head was just ok, nothing too special.
Had their pan fried pork dumplings, Peking duck and hunan chicken. The Peking duck was above average and affordable. Would come back for the Peking duck :)
Really good! Best dim sum I've had in awhile. High quality and the restaurant ambience is fantastic for a date night. I suggest the pork soup dumplings. Will be back again.

This is the top notch tea house, the place is very relax and spacious, good for gatherings. There are different varieties of teas you can pick, if you are tea lover, you must go to Uluh. The food and deserts are extraordinary. I will definitely come back again with my friends.
we got the scalllion pancakes and peking duck -  they were both amazing! scallion pancake was crispy and flaky. peking duck was very moist, crispy skin, very thin wraps and great veggies and sauce
very tasty! huge table which is rare in nyc. authentic Chinese. modern touch. waited an hour. very long line and crowded waitong area.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The manhattan location is always busy but this location was walk in ready. Host and waitress were all really great and the non alcoholic drink that I got was really well mixed. The ramen - the usual you can't go wrong with it! It's a bit small but doesn't matter bc it's good. Matcha lemonade is a tad too sour for me but the pomegranate raspberry orange drink I got was perfect!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Fantastic addition to the Williamsburg area! Make sure to make a reservation in advance. I stopped by here a month ago with some friends and had a really great time! Had a couple of items oysters, ramen and more. Split a bottle of orange wine, a great choice by the server. The staff was hospitable and friendly. Definitely worth checking out!

This feels like a slightly upscale tonchin compared to the one in Manhattan, the courses are small but amazing. Great for a date if you feel like spending over 100 on a meal. I would not skip on the chicken wing, it was the best and also most expensive single wing I've ever had. Worth it? Maybe if you just got paid.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Been here a few times and is a good place for ramen! Their classic tonkotsu ramen is done well, but other noodles such as the tan tan ramen are worth a try too. Would definitely recommend getting the banana pudding and trying the kakigori. The banana pudding was not too sweet and very light, and loved the addition of cream for kakigori with very sweet fruits.

Just as amazing as the original Tonchin in Midtown! Really pleasant quiet space with the best vegan ramen around. Also loved the cucumber salad. Their dessert menu looks great too - have to try the soba panna cotta next time.
No comment
No comment

I came here on a Friday night per a friend's recommendation. Our reservation was at 7:00 PM and the restaurant was busy, but not overwhelmingly so. We all ordered the tonkatsu ramen and two of us asked for their spicy sauce on the side. A little bit of the spicy sauce goes a long way and I liked the soup as is and with a bit of a kick. The portion was very filling and you can tell they start out with a very good ramen broth base. We ordered a bottle of wine to share as they have a pretty extensive wine list. There weren't a lot of options to purchase wine by the glass and when I asked if they had a full bar the waitress just listed off a few liquors they had. If you're in the mood to drink cocktails maybe check out one of the other places nearby before coming here.

Had no prior reservation, so we waited close to an hour and a half in the cold winter temperatures for seats at the bar. But the wait was so worth it because we got the best ramen we have ever eaten! I have eaten great and authentic Japanese restaurants before, coming from Asia, but Tonchin beats it all. The best part about it is you don't have to pay an arm and a leg to enjoy this great tasting michelin starred ramen.

Ginger miso ramen and the cucumber salad was very good. Weird drink situation, though: they call themselves a wine place on their website and have probably hundreds of wines available by the bottle, but only two by the glass and no white wine. They also only have one cocktail on the menu.

Came here with a friend with no reservation at 6pm on a Wednesday. We were seated a high top up front. Within the hour this place filled up like mad! It definitely had more of a lounge vibe than some of the more traditional ramen spots. My vegan miso ramen was very flavorful, full of all the fixings and all in all delicious. We got the shitake appetizer from the bites, which came with big pieces of toasted bread. But the appetizer was basically hummus with 3 pieces of charred shitakes up top. It was a totally bizarre dish tbh. It ate Mediterranean in flavor, and was way too heavy on bread before consuming ramen. Happy I tried a new spot, but I'll be returning to the more traditional ramen spots around the neighborhood instead.

It took 90 mins to get our ramen. Not acceptable. We got there at 8:00 p.m, ordered food at 8:15 p.m. Didn't get our ramen until 9:40. We ordered five appetizers, which should've come out together or one after the other, instead, they came every 15 mins or 30 mins. After the appetizers we waited a solid 40 mins for the ramen. I have never waited for ramen this long. The appetizers were amazing but ramen was nothing out of the ordinary. Go elsewhere, not worth your $$$. Also we didn't get anything comped for waiting so long for our food.
No comment
No comment

Best ramen I've had in NYC thus far! Smoked dashi ramen was so flavorful but not too oily, greasy, or excessively rich. Also loved that there was an attention to diversifying toppings rather than opting for little to predictable toppings. Would definitely come again-- especially since the staff was so sweet and the space was so beautiful.

Really dank ramen. We also shared the chicken wings which were cooked perfectly and had a small spice kick to them - really great flavor. I had the vegan miso ginger ramen- the noodles and broth were so yummy. I'll definitely be back here soon.
No comment
The fried fingerling potatoes were crazy good. And I would go back definitely for the smoked dashi ramen, incredible dark rich umami flavor.
No comment

Stellar meal! Everything we had was outstanding. The chicken wings are a must order as is the hummus (yes hummus at a ramen restaurant sounds weird but it's so good!). I had the classic ramen, and it was awesome. Service was attentive and friendly. The restaurant space itself was beautiful, it wasn't too loud and tables aren't crowded together.

Tonchin probably has the best ramen I've tried in NYC. I ordered the dashi ramen and finished the entire bowl. The broth is packed with flavor and the scallops were so tasty. For dessert I had the soba panna cotta - big fan. It was a lovely combination of flavors and textures between the cream, honey, olive oil, and toasted bits on top. Very nice waitstaff as well!

I was super excited to try this restaurant, but management needs to fix a lot of the operational issues here. We arrived at 8 for our reservation, we were seated at 8:30. We then ordered appetizers and our food, those took 30 minutes and the entrees took another 30 minutes. The appetizers were tiny and not that great. The ramen was somewhat better, but was extremely salty. Everyone seemed annoyed that we were asking when our table would be ready and when we checked on the food. Something is off here. I would not recommend going until some of these issues are fixed.
No comment
No comment

I'm not vegan but definitely recommend their vegan ramen. They have a nice selection of wine and my friends really liked their mocktails.  Must try their spicy chicken wings and end the meal with their matcha shaved ice.
New and amazing restaurant, one of the best places in Williamsburg. Really enjoyed everything
The Somalia here is fantastic. I think their name is Raquel? Served me all the perfect wines. Had the best experience. All delicious foods.

One of the best meals I can remember.  We had the original salad, the shiitake spread, the potato, the wagyu yakitori, the tebasaki wing, and then we split the classic tonchin ramen and the spicy tan tan ramen.  Everything was amazing.  However, the real heroes of the night were the tebasaki wing and the classic ramen.  Fried to perfection, the chicken wing exploded with flavor and was easily the best appetizer anywhere in Brooklyn.  The classic ramen broth is a thing of beauty.  We could eat that ramen seven days a week.  Fantastic meal and wonderful dining experience!

More like 3.5 stars, but they just opened and are working out kinks. We tried a bunch of shared plates and each got a bowl of ramen.  The plates (shitake spread, chicken skewer, and salad) were all good  and generous enough in size and price for these times. I really didn't enjoy my smoked dashi ramen. The smoked flavor was overpowering and unpleasant after a few spoonfuls. My spouse liked their tonkatsu.  The space was sleek and cool, with a young bratty crowd that was half fun, half irritating to watch from a distance. Staff was generally super sweet and attentive, except for the unwelcoming and aloof gentleman greeting (or not) customers at the door. He set a bad initial tone for a very gracious spot.

The restaurant has a casual, cool vibe and the fried chicken and miso ginger ramen were both good. Although we didn't order it, our waiter also brought us the kyuri (which was good), and then charged us for it. I've never had a waiter charge me for a course that I didn't order/ask for. Their ramen is fine, however, I'll never go back due to the sleazy way our waiter tried to get us to spend more money and would warn others to not fall into this trap.
The food was good but the portions were tiny for the price. The food didn't look very appetizing but the flavor was good. I'd order again but would double my order of pork and string beans
No comment

The food here is DELICIOUS!!!! The food has always been fresh and tasty! However, it might take a little extra effort to make and changes and/confirm your order because of the food being so AUTHENTIC...it is a language barrier. The staff was sweet and patient. Although we could hear someone yelling in the kitchen every now & then.. All we were greeted with were smiles!  enjoy the meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were a party of 3 and it was super quiet on a Sunday. We ordered the Shanghai soup dumplings and the pan fried shanghai soup dumplings. I'm used to getting 6 or 8 in a portion so it was strange to me that it was only 4 for a portion. The pan fried soup dumplings were something I never tried before, so my group was excited to order it. The bottom was crispy, but the filling was unfortunately lukewarm at best and the dough was thicker than one would expect for Shanghai dumplings. The steamed soup dumplings were hot and flavorful, but again the dumpling exterior was more doughy and not the expected light and thin exterior so that threw me off.
Not authentic Chinese. Food was so bland. The dumpling had raw meat. Overall wasn't what I expected at all. Don't understand the reviews here.

Yesterday evening my husband and I decided to come here for dinner and drinks. We chose this place since we were in the area. We wanted to try a new restaurant that wasn't too busy. When we walked in, there were about 3 or 4 small groups dining. The other half of the restaurant was empty, and that's where we were asked to sit. One of the female employees immediately handed us our menus and served us water. The other female employee was taking table orders and chatting with customers. After about 5 minutes, we were ready to order. We waited and waited, and waited some more. We looked around, made eye contact with both employees, but no one ever came over. After a few minutes, the employee who had served us water approached our table only to refill our glasses and walk away. We decided to give the staff additional time so I went to the restroom in the meantime. When I came back, I learned that the server still had not come to our table. We had waited a total of 25 MINUTES before deciding to leave. In addition to service being is terrible, the restroom smelled very filthy. This lack of cleanliness was definitely the deal breaker. That's when we decided that we needed to leave. All of this was a definite sign that we were not meant to eat there. Having two customers wait that amount of time shows how inconsiderate and unfriendly the staff can be towards their customers. Don't come here. There are better places with better service in the area.

Wow at this price it's pretty good. Only downside is that chicken was kinda soggy. I'm not gonna call it diarrhea chicken like the other restaurant I went to cuz the flavor was just right. Added additional star cuz it had healthy balance of broccoli

We made a reservation and they didn't honor it. Showed up on time and they gave out table away. 30 minutes later and still haven't sat down. I'll let you know if I ever get a table! Pray for me! Go to Chinatown for this instead, many more restaurants and they honor reservations and save tables
Good food, tasty and affordable. Portions are generous. Not a fancy or trendy place, but clean and cozy. I would go back!

Recommended by a local when I asked for somewhere yummy to eat. We went at prime dinner time and was still able to get a seat no problem. The food took a little bit to get to us but it was delicious and my bf and I both agreed we would eat here again if we were in NY!
It took them forever to finish a takeout. Not to mention I preordered already.... I waited for more than 25 minutes to get my lunch. How on earth is this possible?
No comment
I ordered an take out on Jan 12, 2022. The service guy mistype my order, and refuse to do anything to fix it. Never come back again!
No comment
Really great little spot by Washington square park. Xiao long bao (both steamed and pan fried) are flavorful - more so than your standard. Noodles with pork were good too. Would definitely go back!

It might be the specific day, it might be just me, but the food here just isn't meeting the expectations of an established West Village Chinese restaurant. The sauce on the ribs were a little off, the soup dumplings were nothing special, the scallion pancakes were meh, and the noodle dishes weren't up to par.

We randomly stopped in here one Sunday afternoon after seeing a sign advertising their pork xiao long bao (pork soup dumplings), which is a treat I can rarely pass up. Of course we ordered a few sets of the dumplings along with the Shanghai salted meat with vegetable rice and the dry-fried green beans with pork. We later ordered the crab soup dumplings just because we could! Each dish was delicious. Next time I plan to try the other signature dishes. I have a feeling you can't go wrong ordering from here and this is your chance to get a taste of cuisine from the Jiangnan region of China (the menu mentions several cities in the region including Shanghai and Wuxi). They offer other more well-known dishes like kung pao chicken and orange beef, which I'm sure are very tasty, but I think before I went for those I'd like to try the Wuxi Pork Ribs and the West Lake Fish. The place had a relaxed, casual feel and seemed to welcome people there for any occasion. We saw a couple groups of four to six people and a few couples.

I don't recommend. Waited for 30 minutes for my take out order, they told me after 30 minutes they could not make it and I had to cancel through the ordering app. I asked if we could come back later to pick it up? No, they can't make it. When I asked why didn't you cancel it before, they said they can't do it on their app. So don't waste your time, they can't handle a 2 person order at peak time...

Cute little gem with simple but well executed eats. Cozy atmosphere and attentive staff. Easy to walk by and get and indoor or patio table. The spring noodle soup and ribs were standouts. The spring noodle soup had a delicious mushroomy broth and amazing noodles. The ribs had fall of the bone meat in delicious sauce. Would come back here in a heartbeat.

Ok despite spending an inordinate amount of time asking for the soup to not have bacon  it arrives a very long time after( not the promised 15 minutes)  replete with BACON.  The shrimp cooked in their shell were so small that it was ludicrous to try to peel them    Topped this off with some of the worst peanut noodles in nyc.  The dumplings were great but not enough to ever have me deal with this restaurant again
Low price Taste very Chinese Very good China  South food I will come AgainBeef Noodle Soup
Bad service. The owner (lady) was so mean for no reason. Ordered to go and asked for chopsticks and she seemed so annoyed by that
Simple Chinese food. Good noodles, fast service, what's not to like? Would recommend others here.

Zero integrity as a business, canceled my order at the time it is supposed to be delivered and tell me they are closing the kitchen in one hour?? Seriously? You can't cancel an order when it is placed?????

AMAZING FOOD!!!! There's something for everyone. The decoration is so chic and updated. You would not believe how affordable this place is. Beef noodle soup was my favorite and the soup has been cooking for hours. 10/10 would take my family here!

Tipsy Shanghai is the New York sibling of a restaurant in Shanghai that was started in 1905. So with that history you would expect amazing flavors and unique Shanghai dishes. Unfortunately, the food at Tipsy Shanghai can only be described as bland and some of their menu items are more American Chinese (shrimp with lobster sauce, sweet & sour chicken, etc) than truly Chinese. The restaurant itself is very nice and the service is good, but the food is simply bland. We were hoping for something special and left being disappointed.

A few friends have recommended this place to us, and we finally decided to order a delivery for dinner tonight. However it was actually a disappointment. The noodles taste ok but we waited one and half hour for the delivery(which is also annoying), so as you can imagine, all noodles stick together and became a soggy pancake. The ribs and zongzi are both very disappointing. Sour taste. Feels like they are spoiled. Our favorite is the sweet sticky rice. It has the right amount of sugar and well balanced with red bean paste. Everything with the sticky rice is just good, opposite of the other dishes unfortunately.

They do make authentic shanghainese dishes but it is going to be on the salty side so beware. I like some of their dishes such as marinated bean curd and tofu but others such as their XLB and beef noodle soup to be underwhelming.

After my first time here I can say the food was indeed quite delicious and that's alone did it for me. The service however was honestly really not that great and i like to think I'm a patient person who's worked in the industry. Upon arrival there was only one woman working the whole restaurant and other than my party of two was a table of 4, 2 and another 2. We were seated at 6:30 and didn't receive even our drinks until 7:48! We asked for two beers and two glasses of water and only got the beers, the food took over about to come out and it all come out at once, delivery orders were going out before the tables were taken care of and other tables were being served before us despite ordering after. I would come back for the food 100% I just have to make sure I don't have plans closely after dinner.

Came here for the pulsd deal. Sooo good!!! Their ribs are some of the best I've ever had, and a great value for the money. Interior is really trendy too!

The dishes are tasteless, the service was not good. Our server talked too fast, and she is defensive. I was born in Shanghai, this food does not represent Shanghai cuisine.

While spending the cold afternoon in the village, I was heavily craving spicy noodles or soup, and Tipsy Shanghai appeared to be the right restaurant to satisfy my craving. I'm so happy I found this restaurant, and will definitely visit it again the next time I'm con the area! The only unfortunate drawback is the minimal options for vegetarian and vegan diets. Nevertheless, our server was very helpful and the kitchen altered a couple of items into vegetarian dishes. The stir fry green beans are absolutely fantastic and spicy, with that "kissed by the wok" flavor essential to this dish. Plenty of outdoor seating, very clean, and 100% in accordance to Covid regulations.

Came here with a friend for dinner because we were craving for Shanghainese food and many online reviews told us Tipsy Shanghai is one of the best in the area. But aside from an interesting retro decor, good service and having many authentic items, the food tasted very bland and lacked any serious flavor. Both the pan fried xiaolongbao and the shredded bean curds (tasted pre-frozen?) in chicken and shrimp broth didn't really hit home for me and were very unimpressive. The pork ribs were just okay because many of them are the tough, dry pieces of meat not attached to the rib bones. The presentation of each dish, however, made them slightly more appealing but the taste is very average for Shanghainese food.

I ordered to-go and picked up once. The restaurant looked clean and has a lot of spaces. They packed their food pretty well, and the food was amazing. I ordered beef noodle soup, xiaolong bao, osmanthus salted duck, pan-fried dumplings and xiaolong bao with crab meat. They also gave us a free desert. I am not a big fan with the crab one, but I love all other food. Their bao are so juicy and flavorful. The staff was friendly too. I will def come back!! Highly recommend!!
Good Chinese food in the heart Greenwich, definitely satisfies the cravings! Recommend the  boiled shredded dry bean curd, very umami.

The food here tastes good and I like it very much. I like the drunk chicken here. The taste is very similar to the local ones in China. And then there's the shrimp, which is just so delicious that you can almost eat it with the shell. And pickled cabbage fish. It's delicious. This is my second visit. I'll be back again.
Authentic Zhejiang/Shanghai food! It's really a good place to dine in if you are craving for home food, or just wanna try some real Chinese food. Easy location, friendly staff and great environment

Came here with my girlfriend and another couple on a Friday night.  Food was just fine for authentic Shanghai cuisine.  The vegetable dishes were pretty good but when it came to the meat dishes we were a little disappointed.  All in all probably won't return.

Came here for quick dinner with friends, and we enjoyed the food very much. We especially liked the General Tso's chicken.
Great vibe and super friendly service! Highly recommend the Wuxi ribs! The pan fried buns are very juicy but a bit on the sweeter side. Overall a solid Shanghainese restaurant!
