Best orange beef on the planet, hands down! Over a year and a half later, I still dream of this meal.

Very authentic Shanghainese restaurant near school. They have a great lunch special where it's $12.95 for a noodle soup, xiao long bao, and your choice of a beverage. They have delicious xiao long bao where the skin is very thin and there is a lot of soup. The interior design is a good combination of modern and traditional and all the food is quite aesthetic and well-seasoned.

Overall very solid dinner choice. Came at around 6pm on a Sunday night and the restaurant was full but there was no wait line to get a seat. I love the interior decor with old photos and auspicious red colors. The xiaolongbao was soooooo yummy, and you could see how freshly steamed and made it was. The signature dish, Wuxi pork ribs was good and the meat was so tender it fell off the bone, but the only downside was that it was not completely flavorful throughout the entire piece. The string beans were cooked to perfection just the way I like it. But the main star would definitely be the beef noodle soup. The beef was so tender and the soup was light and broth and the noodles were chewy but soft. Portions are just right, but not huge, so we ordered 4 dishes for 2 people which was just right, and we finished everything. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!
The soup dumplings are really authentic from Wuxi area which a little bit on the sweet side. Only pork option. Strongly recommend the fried soup dumplings! 10% off if you pay cash

The moment I step into the restaurant, I was attracted by the oriental decoration, which is tastefully designed. Food is amazing! We had their signature dishes Wuxi Pork Ribs,  Pan Fried Pork Bao, smoked fish noodle. Yummy! The best in the village!
No comment

The food here is pretty gross. I ordered via Uber Eats and ordered the pan fried pork xiao long Bao, the spicy roast beef, and sweet and sour chicken. The spicy roast beef had absolutely no flavor and the sweet and sour chicken was undercooked (I bit into raw chicken). The best dish was easily the pan friend pork xiao long bao, but it wasn't good enough to make up for the failings of the other dishes. Perhaps it's better if you go to the restaurant but I'm not too confident...

Really love this place! I grew up in Wuxi and have been craving for my hometown food for a long time, and I have found THE spot in NYC! Every dish here reminds me of what I used to eat growing up. I came here for my birthday with my friends, and was welcomed by Chef Liu, who gave me a discount and personally prepared birthday noodles for me, which warmed my heart. In addition, the signature dishes such as Wuxi Xiao Long Bao and Wuxi style ribs are so authentic, the most authentic you will ever find in NYC. The ambiance is so cozy and intimate. I will be back!!
Recommend by a friends and it is very authentic! Definitely recommend the Wuxi braised pork;)

I caught up with a friend over lunch at Tipsy Shanghai. The lunch menu allows diners to add a half order of an appetizer and comes with a drink. Very convenient. Food was good and filling. I rarely have noodle soup with fish, but enjoyed the aozao noodles. Service was nice and courteous but not very attentive. It took a while for the staff to bring check, to pick up payment, and to return with CC receipt. Great if you want to stay and chat, but not those with tight lunches.
2nd star cuz the food kinda hit, but micro aggressive as fuck... like the staff def treated us a certain way (point being, if you Black maybe hit up the Go Go Curry across the street)

Very good authentic Shanghainese food. The waitresses are super nice. Strongly recommend Wuxi pork ribs, pan fried pork bao, lion heads in brown sauce, sliced fish in wine sauce, shredded dry bean curd. All tasty!
The food is delicious, waitress are very friendly. I like the Wuxi pork rib and Xihu beef soup! If you add a little bit white pepper, that'd be perfect!
Good, traditional shanghainese food. Got the soup dumplings, shrimp with crab meat and ribs. So delicious!

The Tipsy Shanghai is truly a joyful surprise! I grew up eating Wuxi pork ribs. It reminds me about my hometown. The rib is very tender and juicy. Steamed pork xiaolongbao and its pan fried version are both delicious. Also very impressed by the beautiful deco inside. Tks for bringing a nice authentic Chinese restaurant in West Village!
Very authentic Chinese comfort food from the south!!! Every time I come I would order different dishes and they are all so delicious....reminding me of the good food in childhood in China.

Service is good and fast. Very authentic taste! We had a good time indoor dining here Saturday night!

I have to come here at least 1-2 times a week. addicted to the food. And, The staff and boss there are soooooooo nice.
The best place to have a Hangzhou style meal. Authentic Hangzhou food. Fulfilled my expectations.

One of the best and non pretentious Chinese food in Manhattan. Founded in 1905, everything was delicious. The hot and sour soup, the dumplings. Exquisite, really good. Hidden jewel. A great surprise in the area.
We're regulars here and really love every item on the menu. Really nice Chinese style restaurant in the backyard of NYU. Our favorites are the drunken chicken and zha jiang noodles.
Good Shanghai food.  Note that like tapas, you can spend a lot if you are hungry, but reasonable for those with more modest appetites.

Service is awful. They can't be bothered, seriously!!  Soup dumplings had a sweetness to them not a fan. Food is mediocre   General Tso chicken was okay. The cold duck appetizer was okay.  Best dish we had was the cold noodles. Disappointment.

This restaurant offers various unique Shanghai style dishes. I enjoyed their spring noodles, marinated  bran dough with peanut. Most of their food are unique and disqinshed from typical Chinese food in US.  I am satisfied with their food.

Ok, this is the last time I will dine here. I already give this restaurant many chances. (Current location and previous location). The food quality and the service is just below average. Some dishes look authentic on the menu but in reality it's just not flavorful with smaller portions. By the way, they are so lazy, they tried to get people use Chinese WeChat to order food. Come on.

shredded pork with garlic source is the worst so far. Never order, not worth it. It's such small portion and it is so messy packaged. It tasted so fish which means they probably didn't wash the pan in between cooking different dishes. Omg, sucks.

We wanted to like this place, and it was nice to be out for dinner, but the food really wasn't good enough. It was a pleasant street to sit on and we enjoyed our evening out, but the dumplings were not very good, and the only thing we ate that really was good was the shredded pork with garlic sauce.
The food here is very authentic. The environment is comfy and cozy, nice place if you want to hang out with friends, chat and maybe discuss things.
The food tastes very good. Very nice lunch place. It's very close to NYU and is very quite. The membership card gives 10% off, great.
Food is tasty, service is extraordinary nice! Would recommend going here for a bit of taste of a real Chinese food
I came tipsy Shanghai with my friends for dinner. The server is really friendly, the Shanghai food is authentic, it's taste like home. I think Xiao long Bao is the best dish here.

Very good restaurant and good food. We ordered the bao, cabbage and stirred fired rice. Tho it is kind of hard to find the location. It is located in the basement and it is a bright and clean place to go on weekends.

Have been coming to Tipsy Shanghai since their opening. Probably most authentic Shanghainese and Hangzhou food in the village. Delicious, hearty and always remind me of home cooking. Staff doing their very best to offer the best service during COVID.
Food was okay, not the best in NYC area but good enough if you want to have some food not too american style.

Looking forward to a Chinese restaurant specializing in cusine from Jiangsu for a long long time...Delicious cusine from my hometown! Especially fried rice....taste exactly same as i had in my home town.
Pretty average to be honest small portion reasonable prices   not many plp but i like the music they are playing
I'm very impressed with how authentic their dish is. I've came here for 4 times and the food still amazed me. I especially recommend their fried.
This is the most authentic Chinese restaurant I have  had in NYC so far. Literally any dish I ordered saitisfied my picky flavor. I will definitely come back again.
This restaurant serves very authentic shanghainese food. As an international student, it satisfies my cravings.
Really nice place and Shanghai atmosphere. I ordered sweet and sour ribs, assorted gluten, fried green beans and pan fried xiaolongbao（小杨生煎）. And I highly recommend the fried xiaolongbao.

The restaurant offers very authentic Shanghai food at a reasonable price. I like the fried rice with sautéed meat and Yanduxian. Definitely will recommend to my friends.
Very authentic shanghai food. Decent dining environment and friendly staff. I dined in this time but their delivery is really good as well.

One of my go-to Chinese eateries in the town, reasonable cost with great nourishment. Normally the hold up isn't excessively long and the administration is neighborly. Suggest for an easygoing lunch or supper

TS offers the best pan-fried pork buns in the city - though not exactly the same as the ones in Shanghai, it is way better than China Blue, Shanghai Heping Restaurant which only serve fakers. I have to admit that not every course here is perfect, but the style is typical shanghai. All the mains - buns, fried rice, noodles are strongly recommended! Ribs are fine but I have reservation regarding veggie courses.

Came in on a Thursday night around 6:30pm and it was PACKED, but luckily we were able to get seats. Right off the bat, the place looked really cool. It was colorful and bright and the design felt thoughtful and appropriate for the cuisine. The menu was a bit of a mess to navigate, but we found the dishes we wanted. We got soup dumplings, salted duck, pork rib soup with radish, bok choy with tofu skin and osmanthus flower with rice ball dessert. The price of the food is way more than I would normally pay at a restaurant in Chinatown, but the flavor and service at the restaurant made up for it. The soup dumplings were hot and juicy and had a hint of sweetness to the soup. The duck was clean and easy to eat, minimal mess with the bones. The rib soup was just like how mom makes it, so extra points there and the bok choy with tofu skin was fresh and clean too. Our waitresses were also on top of the water, warm lemon water, perfect for the cold day outside. We finished it off with the rice ball soup which was slightly sweet and very warm, a very refreshing dessert. It was a good experience, definitely a good date spot, but personally not the kind of restaurant I would visit regularly.

Came back tonight with my friends for party of 6. We ordered Wuxi rips, Xiaolong Bao, Pan fried soup dumplings, boiled green vegetables, dry-fried green beans, salted meat and vegetable rice, famous assorted soup, and a desert with alcohol! We were so full and satisfied! Best dinner party ever! Wish they had more dessert options (owner said dessert menu was not completely ready at the moment). Average price per dish was under $10! The boiled green vegetable was recommended by the waitress. They used chicken broth with Ceder nuts. It was so delicious and a delightful surprise. The Wuxi Rips and Xiaolong Bao were as great as the first time. We were fighting for the rips! Will come back with more friends when school starts.
The place is fantastic. Very traditional Shanghai food vs. everywhere else only serving Sichuan food... they have outdoor seating which feels safe. Friendly staff

Very authentic Shanghai cuisine, not expensive but have good decorations and flavors. Would recommend to people who are interested in authentic Shanghai food. Their Wax Ribs are absolutely the must-try.

It's a nice little restaurant. Service was better than average Chinese restaurant. As for the food, it's just average for someone who are from Shanghai or surrounding regions, but it is better than average Shanghai restaurants in US. We had the crabmeat soup dumpling. The fillings were ok but the covers were too thick. The wu xi pork rib was not sweet enough. And the soup in the ao zao soup noodle lack in flavor.

I don't normally leave reviews on Yelp, but when we found this place to have no wait, we decided we would try it. I lived in Taiwan for two years (non-consecutively) so I'm a picky person when it come to Xiao Long Bao. I was honestly blown away by the flavor of the steamed XLB. Yes, I suppose it might be a bit sweeter than others' but the flavor of the soup in these dumplings is bar none. I enjoyed them so much I ordered a second batch. Absolutely delicious, and I will be coming here for all my XLB in NYC for the future!!!

My boyfriend, two friends, and I came here for a nice traditional Christmas meal, and we were astounded by the high quality of the food. My favorite was the delectable, sweet, and savory Wuxi pork. I also loved the juicy soup dumplings, and I even tried a sour fish soup with pickles that turned out to be excellent. The service was good, too. Overall, we had a great time!! Merry Christmas!
No comment
No comment

The Wuxi and Shanghai food here are so authentic and delicious. As a girl whose hometown is in Jiangsu province, this place really amazed me. Recommend: Drunken chicken Suzhou, west lake fish, Sauté shelled shrimps.

The food was really good here! Delicious ribs, soup dumplings and general tsos chicken. Attentive & friendly service, nice atmosphere and decently priced. This is during the soft opening so I can imagine it will only get better from here!
Best and most authentic Chinese food from Zhejiang/Jiangsu region love the place so much that brings me back to my hometown
Loved eating here today. Clean, excellent tasting food. Only issue is not too much pork free items. Would otherwise come back.

Tipsy Shanghai is an authentic Chinese restaurant. It is a cliché that an indication of a Chinese restaurant's authenticity is the proportion of Asian patrons. This restaurant is popular with Chinese customers. The cuisine and service are excellent; prices are moderate. The music is pleasant and at a low volume (important factors for me). I particularly recommend the "signature dishes," such as the steamed dumpling appetizer, which are called Steamed Pork Xiaolongbao, and the Wuxi Pork Ribs entree. The wait staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. I highly recommend Tipsy Shanghai.

One of the best experiences I have had for Chinese food in the city. The restaurant was clean and the decor was beautiful, and the food traditional with a modern twist--exactly what I was looking for. I highly recommend the orange beef, garlic eggplant, and fried rice. The waiters were also great and very accommodating....all in all, a must-go for Chinese food in NY!
Love this place!!! My friend is a regular here and he loves this place so much. Love their spare ribs and soup dumplings. Definitely get these.
The food is four stars, above average. The pricing is okay for what they serve. Would be better if the staff would be more professional.
This is the best 江浙菜 in Manhattan! I really love it and am glad to find this spot so that I don't have to go to Flushing for good food!

Tipsy Shanghai is one of my defacto places for Chinese food in the Village. They have a large selection of Chinese soups (with the pork and daikon soup being my favorite). They also excel at less healthy options, including General Tso's chicken (deliciously crispy) and fried, meaty dumplings (which I prefer over their oddly sweet xiao long baos).

So freaking good. In terms of authentic Chinese food in Manhattan, I'd say this place is definitely top 10. They've put a ton of thought into both the decor and menu, making this restaurant and its offering easily accessible by all. There was another location in FiDi but this location just recently opened up and I highly recommend it.

My friend and I ordered beef noodles, pan fried buns, and wonton soup. They are all so delicious. They use thin noodles for the beef noodles, and the noodles have a great texture: not too soft and they stay chewy for the entire course of the meal. The pan fried buns are the best! The meat inside is so juicy and delicious. The soup for the wonton soup is chicken broth, which has great flavor. Overall, a great experience!
The food taste really delicious. The service is really nice. Waitress Jimmy is really nice and friendly

Very authentic Shanghainese cuisine. Service is attentive and welcoming and food is top-notch. Not a fan of how sweet the soup dumpling is but everything else make up for it. Get the Wuxi Pork Rib, it's sooo good! Have been coming back at least a handful of times since I discovered this little gem so close to WSP and will definitely be coming back more.

The food here is delicious. I first came here couple days ago for a beef stew noodle and a Pan Fried Xiaolongbao, they were absolutely amazing. The Pan fried Xiaolongbao was savory and juicy every bite. And now I brought my friends back here again, and enjoyed it once again. I would definitely recommend this place.

This restaurant has some of the best dumplings I've ever had. The soup dumplings were to die for, and their signature Wuxi ribs were fantastic too! I definitely recommend this restaurant, they have a friendly staff and comfortable ambiance.

Probably the best shanghainese place in New York. Can't really go wrong with anything here...try their Wuxi rib, soup dumplings, bok choy, and spicy beef..everything is light on oil and sugar etc but tastes so good..
Ordered drunken chicken, gluten, red cooking pork. very authentic.
Very authentic Shanghainess food, would recommend Wuxi pork ribs, my favorite dish. had a great time hanging out with my friends
Very nice and authentic Chinese food. The portion sizes were pretty good for lunch time too. The dumplings were a little sweeter than I would have expected but overall very tasty!!
No comment

I like the noodle here. It's very authentic and home style. The taste is gentle and comfortable. I feel like I am returning my hometown. Especially the price is pretty reasonable comparing other Chinese cuisine restaurants in NYC.

As someone born and raised in Nanjing, I have to say: this place is so delicious and authentic. Every signature dish was made on point and tasted just like home. Thank you so much for bringing legit Huai Yang cuisine to New York.
Very good. Authentic. Like dessert and salted duck. Great place to get things from my hometown but can never be found elsewhere in NYC
It's a really good Shanghai restaurant near New York University. The food is super!!!! The environment is good!!! It's really a lovely place for students and faculties to enjoy their lunch
This is great! Came here on a Saturday night. Service was good and got to try plenty on the menu. Would recommend the Xiao Long Bao and the noodles

This restaurant is super close to NYU's campus and the staff is super sweet. The food is reasonably priced and tastes really good! Their lunch specials are crafted well and Id definitely come here for comfort food.
No comment

For a soft opening these guys are doing a great job! The ribs were especially good and it was a great priced place!! Also Jin was the cutest, nicest, most attentive waitress ever. She honestly took the experience to the next level. I lived in China for a few years, and my friends and I went here to try the newest 中国菜 in the village and reminisce about our past lives there. The decor is nice, and I just really loved those ribs, gotta say that again. So yummy.
Excellent new restaurant with great service on a busy Saturday.  I recommend the soup dumplings and ribs.  Shanghainese food is excellent but seemingly rare, so check this place out.
No comment
Very authentic Shanghainese food. Strongly recommended dishes: anything with crab meet. Noodles. Braised pork belly. Bamboo shoots

Amazing food and excellent location! It should be the best choice to enjoy Chinese food, especially Shanghai style food for NYU students and faculty. I really love the Aozao noodles. The soup dumplings are quite amazing because it is a little bit sweet which makes it different from soup dumplings from other restaurants. The best Chinese noodles and soup dumplings in NYC! Next time I would like to try Wuxi rib and Dongpo pork which looks so good. And thanks for the opening discount!

This place is super nice! Very authentic shanghainese food and very good service! Also the environment and decoration is good. Price is reasonable. If u wanna try good shanghainese style food, come to tipsy Shanghai

It is a great restaurant that I usually went to when I was working at Wall Street. After they move to the new place, I tried it again today. They are still great with good quality food, delicious favor and very friendly welcome . Will definitely come back again.

Beautiful decor and excellent service. But the food was not authentic... it felt like they were trying to make the pan-Shanghai style food with a Cantonese chef. We had a good experience there, but probably wouldn't come back.
I come to this restaurant all the time. The food is authentic and the service is very warm too. Usually no wait and they have good lunch specials.
No comment
Really enjoyed this new discovery. Great xiao lum bao, hot and sour, babao la jiang and great service
I really like this place, the have my hometown food 扬州煮干丝。I always come with friends and family!

Came here with a friend for lunch, for the lunch special (Monday-Friday 11:30am-3:00pm).  Very affordable and you get a solid variety of food for the amount of money you pay.  If I recall correctly the two options are: appetizer, entree, and dumplings or appetizer, entree, dumplings, and veggies.  The dumplings were very delicious, but the noodles were a little underwhelming.  Overall a pretty solid experience, very cozy atmosphere and good service.  The interior is very pretty and pleasant.  If you are looking for a quick bite of chinese food around Washington Square Park this place will fullfill your needs.
Very authentic Shanghai cuisine. Healthy and delicious, make me homesick. I can come here and eat every single meal, lol
The rice cake and the Shanghai dumpling are super good, we like them a lot. And the service here is good, the people here are very nice. The environment here is good too. Recommend it!
Great place to get real Chinese food. I come here frequently. Their lunch special menu is great value. I recommend the XiaoLongBao here.

To start with, this place's interior decoration is on point, making the restaurant very expensive looking. Surprisingly, the price is very reasonable and the portion is good. Everything we ordered was authentic and delicious. The service is really good and the restaurant provide complimentary dessert for the mid-autumn festival! Highly recommend this place to people who are looking for shanghaiese cuisine!!
Juice dumplings are in good flavor. Clean and friendly.  Will come back again. It is in low level of building but it is still easy to find.
The braised pork belly is bit on the sweeter side, and a bit too fatty for my liking. This being said, the service is good and the food is decent overall. Definitely a place that worths coming back.

Three star for good Shanghai food. But, the offering amount is so small.... Just like sushi offering. I won't be here again because $30/person is not full. But $30 spending could have equal or better value meals in same level restaurant.

The steamed soup buns here are to die for! Hands down the best soup dumplings I've ever had in NYC. The decorations were peculiar and very interesting to look at. There were even USB wall outlets everywhere which made it easy for me to charge my phone, plus the staff were super friendly. Can't wait to come back and order more xiao long baos. I totally recommend trying the food here!
No comment
No comment
Very authentic Shanghainese food place and their price is very reasonable. Visited 3+ times already
Very delicious!! I like the Chinese food here and the environment is great! A great place to hang out with friends!

Tasty Shanghai cuisine. Never close during Christmas. If you wish to visit them often, register a membership and they will offer you a 10% discount from the second order. About $25 per person. Recommend: 小籠包、陽春麵、水晶蝦仁、左宗棠雞、奧灶面. One bad thing: 小楊生煎 is very different with the ones I had in Shanghai.
Authentic Chinese food! The fishes with pickled cabbage  is super delicious
You must try it. The most authentic shanghai food in Manhattan. Must try the xiaolong bao

I really like the food here. They have great Chinese traditional food. The restaurant looks great inside. The decoration is very fancy. If you like Chinese food, you should come here often! I ordered Yangzhou fried rice and it tasted amazing
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NY. Very cozy environment, nice service. Pretty authentic Wuxi dishes offered. The price is also very reasonable.

I passed by this restaurant last week and thought it might be a nice place for me and my sister to try for our hang out today. However, we order the noodle soup with the salty duck and the vegetables (can't remember the name of the veggies). My sister was quite satisfied with her noodle except the salty duck. It wants what we expected. The meat that cut down was all the bad part of the duck. We will not recommend this place to our friends next time.
First time here for a group party. Elegant environment, delicious foods, especially the fish and ribs!!
Went to restaurant for a friend's birthday and it was really tasty!!! We had the rice cakes and Shanghai dumplings. Those were our favorites! Tasty restaurant and good price! :)
Love the famous Assorted Soup, the pork belly is not greasy, meat ball with tofu skin is good too!    Very authentic
Absolutely awesome food and the decor is so nice too. Right in the heart of NYU. Real authentic Shanghai regional food.
The wontons are really good. Service is great and the environment is really good. Price is also fair. Near to NYU. Good place to have lunch.
No comment
Just have a dinner with friends. Pleasant atmosphere, friendly people. Quick service. Food is delicious and mild since I ordered a lot veges. But they serve you with small plates.
I especially like Yuxiangrousi. The food is delicious and tasty. Also, it is affordable. Highly recommend!
No comment
Absolutely stunning. The wu xi pai gu was exquisite and made me feel like I was ascending to  another spiritual plane. Who needs a girlfriend when you have wu xi pai gu?!??
This is my third time here. Good here is Very delicious. Very authentic shanghai cuisine. Will come back again.

I came across this restaurant while visiting family at NYU and was truly amazed by the quality of the food. The food was very authentic and service was very friendly. The 盐水鸭 and 酸菜鱼 were  especially good and better than most restaurants I've visited in China. Overall, highly recommend this place!
Went there for a lunch. The food was not so special but the xiaolongbao was decent. The cons is that the service is very slow.
Good ambience and service. The food was tasty, but people should understand this is not a place for salty and spicy food.
Traditional Su Hang food. Didn't really find anything spicy. The rib soup is pretty good.

Pretty good place, recommend it shen-jian and hong-shao-rou. The price is reasonable as well. They also have private dinning room, which is good for party and people who value private of their conversation.

This modern authentic Chinese restaurant has great food and decor. Walking by I was worried about the prices, but their dishes are all reasonably priced for the high quality and authentic Shanghai flavored meal. We had the Xiao long bao, eggplant with mushrooms, and beef noodle soup that came within 5-10 mins. Wait staff were extremely courteous. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
Delicious orange beef, yummy vermicelli noodles, and tasty dessert!  The service is excellent and it's such a great way to spend a relaxing evening in the city! WOW

Terrible restaurant and service.  Speaking about  delivery only.  Ordered food at 8:30 PM.  There were no updates for over 2 hours and had the delivery cancelled on me at 11PM.  This is not the way a restaurant should conduct business.  The worst service, and there are better establishments in the neighborhood.
This is the most amazing Shanghai food I have met in New York! You must not miss the baozi and noodle here! I will definitely come back again!

I ordered Crucian with scallion and osmanthus flowers with rice ball soup. It was fresh and delicious. I enjoyed the environment, and the waitress (Vicky) was friendly and able to help with my questions about the menu. Highly recommend you try them out.
Delicious, healthy dishes. The waitress taught me to use my soup spoon to catch the juice that escapes the yummy dumplings when you bite into them.
Must-go shanghai food in Manhattan! Friendly and quick service. Food really authentic and tasty. Sometimes they offer seasonal menu. Must try crystal shrimp(水晶虾仁).
Great restaurant, very authentic. I'm Shanghainese and I definitely feel like home whenever I come here. Really recommend all the dishes
Great dishes, reasonable price and good service. Not too loud inside with good decor. Would come back.
Easy to find, good environment, delicious food. Wuxi pork ribs pan fried xiaolongbao are my favorites! definitely will come back again!
Very good shanghai restaurant with nice staff and tasty dish. I recommend this place!

This is one of my favorite place to eat out around NYU. When I don't know what to eat, I always like to  go there. Both the food and service are excellent. Definitely try the restaurant if you like Chinese food.

y'all... I've lived in Hong Kong all my life and have spent a summer in Shanghai studying abroad, the waiters here are the absolute sweetest and this restaurant has the menu that makes my heart so full for food back home. Their soup dumplings are a STEAL for $5.95 and is probably the best broth I've had in New York City. Yes, it's a little sweet, and the skin is a little thick, but if you want "high class perfect Chinese soup dumplings" just go to a 酒樓 in midtown or the soup dumplings place on St Mark's that'll give you that with the appropriate higher price tag. Tipsy Shanghai though is so homey. Will become a regular here for the rest of the time I'm here in NYC.
The food was so good! Love the baozi!!!!!!!!!!!! I brought my bf here today to celebrate his birthday and they offered him a free bill on his part!
Very good experience here! The food is great and I'd definitely come again. I highly recommend the soup dumplings and pork ribs for anyone coming.
Overpriced! No rice! Small amount of food! Purchased $23.24, but I'm not full. Won't order again!
Super disappointed with the xlb here as it tastes way too sugary like a dessert. Definitely a bad recipe here. Besides that the noodles were really small portioned. Overall not worth.
Food was quite good! I got quite a few things and not having paid an arm and a leg for it. It's reasonably priced for New York standards. The location is nice, and its a nice decor as well.
The home made spicy souse tastes really good. I like the yangchun noodle and xiaoyang shengjian.
Super yummy! Reminds me of the real, good Chinese food in China! Chinatown ones mostly are just like fast-food version chinese food(lame). This restaurant is aweeeeeeeesome!
No comment
I have never been to Chinese restaurant that serves with such small portion. Also the dishes are bit too sweet. I am from Hangzhou, this place's food is not a good representation of my hometown food.
This is my third time here. Perfect place to hang out with friends. Delicious authentic Chinese food but also laowai friendly. The vibe is great and decor is nice.
The food is amazingly authentic! Feeling at home back in China! Location is good, very close to W4 and NYU. If you are a big fan of southern Chinese food, I highly recommend you to come here!

An authentic Shanghainese place. We ordered a couple of Shanghainese dishes, such as the braised pork ribs, braised fish and fried pork buns. All of them taste good. I guess I will come back and try more
First time being here, and the food tasted great! Service was fast and friendly and all of the food was reasonably priced. Definitely coming back soon.

Tried today but it's really disappointing. The one star is for the nice decor but that's about it. Food is very salty. The waitress was rude. We two only ordered one entree to share because we were too full. The waitress gave us the usual Shanghai attitude of looking down on u because we only ordered one entree. "Dog eyes looking down on people."

Came here on a Tuesday night with my boyfriend for dinner after seeing this place on Instagram. Ordered the fried pork soup dumplings, auntie fish stew, and the shredded pork. Overall was very impressed with the freshness, flavor, and price! Would definitely come again
Great Shanghainese restaurant with classic vibes. Would definitely come back with friends!
It's hard to find authentic Shanghainese food in Manhattan. Glad that I found this place. Waitress are all very friendly. I'll definitely come back.
Delicious food and excellent service. Will come back again soon! Make sure to get the soup dumplings.
Very traditional Shanghai food. I love their pan fried pork buns drunken chicken and sweet sour ribs

Coming from the region that represents this cuisine, all dishes taste really good, especially the Wuxi Pork Chops and the Dongpo Pork. We wanted to get the stir-fried shrimp but they ran out of stock today. Guess that dish is pretty popular too.
The food is so authentic and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant. The noodles the soup and xiaolongbao are so good. The food is healthy for sure!
delicate and authentic south east Chinese dishes. highly recommend rice wine and ask them help you warm it.
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants! One of my favorites is the pork rib and fish. Salted duck is also very delicious. The environment is faltering and quite. Good place for date.
One of my favorite Chinese places downtown. I come here weekly since they have more authentic flavors compare to other Chinese places. Highly recommended if u are looking for real Chinese food.

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I feel like I'm addicted to the place. The Wuxi pork rib lives up to the expectation. They made the noodle themselves in the spring noodle, so it's also super good!

This place has very good service. The decoration is  nice. The food is authentic. I have been here multiple times. The most amazing thing is that they have Yin Er Gen and Cai Fan (cooked in real Shanghai style!), which is not available in many Shanghainese restaurant. I will give this restaurant five star.

The ribs was very tender however a bit costly, the wine chicken was not a lot of wine compared to others I've tasted but still good, the soup dumplings soup had a nice tad of sweet, the noodles soup was homey but I don't prefer the noodles they use, the hot and sour soup was hearty and good.
The food here is amazing. Very authentic Southern Chinese dishes. Try the shrimp and pork rib!
I went for a meal alone and the waiters were super friendly! It was also very nice and quiet
Foods are very mediocre. The dumplings are even not good as good as those I got from Trader Joe's. Service is not good either. I don't get any reason of giving higher rating.

Cute little place with great decor and ambiance. We split two types of soup dumpling (try the crab!!), short ribs, and beef noodle soup. Would be a great place for a group to come and split a bunch of things as well

Stumbled upon this Chinese restaurant near my apartment and I am so glad that I did!!! It's hands down the best Chinese restaurant in the area and maybe in the entire city. The food is delicious, authentic, and super affordable. The service is amazing as well. Can't ask for much else from Tipsy Shanghai...I'm definitely going to be a regular here.

I live in the neighborhood and was so happy to see this place open up. I feel like most Chinese restaurants are Cantonese or Sichuan so it's nice to have somewhere that serves traditional Shanghainese food. So far I've tried the pan fried pork buns, the minced pork noodles, sauteed string beans, and a few other specials - all of them tasting very authentic. Definitely recommend!

We ordered Spring Noodles, braised beef noodles, Wuxi pork ribs and crab dumplings. The noodles dishes were very tasty, the broths were flavorful and the noodles had a nice texture. Would go back for the noodles. Our waiter Jimmy was very attentive and friendly.

The exquisite fitments was impress me, the interval of tables are just right .We order the wuxi rids, they was totally surprise me. Some of dishes are not exactly look like what we see in the menu, but the food still tasty.
First time here, food is delicious here and authentic, good place to go with friends!
Great food, I had the Spring noodles and it was very tasty and comforting. Price is on par with other restaurants in the area. Would definitely come back!
Tiny portions, inattentive service, mediocre taste. No real reason to come here when there are options in Chinatown which are much better value.

Probably one of the best "real" Chinese cuisine since Joe's Shanghai, everything we ordered were spot on, they didn't adjust any flavor into any kinds of western styles, the soup dumplings and tofu are my favorites, we hope that we can ordered one more fried dumplings but we were full, definitely will come back really soon!

Had a late lunch and it was quite tasty Shanghainese regional food. My wife had a chicken broth noodle soup dish and we shared had several appetizers (xiao long boa soup dumplings, deep fried dumplings, and the Wuxi spare ribs). All were pretty good/decent (be prepared that the dumplings are really hot and can burn your tongue though). My favorite is the Wuxi spare ribs which are very sweet and tender. For those familiar with Shanghainese cuisine, it's similar to hongshao rou but better, IMO.
this place is bomb，if u want to experience authentic Chinese food definitely come here
No comment
No comment
No comment

So wanted to try this place as I love South Indian food and I normally go to Lexington avenue, I had the pooris to start which were really good and the portions are large and then had the masala dosa and it looked great, the sambal sauce is delicious but the filling was a little to greasy, I felt it was to many fried onions and it just was a greasy mush, the bottom of the dosa ended up a little soggy, will definitely try again with something else, very clean place and prices are very good
No comment

Really good, but I know Americans aren't used to paying more for higher quality Indian food which comes at a premium. I got the bhaji pav ($13.99) which was really really good. The spice was on point and I could literally tell by eating it that the ingredients were just of a higher quality. Of course as one knows with places where the quality is good, the portion size of the dishes are smaller. But to be honest, I think it is good because usually portion sizes at restaurants are inflated. I will come back occasionally due to the price point.
No comment
No comment
We went the for Saturday dinner had Masala Dosa and masala chai. This was good food and liked the decor of the restaurant.

My dreams of having shiv sagar type restaurants in NY, have been answered. This place is AMAZING! we have tried pretty much all the dishes on the menu. My favorites however are the pani puri, bhel puri, bhakri pizza with amul cheese and bahubali sandwich. This will be a constant till I live in Manhattan.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I visited NYC yesterday and the person next to me was an Indian from an area close Delhi. and in talking about pav bhaji, she recommended Honest as a great place for that and vegetarians. Unfortunately, when I went I was rather full from a late lunch so just had some samosas, what struck me was how fresh they were, delicious. Honest serves vegetarian Indian street food and it feels and looks that way. I know a lot about Indian food but I am not an Indian, but it strikes me that the  food here would be a cure from homesickness by someone from India. Will definitely come back.
No comment

HIGHLY recommend coming to Honest for some delectable chaat!! Honestly, the food tasted like the street stalls in India. I tried the vada pav, kattappa sandwich, dahi puri, and pav bhaji - and oh my god, every bit was so so good. The staff is very friendly, and the food is very fresh and tastes amazing. I've tried chaat at quite a few places in NYC, and I don't think many places compare to Honest. The restaurant is cute, chic, and I love the instagrammable sign that they have inside. Great place to hangout with friends, for a quick bite, or a nice dinner. I will definitely be coming back again to try more!
No comment

Loved everything we ordered here - pau bhaji, and special pizza. They even made a small size sada dosa for my one year old and she relished it! Great quality with great taste. The place was very clean and neat. Loved the ambiance. Coming back for sure!

This place is a gem. Love that it's right in the middle of the west village and has affordable prices. If you are an NYU student you can get an additional discount ! The food was amazing and portions were huge. I recommend going family style and sharing a few dishes.

Small, unassuming place, order at front and they bring your food to your table.  It's definitely different than typical Indian food. They call it Street Food. The plates are small and meant to be shared. Everything seemed fresh, nothing frozen or reheated. Good quality ingredients. Started with bhaji pav, which is kind of a loose mashed potato curry served with buttery rolls for dipping. It was pretty tasty. We then had some samosas which I thought were just ok. Then we had paneer chili gravy which was grilled paneer cheese with veggies in a spicy sauce. That was my favorite dish. Also got something called a mango falooda which is kind of like a mango lassi but with nuts, mango ice cream, and thin noodles. Apparently it's a very popular  Indian street drink. My friend and I really didn't care for it. It actually wasn't bad, but those noodles were pretty off-putting for us. Maybe it's an acquired taste. Overall, an interesting meal, the restaurant was basic but very clean and bright and pretty, and the service was very good. But the food itself, while interesting, wasn't actually that great. I'm glad I tried it, but wouldn't rush to go back.

Perfect place for Indian chat around Greenwich area. Their menu options are great for street food nostalgia and the taste is original. As 'Desi' as it could get. I had the Samosa Chat and it was amazing .

This place caught my eye when I walked by it. Vibrant and colorful which I love. I decided to go in and was greeted very friendly. I asked what was good on the menu and was offered a few suggestions. I ended up picking the Bhaji Pav and the Hangover juice (lemon, ginger, carrot). You could sit anywhere which is pretty cool. The decor is spacious, bright, and inviting. I ended up sitting in the back to look at the backyard view which was nice. A kind woman brought my food to me and saw I was taking selfies which she asked if she can take the picture for me instead. The pictures she took were so lovely! I appreciate her lol The food and juice overall were delicious. It was a very calming environment to eat in. I definitely will come back and recommend it!
Highly recommend this vegetarian restaurant! Must try the pau bhaji with cheese and the dabang dosa!
No comment

most horrible customer service. Our order was wrongly served to another customer and we kept waiting forever for it to arrive. the server girl realized it.  But gave us no update and neither any apology for the delayed service!!! very rude and proud girls man the restaurant. I wonder if they will ever get a return customer. The whole time that we were waiting, we were hearing loud conversations amongst the girls in the kitchen about their personal life. No wonder the mistake! Owners please be aware of what is going on in your business.
Dropped in for a quick paani poori. Honestly I can make them much better and I don't know how to cook.
SO good. My favorite desi street food in the city, tastes like I'm eating roadside in Ahmedabad!

'Honest Indian Restaurant' is a great addition to the Greenwich Village area. The interior is very spacious, clean, and aesthetic - with lots of murals and art decor. Everything on the menu is vegetarian. We tried a variety of dishes - Kattappa, Veg Hakka Noodle, Samosa Chaat, Pav Bhaji, and Pani Puri. The Bhaji Pav and Samosa Chaat was my favorite. Pav Bhaji is their signature dish, so I had to try it! It was a simple, homey dish. Every bite of the Samosa Chaat was loaded with flavor - sauce, chickpea, vegetables, and fruits (pomegranate and apples).
No comment

I have a nut allergy and they assured me their samosas were nut free after explaining my allergy to the person working there. Within minutes of eating the food, I had a severe allergic reaction and had to be hospitalised. First time in my life having to use an epi pen and spent hours in the ER. I will never eat here again!!!!

Great food. Loved the dabang dosa, pani puri. Also the person at counter was suuuuper nice and very kindly made the best recommendations. He was also thoughtful enough to space out my large order appropriately so I have the best experience. Can't wait for them to open more of the restaurants in the city.
Doesn't look like much when you pass by but OMG is this place good. Reminds me of my moms home cooking! I'll be coming at least once a week!

The food was very tasty and place was modern, clean and spacious. We had the plain dosa, gobi manchurian, pav bhaji, dahi puri, falooda and chai. Everything was delicious. It has the same quality and taste as chaat that you would get in India.
Really good, quick service, and friendly staff! Friend had the mango lassi and said it was great too

This is basically an Indian fast food restaurant. Best for a quick lunch. The food is just okay. They say it's Indian street food, so it's not to be confused with what you would expect from a typical Indian restaurant.

I picked up the Dabang Dosa and the Vada Pav for dinner last night and it was incredible. The sambhar for the dosa was so so good, didn't care much for the coconut chutney. The food was so good that I ordered the Pav Bhaji and the Kattappa Sandwich for lunch today, and once again, they were both so delicious. The texture and the taste of the pav bhaji gravy was perfect. The Kattappa sandwich could have been more spicy but it was really really good. I'm going to try literally everything on their menu. I'm Indian and I definitely recommend this place.
Delicious.  I had the chili paneer (dry) and the kaju anjeer milkshake, and they were extremely tasty.  I'm so excited to have a good chaat + Indo-Chinese place in the West Village!

Ate here for lunch. The Bhaji Pav is incredible and perfectly spiced. Surprisingly large inside; I was able to set up my laptop on my table while I ate. Great background music. I expect to come here a lot!
Had a wonderful experience at Honest. Tied thali, puri, pao bhaji, dosa, kulfi. Great food, great service.
I visited this location twice while I was on vacation in NYC. Food was amazingggg. Location was clean and service was nice. I wish we had Honest here in Arizona lol.  Must try, if you are in NYC.
I loved every single bite oft paneer roll! Really good flavoring, super fresh and tasty.

So glad I stopped in to try this new place in our neighborhood! We had the Bhaji Pav, the Manchurian dumplings, and the samosas. Everything was delicious and there's lots on their menu I'd like to try next time. You can ask for different spice levels if you'd like, and pretty much anything can be made vegan- and there are so many interesting vegetarian options! Your food is made fresh when you order. It was great.
Classic honest. Pav bhaji cannot disappoint. Glad we have this one in NYC now. One of the best places for Indian food in the city.
No comment
No comment

This was a super cute vibe inside and would be good for a date night or intimate setting. The light was fairly low inside so it is a bit more dark. The margarita was great and had a bit of a spiciness which was a good addition. I ended up getting the burger and fries. The fries were very good, warm, crispy enough for my own tastes. However, my burger was a bit burnt so I didn't really eat too much of it given that.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for brunch on a super hot day with some friends and the waitstaff were incredibly kind to us. The food was also very good -- tasty and not too heavy. The salad was tossed with too much dressing for my liking, but I thought it had great flavor. I think this is a great restaurant to go for a casual sit down with friends. They have indoor and outdoor seating. I love the outdoor seating during the summer time because of the fresh air and there are plenty of fans to keep you cool. I also got the fresh squeezed orange juice and it was what I needed to balance out the meal.

Food is relatively good but you have to be in NYC to survive. However the price is not exactly worth the food. We walked in and the place was LOUD. Sat down and it felt like the tables next to us were screaming at each other. Did not make for a good experience. We ordered pancakes with blueberries that were $19. Thick cut bacon that looked like Oscar mayor (so?). A cheeseburger that was $27. Definitely not worth the price. Decent taste but don't think we'll be going back and not worth the hype.
No comment

Stopped by Esme with some friends from Jersey and had an amazing time! The decor and atheistic were great! Came for brunch and we tried a couple of items. All tasted amazing and would definitely order again! Cocktails were great too!

Met someone here for dinner a few nights ago while visiting.  They offer both small plates and some entrees.   I had a salad with endive and apples that was very good and also a squash item that was delicious.  Both portions were healthy and ample and we took the leftovers.  They have a heated and enclosed patio area that was nice.  The service was fast and responsive.  Certainly a place I'd go back to and recommend!!
Received this for a $80 take out order.... Pretty shocking for that price, bang average food, very overpriced !
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with some friends around 11 AM on a Sunday and didn't have to wait to get a table outside which was great! Beautiful interior and outdoor area, very friendly staff, and a delicious menu with options for everyone. I would highly recommend their kombucha specifically, but we got a mixture of dishes and everyone loved what they got!
The best salad I've ever had in my life I ate at Esme. 10/10 would recommend this place.

I just experienced sticker shock big time. I wanted a bite to eat so I ordered an egg sandwich and tea. My bill including tip was $32. That's my all time record high. Other than ordering a real breakfast in a restaurant I don't think I'll beat that. Just for some perspective, in a regular coffee shop it would have been $8 even with today's inflation.

I went here for the first time a few weeks ago with friends and we had to leave even before the meal. We arrived for a 3:45pm reservation and were seated closer to 3:55 which is fine but no one told us that brunch orders would end soon and leave us with an hour before dinner. During the hour there's a limited menu with limited veg friendly options but then we found out the main veg meal was also unavailable that day. When we mentioned the confusion, our server sent out someone from the kitchen who briskly pointed a menu and said "You just have to order from that, okay?" without apology or acknowledgement of what happened. Once a manager arrived, things turned for the worst with him asking "what do you want me to do? fire him?" after we shared our disappointment in the prior persons tone. In all, I'll never be back because it's clear this place is run by men who can't accept any accountability or feedback.

a delightful brunch spot with fast service, superb food with an array of options ob the menu and and a gorgeous interior. bonus is the garden area which has a more casual vibe then the interior, but that being said, the interior isn't over the top. it has a modern, minimal, open atmosphere that allows esme to be a great option for any occasion. I opted for the salmon dill on sourdough but swapped the pickled egg for a sunny side up. I'd give it a 4.5 stars/5. Deducted half a star for the lack of milk options (oat and whole) - would love a less fattening option such as almond though!

Great brunch spot! Came here with a friend on a Sunday around noon and got seated right away. My friend and I shared a few things. Started out with the Cinnamon Roll for Two, which was not too overly sweet and perfect to share. The Fried Chicken Sandwich was great, the chicken was nice and crispy and the red curry mayo was delicious. We also got the Avocado Toast which was good. Solid spot for all your brunch going needs!

Really love the back garden area here. It would also make a great space for a group dinner/private event. But the service and the food were meh (closer to 2 stars). We got the fried chicken sandwich and the veggie burger -- both of which were dry and didn't have much flavor. The veggie burger in particular was really disappointing, especially when there's so many other great veg options in the area.
No comment
Really enjoyed breakfast here. Cute aesthetic inside. Was good service. Food very good. Would come back.
No comment
Great food and ambiance.  The chicken sandwich was delicious and the lemonade was so refreshing.
Brunch: Everything went well until I got the Eggs Benedict. I love a runny egg yolk but I'll pass on runny egg whites. I'd like to come back and try other menu items though!
Food was fresh and ever so tasty. Nice variety and highly recommend. We had takeout and the dessert was to die for!

Every time I passed by this place I've always wondered about it because the interior looks very well decorated and has this minimalist design. Today, was my first time actually trying the food. We didn't have a reservation so we had to wait about 15 minutes to get a table. We ordered the eggs Benedict, Double cheeseburger, and A two egg breakfast which came with bacon as well. I must say i was impressed with the food. Everything was seasoned well, perhaps a tad salty but flavorful. I would highly recommend this place and would love to come back in the future. Service was great to top it all off!

American bar restaurant in Greenpoint . They are open for lunch and brunch. Menu is nit that big for lunch mostly sandwiches. We got gem salad and pork sandwich. Salad was very good with a lot of flavor. Sandwich was good but a little dry because there's no dressing on it just cheese.

Esme was one of the first thoughtful, well-designed restaurants to appear w/in five minutes of our Greenpoint home -- so it was a pleasure to find its fresh menu and rustic art-barn decor standing the test of time at brunch today. (We also used to come to this space when it was Papacito's a decade ago!) Beautiful, simple yet special ingredients deliver here: Eggs fluffy as air, housemade sausage, deceptively "easy" home fries (tasty seasoning, not mushy -- perfect texture), mimosas and bloody marys that actually taste like COCKTAILS! Bread from NYC's iconic Orwasher's bakery ... and a few extras that we gotta mention. We opted to eat outside so we could bring our old senior dog, on her last legs, with us. The server -- so patient -- brought her a bowl of water as she splayed out, not exactly making it easy to maneuver around her. He also smiled through our (probably) annoying requests for a couple of menu swaps (hollandaise sauce on side, cheese in the scrambled eggs). They didn't rush us out. Satisfying dining experience. Thanks, folks. Will be back.

Wow, Esme offers up delicious food in a beautiful outdoor space with excellent service. We started with the marinated winter squash and potato leek soup. Both were superb, full of flavor and perfect textures. I ordered the crispy polenta for my entrée. The blend of smoky mushrooms, smooth ricotta, and citrus-y fennel went beautifully together. One of the best spots in Greenpoint!

Food was amazing! Is it dramatic to say life changing? Fun drinks! We got dinner: burrata salad to start, bass and risotto for main, and rhubarb cobbler and panna cotta for dessert! Couldn't say enough good things about this place, service was great and vibes were super enjoyable. Take your favorite somebody here for a great meal.
Great place!  The entire management and staff are very friendly and welcoming. The food and drinks are terrific. Would definitely recommend!!
No comment
No comment

Wonderful place for brunch in Greenpoint! The buttermilk pancakes, which come in a huge stack of 3, are amazing. Blueberries (for $3 extra) are non-negotiable. Those wanting more protein should try their two-egg breakfast. The eggs are cooked well (you won't believe how many over or undercooked eggs I've suffered through at other brunch places), and you get your choice of bacon, sausage or veggie sausage. Even if you're carnivorous, I recommend trying the veggie sausage - the texture and taste comes about as close to meat as I've tried and even putting that aside, it's just a really tasty "sausage"! As for drinks, they have a limited wine list on their brunch menu, but they actually have more wines available by the glass if you ask. I had an extremely impressive glass of natural rose when I was here.

Sad to update this review with 3 stars. I got a burger yesterday for take out. The burger was good but the number of fries was ridiculous, especially for a $ 17 burger before taxes and tip (picture attached). I used to have Esme's burgers every week before covid (they upgraded the burger after they reopened and increased the price) and they used to be very generous with the fries. I talked to the host and he just replied that this was the new take out format and if I wanted more fries I had to order an additional side. I was particularly surprised with the bad customer service. I was a regular at Esme before covid and sadly I won't be coming back.
The Bodega sandwich was incredible, great fixings and the bread was so soft. The French Chardonnay was very good, but very pricey compared to the menu. Definitely recommend this place

Their butternut squash is the best thing I have ever tasted with browned butter. I LOVED how soft and flavorful this was! Their cauliflower was our second review and it was sweet of them to give us toasted bread slices which we dipped in the browned butter and ate:) The strawberry mocktail( Fitzgerald ) was bomb
Delicious and tasty choices of food. Friendly and attentive staff. I was very satiated after my meal. If you like brussel sprouts it'll be bonus.
Let me set the scene...noon on a warm summer weekend. A block from the G-greenpoint is a well-lit brunch spot serving

Excellent. The Black Sea Bass dish was amazing. Loved the white beaks and miso. The short Rib was also equally as impressive. Check it out
I loved this spot. I highly recommend. I could go into detail but that would be a waste of time when you should be on your way instead of reading another yelp review.
No comment

No comment

Modern, clean tasty establishment reminiscent of something you'd find in LA. We ordered a double cheeseburger with fries, which most likely would not ordered again (nothing special) and the Bodega sandwich which was a delightful Turkey sandwich with jam and all the fixings. Worth coming back to if you're in the area.
No comment
Delicious, fresh food. What stood out for us was the great service by our waitperson Falikou. He was professional, friendly and helped us get exactly what we wanted.
No comment

Beautiful outdoor space for Covid-19 and great food. My husband and I ordered the Fried Chicken Sandwich and Veggie Burger (both came with fries). The veggie burger was ok (7/10) but the fries were amaziiiinnnggg (11/10)!! My husband loved his fried chicken sandwich claiming it as one of his favorites (but later that night had some stomach pains--maybe it was the sandwich????). We love this place and will come back!

Walked over here for brunch on a lovely summer afternoon and sat outside. The interiors are classic Americana and there's a decent brunch selection for every mood. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and was presented with tender and juicy chicken on a soft grain bun. Aside from the over abundance of mayo-y sauce, it very much hit the spot.
No comment

Went for dinner. Ordered the bluefish with cabbage. It was good. My wife ordered the crispy chicken. It was edible; nothing special. Pretty underwhelmed by the food, service and atmosphere. The bright blue, bold restroom was the highlight.

The food here is soooo good.  My friend and her husband opened a store up the street from here, and we decided to come here for dinner after I spent a day at their shop taking photographs of their product.  The servers were incredibly nice and provided great service.  The drinks were delicious - I had the autumn garage and my friend opted for the good soldier.  We decided to share the crispy calamari with honey, chili and garlic aioli as an appetizer, and it was phenomenal - we were singing its praises with each bite...it was that good.  We each decided to get our own curried fried chicken thigh sandwich for lunch.   At first I wasn't too sure that I was going to love the bun, because it just looked healthier than the kind of bun you would usually expect with a friend chicken sandwich; I think maybe it's a seeded whole wheat bun (?), but I was wrong, the texture on the bun added to my enjoyment of the sandwich.  The chicken itself was juicy and flavorful...so good.  The sandwich comes with either fries or a salad, and my friend and I both went with the fries, which are hand-cut and also incredibly delicious.  Not only were the servers wonderful and the food delicious, but the space is bright, yet very warm and welcoming.  What I'm saying is, I get the great reviews.  Esme is the whole package.  I cannot wait to come back for dinner one night.
No comment

Stumbled o  this place while I was walking through greenpoint looking for a place to grab brunch with a friend. It has such a cute outdoor space! You order food and drinks at the bar/stand area and then they'll bring over the food. There was plates as it was a more casual place and had them in to go boxes. I got the burger and the papacito both were really good! The atmosphere outside definitely made the place! The bartenders were really nice and super friendly. I would definitely recommend this place for a cute casual spot!

Nice outdoor seating. But I got the sea bass for dinner and it was very bland on top of beans and cabbage that also wasnt very flavorful or well seasoned. Marg was nice but wine was definitely on the expensive side. Seems like a good brunch or lunch spot but not great for dinner for the price point and few options.

Came here for Sunday lunch on an extremely beautiful Sunday and to no surprise, there was a wait. We were told 30 min but got seated in 15 at he bar. I ordered the burger with a slab of pork belly on the side. Food came pretty quickly. First, let me say the pork belly was delicious! After a bite, I wanted more but held off. The burger was also pretty good although standard. The bartender who took our order was very nice and attentive, refilling my cup whenever it was half empty. The decor inside was nice and welcoming, and I look forward to coming back and trying other things, hopefully without the wait.

Ah, the this was really disappointing. It took almost 20 minutes to seat us, but the host was very nice and comp'd us an appetizer and some rosé. So they definitely get points there. Unfortunately, the food was simply mediocre. I didn't care for the sweet sauce on the fried calamari, and the salmon was bland. Burger was okay but the fries were soooo salty. The risotto and Brussels sprouts were good, especially the beets that came with the later. It may have been the ingredients, because the dishes looked like they were prepared well, but the flavors fell flat.

Really love it for brunch, not that much for dinner. Still it's a really nice place, good service and good food! Their grain bowl or veggie burger is particularly delicious.

Came here for lunch on a quiet Monday and loved it! More people than I expected, but I got a nice sun-lit spot by the windows. Ordered a cold brew, which was VERY strong, and the grain bowl. The grain bowl comes with quinoa, avocado, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, pickled onions, cabbage, a poached egg, and pickled mushrooms. It was delicious and very filling, although I will say that about half the things in this grain bowl are pickled, so maybe stay away if you don't love vinegar. The prices here are also super, super reasonable -- my whole meal was only $20, including tip. Really want to come back here for brunch and dinner!

No comment

I wish I could give this restaurant ten stars but I'll settle for five. The wait time was short for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. Seating is either indoors or outdoors but I would suggest sitting outside( there is a lovely breeze back there). My waitress was friendly and attentive and also very accommodating to my food allergies. I left feeling full and happy and have already recommended this gem to my close friends ! You won't be disappointed !

Stumbled across this restaurant yesterday while in Greenpoint.  First the interior is gorgeous, it has such a chill vibe (similar to Sunday in Brooklyn).  The hostess and staff were very welcoming and the food amazing! I had the avocado toast with a side of pork belly and the Pimms cocktail.  Perfect brunch spot!
No comment
Veggie burger and cocktails were beyond delicious. Ambiance and service were second to none. Gorgeous place, wonderful food, 10/10 would recommend.

Delicious breakfast. Pork belly egg benedict, short stack pancake, and avocado toast. Hollamdaise sauce tasted funny to me and some pork pieces needed to be rendered more because there was a lot of fatty peices that weren't cooked all the way. Pancakes were delicious.
No comment
No comment

Excellent date night spot. I came here with a friend but I love the atmosphere - mood lighting, modern classy look. As for the food - exceeded expectations. We had the burrata to start, which was rich and creamy without being too oily and paired nicely with the Albariño wine. My favorite however, was the main course - the mussels. That's what made it 5 stars for me. The mussels come in a rich buttery sauce and are amazingly flavorful. I am already craving these again. Plus, the staff are nice enough to offer you bread to dip in the sauce once you finish the mussels and the bread comes out warm! Afterwards I had to rush off to a show so we did not have time for dessert, but if it was anything like the main course I would not be surprised. :) Already planning to come back here.
No comment
No comment
Amazing fresh food! The bloody Mary's are out of this world. The best I've tasted ever. Highly recommended this place.

Came here on a a Sunday night for dinner.  Based on all the great reviews, were very excited to try Esme. This place definitely didn't disappoint. The cocktails are amazing and the food is delicious. We ordered the salmon, roasted chicken, steak and brussel sprouts and everything tasted amazing. Definitely recommend!
No comment
No comment

We came here for brunch and it was so good!  The service was excellent and food was incredible.  The avocado toast is so good, the pickled onion on top was such a great addition, as well as the sprinkle of poppy seeds.  My husband got the fried chicken sandwich and he wouldn't stop raving about it.  The chicken was so juicy and the curry mayo sauce on it complimented it so well.
Killer burger, pancakes, and grilled cheese. Quality ingredients. Has a good vibe. Nice bar if dining alone. It can get crowded, I tend to go on off hours, prefer it for a weekday lunch.

I live super close to Esme and I've been many times! It's wonderful for date nights or intimate group hangs. They have a pretty niche menu but everything tastes great! Cocktails are also amazing.  Would recommend for brunch too. Cheers!

We popped in for a quick bite and were seated right away. Ordered the calamari as an appetizer .... some of the best calamari I've ever had. Also had the pea risotto and it was amazing. The service was very professional and upscale but not pretentious. Would absolutely love to go back here.
No comment

Sunny, comfortable, casual Greenpoint restaurant. People were eating at the bar/counter (those seats are part of the waitlist if you go at a busy time). I enjoyed my brunch. Afterwards you can take a stroll around the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Food is fine but uninspired. Big salad was the tastiest, but nothing to write home about. Avocado toast was oddly guacamole like. Worst insult is highlighting on your menu a $5 "Vegan Sausage" that turns out to be a rubbery Morning Star breakfast sausage pattie that you've reheated. It's fine to sell those, but be upfront about it, don't have your staff at first think "no that doesn't sound like us, we basically make everything here" only to come back and sheepishly confirm it.
No comment
Really loved it, the beet salad was amazing and the pastrami sandwich was just perfect, great customer service and good prices!!!!
No comment
Love this restaurant. Delicious brunch, friendly service. Expect a wait if you are headed there during the weekend.

Brunch review: really excellent brunch in Greenpoint. Light-filled, quick service, huge portions, good price point. My advice is to go right at 11am, otherwise you'll be stuck waiting awhile for a table. Tried the ricotta doughnuts, eggs Benedict with pork belly, breakfast potatoes and avocado smash. The thick toast was great; the avocado could've used a little bit less citrus and a little more natural avo creaminess. Still good. As far as brunch goes, it doesn't get too much better in terms of portion size, quality, price and service.

I got a burger, fried chicken sandwich and fries to go and it was all delicious and reasonably priced.  My husband and I got mimosas while we waited (short time) for our food- also great.  The place is super small but it's cozy.
No comment

Super hungover and in need of breakfast food. Came here and had the first thing on the brunch menu: 2 eggs, home fries, pork belly and toast. It was fire. Didn't need any salt or pepper for the eggs, and passed on the usual ketchup for the home fries. Had a mimosa and a tequila sunrise. Sean absolutely killed it in terms of service. Best dude ever. Best brunch spot ever. Don't pass it up.
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Greenpoint, and definitely in my top 10 for all of Brooklyn. I come here at least twice a week and the food / service never disappoints!
No comment

Nice atmosphere. Had the chicken fried sandwich which was great! Decided to have the salad vs. fries to be a little healthy, but was disappointed. It was a pile of lettuce with a simple dressing, which would've been fine had the greens been crisp or the dressing interesting. Neither were good. Decided to order a side of fries because I couldn't finish the "salad". They were great and the herbed aioli was a nice touch too. Also had the limeade which was quite nice. Would def come back, but won't be ordering that side salad again lol.

I had a great brunch here to celebrate a friend's special occasion. It's a small place, so arrive early for brunch, but the lighting and decor are both great and we all really enjoyed the food. (I recommend the blueberry pancakes!) The pricing was quite reasonable for NYC, too!
No comment

Such good food! I got the blueberry pancakes (short stack) and it was huge and delicious. My friend got the overnight oats and they were also amazing and great portion size. The environment was super cute and cozy and there were a bunch of locals there so it was upbeat. The service was also great and staff very kind and helpful. Overall great experience!!
No comment

Came here on a weekday for lunch. Seated immediately, restaurant was not full. We were hoping they had some brunch items on their lunch menu, the host mentioned they may do that for the future but for now brunch menu is weekend only. We had the Fried chicken sandwich and the Reuben. Both were well made and delicious. People at the next table were finishing their burgers which looked really good and pretty big. Generous serving of fries and salad with our lunches. Good service, good space.
They have the best vegetarian burger! Atmosphere is nice when it's not jammed pack but it does get very busy.
No comment
No comment

Food was Eff'n amazing!!!!! The scenery, service, drinks !! Amazing. I had the smoked salmon with avocado sandwich and a grape cocktail I can't really remember the name of - 2 of those and the poached pear for desert. Everything was so good I'd love to go back a million times !!

I went to Esme for brunch for the first time on a Sunday and I was told that it was a 30 minute wait which ended up being about 10 minutes. I ordered a couple of entrees but the fried chicken sandwich is what's worth talking about! I got to try this amazing sandwich by accident.  The manager noticed that one of the poached eggs was kind of runny, so he gave us the fried chicken sandwich to try! This manager is an excellent manager! I would've come back just for the great service. However, the fried chicken sandwich was lightly crispy, tender and juicy! Seasoning was perfect and the strips of bacon added to the flavor. It was accompanied by hand cut fries which was also off the hook! I am definitely going to crave this sandwich!

This place is a solid choice for great food, atmosphere, and service. The beet and brussel sprouts appetizer is my fave. All of the desserts are delicious but the marscapone cheesecake is really special.

Found this gem when visiting one of my husband's job sites down in Brooklyn! It's a great place to visit when the weather is nice. Have a seat outside and enjoy the sun and the birds chirping. You have to try the Avocado Toast and the warm  Quinoa bowl! To die for! Pair with either their homemade lemonade or some hot tea!

The hostess was accommodating but food was only alright. The fried chicken burger was the best. Cohesive in flavor and texture. Coming here to try their dishes was a good choice but not for a second visit.

So happy I finally got to try Esme! The drinks were absolutely delicious: Bloody Mary - best one I've had in a while, loved the pickle juice in it! The Russian journal (I believe that's the name) was so refreshing and yummy. Great job on the fried chicken sandwich - not dried up and good flavor. Reuben was delicious as well. All in all - great choice for late lunch. Would love to try dinner at some point! Oh and did I mention there is a lovely garden in the back? Very roomy inside and out. Definite recommendation!

Cool place. Food was good; we had the chicken liver mousse as a starter. Pretty excellent. For an entree I had the cavatelli with hand cut fries on the side. Both were very tasty and filled me up for sure. I had a cocktail called Erika something. Pretty solid and full of alcohol. Ambiance is cool, server was ok. Manager on duty was pretty on his game. Would go back for sure.
Food was really good, the only problem was that the salad was over salted. Nice place, good food nice service.

Pretty good brunch place! It had a bit of a wait but that's to be expected on a Sunday morning. I tried the savory French toast. It tasted very similar to bruschetta with an egg. The cheese on the "French toast" added a nice crunch. I also ordered a side of pork sausage which was a bit meh. Kind of dry and had a strong black pepper flavor that I didn't care for.

Esme benefits from being the sole renovated, well-lit, hipster decor (read: wood) restaurant on a block of old school delis with no windows. So it's no wonder that the was a line when we got there. But we weren't discouraged, and ventured in. Good thing we did! We got seats at the bar almost immediately and proceeded to order the savory French toast. Pretty good concept and it was pretty healthy too. Staff was nice and relaxed which isn't always the case at a brunch place in BK. We would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment

We got the chicken sandwich and Eggs Benedict for brunch and weren't too impressed. The Eggs Benedict was one flavor - mayonnaise. Potatoes were burnt -- just don't order it. The fried chicken sandwich was good, but not a show stopper. The Pimm's Cup is much better than the Jump Up Jack. It looked like most people got the burger and a salad -- but honestly, I would not come back here based on the first experience.
