The food was great and the staff was really lovely.   Looking forward to our next visit.
Porkbelly Eggs benny was delicious! I would have appreciated a palate cleanser, like a small side salad though. Otherwise fantastic!
No comment

We came here in Saturday for brunch. A party if two, a party if four came after us, even though both our tables were available at the same time. They were sat first. We ordered the eggs Benedict with pork belly and the savory French toast. They were both really good.  Until I found a hair in my French toast . They offered to make me a new one, but I'm the kind of person that can't move on from that. So well ... It was a good experience while it lasted.
No comment

The food at Esme is absolutely delicious. One of my best meals of last summer was here. I ordered steak and my friend got chicken, both were very well portioned and cooked perfectly. The food comes out a bit slow so I'd be prepared for that but when it comes it will surely be delicious. One of the better places in greenpoint, despite a slIghtly high price tag for the area.

A very cute and chic spot in Greenpoint for dinner. The menu is not very extensive, but there are some great, creative options. To start we got the pork rillette (like a pate consistency) that came with a caramelized onion jam, some pickled vegetables, and sourdough. It was really tasty and out of the ordinary. For my main I got the ricotta cavatelli which had bacon and a poached egg on top. The best part were probably the cocktails- they had a great selection of well crafted drinks. I got the Autumn Garage #2 (replaced rum with gin + blackberry jam+lemon,) and the Crimson and Clove (vodka, hibiscus, and spiced honey.) Highly recommend this place if you find yourself in Bklyn.
No comment

Finally got to try this place. Both the Savory French toast and Waffle were delicious!  I have dreams about those soft eggs. Veggie sausage was very tasty as well.  Black Walnut coffee drink was tasty. Cappuccino was on the small side but tasty.  Little British waiter was kind and attentive.  Love the size of the booths.

I've lived in Greenpoint for 10 years and was around when the space was Papacitos. Thank god ESME replaced it. Every neighborhood needs a solid restaurant and bar to rely on and ESME is one of those places. I Come here 3 times a week and have yet to be disappointed. The food is great, top notch bar and the staff is really friendly. Thanks to the chef for putting an egg on my burger. Try it! You won't be disappointed.
No comment
No comment

Small menu but its really good. Went here with some friends multiple times, We tried everything. It's quality food. Definitely a good place to go to, We waited too long for the food, Ordered more drinks then we should in the meantime but when the food came it was worth it. You can tell they really put craft into the meal, This place is worth trying multiple times.
No comment

Such a cute place!  There are both indoor and outdoor dining (we didn't get to check out the outside portion but saw a lot of people being led back there).  I ordered the pork belly eggs benedict (those big pork belly chunks really made the dish!) and my husband ordered the grass-fed burger.  Overall, we enjoyed the food and the atmosphere and will definitely return to try their dinner menu!
This place served me a raw egg. Egg and cheese sandwich to go. Not just undercooked but raw. Clear egg white.

The food at Esme is amazing. Balanced combinations of flavors and textures are a step above the other high-quality options in the neighborhood. After The Bounty announced their closing, Esme has quickly become my new favorite. I recently tried their special watermelon salad with chili oil, whipped feta, watercress, and kalamata olives and was blown away. My seared scallop entree and a dessert of mascarpone cheesecake were also well prepared and equally delicious. Can't wait to go back.

Went here for lunch and it was pretty mediocre. The savory French toast was definitely not savory. Bland tomato sauce, basic kale and a poached egg on soggy toast. Not impressed. The grilled cheese was little better then diner food and the veggie burger was meh. Delicious Bloody Mary but served in a slender glass and left me wanting more. I don't get the fuss about this place.
No comment
No comment

So glad this place opened up in Greenpoint! Amazing food and great service. The decor of the place feels very cozy and warm and the food is absolutely delicious.  We went there for my husband's birthday and ordered a ton of appetizers and main dishes. The chicken liver mousse was delicious and I had the chicken which was super tender and juicy. We also had the wings, pork belly and the butternut squash salad all of which was delicious. The cocktails were very tasty as well. Definitely a 5 star place in Greenpoint! This will definitely be my go to spot!

Went there with a friend for a Sunday brunch. Very slow service. The waiter brought coffee to me first and 10 min after to my friend. Food came 30 min later pancakes are awesome, potatoes too spicy. They entered our order wrong, however food is 3.5 our of 5. 1 for poor service, sorry

Inexpensive and delicious food in a cozy atmosphere. I easily made a reservation on OpenTable on Friday night 4 hours before I wanted to dine. I ordered the veggie burger ($12) and my friend ordered the mussels and frites. The veggie burger was home-made and huge. It was tasty. My friend loved the huge pile of mussels. We both enjoyed our fries. The real winner at Esme, however, is the dessert. I rarely order dessert at restaurants but everyone around us was ordering so I figured we should endulge. My friend and I shared the beignets with nutella whipped cream. It was so delicious and mouth-watering, I am still thinking of them a few days later. I would highly recommend this spot for a low-key evening dinner with friends!
Esme is a great little gem in the neighborhood. It's got a cute bar And their Chicken entree dish might be the best chicken dish I've ever had!!
No comment

Their signature cocktail made with gin and cucumber was AMAZING. As a gin lover I pretty much have been drinking gin based cocktails all the time and Esme's house cocktail was very delightful. The scent of cucumber and some what herb? I don't know but it combined very well!

Well, so I order the (overnight) oatmeal. $9. With nuts and berries. A small bowl. A few nuts. And it's not berries. It's a berry. One berry. One strawberry sliced in 4 quarters. Does that make it berries? No, still one medium sized berry. C'mon! Why be so baldly chintzy? Stop being so precious and twee. It's just a bowl of oatmeal for chrissakes.
No comment
Excellent food, drink, and service. Nathan is awesome ! I had a special request and he hooked it up.

Always enjoy the Esme burgers. These are our favorite burgers in NYC and we are fortunate this place is close to our home. We often order for take out but when we dine in the desert menu is great too.

Had a great dinner at Esme last night....everything from the time we walked in we were so warmly received. The wine list is simple but with some really great wines. The food sounds very straightforward on the menu, but wow what a great combination of tastes and all the food is prepared to perfection. Absolutely one of the besT chicken  dishes I have had at a restaurant in BK. So refreshing to have attentive staff!

We were staying nearby for one night and chose Esme for dinner. I'm so glad we did. Even though we were a bit late for our 7:30 reservation, our host (co-owner) Nate greeted us like old friends. I had seen the beet and Brussels sprouts appetizer on the website and it did not disappoint. We enjoyed the cavatelli which was cooked perfectly- just enough bite. When we passed on dessert, Nate brought over two glasses of a lovely dessert wine, on the house. Esme is a lovely, cozy, high-ceilinged room, the meal was tasty and well-prepared and Nate could not have been more welcoming. Don't miss the cocktails- the bartender is a certified mixologist who really knows his way around the bar. Ask him to pour you the Orange. Thank you Esme!
No comment
No comment
No comment
New BF lives across the street from this charming bistro. He went with the BIG Salad, which was great. I devoured the burger. Incredibly yummy! I am sure that I will be back many tmes.
No comment

Esme is the best for brunch in Greenpoint! Their breakfast menu is awesome and everything is delicious. I'm a big fan of the homefries and the House sausage! Servers are all friendly and quick. Definitely try to get here early though, because it fills up very quickly during brunch hours on the weekends.
No comment

Wow. This place is amazing. Went here for a solo meal and wanted something hearty, healthy, not bank breaking, and still unique. Had the veggie quinoa burger with a glass of wine during happy hour and it was one of the most delicious meals I've had in NYC. Maybe it was the curry ketchup sauce? Or the ambiance? Or the amazing service! Not sure but dang that was good.

My partner and I dined at Esme last night for our anniversary dinner and it was perfect! We made a reservation, but it probably wasn't needed on a Monday night. It was unexpectedly lively, but that didn't take away from the cozy ambiance. The wait staff was extremely polite and attentive, appropriately checking in and refilling our waters. We both ordered the Dark Passenger - it is a truly unique cocktail. We shared the calamari as an app and it was fantastic! I ordered the steak dish and it was cooked perfectly. The flavors were wonderful. The menu has a great variety for all sorts of dietary restrictions and preferences. We were too full for dessert, but next time when I have more room I would love to try the beignets. Very lucky that this is my neighborhood! Will definitely be back.
One of my favorite veggie burgers, great customer service and beautiful space. Nice prices and variety too!
No comment

This place is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. The best food and the best staff are here. Dinner is delicious, I recommend the pork belly and the salmon. For brunch do yourself a favor and get the waffles they will make your day! I can't give Esme enough praise!

We come here a lot. The watermelon salad is really good. I can't remember what they told us the garnish is, but it is really good. The burrata is really good too. The calamari has a sweet sauce. They were nice enough to make noodles which are not on the menu for our kid. These were the best noodles ever, but they won't always make them because they said their kitchen is too small and it breaks her heart. The staff is really nice. The ambience is whatever. Kind of typical, but the food is superb.
Super chill spot. The food is delicious and so is the decor. It's definitely a cute brunch spot with the girls or perfect for a date night.
No comment

Okay restaurant.  I don't find the menu to be particularly interesting or exciting.  Seems like just another restaurant similar to anella that pops up and is too overpriced for the hood.  Surprised it has stayed open as long as it has.

Had dinner here with a friend and the service was amazing very attentive to its  costumers and the atmosphere is cozy and hip with a rustic feel I ordered the flat iron steak and it was AMAZING ! Along with the steak the creamed kale was so tasty !!! For dessert we ordered the sugar doughnuts which were superb when dipped in the apple butter!!! Had a pleasant dining experience here can't wait to come again !
Met up with our friends, who have two kids, for brunch on Sunday. Very kid friendly and got seated quickly. Food was delicious, definitely be back!!

This place deserves all the praise it gets. I've been here three times and have never had one complaint. Definitely the best restaurant in greenpoint, and maybe the most underpriced place in the city. Michelin level food and service, and clearly run by very competent industry pros. The bartender (forgot his name) who always works weekends is fantastic. I doubt that it will be easy to get a table here soon, so go now, and order everything, it's all great.
No comment

I was dying to go here based off of yelp photos. We went on a Saturday around 11:30 and just beat the brunch crowd. The food took a while to come and the couple next to us got upset when we received our food before theirs even bought they ordered before us. We ordered the fried chicken sandwich, 2 eggs platter and beignets. I had high expectations for the fried chicken sandwich but I thought it was kind of dry. The eggs were standard. The beignets weren't as fluffy as I hoped they'd be. It's a cute spot but probably won't be coming back.

This place is a gem in the midst of regular stores on Manhattan Avenue! Very chic and rustic decor, (wood, candles, old church pews, piping), the music was great for an early morning brunch spot! We arrived at 11am when they opened and were seated promptly, but get here early they soon filled up. That is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5, the service lacked as they filled up and there seemed to be more then enough floor staff to deal with the amount of customers. The food though, no complaints! It was all delicious and portioned well. The beignets and waffles are killer! Even the butter and syrup tasted homemade! I highly recommend Esme for brunch, will review again when I go for dinner!
No comment
The blueberry pancakes here are amazing. The fries and the fried chicken sandwich were also very, very good. Of the drinks, Pimm's Cup was a nice complement to a heavy meal.
No comment
No comment
Nice brunch spot in Greenpoint with an open feel. Went recently on a Sunday just a few minutes after they opened. By the time we ordered, the place was packed. Great comfort food- worth going back.

Perfect brunch spot. Comfortably appointed with wooden hipster minimalism and a welcoming bar, the menu is short but packs a punch. We had pumpkin spiced beignets to share and pork belly eggs Benedict and savory French toast respectively. The beignets were done very well, not too sweet little pillowy morsels of love. The savory French toast a juxtaposition of tomato compote, kale, shredded parmesan and poached egg. The pork belly eggs Benedict was the star, definitely fatty, but spot on serving size with a side of crispy potatoes. Add fresh squeezed OJ and some herbal tea, a family friendly environment, and what could potentially be a happening happy hour spot bar lining one wall of the restaurant, and Esme is certainly doing many things right by northern Greenpoint.

It takes quite a bit to stand out in Brooklyn, but after eating out every night for a month it is a fact that my two best meals have been at Esme. Directly on the G, brilliant construction of taste and a knowledgable staff. I personally couldn't ask for more. Highly recommended.
I should have reviewed this place a long time ago. It is one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. The food is consistently good no matter what I order and service is always friendly.

The Ricotta Cavatelli was to die for! Amazing flavor, a must have. The Brussel sprouts and beet app and the mussels were also very good. Service was great, as they accommodated us with a higher end champagne by the glass, since they were out of stock of their menu option.

Very nice spot that our friends introduced us to a few months ago. I really, really love the decor and the food was very good. One of the best restaurants in Greenpoint. We'll be back again to enjoy the garden early Fall when it cools down a bit. Nice to see a chef owned place with creativity and ambiance in one of my favorite Brooklyn neighborhoods.

The food was incredible starting from the appetizers and ending with the deserts. It's a lovely atmosphere with a really friendly and attentive staff. In a restaurant scene where most restaurants are identical to one another serving "new Americans" esme really stands out. The manager/owner was a gentleman made sure the experience was lovely from beginning to end. We waited a while to get seated and he kindly sent over a few extra dishes with our appetizers. All dishes had inventive and delicious sauces. Really pleasant experience all and all!
Great brunch spot, always seems packed in the evening. If you get lucky on warm day it's worth waiting for a spot in the yard

This place is a real gem. Came here with my bf and we are beyond pleased. Veggie burger is deliciousssss. Beef burger,also. Had their calamari as a starter and I must say it's one of the best I've eaten. They have it in a sauce that makes them a bit moist but when you bite in you can feel a crunch. Perfection.

Came here for brunch Saturday and was seated in about 10 minutes (didn't have a reservation so we were fine with that). The atmosphere was lovely--big windows to let the sun light in with a beautiful, cozy bar. I got the two eggs platter (came with the most delicious toast ever) and I was able to substitute home fries for french fries no problem at all. My girlfriend got the pork belly benedict and it was delicious, although the pork belly was a bit fattier than what she expected. She ate everything on her plate except for some pieces of fatty pork belly, and when the manager came around he noticed and offered her a beer on the house which I thought that was very nice. All in all, a great brunch experience and we'll definitely be back!

Brunch was great, the food that is. But the screeching baby that sounded like a rape whistle going off every 2 minutes kind of ruined the ambiance. If I wanted to hear that shit, I wouldn't have insisted my girlfriend get an abortion. I came here for brunch with my friends, not for a reminder of why you should practice safe sex and not practice monogamy. I guess it served both purposes. I got a yummy satisfying brunch and a side of feeling very lucky that I haven't fathered any snot nosed bastards despite decades of promiscuous brunching and some real close-calls on the menu. The bottomless coffee, the endless wailing, this place had it all.

A gem in Greenpoint. Everything we had was loaded with flavor.  A little mix up with my entree selection but ultimately it was delicious. They offered to remove the entree from the bill and did so even after I insisted that it was fine. This would be our spot if we lived in the neighborhood.

Esme has improved a lot since it's initial opening.  The menu has continued to be updated and the quality improved.  It's consistently good, if still a bit pricey.  The cocktails are particularly good, as well.  The brunch is a little uninspired, but mostly I can say I'm a fan.

Decent food, good service.  However, just one of those new high priced restaurants with trendy edison lightbulbs and no personality.  Overpriced for what it is and always seems emply.  I cant imagine Esme lasting in the neighborhood.

A couple friends told me about this place so I figured I would try it out with a friend over lunch. Let me just start off by saying the service absolutely sucked, I know the sole waitress is probably bitter cause she's in her mid 30s and is still working as a waitress but that's no reason to be rude to your customers, especially new ones. We had to practically beg to get our drinks refilled and separate checks. The food was ok, way over priced for what you get, it totaled out to about $16 for a Chicken sandwich and fries, no drink. Will not be going back, not into overpriced places with piss poor rude service.

Eagerly anticipated our first visit. We were promptly seated.....without menus. Others were seated. Our orders were taken and after others were served.....and others were served......our food finally arrived. There was no indication of regret for unreasonable delay. At least the food was good which allows me to give a few stars.
No comment

Starting to become our local brunch spot. The pork belly benedict is superb. Bloody mary on point. The old bay potatoes are yummy. Overall, it hits the spot. I went a couple times a while ago for dinner and remember it being not too shabby as well. Overall a great spot if you're looking for a casual solid meal in the neighborhood.

Our dinner was a little disappointing. Wine selection for price point was good, we enjoyed all of our drinks. We weren't super hungry so we skipped any additional sides or starters. We had the salmon and roasted chicken. Salmon was overdone for our taste and dry. Chicken was good (skin could have been less fatty). There were a couple sauces spread under the entire dish and one made anything it even touched rather unappetizing. Hate to use the word bad but... for the price range and what they were trying to go for, it just wasn't great. Drinks, service and atmosphere were perfect, food not so much.
Outstanding bistro near Queens. Quirky but good fun cocktails. Great American food with selection and quality. Both unique and filling restaurant in New York.
No comment
No comment
I love Esme so much. One of my favorite brunch spots in the neighborhood. The dinner is solid as well.

Even though I'm a vegetarian now,  I used to eat meat and Italian beef is one thing I missed. The vegetarian Italian "beef" sandwich captured the texture and taste very well. Looking forward to trying more dishes there!

Wow, outstanding. This is my new favorite Brooklyn restaurant, having lived here for 15 years. We came to Esme since we love the bar they co-own, Exley, which is right down the street from our home. We had no idea this place would knock our socks off like it did. Every dish a home run: pork belly, salmon, shrimp/chorizo. Loved it. We will be back, without fail.

One of the, if not the Best spot in the neighborhood. I find this location, particularly the cocktails, to be profoundly delightful. Very impressed with both service and cocktails!! You get your money worth here. Will certainly be back.

This was amazing food.  The roasted chicken was out of this world, as was the cauliflower and the smoked potatoes.  Also highly recommend the beautiful watermelon salad.  It's clear the chef takes time to choose the freshest, highest quality ingredients and prepares everything with perfection as the goal.  Absolutely delicious.
Loved everything about this restaurant, from the lighting, wait staff, food, and overall good vibe.

I gave Esme two chances to ignite my food senses but I failed to see the hype both times. I've had the savory French toast, pork belly eggs Benedict and the mussels (dinner) but nothing great came to mind. The food is average, but definitely a good place with a nice ambience to come get a drink or two and then make your way out.
No comment
No comment

Aces. The cocktails are expertly prepared, the food is delicious, interesting and amazingly satiating and the service is impeccable. Oh, and the ambiance is wonderful. Good music played low, lights soft but you can see your date (and your food). We had the war and peas and the autumn something #2 for drinks - both great but I prefer the former. Started with beef carpaccio and pork belly. Delicious, especially the pork belly. I had the duck and my husband had the steak. I think the steak may have eeked out the duck but both were amazing. Finished with the pistachio pound cake. A tiny bit dry but really delicious. Honestly above all was the service. We are so happy to have this place in our neighborhood and will be back often.

We stopped in for an early dinner on a Saturday evening, there was about a 15 min wait when we arrived, so we decided to grab a drink by the bar. Best thing we could have done! Their cocktails are killer, it may look a bit "creative" on the menu but once you have a taste, it'll just make sense. Hats off to the bartender. The best way to describe the food is that everything is just super fresh, I had the duck, while the BF had the steak, both were cooked to perfection with just the right amount of flavor.

i have been to this place about 5 times. they never disappoint with the service and experience. the brunch menu is my favorite but the dinner is great as well. i really suggest their cocktails because they are really unique

Got there around 11 am on Saturday morning and there was no wait to sit. The waitress, who was less than friendly, took our order and the wait began. It took about 45 minutes for my husband and I to get our food. I ordered fried eggs with pork belly and potatoes--no toast bc of a gluten allergy. Not only did my eggs have a hair on them, there was toast! But I was so low blood sugar and hangry that I removed the toast and hair and ate it. It took me 10 minutes to flag down someone to get me hot sauce and the waitress didn't check in at all. All in all the staff was rude, inattentive and messed up my order, I was served food with a hair on it (GROSS) and the actual food was just ok. Verdit: I will NEVER be going back.

Great place to go for dinner after concert nearby.   I ordered the beets appetizer, then the mushroom risotto, followed by flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  Everything was tasted amazing! Service was superb.  Highly recommended!!!
Best food in the neighborhood! The service is always on point and the wine and cocktail menu are well curated. Love this restaurant!!
SOLID cooking.  I have eaten here four times and tried many things from the menu, all incredibly cooked and exciting to eat.

I've eaten here a handful of times and never left a review, so here it is! Esme delivers each and every time I step inside. Not only are the people awesome, friendly, and attentive, but the food is incredible. My favorite menu items include the beet salad (even if you're on the fence about beets, I implore you to try it) & the polenta dish. What I like about Esme is that you get a decent amount of food for a fair price and the restaurant itself is unassuming from the outside, yet very trendy and modern-industrial on the inside. I only ever order wine, but the cocktail list is also impressive. I personally prefer dinner over brunch at this establishment.
Excellent service, great backyard, open in the summer. I have been here many times and have never had a bad experience. The food is always excellent and the atmosphere is great.

Fantastic food, great portions for the money and wine is priced perfectly. The restaurant has a nice vibe. The lighting is beautiful. The staff was very friendly. So glad I finally made it there. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
I love this place, fantastic burger, consistent quality and a great vibe.  Place always delivers the goods.  Looking forward to the outdoor seating!

We came in on a Friday evening. The atmosphere and service were fantastic. We didn't try any appetizers unfortunately. We got the veggie burger and the grass fed burger, and both were fantastic. The cocktails were also delicious. Highly recommend. We will return to try more of the menu.
No comment

The Blueberry Pancakes are fire. Definitely the way to go. I had the Big salad and a short stack of Blueberry pancakes. The salad was fresh and good but did not compare to the amazing consistency and flavor of the blueberry pancakes. Then again, salads never compare to a nice fluffy stack of pancakes. Should have known that. Overall great meal though, Solid price point and consistent tasty food. Bloody Mary was Fresh and definitely Tasty. Good Coffee. Nice menu selection. I will certainly be back. Overall nice atmosphere and great brunch spot but those pancakes certainly set it apart from other places. Not your typical heavy dense pancake. Nice and light, very fluffy and tasty! Thank you!
Amazing service. Amazing food. Came here for our anniversary and were treated like royalty. Highly recommend.

This place is a gem. The staff was on point from beginning to end. I arrived alone and was greeted promptly and graciously. I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and was bowled over by it! Served piping hot with a surprising onion jam, it was nothing like any grilled cheese I'd ever had and was accompanied by a healthy serving of spring greens salad. Dessert was a great little cheesecake tart with blueberry and the kitchen sent out a mouth watering white chocolate truffle like treat which I failed to get the name of but will never forget. I was there for lunch, had one glass of wine and my bill was under 20.00. I'm looking forward to being impressed  by their dinner selections soon!

Esme is a brand new, welcome addition to Greenpoint!  The food was amazing - from the apps (I could eat the beet salad every day), to the mains (delicious version of chicken & waffles, fantastic burger, a well done steak, pun intended, and my carnivorous friend even loved the squash & farro), as well as the desserts. Service was great and on point.  And of course the cocktails!  There were five of us so we actually tasted most of them - to die for!  We will definitely be back!
Get the Middle Kingdom cocktail! Eat anything on the menu, I have yet to eat anything that wasn't fantastic. Eating fried artichoke appetizer right now, and it is delicious. This place is top notch.
What a great place for brunch. It's a tad pricey, but the homemade sausage makes up for it.
Amazing new spot in Greenpoint. Excellent addition to the neighborhood. And the chef is sexy

The burger is still great but no more Dutch margaritas... And that makes me sad. Their salads are all pretty tasty, but their fries always come out a little too well done. Always friendly service and accommodating to children.
No comment
No comment
Good Brooklyn fare, in a classy setting, but feels a bit more relaxed than some places in the neighborhood. Good risotto. Great cocktail list.

Fun cocktail menu. Good service. Loud and crowded, such is life in the big city. Almost all of the mains looked fantastic. The roasted chicken with cheddar bread pudding was a wonderful bit of comfort food and was very well received. I was a little sad that my salmon was a little plain and the promised harissa was so light touch as to not add very much spice. Next time, I'll ask them to spice it up quite a bit.

The mister and I eat here probably once a week on average and we've never had a bad meal, not one...in fact never had a meal that wasn't completely delicious. The menu changes regularly so it's never boring. Great service, great atmosphere, best pancakes we've ever had.

Esme is stellar for brunch. I've had the chicken biscuit, the veggie burger and the burger. Their fries are superb. I have been for dinner and had mixed experiences. One time really fantastic, one time good. This restaurant is close to my house so I eat here semi-frequently. The space is wonderful and the service is great. They have a spacious back patio that is partially sheltered.

The stars are for the staff - great service! Food is nothing special except for the fries everything is way overpriced! I'm not sure why this place gets such a great reviews there's nothing special about it...
Killing it w both familiar and pushing it territory. Good drinks and good service. You're gonna love it

The food here is exceptional.  Everything we had (pork belly app, borscht salad, chicken liver mousse, mussels, short rib entree) was amazing.  Nothing was mundane, and everything exceed my expectations.  The cocktails were also fantastic.  And they were very accommodating about my somewhat picky tastes with wine pairings.  Can't wait to go back!

Man, I so want to like this place since it is cute and 3 minutes away, but I have been twice now for brunch and was disappointed both times. I don't understand what people are raving about here. The first time I had the pork belly benedict, the second time I had the fried chicken sandwich. The potatoes with the benedict were dry and sad, and the fries, which they charge you an insane $6 for, are nothing special. The pork belly and the chicken sandwich were also really low on flavor (though the chicken was fried well).  Everything just seemed to lack love, including the waitstaff. Perhaps dinner is better, but I won't be back to find out.

We went for dinner, and had a very tasty hamburger and vegetarian burger. We also had a rum/carrot cocktail (which tasted more like an orange soda, would not recommend) and mescal cocktail (excellent). Service was very good, although it took far too long for our food given what we ordered and the fact that it wasn't egregiously busy.

My girlfriend loves this place, and it's a pretty good date spot. They're pretty good all around. Service is always good, and the cocktails are solid... I just don't really love how the chef seems to play it too safe. I feel like, for the price, the food isn't as interesting as it could be. Perhaps they can step it up a bit with the excitement factor.
No comment
No comment

I stopped in late at night to dine at Esme and worried about being one of those people who keeps servers there late. Turns out our server was the warm, friendly owner and our food was delicious. I had the salmon and I usually don't like salmon. It was tender and flavorful, and shared the plate with a sautéed treviso that provided a nice flavor and texture contrast. We were not rushed, and the space is stunning -- gorgeous light fixtures and tables. Loved my wine, and I will be back again.

Our daughter got married in Brooklyn and was having a vegetarian wedding. I called restaurants that could accommodate a brunch party of 25-30 carnivore people and found ESME. We rented the back patio which was so lovely for an early October brunch. A lot of family was coming in from Florida for the wedding. Hurricane Matthew stormed most of Florida and several guests were unable to make it to Brooklyn because of it. We contacted Adam at the restaurant and he graciously accommodated whomever could show. When we arrived the table looked amazing with fruits, cinnamon rolls, and flowers displayed. The food was outstanding!! Some guests had said that they had been there before and it was one of the best restaurants in Brooklyn. The service was so attentive and we were treated like royalty. It was the delicious food, however that stood out!! Wish they had catered the wedding. Remarkable food, impeccable attention to detail, attentive service, beautiful atmosphere, and a cuisine that deserves 5 stars!! Thank you to everyone especially Adam V. We will return on our next visit to Brooklyn.
No comment

Went to Esme for the first time last night and was blown away by how awesome the food was. The atmosphere was very warm and inviting. The lighting and music topped it off. The service was some of the best I've had. Someone in our party was vegan and they were more than able to accommodate. I highly recommend the Brussels sprout beet salad as well as the risotto. Cocktails were also excellent. The price point was perfect for the experience. Will return.

Was walking down Manhattan with a local friend and both of us were craving a great burger. We stumbled upon Esme and a great burger we got! Juicy and cooked to perfection. I got a nice medium-rare with blue cheese. Our quick-witted server added to the experience. He was funny and was very adamant on our burger experience. I would go back in a heart beat!

I don't go to Brooklyn often, but cute places like this make the trips worth it. I went for brunch and immediately got a table for 2 at noon on a Saturday. Fried chicken sandwich and a Pimms cup for $25 total.  So good!  The ambiance is modern/casual, and the staff is very friendly.

Eaten here a few times and been happy with every experience.  Cocktails are good and staff is very nice.  The food is on point, except the veggie burger, which I've had twice and it's been dry.  Don't let that keep you from coming here though, the salads are excellent and main courses are all good.  Nice to eat inside during the day, lots of natural light.  I'm a stickler for atmosphere and my only issue is the evening dining light which is all Edison style bulbs.. super orangey which makes me kind of nuts, but then again I'm picky and irritable.

What a lovely place for brunch in Greenpoint - phenomenal food for reasonable prices (albeit with a bit of a wait). My friend and I went here around 1:30pm on a Sunday, and our wait was only about 15 minutes. Esme is small, but with a crisp, modern design, and the massive windows in the front let in plenty of natural light. My friend ordered the savory French toast, which was even better than it sounds: two massive slices of French toast with tomato-roasted kale, poached eggs, and (what I think was) parmesan cheese. Tomatoes and kale go great together, and the large slices of bread made this a filling, but not overly heavy dish. My dish was also excellent - eggs benedict with (yes) pork belly and roast potatoes. Oh MAN was this delicious. The pork belly was cooked perfectly such that it was tender, but not too rare, and the hollandaise sauce had the right hint of tabasco sauce to complement the egg. And these potatoes, whoa! They were crispy and so well-seasoned, possibly the best brunch potatoes I've had a looooong time. With two dishes and a coffee, the bill came to around $24, so all things considered, not bad at all for a delicious meal in BK. Can't wait to go back!
all i have to say is the fried chicken sandwich. it's tasty with great flavors.  subtle curry hint.

ESME is our go-to neighborhood restaurant--especially when we have out-of-towners over. We've gone for brunch, happy hour, and dinner, and have never been disappointed! We love that the cocktail and dinner menu changes seasonally. Some standout dishes that you absolutely have to try... For appetizer, the bibb lettuce, blue cheese, buttermilk, pork belly, and crispy onions; or the crispy calamari, honey, chili, black pepper, and garlic aioli. For main: the P.E.I. mussels, with fennel, Calabrian chili, lemon, Pernod, and house-cut fries; the roast chicken; ricotta cavatelli; and the burger is always reliable. And they always have specials that make the choice even than much harder! Brunch gets packed, but we've never really had an issue getting seated during weeknight dinner. The cocktails are carefully hand-crafted, the wine selection is solid, and the drafts are nice and chilled.

This is our new favourite place in the neighborhood. It's pricey, very pricey for Greeenpoint, but it is really great. We've been for brunch, lunch, and dinner. It's been perfect every time. They cocktails are fantastic too, so if you're not hungry but want a drink then I'd recommend you head to the bar.

Came in on a Saturday around 7:30pm for dinner in a group on 3. Service was attentive and helpful. We shared our plates, started with the Borscht Salad ($10, excellent), the Butter Lettuce salad ($9, meh) and Fries ($5, large portion). For mains we had the roasted chicken ($22), risotto ($19) and short rib ($25). Overall the food was prepared well and taste was on point, but didn't really stand out in the endless sea of Modern American restaurants in NYC that serve exactly the same things. The cocktails ($12), however, stole the show - had the Dutch Marg and Autumn Garage #2 - Wow! Unique and delicious.  Will definitely make this a future destination for a small bite and drinks.

Loved it, our waiter was amazing, he had an expertise that I hadn't experienced in a long time. I ordered the risotto vegetarian platter and he said it was his favorite, and it really was the bomb. We all had cocktails and the green pea vodka was the best. Highly recommend this spot.
Cocktails on point.  Absolutely delicious.   Great lighting.   Definitely coming back for dinner.

I can't say enough good things about Esme.  The food is always inventive and delicious.  I haven't had one thing on the menu that I did not love.  More than the food, the atmosphere is great.  Nathan, the owner, always tries to make the experience one that you leave and say "how can I make another excuse to come here again."  Make sure you have a reservation, especially on weekends!  I took my family there and the table that was supposed to be ours loved the experience so much that they wouldn't leave.  What could have been irritating wasn't.  Without prompting, Nathan gave us all some champagne and some other treats from the menu.  Go there and go often! Planning on trying the brunch soon as well.
No comment

Love the brunch here! I come every Sunday to order the all-American breakfast. The bacon is perfectly cooked, the eggs are fresh, and the bottomless coffee just takes it over the edge. Would definitely recommend.

Love this place! I have been here a few times since moving to the neighborhood and if there are 2 things I can recommend they would be 1. Get a burger, they are great! and 2. Come here for brunch! The service has always been great with very attentive waiters. Bottom line is you will love this place!
No comment
No comment

Excellent.  Well prepared. Attentive service.  Good home and comfy food.  Was a bit short on time and was not able to lounge as much as we would have liked.  The staff and kitchen were very accommodating given our time.
One of the better meals I've had in ny ever. Great drinks, absolutely perfect food and nice setting.
They have one of the most amazing veggie burgers I've ever had. Their cocktails are always delicious.

Based on one visit only. Got seated very quickly and service good during the whole visit. Feels like this restaurant haven't gotten a little bit too good reviews. My bisquit and gravy with pork sausage tasted absolutely nothing. I don't understand how you can make sausage and gravy without any flavor:-(
This was my second time dining at Esme! Loved the food and the service makes you feel very special!
Never had a bad meal here! That's a rare statement for a New York restaurant.

Super friendly staff in a beautiful space. Well-curated beer list with food that is creatively described , pleasingly plated, but completely void of any sensible flavor.  Beet / Brussel sprout salad would have been good if the sprouts weren't deep fried. Vege burger, polenta with mushroom, and butternut risotto were all tasteless. Interestingly, all the food seems to have been cooked perfectly but fell flat when it came to flavor. $125 / 3 people  . One star for the space and one for the side of French fries. Deep breath - cmon NY!!!! Off topic - Kings imperial under the BQE May renew your interest in Brooklyn dining
Really great addition to Greenpoint. The veggie burger is one of the best I've had in NYC.

I honestly don't know why people rave about the brunch here. Their potatoes were fried to dust, the poached eggs were over cooked and the savory French toast was just mehh. Disappointed overall given all the hype.

This place look nice, has nice out door seating. The cocktails are different but very good. The food was good nothing extraordinary but the waitress was not very aware of the menu and she had a bit of an attitude.
Better than I expected! I loved the veggie sausage! I need to come back and try more dishes
great little spot, with really accommodating and helpful staff. love it!

We had brunch here after enjoying dinner last month.  Our 30 minute wait for a table was expertly handled as the host seated us at the bar and when we were ultimately seated quickly brought a plate of their famous warm beignets over , gratis along with a "thanks for your patience".   The pancakes and waffles with sausage were excellent. Our dinner was also excellent, particularly the vege pot pie. Very highly recommend, great food and service.

Fantastic food and cocktails, all really handled with care and balance. The pork belly was out of this world, and perfectly prepared. Great service, all well. So nice to see a place paying attention to service details, like changing silverware between courses and waiting to clear any plates until everyone is done eating-- details which are often overlooked, but I really appreciate. Our waitress was also very attentive, genuinely personable (not in a forced, chain-restaurant way) and extremely knowledgeable on the all the questions we asked. The only SLIGHT thing I'll say is that the chair (folding wooden ones) were a bit uncomfortable after 3 courses and after-dinner drinks. They look great, and really add to the clean, minimalist aesthetic, but my butt was getting a bit sore!  Pain I'll endure again, because the experience was that great!
Our dinner was great. The service was excellent. Was a little over priced. Also was a little too well lit.  Maybe turn the lights down a little.

Great food and the owner is amazing!  My fiancé and I went out for dinner there and after having a fabulous meal, the check came and we were a little taken aback, after taking a look at the menu again we discovered that we had ordered a hundred dollar bottle of wine (their most expensive) and had misread the price as $30!  Completely 100% our fault.  The owner came over when he heard what happened.  We said there was no problem, we made a mistake, we had a lovely bottle of wine, we loved our meal, there was no problem with the check.  He insisted on taking the wine off our check and there was no dissuading him.  This was so incredibly nice!  Great food and above and beyond service!  A welcome addition to Greenpoint and a restaurant we'll be visiting often!
No comment

One of the Best restaurants in New York. Was taken there for my birthday, what a surprise. Ever dish was better then the last. Defiantly worth the trip into Greenpoint. The staff is top notch. can't wait to go back for brunch.

Let me preface this review by saying that this is my first yelp review, this place was worth taking the time to write a review about! This place is killer! Amazing food that you will dream about later! The pork belly appetizer and bruschetta are tasty, flavorful, and memorable. The flank steak and chicken and waffles are comfort food with a twist. Seriously I cannot stress how great the food was and how nice and down to earth the waitstaff was. The cocktails and dessert are also not to be missed! My favorite cocktail was the Zelda Fitzgerald ( a tasty gin number) and the dessert to beat was the grapefruit compote with sea salted Carmel (it tasted like a deconstructed playful key lime pie). This place is a new favorite.

I came here with my friend and we had what was a really nice experience until i got my entree. On a saturday night we only waited 20 minutes for a table, there was room at the bar so the waiting was easy, the Zelda Fitzgerald cocktail I ordered was great. We had a tomato soup with basil, a fragrant oil, and croutons,and it was delicious. I ordered the vegetable pot pie and my friend got the flat iron steak. Our dishes looked beautiful and I was so excited to take a bite of the golden crust and warm veggie filling. Instead I started eating what was all crunchy root vegetables. My pot pie was very obviously undercooked. Maybe they ran out of filling and tried to make more on the fly, i dont know. But it tasted like Half cooked veggies in a hot creamy sauce. Just...no. The onions were the worst tho and I LOVE onions tons of em in a salad but not like that in a pot pie. The pieces should be tender to the bite, flavor melting together and with the crust. I tried to enjoy the crust at least but that is like hardly any food. So for the first time in my life I had to ask to send something back and all I ordered was mashed potatoes instead. There was no apology or anything and they charged me for both items!! They finally agreed to take off the mashed potatoes. Big woop those were actually good!!! I dot mind being charged for edible food and great food! As a vet of the foodnetwork and serious eats Im really really shocked that the chef was a James Beard winner, he should know better. Maybe it was an off night but it sure ruined mine. Sad about this experience bec I was very excited about this restaurant, hopefully they don't do this to anyone else-it's super insulting. Guys srsly just dont be assholes. I've never left a place feeling so cheated and so hungry...and I'll even usually begrudgingly eat an over cooked burger or something I don't love. Ugh. Now I should go leave nice reviews for the places I enjoy and who don't insult their diners if a mistake is made.
really liked the food. glad some good things are finally coming to greenpoint.
No comment

Views for days, an absolute laid back vibe, strong drinks and fantastic food - What more could you want?  This is a South Street Seaport must visit for after work al fresco decompressing.  The owners are all locals and regulars so when you're there you feel like you're in their backyard.  This place is a total gem on Pier 16!

Very casual waterfront restaurant. Nice views on the outdoor patio, but limited umbrella shade during the summer. FYI they only have bottled water. Very simple menu. We split the chips & guacamole and soft pretzel with beer cheese. Skip the Guac, it's very bland. The pretzel was basic, but the beer cheese was good. I had a spicy lobster roll, which was good. The food wasn't anything to write home about, but we did enjoy the laidback patio.

Let's start by saying it is the most cutest comfiest spot the seats are so cozy the ambiance is awesome the customer service is great we dined in the seafood paella fried shrimp Po boy fish tacos banana pudding and their fruit juice was so fresh and tasty I loved this spot it was so nice after a flic at ipic #minios

Enjoyed being by the water but that was about it. My beer didn't taste great and we ordered ice waters which the waitress made sure to point out were unfiltered. Seemed like a strategy to upsell bottles of water. Also the dock area rocked a bit with the water which upset my girlfriend's stomach.
No comment

My favorite summer spot. They have an amazing po boy sandwich. The drinks are also great.  I don't believe they are open during the winter, which is a disappointment but other than that this place is a great.

Decent spot if you're in South St. Seaport area. Pretty casual -- beer served in plastic cups; chairs were a little stained/dirty -- but it's nice to be by the water. They were out of frozen margaritas the Saturday night that we went. Bathroom is in a trailer-like structure.
No comment
No comment

Lovely atmosphere in the late summer. We ordered mushroom croquettes, shrimp, and fish and chips. The only item that I wasn't a huge fan of was the fried fish in the fish and chips. The fries were one of my favorites, very crispy/crunchy. Good sauces for everything. And it's an affordable place with great views! Would come back!

Great atmosphere! We got the beer battered fries with garlic aioli and could not stop eating them. We also got the quac and chips. The fish and chips were incredible, the batter was light and SO fresh! The fish tacos were good, wish they were in a corn tortilla though.
Small portion for big money nice view slow service dirty bathrooms much better places to go
No comment
No comment
Hannah (trainee) and Ryan took fantastic care of me and my business guests. And on top of it, the food was great and the breeze was amazing. This place is a gem. Eat, drink, enjoy here.
No comment
They had really good service and the food was really good. Great outdoor spot! Cozy and great view.

column3: Central West End, Saint Louis, MO
column6: No comment

Awesome spot on the pier and the drinks were really good! Our waitress was fantastic and definitely made it a super fun along with relaxing environment! We had the shrimp and fish tacos which didn't disappoint. Give them a try!
No comment

I threw my engagement party here with around 40 people. It was everything and more. My family and friends were so thrilled with the service from the staff. The food was absolutely delicious, especially the lobster rolls and the jam croquets. The location was incredible, nothing better than being on the water in NYC as the sun was setting. Thank you Cobblefish!
No comment
No comment

Had a great night out with friends at Cobble Fish. Great drinks and food. The owners are great and greeted us to help us find a table and seats! Love Neil and Renee! Felt like we were in the Hamptons and dining al fresco! Great music, vibe and really nice crowd! Will definitely go back soon! Great for locals as super decor, atmosphere and fabulous location..

We were visiting NY this past weekend and stumbled across this cute little spot. Great service and amazing seafood!! Everything tasted really fresh  and had great flavors. We had the calamari, fries, fish tacos, and lobster roll. Definitely a must when u are visiting the area!
Great mahi fish tacos and the owner Victor couldn't be more hospitable!  Great views of the bridge. Wave chaser on tap clinches the deal.
Best food and service yesterday I had chicken Marsala it was amazing .

Arrived on time and they sat us rather quickly.  Liked the ambiance, the servers, and especially the food.  The Mango Bellini was great for the family.  Everything was tasty and brought within a reasonable time.  Great serving sizes.  Did not feel rushed and definitely will return!

The best spot I tried in New York I was wondering where the good food was at and it's here Verde on Smith great service. we had  the unlimited mimosas and they kept coming quick.  Food talk fried mozzarella were so cheesy and stringy, chicken dish was so good I forgot what it was called but it was stuffed with eggplant and cheese. I tried my cousin steak which she order well done and let me tell y'all it was well done but juicy I wanna say best piece of steak I had.. drink must grab beside mimosa's Strawberry blossom so refreshing made with strawberry's. Don't sleep on this place y'all

No comment

The food was horrible along with the service as well. I will never come here again and to top it off they charged gratuity on top of the bill. My service was not even worth the gratuity they put on the bill. What happened?
No comment

I organized a family dinner of 15 here and it was perfect! The owner and staff made it so easy and fun. The food was delicious! We sat in the outdoor patio - weather was lovely, they opened the retractable roof and loved eating in the open air. Eggplant lasagnetta, grilled salmon and mango sorbet were delish.

No comment

What an amazing quaint place. It's not large but definitely accommodating. They have two outdoor seating areas in front and our back. The back area flows indoors seamlessly. The food was amazing. They had bottomless mimosas for an hour for a cheap price to add on to the meal.
No comment

I visited this establishment yesterday evening with family and friends. I ordered the fried calamari as my appetizer which was delicious. I had the Salerno Sunset which was good as well. For my entree I had the Chicken Sorrentino. The Chicken Sorrentino didn't wow me. There is way to much cheese in the dish and the mashed potatoes had no flavor. This is why I'm giving the review 4 stars. The server was nice. He kept refilling our water and ensured that when our plates were empty he would clear the table. I'm willing to give the restaurant another try maybe I'll attend their brunch.

So I ordered the steak and pasta it was good. My husband had the rib eye and that was delicious. The baked clams were delicious. The sangria was just wine, I ordered a sprite and poured it in to help repair it. I was looking forward to coming to this restaurant based on the pictures on Instagram. It wasn't even close to what I had imagined. The service and attentiveness were great but everything else was just average.

Great ambience but the food is average or slightly below average. The portion to price does not match and could be more food for the price. We concluded that most people that gave the restaurant a 4 or 5 were tipsy from the bottomless mimosas which seem good but I don't drink so I was there for the food and not the drinks; hence, the 3 stars.
Brunch is very good dinner not as much. Dinner can get expensive as well but brunch is yummy and pretty reasonable.

I love that brunch is served everyday. I had the penne ala vodka with shrimp and calamari as an appetizer. The food was really good and the restaurant itself is a pretty restaurant. The only downfall was it was busy so refilling our mimosas took some time and also bottomless brunch being 60 mins sucks. I'm used to 90 mins or two hours. I do love that the mimosas and Bellinis had different flavors and we got to try most of them. I would go back to this restaurant.

Friendly and good service from the moment you walk in. The restaurant ambiance is more like a bistro, but it is Italian food. The food is basic but tasty and there are several things to choose from pasta to various types of meat.
No comment
Friendly staff, good food, and good drinks. They have bottomless brunch and the drinks were pretty strong. Perfect for a day out with friends.

I have been here twice before and both times the food was excellent! Both times I ordered the same thing - Breakfast Avocado Toast and a Pineapple Bellini. It was a great portion for the price, and the bottomless drinks are a great value - although I only ever ordered one drink and never ordered the bottomless. The only complaint I have about this restaurant is the service. On my first visit, I had no issues. However, on my recent visit a few days ago I was very unhappy with the service and attitude from the waiter. I ordered a Fried Egg on my avocado toast, as the menu stated you have a choice between Fried Egg, Scrambled, or Poached Egg. When he brought out my food, there were scrambled eggs on top of my avocado toast. I then informed him that I had ordered fried eggs, to which he told me that these were fried eggs because the eggs are fried. He went back and forth with me, trying to correct me that the term I was looking for was "Sunny Side Up." However, I am a chef so I think I know the difference between different styles of eggs. Also, a quick google search will show you that Fried Eggs are the same (also known as) Sunny Side Up - there are just two names for it. Once you scramble the yolk, the egg is no longer a traditional "Fried Egg," but rather scrambled eggs, as you have scrambled them. So if what he served me wasn't scrambled eggs, but rather a Fried Egg, I am confused as to what their scrambled eggs look like. Although it may have been a simple mistake from the kitchen, it was the attitude and condescending attitude from the waiter that really turned me off. All he had to say was "No worries, let me bring it back for you." It is just strange to me that a waiter at a brunch restaurant seriously doesn't know what a Fried Egg is and has the nerve to correct me when a simple Google search proves him wrong. Even after showing him the Google search, he still insisted I was wrong. It was so strange to me! Next time I visit Court St I may just check out a different brunch spot, not to run into this waiter again!

Yes... okay yes to this restaurant. I don't know how I found out about it but I've had it bookmarked for quite awhile. Came in for an early dinner last Saturday and was not disappointed. We were seated on the back patio which is gorgeous and thee perfect vibe for a summer evening. They started us off with complimentary bruschetta which was yummy! We got the mussels and calamari to start..highly recommend both. The star of the show for me was the Bronzino. I was in lovee. It was grilled to absolute perfection and the flavors were insane. I highhlly recommend. If you don't mind deboning it yourself I'd go for the whole one instead of the filet. Service here was awesome too. You need to bring cash to this place though because they charge you when you pay by credit card --which I think is tacky btw. I would come back though WITH CASH!
No comment
No comment

I went there for brunch on a Sunday at 1:30. Me and my friends had a reservation and were seated a little later, which was fine because some of us were running late. we were seated in the "outdoor" area which was pretty well heated and covered. I ordered Canadian eggs Benedict that came with brussels sprouts and potatoes, the brussels sprouts were OK nothing exceptional, the potatoes were good and the eggs Benedict were pretty good, not too much hollandaise sauce however, they got cold fairly quickly. I'm not sure if it was the space or just eating a bit slow. Also got the unlimited bottomless brunch which was $22 a pretty good deal and you were able to switch the drink so I started with a peach Bellini, then to a mango Bellini and I also tried a pineapple Bellini. all of them were delicious and the waiter was really on top of bringing us a new glass when we were finished. A small tip is to pay in cash so you don't get the 2-3% credit card charge.
No comment

I was taken here for my birthday brunch in December. Upon arrival, staff checks your vaccination cards. (Pretty standard in NYC) We had a reservation and were seated almost immediately. It was around 2pm, so there were only a few other diners anyway. For the meal, I ordered the pappardelle in tomato sauce. It wasn't on the menu, however I knew they served it based on a previous post. My bf ordered the burger and fries. We also had the bottomless brunch mimosas. The food was delicious and was served in decent portion sizes. The mimosas were pretty great too lol! Definitely left there with a buzz. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall giving this restaurant five stars, will definitely be back.
Weekend in Brooklyn and we found this place for our last dinner!  Staff, food, cocktails were all awesome!  We sat outside and enjoyed people watching and feeling the life of the city around us!
No comment

I really can't wait to return here. Was visiting NY for the weekend and found this place online. There was a slight wait to get seated because we didn't have a reservation but we were quickly accommodated. Sat in the outdoor patio which was super cute. I kid you not but this was the best steak and eggs I've had in a very long time. The service was great too. My friends enjoyed their meals as well + the overall ambiance was relaxing. Highly recommend this place for brunch, would like to return and try their lunch options IG: @mayzmind
Came here with my mom for her birthday and it was so good! Prices are reasonable and food is amazing
No comment

The brunch is amazing and the mimosas are great! The service was fabulous too, and I love that they have brunch everyday. The prices are not expensive and it is a nice calm atmosphere. Definitely recommend.

The food is always perfect.  Great staff, drinks and atmosphere.  I've been for brunch and dinner; never disappointed.
No comment

Verde on Smith used to be one of my go to brunch spots a few years ago. I haven't been in a long time so when a friend mentioned she went and enjoyed it so much and asked would I like to have our next meet-up there I was more than willing. We went for a late weekday brunch and the weather was a bit meh so it was pretty empty that day. I ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo and it was a nice portion with good flavors. I also ordered crème brûlée for dessert and a cappuccino. We were permitted to stay past the 90 min brunch seating time allowance as it was a slower day. We really enjoyed our meal. It's great to know that they have been a consistent staple all these years. I saw menu items I knew and loved from a few years back. Definitely a great option for brunch as they have weekday and weekend brunch. The wait service was very pleasant and helpful!

The brunch here is great. Very affordable prices. I've only done take out from this place but I highlight recommend the French toast as well as the steak and eggs which comes with a side of roasted potatoes and veggies.

The food is delicious!!! The French toast and mimosas were everything!!!! I will definitely go back!!

Had taken a day off for myself to have  some time without hearing mom mom mom all the time. Anywhoo I stopped at this spot for brunch and I have to say I love it . Bottomless mimosas, Bellini , screw driver or Bloody Mary for $21 was amazing to start with. The waiter kept making sure my cup wasn't empty and that was just what I needed. I ordered the classic steak & eggs and yum. I was happy with the whole experience. Will definitely return for more brunches!!!
No comment

As Spring break is coming to an end and the weather was beautiful, I decided to take the kids for a mid-week brunch date. As we walked closer to the location I noticed that there is an front outside dining and inside dining.  However, as we entered the location we noticed that there's also patio  dining (the  ambience of the location is breathtaking). As we sat, I thought to myself "I hope the food is plenty full" and to my pleasant surprise the food was exactly that. So much so I have to get a to go container. I would definitely return and recommend.  Verde on Smith is a most go destination.

The food was superb as always and the service is phenomenal. Great ambiance! Always a great place to eat.
Omgg sooo good I love this spot.. The bartenders are great I think I met all of them so far... lol. Everyone in there is nice far as the staff. I definitely recommend and I will be back..

I've been to this place once (ate at the bar) and also ordered delivery from here. Delicious both times. The vibe at the restaurant is lively -- they keep busy and it's a nice-looking, diverse Big Apple crowd. I think they have an outdoor area too but I'm a bar kinda guy and their bartender was great. I had the vegetable omelette with a side of Italian sausage (and mimosas of course) and everything was top notch. Couple months later, ordered delivery which came piping hot and tasted just as good. There are so many options for food in NYC. I'm just thankful to have run into this place, my new go-to brunch spot.
No comment

Surprised by all of the great reviews. Maybe it's strictly a brunch spot. For $120 the two plates of pasta were bad. Not ok...literally unpleasant to eat. The vodka sauce was watery and flavorless, with the prevailing note being onion. The carbonara was all cream and similarly flavorless. Simply not worth it. Did not finish our plates. Additionally, it was a $10 surcharge per plate for spaghetti and penne...Went straight to Vinny's  afterwards for good food. If you're looking for bottomless Italian brunch there are many MUCH better options out there.
No comment
Went there for a friend Bday dinner mostly cuz she loves Mojitos & bottomless brunch but the food not that nice ..I love the bottomless brunch but they need to work on the food

I had my birthday brunch here back in September 2019! It was a vibe for sure. The drinks were flowing and the food was A1. My friend managed to tell our waitress to bring over a cake too which was nice and everyone sang "happy birthday" to me. Apparently, there was another table that was also celebrating their birthday!
No comment
No comment
Service was excellent & food was amazing & fresh!!! Definitely coming back! Ambiance is relaxing & clean

Came here for brunch while visiting Brooklyn. The food was so good and the bottomless drinks were amazing, not bad for $30 for 60min. My friends and I all chose the Bellini and we switched the flavors, tried them all basically. We all agreed pineapple and mango were the best. Friendly service as well, all the servers were welcoming and they worked together as a team. You're giving a "shot" of hand sanitizer upon entry.

We came here yesterday for my sisters birthday on a Sunday around 3:30 pm. We decided to go with the boozy brunch option ($22 with an entree) while the others in the party settled on just regular brunch/dinner courses. The table behind us was excessively loud and people actually asked to be moved away because of how loud they were. All the tables were pretty crowded together. It was hard to maneuver around. We were sat in the back room.  I could barely hear the music. Also our waiter wasn't the friendliest guy, was whatever about everything. We were waiting pretty long for our last few round of drinks and then the waiter came up to me and my sister and said "ok your time is up" after not being seen for 15 mins. I will say the food was good. I ended up getting the chicken sandwich with fries and it came with brussle sprouts as well. Those were delicious. But the Alfredo pasta was pretty bland. I wouldn't come back here unfortunately, there are definitely better brunch options out there.

Who doesn't love Brunch @ Verde on Smith. Gem in Brooklyn on a great street filled with a number of eateries. Yes the wait is long on weekends but timing is everything. The food hasn't failed me yet. So I will always be back..Front outdoor seating as well as backyard seating so there are def options but just get there early when dining for brunch- No reservations for brunch either. See ya soon!

No comment
Went here as on a date last night and everything was great. The food was delicious and the drinks tasted just as good. The servers were nice and accommodating. Will definitely come back

Verde on smith is such a vibe .. I've been here twice, once for dinner and one for brunch . Both times were amazing . The food is amazing and the Bellinis for brunch hit the SPOT . Their steak is amazing and the staff is very attentive and helpful .

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Sangria and mimosas are really good would go back for the drinks. The food was okay, had the salmon with spinach and rice

Wow - 5 star experience!  My cousin is in town from SF and we were looking for a spot in this area.  I found Verde on Smith on Yelp and made a reservation for outdoor seating for 3 of us.  Because outdoor wasn't specified on OpenTable, I called to make sure and the guy who answered the phone was very nice and accommodating.  As we got closer to the date of our dinner, there was a Covid surge in NYC and the outdoor dining was even more imperative.  We grabbed drinks at Clover Club next door and headed over at 7PM on Fri.  It was not crowded at all - they let us check out the back patio - but to me it felt too enclosed, so we opted for a little "bubble" on the sidewalk.  It was great.  They even put a space heater in there to keep us warm.  The menu looked great - lots of options in the Italian/Mediterranean realm.  They started us with delicious bread (refilled twice) and we ordered a bottle of wine, apps (Goat Cheese Salad and Tuscan Stuffed Shrimp), entrees (Lobster Feast for them and Salmon Scaloppini for me), Creme Brulee for dessert, and Sparkling Moscato for them and Irish Coffee for me.  All of it was delicious.  We devoured everything.  Service was great - even though we were outside, they checked on us multiple times (refilling our water as needed), everyone fully masked, and even zipped up our little bubble each time they left.  We were all impressed by the food and the service and more importantly, I felt extremely comfortable with the seating during this tense time in the city.  Highly recommend this place, and even my visiting cousin told me I should come back again.
Pretty packed for a Saturday at noon, but I'm sure that's because of their brunch! Got a spot at the bar right away and enjoyed my meal. Ambience, food and drink was great.
Everything about this spot is good... attentive and customer service great... food good ... price is RIGHTTT.. mimosa dont miss..
Food was absolutely delicious. The spinach omelette was on point very filling and flavorful.  The bottomless mimosas could have been stronger but they we good for the price I paid.
The food here is so delicious. My husband and I came here for brunch for his birthday we had the bottom less mimosa. Everything was A1 I would definitely be back food was so good

Good atmosphere, attentive staff, delicious food and good wine selection. Intimate indoors, cozy back yard dining area, still an overall great experience. If you're driving parking might be a little tough. Will definitely visit again.

Brunch is a go to! I've been to brunch a handful of times here. The pancakes, French toast, chicken crepes, and chicken Alfredo are all pretty great. Definitely a must try!

We experienced Verde's excellent dinner service this evening.  If you're looking for a location for a birthday evening, this is a great spot. The service is exquisite!! The staff was beyond expectation.  The food was absolutely delicious.  They brought out a birthday themed dessert plate - so lovely!  We'll be back soon.

Amazing brunch / boozy deal. 55 for a pitcher of mimosa and two entrees. Got the smoked salmon Benedict and vegetable omelette. Quality of the food was excellent. Back yard patio was very comfortable and cute but there were flies here and there which I think could be taken care of better.
