What kind of restaurant owner turns away patrons who had a reservation and a pregnant woman???
No comment

We always have an exceptional time coming here! Their staff is friendly and helpful and their food is ALWAYS AMAZING. Cute italian ambiance. A perfect place for a saturday night dinner.  Another true gem in brooklyn.
No comment
No comment

We had a reservation for 2pm and still waited until 3pm to seat our party. The manager seemed to be afraid to manage the party currently there and tell them that their 2 hours of brunch and bottomless mimosas were up 30 mins ago. We literally had to speak to the manager about 4 times before he gained enough courage to ask the table "how much longer will you be here?" Fortunately they finally said they were leaving now. Apparently they do not honor reservations here so be prepared to wait regardless. We were finally seated and eating after 3pm. I had the Spanish omelette which was nothing special. The potatoes it came with were dry and only tolerable after drowning them in ketchup. Even though they seated us late we had to go back and forth with the server to honor the 2 hour bottomless mimosas we paid for since they tried to cut it short. Needless to say, we will NOT be revisiting the establishment. The food was far too average to deal with the bad customer service and wait.
No comment

Nice-looking place, charming owner - went there with a Groupon for the first time, unfortunately won't be going back.  The food was very average and reminded me of typical easy-to-make Italian dishes that I would have made myself.  And the service was a joke.  I did discover robiola cheese - made in Northern Italy - like Italian cream cheese, delicious.  Overall would not recommend eating here, there is much better Italian in our neighborhood!

This place was just delicious!  I gave 5 stars to try and up their average because I didn't understand why they were 3.5!  The eggplant lasagna app was delish, and so was the orrechiette with spec and chickpeas.  YUM YUM YUM!!!

Last sunday me and some friends had unlimited brunch here the food was amazing and the drinks were strong but lacked flavor; Which is not an issue for me, enjoying a stiff one from time to time is ok. Service on the  other hand was the worst I ever had in New York. My waiter was extremely rude when responding to questions and acted like it was an burdon on him to service my table. On top of that he took my friends plates off the table when they were still eating CRAZY right. Louis you will never get my service or money agian.
Loveeeeeeeeee...the tiramisu is fantastic.... Thanks, Carissa    ™®
I love this place- my fav for brunch! Just wish it was bigger - when it gets busy it can get packed-def a regular for me
Very confused and rude staff.  Food was sub-par and the staff had no idea how to handle their own groupon

Beautiful space. I can tell that this place will be hopping once the weather turns a bit warmer. Overall we had a great experience, but I believe they may want to explore the menu. It appeared things were inexpensive, but with a lot of two-tops, it lacked enough "shareable items." The menu is dominated by pasta items that appear small and then larger plates. A meat + cheese plate would be welcomed  as well as some crostini options. They were really very affordable for the food, but $7 for a draft beer is a lot in this area of brooklyn. Will try it again soon.
No comment
Loved it!  The owner Cono is very nice. The staff is very attentive. The food is great! Great looking place!
No comment
Excellent food and atmosphere. Live music and great a experience.  I Would definitely recommend Verde!
Amazing steak & eggs!! And boozy brunch with good service, always a plus. Love that there's a champagne only option. Will definitely come back!

Meh meh meh meh meh skip it. The mussels tasted funny and smelled funny. The lobster didn't even come out with butter. They probably just buy their entrees from Red Lobster and mark them up and resell them ha ha joke's on yous
No comment
No comment

My brother and I took my mother here this past Wednesday for an early Mother's Day meal because he's retuning to Australia today.  The service was superb!  Our wait person was very patient and let us take as much time as we wanted to go over the menu and specials with him.  Our meals arrived in a timely fashion, hot and DELICIOUS.  I'll definitely be returning to Verde on Smith very soon.  Perhaps tomorrow evening.

Food awesome. Great service, very friendly. Perfect place to share your dinner with friends.  I had great experience with my friend there. Moderate prices.  One of the my favourite places in the city.

We stopped in here for a $5 glass of wine during happy hour. It was early and the place was pretty much empty. It looked classy enough and the bar tender was friendly. I'd try it again next time I'm in the neighborhood if there is more of a crowd. Also, the food that we did see looked nice and the menu looks decent, so they have that going for them.
No comment

Every time we come here without fail we have an amazing and service. The bartenders for brunch and dinner are always great and the server we get Louis is so nice and we want for nothing when he takes care of us! The brunch is such a great deal with boozy brunch plus yummy entrees and dinner if you come in with a Large group they're so willing to accommodate!
Just moved to the area and I love this little gem. Gnocci was delicious and the broccoli raab was awesome. Love this.
Great food, great music, great service. I'd defiantly be going back very soon.

I've been here several times for Sunday Brunch.  Love this place.  Not only are the waitstaff friendly and on top of things, food is delicious and their selection of bottomless mimosas is wonderful.  Looking forward to my next visit!
No comment
Friday seafood lobster platter is amazing. I go there on my lunch break eat, enjoy, and back at my desk in 1 hour. Awesome waiters. Clean establishment.
No comment

The brunch here is delicious and the service is wonderful. It's got the hipster vibe. The only thing is that they have a B rating from the city but you wouldn't know because they stuck it at the bottom of the glass, where the chairs and sign cover it. That's a little shady to me haha but I love my experience there so I let that tidbit slide.

I have been here twice. The Gorgonzola salad and stuffed shrimp appetizers are great. Full of flavor great presentation. For main course I had the Lobster Feast. It was intimidating as it approached my table. It had a half lobster cut in half breaded, breaded shrimp, claims and French bread. It was tasty but I wish they would have cleaned all the green stuff out of the lobster before it was served. I could only eat some of the meat. I love the ambience and the manager was awesome.

This place is amazing , the unlimited mimosas are strong and if you're lucky you'll have Hector as a server. He's so sweet and the best server there( we've had others). The food for brunch is really delicious but our server really made it a great experience . Would come back here for sure ... Good food strong drinks !!! Love this place!

Its alright! There are better Italian places out there.I ordered the Nutella- Mascarpone crepe. They were good but it was kinda little for the fact that it was on the brunch menu n it costed 11$. My friend ordered the Steak Sandwich for the same price n got a huuuuge plate with burger, potato, salad. I tasted his and it was really good. I mean my crepe was good too, I was just confused about the same pricing for the 2 very different meals.

This a fantastic jewel of brooklyn. I had a birthday there last night and the quality of the food and service was very impressive. I had the gnocchi for dinner and the prosciutto goat cheese salad, and was very happy with my order.

This is a decent place, nothing extraordinary or exciting about the food or the drinks or the prices but the staff seems friendly and nice enough and I just saw a sign for an all you can drink brunch - so together that seems like it'd be worth coming back for!

1st of all they changed the lobster feast to 19.95 but it is still worth it. I was very pleased. We had the lobster feast and the chuppa seafood. Oh, my God. Not every one can cook seafood correctly but this place gets it just right. Its fresh its light, well seasoned and not over cooked or undercooked. Perfect, just perfect.

I lurve this place....the ambiance is nice, it's not over crowded, and very intimate for a dinner for two.  I've never had a miss with the pasta dishes and the gorgonzola salad is my fave.  The food is on the cheap side...you can totally enjoy a full dinner here.
No comment

Ive past this place a bunch always thinking, "oh i should go there sometime". Had company in town thought we would try it out. scallop dish ended up tasting soapy. service was a little snappy even for a saturday night. eh.

Do not go here. Sorry, they lack any and all basic perception of customer service. Yes, your tables were teeming with patrons but the way my sisters and I were ignored, dismissed, and disregarded left us with a terrible taste in our mouths. I was eager to try the food but now not so much. WOW, the incompetence and rudeness I saw was unspeakable and it was saddening to see that classism, bigotry, and prejudice are alive and kicking... this is my opinion based off of my experience. Really, what was it about us  that prompted this lack of service and caused two staff persons to show us how annoyed they were while serving brunch today? Have things become a bit unmanageable or out of hand with this restaurant? We have had our fill of VERDE exasperated staff lashing out on paying customers (no groupons or deals for us, cold cash only), maybe I can return when management or ownership is changed. Eek! Methinks NOT!

Just fantastic! Wandered in here with my husband last night and will definitely return - an impressive list of specials which were difficult to choose from in addition to the regular menu and the service was A1 as others have said

Great place! I hosted my sister's bridal shower brunch for 10 ladies here last June and the owner of Verde on Smith was extremely helpful in setting everything up.   We had a big table in the back garden and ordered off the menu but also did the unlimited drink deal and really enjoyed the afternoon.  Food, drinks, and service was great and they let us stay as long as we wanted (and just paid separately for more drinks...).  I would definitley go back and happily plan another brunch party here!
My husband said "I'm full but disappointed". Which summed it up for me too. Nothing really wrong but nothing really right. Next time its LuLuc for us.
No comment

Came in here after having drinks nearby with my better half on a Monday night. While I was a little apprehensive at first to enter given that there was no one inside dining, we chalked that up to it being a Monday night. We're glad we decided to give Verde a try. I had some pasta with meat sauce, my girl had rigatoni with a tomato sauce and prosciutto, both were pretty fantastic. Would definitely come back here again.

Short and simple I loved the food! We went on a Monday night after work so there was no wait time. The waiter kept brining over bread which was a good and bad thing. I love bread so that was the good put the bad part was I couldn't stop eating it. We will go back, I recommend the linguine with mussels.
Awesome food, great atmosphere! Get the mozzarella And prosciutto app and mojitos are great too! Can't wait to come back! :)
Very sedate and pleasant atmosphere. Had baked clams as an appetizer, and a whole bronzini (Mediterranean sea bass) as the entrée. Impeccable.
No comment

Such a great place to grab lunch on the weekends. Always a great experience. Their bloody mary's are the perfect mix of alcohol and spicy. Service is great. They have a cool backyard as well as indoor seating. Loved the chicken sandwich. Definitely recommend for anyone who wants to enjoy great food in a chill environment. Many things to do around there as well.

I had dinner here with a friend using a groupon recently.  The food was really excellent.  We shared the burrata with prosciutto (amazing), the crispy gnochhi with broccoli rabe (also amazing) and a chicken dish that didn't stand out but certainly wasn't bad.  The restuarant is very pretty and the service was friendly and attentive.
No comment

Been here a few times.  First time just to the bar, bartender sent my brother a drink on the house, overheard it was his birthday.  Next few times we ate at a table, very friendly service both by staff and management.  Food was very good. Loved the nicoise salad. i feel like this is a good place to try the specials, because the majority of the menu is straightforward but this is where they get a little creative.  Like I said the food is always good though.

What a Great Place!! The decor is nice for a date or to just meet up after work . We ordered lasagna and the chicken... they both were full of flavor but the presentation could use more work. We did come back for brunch and the Kobe burgers, excellent!!!
The food was very mediocre.  Too many great places in the neighborhood to waste a meal here.  Disappointing would be the word.
No comment
No comment

I'm still surprised they are able to attract moderate Smith Street crowds, especially with so many better Italian choices in the neighborhood (Brucie, Pane e Vino, Fragole, etc, etc).  When they first opened a while back, there were some pretty exciting dishes.  I still remember the pasta dish with uni on it, yum.  Somewhere after they switched out chefs, and the food fell off a cliff.  Tried their "lobster feast" since then, which I find to be a funny name for half of the tiniest lobster tail I've ever seen.

I've been to Verde three times now and can say that I like this place and don't know why I don't go here more often. The food is good, the outdoor patio is lovely, and it's pretty easy to make a reservation here. The service can be a little slow but I don't particularly mind a long drawn out dinner. Menu favorites include beef carpaccio, crab cake appetizer special, spinach and gorgonzola salad, salmon entree, and filet over arugula entree. I haven't ordered a pasta yet but will next time and hopefully will remember to update.
They fixed it, music was fun, lively.  The spirit was too.  THe owner had a smile on his face and a packed house.  And we got some extra prosecco and grappa.  How could you go wrong?
This was some good italian food! THE END! started with the oysters and moved on to the rigatoni which was flavored just right. Has a rustic true taste to the food that i love.
No comment

Went here for dinner with my girlfriend. Food was absolutely delicious. The lobster was incredibly fresh and the lamb was fall off the bone tender. Service was attentive and friendly. We will absolutely be returning here.

Went here with some friends for brunch and I am completely baffled as to why it was empty.  My companions were late and I was able to sit right away and they brought water without my even having to ask.  We got the unlimited brunch cocktails and they were refilled even before we had finished the previous ones.  I got eggs benedict and the eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise was deliciously creamy.  As a bonus, while the menu says the unlimited drinks are only served for 2 hours, they were definitely generous with that.  I'll definitely go back!

It was a planned day with a list of 5 bars, my girlfriend and I had the Idea to go bar hopping in Brooklyn, being that we hardly go out in The BK area. As we walked by Verde, we realized how cozy it was in there, not to mention they had a board outside letting their customers know about the happy hour, which really got our attention quick. We walked in and while it was very small place it was elegant, inviting and very relaxed. The service was great and the bartender would go around checking on her guess every few minutes. It was nice and quiet and dimmed lights. It felt very nice being in there good to take a person on a first date, it was sophisticated but not over the top where you would have to where dressy cloths. While Verde was not on our list to go that night it sure made it to our future places to visit.

This has quickly become one of my brunch faves (can't comment on dinner but heard it's great as well).  The restaurant  is pretty small and can get crowded pretty quickly.  That being said, I've noticed there is a garden in the back so I would assume there is additional seating during summer months.  The decor is standard but has a little bit of a romantic flair so its good for a date or an outing with friends.  On to the good part - the brunch!  Food is DELICIOUS and served in nice sized portions so you don't leave hungry.  They also have a variety of brunch cocktails which I like since I get tired of the standard mimosa.  Service is average and although the servers aren't always super friendly, they get the job done in terms of getting the food out and keeping my glass filled.  The best part is that brunch menu is also served on Fridays - you can't beat it!

I decided to host a brunch here. We had the entire garden to ourselves. The waitstaff was great. Int he end the owner Cono tried to charge me for an additional person on the final bill. I informed him that we had the exact number of people 25+ that we agreed to. He started arguing with me in front of my guests. The nerve!!!! Good food but not worth the attitude. Hello Cono, when we are giving you over $1,200. and not causing any issues please be courteous.
No comment
No comment
Food was good, but they gave me a very small portion. The service wasn't great, he barely spoke to us. The best thing about this experience was the free glass of wine when I checked in.
No comment

We always sit at the bar (all night $5 wine happy hour) and eat dinner there. All the bartenders are really sweet. Yummy bread with quality olive oil. Staple is always the caesar salad with grilled chicken. They'll do half orders of pasta and the few Ive had are always tasty with quality ingredients. It's an easy, low key dinner spot.

So good. Piles of seafood. I am from Maine and the lobster in the lobster feast was as fresh and juicy as anything from home. BF had the loster fra diablo which also had a 1/2 lobster on top. I have never seen such high quality shellfish outside of Maine. Tiramisu also amazing.
Mediocre food.  Also, they did not honor my yelp check-in bonus of free wine because I used Savored discount there.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is an UNFRIENDLY GROUPON  ESTABLISHMENT!!   i went in on Friday night ordered a glass of wine off their specials. After ordering a steak I presented my groupon now to the bartender.  She got  real nasty and said my wine was not on special since i had a groupon.  After ordering the steak the owner comes over and tells me he is out of steaks for the evening so I switched to the tuna.  He also says that there was a 2 person minimum to use the groupon now but he would make an exception this time.   I reread my groupon now and nowhere does it state that it was a 2 person minimum.  I showed it to the bartender and the owner comes running over screaming that he owns the restaurant and not groupon!     So I got up and walked out after driving a half hour to come to this restaurant.   I found a nice little cuban place up the street where i had a very nice meal.

I'm pretty shocked by how many positive reviews this restaurant has received. I've been to many restaurants on Smith Street and have enjoyed most of them, but I have no desire to revisit this one. The servers were overly attentive when I was waiting for my boyfriend to arrive but once he arrived, we had to grab their attention every time we needed something. We shared the roasted beet appetizer, which tasted OK but would have been better if served warm. I ordered the scallop and sea urchin pasta, which was what I expected, except the scallops were shredded and cooked in the sauce. Why wouldn't they keep the scallops whole? Seemed very odd and it left me wanting more. But the worst crime was my BF's dish: the tuna. The only reason he ordered it is because he read some good reviews about it, but what they call a  "white bean puree" was just a bland mush of undercooked, underseasoned beans. There is no way this dish is worth $24. They also tried to charge me $11 for a cocktail when all the drinks on their cocktail menu were advertised as $10.

After speaking privately with the owner and being willing to give him the benefit of the doubt that maybe he didn't realize we'd JUST paid the check when he asked us to leave, I've come to the conclusion that this guy is just as awful, patronizing, and rude as we thought he was at first. He insists that we wanted to stay at the restaurant an "unlimited amount of time" -- who would even do that?! -- says I "threatened" him with a Yelp review, and said that if I don't like his response, I can delete my review and he'll delete his. Sorry Cono, that's not how this works. You're the one running a business who has a reputation on the line; I'm just a former customer of your restaurant who had such an awful experience there that I'll make sure everyone I know is aware of exactly why Verde isn't worth a visit.
No comment

This place was a total disappointment. i ordered the chicken marsala the chicken was poor quality a rubbery feel to it. Portions are very small and everything is overpriced! The manager was extremely rude! Overall it was a very unpleasant evening. NEVER will go to this place again!
No comment

Living in the neighborhood we watched the restaurant be built with anticipation-- and finally got a chance to try it for brunch .  Unfortunately the entire meal was a letdown.  I ordered the sausage panini-- and while I enjoyed it, I found myself searching around for the other half of my sandwich.  It literally was sliced like half a sandwich, the other half of which they must have given to someone else.  My wife ordered the crepes with ricotta and mixed berries.  Here as well the portion size seemed like a joke and the mixed berries translated to two under-riped strawberries.  After she crunched into one bite (the crepe being cold and hard, likely pre-made a while ago)-- I could tell immediately that we would not be coming back.  Our server was very nice but she never commented or asked about why my wife had only one bite missing from her dish and so we left without saying anything...and made ourselves lunch at home.

Have been a resident of Cobble Hill for a few years and have been waiting for a spot like this to open up.  Had dinner and drinks there and was blown away by the food, service and decor.  The outdoor space looks great and cannot wait for the weather to warm up so I can go back for dinner on the patio.   The design of the space is the perfect mix of elegant and trendy.  Had the filet mignon for dinner and it was cooked perfect!  Steakhouse quality steak.  Also, the eggplant appetizer was delicious.  Great wine list as well.  Can't wait to go back!!
The service was the highlight of the night. The waiters were all very friendly, professional, prompt and thoughtful. Their homemade pasta with pesto was a great dinner special.

So I made another visit to verde as I normally do!   However I had to write another review because the food is just soooo good!  I usually go to verde for their polenta, which is great. This time we also ordered Oyster Rockefeller for an appetizer.  I still have the taste in my mouth days later. They were unbelievable. I'm dying to go there again this week!!!!

Went here for Brunch. They had nice live music, prices were affordable, food and coffee were good. The only drawback was that the "crepes and fruit" menu item came *surprise!* covered in chocolate (not listed on the menu). Changed the character of the dish quite a bit. Other than that though, really good.
great spot for brunch in our hood. unlimited drinks is solid way to start my sunday funday.

Food was yummy (clams oreganata, shrimp scampi); service could be a bit better.  I hate getting the drinks we ordered at the beginning of the meal after the meal.  As such, there should have been apologies and drinks comped but that's just me.  Don't wait staff notice these things anymore?  I think part of the problem these days is that there is no one - no head waiter, no maitre d', no hostess going around and making sure that everything is satisfactory.
No comment

Had dinner at Verde with 3 friends last Saturday night - we were seated promptly after a drink at the bar - the decor is very nice and service was prompt.  We were pleasantly surprised by the menu, as it was unique and much better than expected. Overall - Great dinner! Definitely recommended!

I think that this place is overpriced. Simple pasta dishes cost at least $14. My pasta wish shrimp and scallops was mediocre considering it was $18. I think the only reason it tasted decent was because they put a lot of sauce on the pasta. I wouldn't say the food was terrible it's just that it wasn't worth the price in my opinion.

This place is amazing!! I went several times and always happy. I get the 3 dollar Peronis and eat items off the tapas menu like the Burrata Parma - soft cheese rolled in Prosciutto, Eggplant Lasagnette, The bruchetta. Amazing fresh homemade food. Nice back Patio to eat outside ,Owners are great people. And the bathroom is even awesome lol it's got the music pumping!!! All in All very happy with this spot and owners and staff!!  :)

This place was okay but with so many good spots on Smith its unlikely I'll be back. My friend had the veal which only so so. I had penne with a vodka sauce that was quite nice - thin, not too creamy. The wine recommended by the waiter was horrible. Service was attentive. Atmosphere was pleasant

Great hidden Gem in Brooklyn! Authentic Italian food. Great decor simple but yet rustic - very clean and very well situated.  Attentive service, nice atmosphere and the owner is a gentleman, circling tables and making sure the guests are well attended to.  As far as Cobblehill Italian goes, this is as good as the others if not better.  We eat out often in the area and are Italian (so we obsess over food) and appreciate good, authentic food.   Great drinks (bartender is excellent), great, well priced wine list.   This is a great place, we highly recommend.

Just 'ehh' - underwhelming, especially given the price. Service was fine...didn't tell us specials until we asked. Free olives and bread were a plus. I'd go back if if they had a good happy hour special..but not for dinner.

the french toast, the bottomless drink sprecials, the lobster shrimp clam platter, the steak and eggs, the potatoes,  the burgers, and the service deserves 5 stars. the garden is very beautiful in the summer, but be mindful that business picks up during the summer brunch days so prepare to wait.

Went here a few weeks ago and had an excellent filet mignon and steamed muscles. It was busy but they didn't rush you out of the place. A nice place to grab a nice meal. I will be going to Verde on Smith again soon.

Verde's is a very welcome addition to Smith Street's restaurant row!! I've lived in Cobble Hill for years and have seen restaurants come and go. The Lobster feast was delicious as were the baked clams and chocolate dessert. Great menu ,especially for brunch and  the prices are most affordable.  The staff is very accomodating and the music adds a special touch to the overall  ambience. So glad to learn that they now deliver to the surrounding neighborhood.

Went with two friends. One had asked for her steak medium rare. It came well done and had to be sent back. I had the tuna whichI I found tepid and inedible and Im not a food snob. The tuna is advertised as fresh but it had no flavor and was likely frozen. One friend had the shrimp scampi which was pretty good but the cream sauce was heavy as opposed to "light". I wont go back.

Amazing food! Will accommodate dishes for vegetarians. Staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Decor is modern, while still being comfortable. You feel right at home sitting with your friends at a table for dinner, or just having a drink at the bar. ALWAYS amazing specials and deals through facebook, which I LOVE! Weather is nice enough to start enjoying their amazing outdoor garden! Highly recommend! LOVE LOVE LOVE!!

Firstly let me outline I am a picky eater. It is very rare that I say I enjoyed everything we ordered. However I have been to Verde twice now and honestly really enjoyed everything. We stated with Gorgonzola salad! Delish! And then had muscle spaghetti. EVEN BETTER! If you haven't tried this restaurant take my advice and go there. The staff are great and the food is even better. I can't wait to go back.

Finally a Fine Italian Restaurant with Italians in the kitchen. That's big to me, there are so many so-called Italian Restaurants around, it's good to find one with true Italian home cooking.  The Food was Great. The atmosphere was great. This is my new Favorite Spot.

My friends and I really enjoyed our dinner here.  The service was prompt, and our food was delicious!  The items on the menu are very affordable (~$10 pasta dishes) however the beer cost more money than I expected.  The sign in the front advertised $3 beer and $4 wine, but that price turned out to be for the bar only.  (That was one of the main reasons we decided to eat there!  We were all going to enjoy a few glasses of wine with our dinner, but couldn't spend $10/glass thus had one beer instead.)  Aside from that, we all liked our food and will probably return!  It has a nice atmosphere and an affordable food menu - two plus-points for a restaurant worth revisiting...at least in my book!

Went for Valentines Day and my husband, who has a stomach of steel, got food poisoning today (next day). Margharitas were wierd and the pasta dish our guest had was left uneaten. Fish and spinach salad were good. The other guest had an OK steak that was served with no care for presentation. Given other reviews below this was  disappointing. Given husband's inabiity to go to work due to food poisoning, will never go back.

This lovely restaurant is like a slice of Italy. It's not fast food or a cookie cutter menu.The ingredients are fresh, delicate, authentic and beautifully arranged on the plate. We travel to Italy often and know the difference. The staff was lovely and attentive. Try the appetizer with beets, leeks and cheese...delicious.

I've been to this restaurant 6 times now.  Last night was the first time on a Friday night and was so impressed I felt needed a review.  The food was very good with interesting flavors and none of it too heavy (standouts were the mussels appetizer and the lamb special).  Tiramisu and sorbet desserts excellent.  Service was fine even when they got very busy and the manager comped us dessert wine.  One of the reasons I like this place is that the room is designed so that you can hear each other talk even when it is crowded, unlike a lot of places which get incredibly noisy.  The garden in the back is very comfortable for outdoor dining in good weather.

I've been to Verde at least 5 or 6 times at this point and they have become my favorite Italian restaurant in the area.  The brunch is equally as good as the dinner!  You have to get their Mimosas!  They do a few different flavors and use fresh squeezed juice for them, not the canned stuff.  The burrata is delicious and so are the pastas.  The waitstaff is very friendly and accommodating.  Eating at the bar is nice because the bartendar is cool.  They have a garden out back which I can't wait to try now that the weather is getting nicer.  Very solid, good food for the price.  Place is nice but can get very loud.  Not quiet and romantic but very inviting.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Marina del Rey, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
No comment

Great spot, heard it was DeNiros restaurant. I'm not sure if that's true but it was top notch and loved the food. This location is $$$$$, but if you're looking for an authentic outdoor new York elite experience this is the spot. I would definitely go back. Reservations recommended.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was our first experience at this restaurant for brunch and it was absolute blast! First, we had an amazing server, Jessenia (Jess). She gave us the best recommendations and timed everything perfectly. You can truly tell she cares about her guests and makes sure they are taken care of. I highly recommend requesting her if you want to have a GREAT experience!! You cannot go wrong with anything you get. All of the food is absolutely fantastic. The pastries are to die for!

When I tell you that everything we ordered was amazing, I mean EVERYTHING. Came here for brunch on a Sunday and were squeezed in because we were working an event so they very kindle accommodated us. The servers were all super friendly and attentive. We ordered: 1. Pumpkin ravioli. So light, perfect wintery dish. Filling without feeling like you left with a rock in your stomach. Amazing flavor. 2. Scampi and grits. Also a ton of flavor. Whatever the tomato sauce situation was was delicious. 3. Mezzi rigatoni. A huge portion and so much flavor! Another great winter dish. 4. Uova medonese which also had such powerful flavors. And of course, 5. Lemon ricotta pancakes for the table. How could we not! They were as amazing as they looked. Everything was 5/5! Also got a side of bacon. We did ask if it was thick and they said no and that was not true, but it was delicious nonetheless. Last of all, the beet juice (Roots #3) was SO good. Heavy on the ginger but I felt so healthy.
The burratini and ricotta were incredible.  Warm, inviting restaurant with great hospitality.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ended up here during brunch service on a Sunday. While the inside is very nice and had an old world New York, but hip vibe to it. I found the service to be slow and the food was lacking for the price. If I am dropping over $200 on brunch for a family of four, it had better be worth it. I had the Porchetta sandwich, which was underwhelming. The only standout dish was the roasted chicken that my son had. Everything else was, meh.

This place was fantastic! Great food, great ambiance. The steak tartare and the focaccia were amazing and absolutely worth it. The duck was so tender with crispy skin and super juicy. Highly recommend this place for a business dinner or an intimate date
No comment
This was my 1st time eating here. Ambiance was nice and customer service was great. Drinks was great and the food was good...

I booked my reservation and wrote about our anniversary. The head maître d' greeted us and a Lionel edged our celebration. We had a romantic table in the corner. Our waitress Gabby I believe was awesome. I even let her pick the dessert she was so well versed in the menu. They held Neal's beers in the fridge for him! Super service. Food was to die for. Omg mouth watering. I can't wait to go back.

What a great option for brunch.   I plan to return for dinner service as well.  There was a block long line front of Bubby's and I really wanted pancakes for brunch.   I saw a gorgeous photo of pancakes on Yelp at LV so decided to walk in.  High ceilings, dark wood, laid back, cozy vibe. You get get the TriBeCa feel here.   The hostesses were friendly.  We decided to wait at the bar for a table but they got us right away to a table.    The ricotta pancakes with lemon curd was delicious. It was light, fluffy, and came out piping hot!   Scrambled eggs toast with leeks and mushroom salad was great.  I thought leek and mushroom were in the eggs as the description didn't mention the salad but the salad was great and I just put the salad on top of the toast to eat.  It also comes with speck but we asked to not include it.  The service was attentive and professional.   The root juice was amazing.  The ginger kick will wake you up.  The regular coffee came out nice and fresh.  Nothing I didn't like about this place.

This was my second time at Locanda Verde and it was better than the first! The aesthetic is very chic and fits in nicely with Tribeca. Our server was absolutely delightful and the Somm gave us a great wine rec. if you come here and don't order the ricotta, you are doing something wrong. The tagliatelle and the rigatoni were delightful. The pasta is obviously fresh and cooked Al dente. The strawberry polenta cake was yummy but pretty dry, so you could skip this.

We got the sheeps milk ricotta and it was SO good. Even if you don't like goat cheese, you would love it!  They also give you more bread so it's perfect. The grandma's ravioli was so good! I got the jersey corn and it was a little too sweet for my liking. The service was AMAZING. Our waitress, Kate was THE best. She was so helpful and kind.
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the downtown area. Locanda Verde has some of the best pasta around. I highly recommend their rigatoni with sheep's milk ricotta as well as their grandmas ravioli. You can never go wrong with either. For a starter, I would highly recommend their sheep's milk ricotta. They also have great specials that are always worth a try. The staff is always very helpful and are good at making suggestions on menu items. I've found the sommelier to be helpful in picking a good wine within your budget as well. The atmosphere is perfect for either a date or a dinner with family and friends. I would highly recommend as one of the better restaurants in Tribeca.

Upscale, polished Italian bistro in TriBeCa. The food is high quality and the ambience is upscale yet casual. The ricotta cheese with bread and olive oil is an excellent appetizer, would definitely recommend sharing it between 3-4 people. The arugula salad with green apple is worth a try as well. For the main course, the pasta dishes are very impressive, they are simple but the texture of the pasta is perfect. The salmon main dish comes on a bed of salad, it was also very well made and has a great balance of taste but not quite as unique as the pastas. Service is attentive overall, although the mains took a while to arrive.

Locanda Verde was great. My husband and I were able to sit at the bar at 6PM on a Saturday night without a reservation. I think we just got really lucky. I had the garlic chicken, my husband had the orecchiette and we shared the brussel sprouts. Everything was really lovely. It's such a great atmosphere there. The bar staff was friendly, always checking on us but not rushing us. They have a tough job managing people jockeying for position to get a seat but they were all great.

My friend who used to live in NYC recommended visiting this place while I was in town.  I made the rsvp for Saturday night, and glad I did because the place was big.  The restaurant is a very nice ambiance,  on the fancier side.  My husband ordered east coast fish with other seafood like clams, muscles, and octopus and had chunky tomato sauce.  The fish was so soft and cooked perfectly, and so was the octopus.  We also ordered a side of broccolini with garlic, and this was absolutely delicious.  I know people don't go to the restaurant to order broccolini but the flavor was so good, I would order that again.   For the main dish, I had pasta which was ok.  Overall, I think the food was overpriced (but I am assuming because of the area) and since there are so many Italian places in the city, I would try somewhere else.
No comment

Came here expecting very good food based on the review. Everything was mediocre. The best thing I had was the burrata. Which I would come back for. I would recommend here. Nice place to try but I won't be back again.

Really yummy restaurant with such a fun vibe inside. I definitely would recommend this spot for a birthday dinner, there is something for everyone on the menu. You can't go wrong with any of the pasta dishes, the burrata is amazing to start with, and dessert fantastic as well. We had a dish with a beautiful little apple pie and vanilla ice cream. Sooo good! I need to go back to try their brunch menu sometime
No comment

Really delicious and wonderful atmosphere. Super cute location with great service and great food. Really loved the ricotta and also enjoyed the calamari pasta. Soo soo good. Drinks were good as well with a berry drink. Overall recommend
Quite possibly one of the worst food experiences I've ever had.  It's shocking this place is rated so high.
Fantastic Food and excellent service. I was with a friend but would definitely go there for a date.  The Ambiance is perfect for a romantic date.
No comment

Went for a quick brunch with friends. The waffles and pancakes are so soft and so good! As weird as it sounds the potatoes we're definitely the best thing! The juices are pretty sweet, but pretty good.
No comment

Such a friendly, approachable, knowledgeable, and welcoming team-we felt we were important to you all, and nothing felt like too much trouble. Thank you for helping make the last day of our year such a significant and special one. The meal was delicious, and the service and ambiance were just right. We will always come to Locanda Verde for celebrations.
Please have more vegetarian options. I am tired of the pumpkin ravioli and the salad. I see all of my colleagues get delicious meals and I am stuck.
No comment
No comment

Food was good but nothing special, which is disappointing because I have been waiting to come here for some time. We canned for brunch and I had the Caprese Fritatta and my friend had the pesto pasta.  It's expensive (yes I am well aware this is New York!) for what you get. Service was also pretty terrible and we were ignored for most of the meal. We didn't even get asked about a drink until our mains had already arrived.
Serious wow! The food is delightful. Taking my time to taste it. The service is first rate. Great find. Recommended to me by a friend.

Amazing ! Hostesses are super friendly and helpful. Bartenders are knowledgeable and can predict your choice of drinks. The food is delicious! So delicious that I forgot to take pictures :( octopus salad is die for ) Pasta was melting in my mouth ( pappardelle). Highly recommend'

Excellent food-- starters, salads, bread, pastas, main and dessert.  We had it all and every bit was excellent.  Ambiance is cozy without being crowded or loud.  Good value in terms of price.

Had brunch here for my anniversary! Great, very friendly and attentive servers despite being fairly busy. Had complimentary Prosecco for our anniversary as well as a small gelato scoop! Nice gesture. The food was great! Cute spot in the village for brunch.
No comment

I came here for dinner on a Saturday night, had read all the great reviews about this place and it did not disappoint! The food was excellent, steak tartare, ravioli and bolognese were to die for. Some of the best pasta I've had outside of Italy. The ambiance was great; upscale but casual. Wait staff and hostess were very friendly as well. Food is a little pricey, but worth it IMO. Highly recommend.
No comment

I went here for dinner, and it was terrific. The restaurant has a lovely interior and a lovely atmosphere. Service was slow, and they were kind enough to acknowledge it and provide a side on the house. Most places would have only apologized. The food was the star of the night. From the bread to ravioli, every dish I had was full of flavor. I highly recommend this gem.
No comment
Delicious and unique on many levels; yet wrapped in pretentious service chipping just a bit away from an otherwise great experience.
No comment
No comment
My friends and I had a great time. The ambiance is great, food is amazing and the service was impeccable.
The food was good. I'm vegetarian but I liked the pasta. Would come again. Thank you for reading my review

I was pretty unimpressed by the food here, I had it a few times while staying in the city. The place is cute, loud, and quite happening. It was packed. The food however does not meet the expectation, it's really rather lazy. Simple things like serving food hot or crisping the skin on chicken are after thoughts here. And the food is oddly bland, lacking any kind of finesse. Things like sides taste like they have been sitting around for a while. It's a shame really. I would not recommend this place for groups, it's really loud and tough to have a conversation.
No comment

My ravioli was divine and my friend raved about the duck. The sauce was out of this world. If they sold it in a jar, I would buy it! The bartender even made my espresso martini a decaf when I mentioned that I shouldn't be having caffeine so late. Amazing service, amazing food. I would definitely recommend dining here.
Always a good time with good food & atmosphere. The lemon ricotta pancakes was just the right texture taste with blueberries inside too.
Very lovely PDR service, ambiance and food! Would definitely book an outing here again (:
No comment

This place is pretty good. My two daughters ordered the pumpkin ravioli and got five pieces. I ordered the octopus and was VERY underwhelmed. It also took an hour to get our food. Service was nice though.

Solid choice if in the area. I'd been walking around for a while and needed a drink and some nourishment. Didn't have a booking but so happy they could find a seat for me outside. Ended up eating a full meal. I enjoyed the food and service and wine it's hard with so many good choices in NYC to give a five star review with only one visit. I'd definitely go back if was in the area! Give it a try!

After receiving this recommendation from various people I finally checked out Locanda Verde last night - and I now understand the hype. This probably goes on my list of my favorite restaurants in NYC. We started with cocktails (Alpino and Fumo) and Focaccia and then shared the Mezze Rigatoni and Tagliatelle. The cocktails were beautiful and perfectly made, the focaccia was amazing, and the pasta was UNREAL. When my parents visit next I am definitely taking them here. I would recommend this to anyone!

This place has some of the best pasta in the city. Having been here a few times, I have not had a single pasta dish I did not like. My current favorite is the cacio e pepe. As for appetizers, the sheep's milk ricotta is always on the menu and is a must order. They also serve a fantastic brunch. I highly recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes. Cocktails are consistently good as well, both at dinner and at brunch.
No comment

A wonderful restaurant.  Acoustical speaking a bit loud for my tastes but overall a beautiful restaurant with fabulous food.  Reception and wait staff A+   Plenty of managers making sure all is running well.  highly recommended.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and so glad I finally got to! We came in for our 6pm reservation last Saturday. I suggest making a reservation if you can! They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating. We sat inside. Our waiter was quick to come over and get us drinks. We started with the whipped ricotta appetizer. If you come here for one thing, MAKE SURE to get this! Oh goodness. The ricotta is just divine. As our entrees, we got the mezze rigatoni and the tortelli. The rigatoni was decadent! It had ground lamb and was topped with yes... more ricotta! So delicious. I devoured it. My friend said the tortelli was good too, but it was a fairly small portion. The prices are quite high, but I'd say it's worth a visit!
I ve been going for years but it has recently lost its luster... food is no longer memorable and the vibe is no longer happening, unfortunately their high prices remain the same

Good food, very good service; however, the restaurant squeezes far too many tables into the restaurant. Diners packed on top of each other and, as the result, everyone feels the need to shout to be heard. Miserable dining experience. It was impossible to hear my dining partner over the two close tables on either side of us. Not the best during a covid surge either.

Locanda Verde is one of the best restaurants in New York.  Came here for an anniversary dinner, had a great time with amazing food.  The homemade Burrata is the best we've had. The ricotta is beyond good.  Both are great appetizer choices.  Tried the wood fired chicken, very moist and delicious, the cacio e pepe was tasty too.  The place has a great vibe with very good wines as well.  They also have some great outdoor seating with some good views.

Everything about this place was disappointing. Ricotta was smooth but tasted like regular ricotta. Meatball sliders were boring. We ordered 2 pastas and both were way too salty. Warm cherry pie for 2 was amateur and tasted like cherries filling from a can.

Roomy and romantic. Great food. You can tell it's authentic Italian food. Very nice service. The Ravioli honestly taste like your grandmother actually made them. It's romantic yet you feel at home. I really like it.

Service is amazing. They knew we were celebrating our engagement and sent over champagne on the house! Will definitely be back.

Just left a client / vender dinner and it was such good foood. Our waiter helped us pick the perfect red wine - a 2013 Chianti. We shared a bunch of apps, the steak tartar was unique but the ceviche"ish" white fish was my favorite! I got a "sweet corn" pasta that was so unique and delicious. Somehow we all made room for desert and our waiter, AJ complementary brought out his favorite tart cherry pie because we hadn't happened to order it ourselves. Great service and food - especially for a group working in food. Highly recommend.

Food was good however service was awful. Had a reservation and waited over 30 minutes for our table. When told we would have "something special set over since we waited so long" nothing was ever sent over.

The food was good but it wasn't great enough to make up for the lack of customer service. The hostess was Gracie and was very passive at the fact that we waited for over 30 minutes for a reservation. They promised to make it up to our party for waiting but nothing was ever sent and when asked they just pretended nothing was ever promised.

Great place! Great service! Food is fantastic. Best Italian food I've had in a while . Everything is super fresh and delicious!! I loved the lamb rigatoni .. highly recommend !!

The food is outstanding!  Never disappoints! And Bravo to the owner who told Meghan Markle and her husband that he wouldn't clear the entire inner outdoor courtyard for them to eat.

The roasted chicken was not up to par. We ordered the chicken for two at $72 which is quite high. There were two measly carrots and very few vegetables. Very few. This is the second time I've ordered this... the first time was full of vegetables and the chicken was much tastier. Prices are very high for such meager offerings. We ordered a pasta dish as well as the ricotta. The pasta dish at $33, as well over priced, and not able to satisfy anybody. The restaurant is not consistent nor is it a good value. I would choose to go elsewhere.

We did our guys brunch here, with recommendation, and it was quite well. We ordered the bacon (utterly amazing), the potatoes, and I had the grits + scampi. The service was flawless, and the setting is comfortable....the only reason I could not give 5 stars is that my grits and scampi entree came out under/at room temperature. Even though I could taste the flavors were well thought out, they didn't realize at their highest potential at room temperature.

It is a disastrous restaurant. Everything is wayyyyy overpriced. And the sanitation is a big problem. At last, please pay ATTENTION, this restaurant changes your total bill amount by thinking you wound not notice, especially for group orders. I am surprised they are not reported to NYC.

This restaurant was recommended as a place that is kid friendly. And it is! They have many kids but not enough high chairs (something to note, please). The food was great, we had Sheep's milk ricotta-outstanding, and beet salad. We then shared Cacio Pepe and my toddler loved it (yup, despite the pepper), and duck-which was just ok.

Second time here. Mediocre service in the sense that about half of the people were nice and the other half were not. Food was not great either. A fun place with a great rustic atmosphere. But not worth the premium you pay to eat in Tribeca.

I was with a group of men who were ordering drinks for me all night, and then the bartender gave us all our individual checks. I didn't order half of my drinks, they did.. yet the way checks were given is bad manners and made me feel very awkward paying for drinks someone else got me... it definitely soured my night.

One of my favorite go to restaurants in NYC. Connected to the beautiful Greenwich Hotel, this gem is the perfect dinner spot for anyone looking to enjoy amazing food with good energy. Great for groups as long as you can book well ahead of time as reservations are tough to get. I always say you can judge a restaurant by the first thing they put on the table. At Locanda they give you bread and butter that is to die for! It's the perfect preview of what's to come!

We went last Saturday and did not have a great experience. We sat outside and waited to order for a very long time. The appetizer, entree, and side dish we ordered was fine, but the pasta was way too salty that we barely touched. We complained to the server and he took it away (without apologizing), and still decided to charge us for that pasta. Very terrible for a $$$ restaurant. Our overall bill pre-tip was almost $200, while the pasta was less than $30, so it was not like a huge portion of the bill. We would expect restaurant like this to show enough courtesy to their customers by taking off significantly mid-excited dishes from the bill. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I've been here a few times over the years. Most recently I went in September and everyone was underwhelmed by the dishes.  The picture I uploaded kind of says it all. It was a small plate of risotto that was completely overwhelmed by a balsamic drizzle. I haven't seen a balsamic drizzle since the early 2000s.  Maybe it is because of the struggles with the pandemic, but the food just wasn't that great.  Hopefully they will improve.
Nice staff and pleasant food. Great for a casual weekend lunch. Beautiful neighborhood!
No comment

Locanda Verde is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC.  I love the food, the vibe, and the service.  It's definitely one of those restaurants you go on a special occasion since it is quite pricey, but the food is so worth the money.  I've tried a bunch of dishes before, but some of my favorites are the beet salad which is probably the best beet salad you will ever have.  The green sauce with the sheep's milk yogurt and pistachio is out of this world.  Additionally, I love their pastas even though I am not a huge pasta fan.  A stand out is the crab spaghetti which had so much flavor from the red chili in the dish.  As for the secondi dishes, I love the duck breast which is cooked to just the right temperature and is so juicy and delicious in your mouth.  If I could afford it, I would eat here all the time!

Hosted a team dinner here in November and the food was excellent, the service was top notch and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Every course was mouth watering. I was so stuffed when I left, I vowed not to eat for the next two days!

The truffle ricotta with honey is a must try. I also loved my scrambled eggs with speck and arugula. They make a fantastic cappuccino ! Ambience is nice, lots of greenery outside and adjacent to a quaint hotel.

My wife and I had been wanting to try out Locanda Verde for some time so we decided to celebrate my birthday there and unfortunately it was very disappointing. The service was ridiculously slow, taking nearly 20 minutes to get a drink and an hour and ten minutes to get our food. The grandma's ravioli was nothing special but the crab pasta and rigatoni were both good. I think the best way to describe this place is an Italian version of "The Smith" with slower service.

One of the best dinners we have had in a while. We sat in the backyard area which is normally reserved for the hotel's guests . The food was amazing. Every bite was an experience . Kudos to the chefs involved including the dessert/pastry ones.

Incredibllleeee Italian food in lower Manhattan, and a great spot for celeb-spotting (I saw Woody Harrelson on his way out!). Make sure you (somehow) save room for olive oil gelato at the end of your meal, because it was exquisite!

I am highly disappointed. I just moved to the city and my best friends traveled across the country from NV and CA. This was the only dinner reservation that I made during this special weekend. I was hopeful that the positive reviews would not steer me wrong. We made sure to be at the restaurant 10 minutes prior to our reservation at 9:30 pm. We waited 30 minutes and had to confront the hosts two times in order to ensure that efforts were being made to seat us. While waiting, the hostess ensured that the staff would bring an entree to compensate for our long wait time. The food was very good. I wish I could say the same about the customer service. We confronted the hostess Gracie about the lack of delivery when it comes to the entree that should have been sent to the table. Her response was less than impressive as she stated, "Okay. I will let them know." I would hope that this restaurant would employ more customer-service oriented personnel at such a reputable restaurant. I guarantee that I will not come back due to the experience with the hostess specifically. I will ensure to deter others from coming here.

Truly wonderful restaurant with A-class food and service-- a little pricey but you certainly get what you pay for.  Great place for a date!

Highly recommend Lemon Ricotta Pancake and sheep's milk Ricotta, ( contains honey and truffle, so creamy and   delicious）

I've been coming here for a couple of years now and they always deliver quality! The ricotta is a MUST try, always smooth and delicious on quality bread (I came here for dinner but it's great with the truffle honey at brunch too!) I'm a pescatarian so I didn't have the tartare this time but the person I came here with did and loved it! The hamachi crudo had notes of tangy, salty and sweet. For my main I had the scallops (the kitchen kindly removed the soppressata for me) which were cooked perfectly, and I got the roast potatoes with that which were crispy and delicious. I was too full for dessert but it looked fantastic at other's tables! Locanda is a must visit for any local or tourist in NYC.

Locanda Verde is Andrew Carmellini's first and best restaurant. It is still hip and hopping after all these years. The food is great, the crowd is lively, the drinks are terrific, the service is stellar and the vibe is totally downtown. The pasta dishes are always good, so you can't go wrong no matter which one you select.

I have been coming  here for years- loyal tried and true. Today walked in for brunch. Plenty of tables for one available. Was told I needed to sit at bar. Returned to host to explain I am short and bar is uncomfortable, might I sit at any of of the four two-person tables. Was told no. I shared that if when I left those tables were free I would be very disappointed. "No we are completely booked". Lo and behold 3 out of 4 were empty. I will not be returning. Shame on 20-something host for treating a solo over 50 loyal female customer in this manner. You've lost my business.

This place.....just wow. I literally couldn't even take pictures cuz I was eating so fast. The ravioli was freshly made, the heirloom tomatoes from the burrata tasted like they were straight from my grandpas garden, the focaccia tasted like my grandmas, and the cacio e pepe was to die for. Absolutely loved this place and think my Italian family would approve.

After an event at Pier 26 on West street, seven of us ventured out into the night in search of something to eat. We crossed West street and headed toward the first lighted place we could see. From the moment we stepped into the very lively, very well attended, Locanda Verde with our party of 7 at 8pm Sunday we were greeted warmly and easily accommodated by the incredibly lovely, attentive wait staff. We were almost immediately shown to a little curbside house that ultimately became our private dining room. Despite the considerable chilly wind gusting outside, our little bubble remained warm and cozy throughout our meal and our servers who had to come out in the cold were always. extremely attentive. The food was first class throughout. I had the cacio e pepe pasta, an absolutely excellent version of a dish that I've had several times before at different locations. Everything the seven of us had was excellent. Food and drink plus tip came out to a total of $ 60.00 per person, a little pricey perhaps, but not too bad considering both the excellence of the food and the very friendly, absolutely impeccable service.  Seven thumbs up!!!!!!!
The lemon ricotta pancakes gave me life!!!! This spot is a true gem and the food is on point!

The chicken was phenomenal and so was Andre, the waiter! Ask for him! He made the experience!

Lemon ricotta pancakes absolutely amazing, beautiful restaurant with nice decor. Would go back just for the pancakes

Such a great spot!!!! Sheep's milk ricotta with truffle honey is an absolute must have. And ask for more bread if you run out!! Delicious. The walls are decorated with beautiful wine bottles to add to the atmosphere

Service was great. The Foccacia was excellent. My Striped Bass dish could use improvement, it was quite bland. The Agnolotti pasta was excellent. The desert should've been just the chocolate and the espresso base, without the white mousse (which makes the dish look bigger but takes away from the taste). Overall a very nice experience.

Best restaurant in the city. My family and I have been coming here for years and have never had anything less than an amazing experience. The ambience is incredible, the food is some of the best I have ever had and is consistent. Excellent customer service as well, all the waiters and waitresses are knowledgeable on the menu and wine pairings and are very personable. Don't leave without trying the sheep's milk ricotta and the grandmother's ravioli. Can't recommend it here enough!

Locanda Verde is an exceptional restaurant.  The service was perfect as was the food and wine.  We love the ambiance of the restaurant and the bar has always been incredible.  Absolutely worth a visit!

There really are no words other than... best restaurant ever. Period. We've been here many times, for both brunch and dinner. Last time there was during COVID- for brunch- very safe set up; seating is separate and heated. No matter what time you go, get the sheep's milk ricotta appetizer. I promise it'll be one of the best things you've ever eaten. (Basically every dish here will be).

Amazing food, great view, amazing staff, would highly recommend. It is on the higher-priced side however I think it's totally worth it because you really get quality food. If you're looking for great Italian cuisine definitely go here it's super cute for a date night. It's also really close to the water so you got a great view at night when the sun is setting

A beautiful trendy spot in the heart of Tribeca! I've read this is a celebrity hot spot and I can see why. A warm rustic feel combined with a classy upscale dining experience. This restaurant is great for an intimate dinner, though it can get loud on a busy night. In particular we were seated next to two very loud women! Service was excellent. Most of all the pasta was to die for!!! I can still taste the deliciousness of the pumpkin pasta I had. A great vegetarian option. The cheesecake was decent for dessert. Pricing is on the higher end with most dishes starting at $29 and up. I'd return just for the pasta alone!
at the heart of tribeca. ordered lemon ricotta pancakes, steak tartare piemontese, scampi and grits. everything was good.

Love love love Locanda Verde! By far my favorite spot for brunch whenever I head to the city.  Must always start off with the Sheep's Milk Ricotta for the table and enjoyed a sampling of standouts including the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (so yum!), Frittata Capresse & Soft Scrambled Eggs Crostino. Delicious foods is equally matched with attentive, caring service which always makes us feel like valued customers. Have made multiple visits during the pandemic to support one of our all time favorite restaurants.

Lovely oasis of calm in TriBeCa.  I have had lunch and breakfast here over time, and in each instance the food, service and atmosphere were pleasing, and consistently good.  One of the places I look forward to frequenting when I am in NY.
Loved our corner table inside as too humid to sit outside. Delicious crab pasta with very light sauce was amazing! Great service, great music. Lively and fun !

I stopped into Locanda Verde for lunch today. I work across the street and it's been on my list to try for a while. The place is small and you need a reservation for a table for lunch although bar seating is available for walk-ins. I only ordered one thing - grandmother's ravioli. My grandmother actually did make ravioli. And this dish was nothing like what grandma would do. The ravioli itself is miniature in size - a square of just over 1 inch per side. You get a bowl of only 10 or 12. There is the tiniest bit of meaty something in the center - probably the size of a peanut m&m. The meat itself isn't particularly tasty. And this is $28. Grandma's ravioli should be large and well stuffed, delicious and served in a bowl you can't hope to finish. 0 for 3. On the plus side the tomato sauce was delicious. But I'll save my $28 in the future and I recommend you do too.

Ricotta as everyone says is a must. Otherwise, just okay menu. Nothing wrong just not my jam. Not as flavorful as I'd like and overly salty. For that perhaps a tad overpriced but I can't hate on DiNero. Think their menu changes fairly often so worth a shot! Also, very welcoming staff so can't complain too much.

I got the Uovo Modenese and my friend got the shrimp and grits, and any course following the ricotta for brunch is paled by its flavors. I came to Locanda Verde on a Monday night. We made a reservation in advance and I'm glad we did because it was crowded with people waiting when we arrived. They have nice Italian wines by the glass. They allow you to taste the wine before they pour it, even when ordering only a glass, which I appreciated. To start, my boyfriend and I shared the blue crab crositini which had tomato compote and jalapeños on top. It was delicious and a really generous portion of crab. Then we shared the lamb meatball sliders. They were delicious. For my entree, I ordered the paccheri pasta which was made in a ragu sauce and provolone. It was amazing. My boyfriend had the orecchiette which was made with a duck sausage, beans in a red sauce. It was also delicious. We were really impressed with the food. The service was also really accommodating and attentive.  I can't wait to try more of their menu!

Thankfully my main entree the shrimp and grits was perfectly portioned. Everything here definitely has a unique take on it. Service is good but not great. Timing is off as they wanted to bring our entrees way too soon after we got the pastry assortment and there just wasn't any room on the table.

BE AWARE! When making reservations at this restaurant's website you will have the option of indoor/patio. Your confirmation email will not reflect your choice nor will the restaurant uphold the reservation you made. Basically, you get there and you are at their mercy!! Indoor or no table! Latest strategy by Reserve and restaurants like Locanda Verde to force people to sit indoor while not following the 25% capacity rule!! I'm all for supporting restaurants during this difficult time and have done so throughout this difficult year but I refuse to be bullied into where I sit....especially when I made the conscious decision to sit outdoors!!

As a big fan of Andrew Carmellini and someone who had dined at the restaurant in the past, I was saddened at how the food had fallen.  In fairness, I could not tell how much of my experience last night was due to a more widespread and partly understandable "coming-back-from-Covid" recovery - one in which the restaurant, the people in the kitchen and the people front of house, are all still getting back on the saddle. With that however, the decline in experience was highly noticed. Focaccia Napoletana arrived tepid and soggy. A cacio e pepe was as though the chef over-salted the pasta water and forgot that the cheese used is inherently salty. The garlic chicken flavor was ok but lacked the crispiness afforded by a good last few minutes in the over (it was JUST cooked through). The highlight was Evan, the wine guy, who was welcoming, informed and genuinely passionate about Sicilian whites. I am so sorry to say that the whole experience seemed soulless, a hustle and bustle of machine-like motions designed to get food, in whatever form, to the diners. I know Carmellini's work and what he and his restaurant's are capable of. As a native Italian, I am hopeful they can take feedback on and double down on attention and focus returning to the days of more sublime experiences.

The bathroom is downstairs which is a little trek but it was expansive, spotless and beautiful. Incredibly overpriced place with second-class food and miserable drinks. Also how about some gas heaters when its 50 degrees outside? We had a fairly good dinner here. The warm focaccia was delicious, as were the lamb sliders. The octopus was one of the best we've ever had. Pastas were on both sides of the coin - the daily special seafood ravioli just didn't seem to meld and we forced ourselves to finish, while the paccheri left us wanting more. Desserts were the same - mango cheesecake was a taste and texture miss (though the sorbet was perfection) while the strawberry tart and violet gelato was a taste symphony. Pricy for small portions as well.

Locanda Verde is a cute little brunch spot in TriBeCa! Their Scampi and Grits were especially delicious.  My tip: definitely go for the tiramisu for dessert. It has a deconstructed look to it but tastes AMAZING!!!!

I have been to NYC a handful of times the past few years and have tried numerous Italian restaurants across Manhattan, and I must say Locanda Verde is overall a great restaurant. Was able to get a reservation for 4 at 8PM on a Wednesday the night before. The restaurant is attached to a fancy boutique hotel in TriBeCa - my fiancé saw Ryan Reynolds here a couple of weeks ago, apparently him and Blake Lively were staying at the hotel  We ordered the Cod, Squid Ink Pasta, Malfadine verde, and Tagliatelle. We ordered Ricotta as an appetizer. Everything was delicious, although the cod originally was too salty. The chef made us a new one and it was perfect. The restaurant didn't charge us for the cod dish, either. Overall excellent service, delicious food, and pretty decor. Would highly recommend!

While out for a walk we cam upon Locanda and stopped for brunch.  A bit pricey, but the food was excellent.  My wife had oatmeal - and I swear it was the best all time. It had apricots and ... "almond crumble".  Whatever, we would go back just for that.  Atypcially, I ordered pancakes.   Blueberry, ricotta, with Lemon curd, and maple syrup on the side.  Both dishes were outstanding.  We were in the middle of an hours-long walk around town so we skipped alcoholic beverages, but diners at outdoor tables all around us ordered them, they looked great, and everyone seemed to be pleased.  Our first visit, but we will definitely go back for another brunch, or even better when indoor dining is once again available.  Really nice looking bar inside.  Tables outside were all socially distanced with plexiglass separators.

The mushroom focaccia appetizer they give away here is better than most dishes you'll get at most places. It's honestly incredible and if it came with the cocktails I'd be drinking here all the time. But alas you must order a full meal. Luckily, that meal is unlikely to disappoint. My ragu (I forget which sort of pasta) was flavorful and the texture of the pasta itself was spot on. Don't miss the sheeps milk ricotta appetizer, it's tartness feels like an italian interpretation of labne.

Took my wife here for her birthday. Great atmosphere and the food was unique and delicious. We made a reservation a week in advance and got seated right away. Service was top notch. Next time we are in the neighborhood we will be back.

We stopped into this restaurant given its 4-star reviews after a long day of walking the NYC streets.  It has a beautiful appearance and was initially an okay experience.  We waited at the bar with wine and one of the bartenders asked if we would like a spot at the bar for dinner if that opened up.  Given how hungry we were, we accepted.  After about 30 minutes we were told that they had space for us at the other end of the bar.  En route we take our name off the dining room list only to find on arrival to the other end that there is only one barstool.  We were then told that when others left that we would be seated together.  After what seemed like an eternity of waiting and another glass of wine later we decided to check on the dining room wait with the host saying that he would "do what I can" despite there being multiple empty tables and approaching closing time.  Needless to say we were never seated in the dining room.  Finally, a spot opened up at the bar.  The service after this was horrendous.  Not once did the bartenders (who were overhead saying that there were a lot of open tabs and that it would be a good night for them) check on us to see if we would like more wine, ask if they could get us anything or even ask how the food tasted (2 apps and 2 entrees).  The person bringing food from the kitchen seemed to be the most pleasant person there!  The food was fine but nothing to write home about.  However, perhaps we were jaded by the incredibly poor service. While we were visiting, I can promise you that we will never return to this restaurant again and have been sharing the word with all friends that may visit the city. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere as Laconda Verde is not deserving of your attention or money.

I gave a 3 stars because the ambiance averaged out the disappointment with the meal. I had heard so much about this place, but wasn't so impressed-- the mushroom crostini was decent but a bit salty. The skate was very bland and the dessert- apricot cheesecake was just off. The waiter did recommend a great red wine, which made the experience much better. Overall, great ambiance and I would go back for drinks, but was disappointed about the food.

This was an incredible New York and even worldly experience. The wine condesceur knew his repertoir by heart with the descriptions on point. The dishes we tried were so exquisite we felt sad when they finished. The fine touches are what make a great experience and "Locanda Verde" is a work of art!

Wow. I'm at a loss for words. This restaurant is incredible. Visited on a Saturday night (call waaaay ahead of time for a reservation) at 9:45 PM. Was seated right away as we had a reservation. Upon being seated, I finally had a chance to look around the restaurant and appreciate the ambiance. Dimly lit, intimate, and perfect for the occasion I was there for- anniversary dinner. We started with the ricotta and crostini, and the octopus. Both were simply amazing. Must order in my opinion. Their house Prosecco was absolutely delicious as well. For our main entree, we split a mafaldine verde pasta. This was so tasty and flavorful. The ground sausage was what made the dish spectacular IMO, but both the sauce and noodles were excellent. We finished with a stone fruit cheesecake, which was, again, spectacular. This restaurant is magnificent and we will definitely be back in the future!

This place has such an authentic upscale Italian dining atmosphere. The menu includes rabbit lasagna, lamb, blue crab, pork loin, bone marrow to name a few and the desserts are decadent and beautiful.

Beyond delicious - worth every penny. Amazing cocktails, fresh pasta, and outstanding service.

Our server seemed annoyed at first that we wanted to share our appetizer, pasta, and main. Once we ordered wine, she warmed up. She was helpful to our friend who has proof allergies and identified foods he could eat by speaking with the chef. We loved the sheep milk ricotta and found it to be easily shared by the table of four. The cruising are small bites,serving two only. Not being big eaters, we were happy to share a pasta , lamb chops, and dessert, all of which were delicious. When the lamb arrived, we realized the server had never asked how we want it cooked. It was very rare, rarer than I would have liked but very tender and flavorful. We shared three desserts between four of us and agreed the pistachio cake was the best. The budino was disappointing for the price and expertise of this level of restaurant. We won" t hurry back.

Fantastico! Thoroughly enjoyed the food, service and ambiance. Portions aren't skimpy, but also not overdone. Crostini with ricotta is so simple and yet so good... I'm a sucker for grilled bread!  The procuitto was a huge serving and melted in my mouth. White veal bolognese OMG, so good. The beauty in it all was the simplicity. Which is actually hard to do well.

Do not come here without a reservation. We came on a random Tuesday night, and when they said 1.25 hours...they meant it. It is a scene in there. What I didn't like was that we couldn't sit at the bar and have a drink because they had a "wait" for bar stools so people could eat there. Come on, I'm dressed up, in heels and I don't want to stand around for 1 hour. I know... I should have had a reservation. Ok, enough about this, let's talk about the good stuff. Blue crab toast is an absolute must! The steak tartare is a large portion and perfectly served and full of flavor. The chitarra was one of the best pastas I've ever had. The yolk of the egg mixed into the pasta is perfection. We also got the Malfatti but I can't remember it too much because it was truly out shadowed by the chitarra!
