I didn't much like your eggs Benedict, but that riccota with the burnt toast? Wow. I didn't bother saving room for the blueberry pancakes, which were also good sure sure but, that ricotta....? Seriously good.
No comment

This is a place where it's probably better to not hear anything about before going to.  The good and bad thing about Locanda Verde is nothing stood out, good or bad.  We ordered the Blue Crab crostini, Sheep's Milk Ricotta crostini, and Steak Tartare.  All three were of good quality.  In particular, I enjoyed the Blue Crab crostini.  However, none of it was all that sparkling.  As my entree, I tried the Girandole with Duck Sausage.  I was a bit disappointed by the flavor of the dish.  It was cooked well for the most part, but  the parts were better than the sum.  I just never got the feeling that the ingredients meshed together.  It also could have used more seasoning to bring out more flavor.  All in all, it was a decent dinner that was supposed to be much more.
One of my top 5 fave restaurants in the city. Lamb meatball sliders and the Sheeps milk ricotta are must haves! A great brunch with great bloody Mary's as well.

Loved it.  Went for lunch with colleagues.  Sheep's Milk Ricotta and Lamb Meatball Antipasti were so good.  Spaghetti All' Amatriciana and Porchetta Sandwich Secondi were great.  Pear & Ginger crisp was to die for.  I haven't been out for a meal where I really liked all of my courses in a long time!  Hip bistro-ish vibe in Tribeca, but cozy and relaxed somehow.  Good service.  Definitely would go back.

Let me start my saying I've dined here before with my family several times and aside from the most uncomfortable chairs in NYC it has been a pleasant experience. That ended today however when I had made a reservation a couple weeks in advance for 4. When we arrived we were sat at a table that could not and should not seat 4 adults. I asked the server for a possible relocation, to which she replied 'it'll be the same table somewhere else" . This was a lie. We asked about a 4 top next to us and another and also 2 2 tops. She was dumbfounded.  They were all empty. This was my daughters birthday and to be sat at a 4 top that couldn't accommodate 3 ppl is an embarrassment.  There was no remedy by Mitch who apparently couldn't be bothered as he said nothing as we left.  I spoke with Peter, who apparently was the manager, after we'd left and appraised him of what transpired. He was kind enough but we had already had a birthday brunch ruined. There was nothing I wanted except to relay to him what occurred and maybe retrain his front office staff how to accommodate in his absence.  In my opinion it was an easy fix that was overlooked by a server and Mitch that didn't feel the need to make a simple change on our behalf. Alas, we went to another establishment but I wanted to share our experience and maybe you would consider somewhere else before you book this restaurant.

I just had lunch with a client at Locanda Verde. I was blown away! After viewing the menu online I can't say I was too excited. Well, once I tasted the Pumpkin Agnolotti I was in heaven. It was the perfect amount of sweetness... so goooood. I'm definitely coming back. I hear you have to book dinner reservations weeks in advance so I recommend you do so immediately!
No comment
No comment
Heavenly. There is no doubt you will leave this restaurant in a spectacular mood after having a phenomenal meal. Come hungry, leave happy. Great pace, great service.
Had the blue crab appetizer, the special halibut entree and a side of broccoli rabe.  Everything was amazing.  Service was great.  Ended up being around ~66 incl tax and tip.

Very trendy restaurant, nice atmosphere....it was packed full on a Wednesday night. Food and service was great and everything is homemade right there. Started with the arugula salad and had the halibut as my entree, which was delicious! The mint and vanilla bourbon gelato was also great.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I met some friends here on my last visit to New York and I was pleasantly surprised.  I can be a bit picky when it comes to Italian food but this place was amazing.  The decor was beautiful in a warm and elegant way without being stark or pretentious.  The server was friendly and professional and helped me pick out the perfect wine to go with my meal.  The food was delicious and it was an all around great experience.  The hotel it's in,The Greenwich, looks lovely as well.  Can't wait for my next visit.  Still thinking about my meal.

Great ambience, food, and service. We sat at the bar for look brunch and our bartender was awesome! We ordered the uova modenese, lemon ricotta pancakes with bacon and potatoes as sides. I ordered the campagnola which was a refreshing drink.
No comment
No comment

Great food but small portions for the price. But it is a nice experiential type of place. Friends invited us- they're into these places. I wouldn't recommend it though unless you're into these types of places.
I recently came back here for lunch, and I just want to say that the sheeps milk ricotta is worth all the hype... pretty sure it's ruined all other ricottas for me
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came for brunch, without reservations..had to wait quite a bit. The food was good, I normally do not love pancakes but the Lemon Ricotta pancakes are a MUST! they are kid friendly. Everything we ordered was quite fresh. I would like to come back for dinner.

we came here for breakfast during a recent trip, and it was excellent. My boyfriend wanted to go back everyday! We got the polenta waffles and hazelnut french toast, as well as the pastry sampler. The olive oil coffee cake is SOOOO good- a must try. The hazelnut french toast is also pretty amazing. Everything was pretty tasty though. And the decor was nice as well- an excellent breakfast/brunch type place. Next time I'm in town, I'm sure I'll be back, but in the meantime, can we get one in LA??

Loved it for dinner this fall, went back for breakfast this week. The pastries are 5-star and that ricotta with truffled honey and burnt orange toast was phenomenal. Husband's frittata was a good one, but not as amazing. Sticky bun wasn't the one I'd heard all about, but was good. Cider donut was incredible. For breakfast, I'd go back and eat more pastries and coffee.
No comment
Love that the menu changes daily. Amazing foccacia bread. Pretty good ricotta and awesome lamb sliders. Ordered the eggplant ravioli which was fresh and tasty, but small.

Definitely your prototypical expensive, trendy place with borderline yuppies ordering "whatever grosses the most revenue" - true quote overheard. But the food talks the talk. The ricotta, sweet Jesus the ricotta. Get it. The only thing that sucks about this place is you have to order so many plates of food because the pickins are slim, and each plate is outrageously priced. I'd give it 3 stars if I had to pay for it.
No comment

With the incredible choice of excellent restaurants with great service in the city, I don't think myself and my fiends will come again to this one.... The quality of the food was not out-of-ordinary, the service was impersonal and slow (with lots of mistakes) and generally the young staff had a very bad attitude and poor manners.
No comment
Loved the food, energy and decor. Modern and fun although just a little loud. Trout was amazing. Service was a little rushed but more likely because it was Xmas eve.
Definitely liked this place a lot.  Friendly service.  Good pasta!

I am a steak lover.  That being said, I would come here for 2 things, the garlic chicken and the tiramisu gelato dessert.  Their garlic chicken is so amazing.  It's a whole chicken butchered to be flat and cooked with a brick I think.  Eat bite was so juicy and deliscious.  The only thing I think would improve it was if the skin was crisper but that is such a minute detail compared to the overall entree.  The second reason to come here is the tiramisu surprise.  It's tiramisu re-imagined as a gelato dessert and it will blow your mind because it's so good.  Here's a hint... mascapone gelato...Go.  Maybe I'll bump into you because I'm going there much more often now.

Such a charming Italian place in Tribeca. We loved it. My wife and I visited NY recently from San Diego and stayed in the greenwich in Tribeca. Locanda Verde is attached and what a lucky coincidence. We had breakfast here 3 times and dinner twice. Oh, and a lunch. We had several of the pasta dishes, they were great. The decor is just great. The staff very friendly. Nice wine list. The first night, we had just flown in, sat down at maybe 10. The waitress helped us pick a lovely Italian red to go with our meals and our wonderful week in NY was on.

Friendly staff and nicely prepared Italian food makes this a good place for lunch. Although a little pricey for a mid-day meal the ravioli was delicious and the broccoli raab sausage grinder with ricotta was a surprisingly nice sandwich.  It was a nice late lunch/early dinner. Beware the drink prices though, they were outrageous (8 oz glass of Coke was 5.00 and there are NO free soft drink refills). Overall it was probably our best meal In a weekend trip to the city that consisted of 3 sit down meals.

This is based on sanitary. While i was almost done with my spagetti, i found a piece of scrub sponge inside my spagetti......i told my waittress about it and they handled nicely. They gave us an apology and spagetti was on them along with free dessert. The food was good but i am not sure if i want to go back though..but the service was great
No comment

My wife and I went here for her 30th birthday and we were not disappointed. The ricotta cheese was absolutely amazing! The blue crab was very good as well but we kept talking about the ricotta cheese. The environment is very exciting and a drinks are quite tasty. I'm hoping to get back here in the next month or so.
One of the best restaurants in the city. Great vibe. Delicious food. Good location. Well priced and creative wine list. Helpful staff. Love the duck entree and ricotta appetizer
No comment

I had a work lunch here recently, and enjoyed the entire dining experience. The waitress was extremely attentive. We also added an extra order of the crostini (they were so good), and it came quickly, so as not to disturb the flow of the meal. I ordered the pappardelle for my main. The serving was perfect for lunch-I felt full, but not sleepy, a delicate balance when we go to Italian restaurants for lunch. For dessert, I got the pistachio cake, which frankly was a little dry. Next time, I will try the tiramisu, which looked amazing!
No comment

It was a windy, raining, bitterly cold day when I trekked down to TriBeCa for brunch @ LV. The restaurant was a warm, aromatic cocoon, and so we indulgently lingered over the check a little longer. Speaking of check, this place ain't cheap. Yes, you're getting top notch ingredients, prepared by skilled chefs and served by professional staff; but you may feel that your portions are a little skimpy for the price, and you aren't alone. That said, the tomato sauce in my scampi and grits brunch entree (which should really be called poached eggs with sausage and tomato sauce) occupied my thoughts for the rest of the day...they should sell that stuff by the gallon. All I lacked was a piece of crusty bread to sop up the last puddle of sauce -- next time I'll ask for it, but better yet, they'd anticipate the need and serve some bread with the dish.

We kicked off the meal with the Sheep's Milk Ricotta crostini, which was multiple thumbs up good! The sea salt, herbs and oil really provided texture to the soft cheese and bread. Locanda Verde also gave us some bruschetta which had thin tomatoes and pesto - it packed a lot of flavor for not looking like it did and was fluffy to the bite. And for the piece de resistance I split the garlic chicken for two, which had vegetables and potatoes. If a restaurant can do chicken well it is an indicator to me that they can do everything else and boy did Locanda Verde deliver. The garlic was still on the skin of the chicken so the flavor and moisture were contained and the chicken was effortless to cut into. The house wine was fantastic and we drank it up like water. No complaints on service and for NY the price wasn't so bad for the high caliber of meal we had.

Robert De Niro's Italian eatery but despite the celeb factor, the food is surprisingly good, very cool décor, and casual trendy scene for all ages. Family style sharing - plates are good sizes but not too huge as some reviews led me to believe. Among four people, we had the Sheep's milk ricotta crostini and wild mushroom crostini, burrata, lamb meatball sliders, smoked duck terrina, Fonduta Ravioli, Wood-Fired Pork Chop, and Grilled Branzino. Sorbet flavors were unique... all very tart though, preferred gelato selections
Best dining experience I've had in the city in quite some time. Fantastic service and food was solid. Sheep's milk ricotta, highly recommend it. Great coffee.

From the crostini to the pasta and then for some, the duck, all were very pleased with the food.  Our waiter was very nice and the sommelier helpful in choosing a great crisp white. If I have any "criticism" it would be with the quick, uneven service. Waitstaff did not seem to care who ordered what and in what order......the plates arrived and placed "wherever" and not necessarily in order but seemingly what made sense to the kitchen and not the guests. They were also very quick to remove your plates when some were still eating.  Being a native New Yorker - I get its about turning the tables, but when you are spending $500 on a meal - they should better align the quality of service. If I want quick, I'll go to a diner.

The restaurant itself is absolutely superb. Amazing food, great service, and nice decor..can't go wrong! Only downside of our night was that we sat adjacent to the bar area which is a totally over-hyped bar scene full of pretentious matchy matchy necktie pocket-square dudes trying to pick up girls. Although we did overhear some pretty memorable conversations, the crowd could be obnoxious at times, but everything else is rock solid 5 stars.

Had breakfast here on a Saturday morning, and it was OK. The food was tasty - had some poached eggs with a tomato hollandaise and sausage hash - no complaints on the dish at all. But overall the restaurant felt dark and depressing - which isn't how  I want to start my day but perhaps it suits some people? The service was on the minimal side. Overall, nothing here was terrible but I can't find a compelling enough reason to go back for breakfast or brunch. Maybe dinner is the way to go here...

Went for lunch and was pretty impressed. The ricotta was good, but I think it is a little overhyped--not mind-blowing. I had the orata and it was really good. The skin was cripsy and had great flavor. Had an order of potatoes that was huge, and I thoroughly enjoyed the seasoning and crispness. While everything was good, it was overpriced for the portions and glad it was a work lunch. Derek Jeter was there, which was cool as well.
Love the area. Really nice restaurant and  food was great.  Cool to hear this was Robert De Niro's place.
No comment

We arrived at this hot spot for brunch with a party of four with doubts of getting a table. After a short wait, we were seated in this lively, beautiful space and were greeted by our lovely waitress. The menu had many options from brunch items to sandwiches. I ordered the prawns, poached eggs and grits. DELICIOUS! My son ordered the same as I. Our friends each ordered a magnificent salad. The wine list is great as are the selections for "brunch like" cocktails. Great people watching.

We came here for brunch and it was a fantastic meal. I tried the breakfast stromboli, which I've never had before. It was phenomenal. You could taste a hint of sourness in the dough from the yeast which complemented the egg, sausage, and spinach perfectly. We also had the lemon ricotta blueberry pancakes which were amazing, though they were served without maple syrup (but it was provided when we asked). The servers were pretty aloof as others have mentioned, but once they put the bread down in front of me, I stopped caring. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Maybe it was over-hyped for me...but I've been told by several people that this is their favorite restaurant in Tribeca. I was expecting to be wowed. Eh. It was definitely over priced and SO LOUD! I went with my mom and we sat directly across the table...we could hardly hear each other. They also seated us on a table that was sort of on a corner where waiters and people would knock into your chair as they passed. There were so many people at the bar, the noise was way way overboard. I had an arugula salad and ordered a fish dish (it was a while ago so I forget exactly which one). Both were good but I just wasn't blown away, especially for the price. AND the service was very slow..probably because it was so busy, but still. I give 2 stars because the hype needs to be drastically corrected....not a showstopper.

It took me forever to get a decent reservation at this restaurant. This place must be phenomenal for it to be that difficult to eat here. The restaurant is a nice, classy establishment. The service is extremely professional, and the food, while not phenomenal, is good. My lamb looked like it was severely undercooked. I usually get my steaks rare, but I didn't know if eating lamb this rare was safe. I ate it anyway, and it was moist, tender, and quite tasty. That was last night and I'm not sick yet, so yay! Overall a good experience, except at the end of our meal we felt really rushed. They wanted to herd us out quickly to make room for the next guests. The waitstaff was cleaning our table before we were even able to get up and leave. While it was a nice dinner, we probably won't come back.
No comment

Was there two months ago for dinner and was actually impressed.  Lots of times I find that restaurants in Manhattan are overrated and overpriced.  Portions were perfect, flavors were unique and service was friendly.  I have recommended it to friends ever since.
No comment

Came here during the middle of the week during happy hour and it was already filled with suits.  The restaurant is nice and has a dark brown rich tone to the decor.  We ordered the sheep's milk ricotta (yummmm), papperdelle pasta, and wood-fired pork chop.  We were all def satisfied.
No comment
No comment

Been there for lunch a few times since my last review and I have to note that they make the greatest eggplant parm hero of all time.  And that's really saying something in a city full of great eggplant parm sandwiches.  They add an egg on top of it which makes it just incredibly creamy.  A must-eat.
No comment

My meal here was without flaws, which is very difficult to accomplish! Such a great neighborhood joint...Mario Batali and his family walked in when we were dining, and they seem to be whisked away to a private table...
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty good Italian food, except there seemed to be something just slightly off about everything. The appetizers are very small, and when my bolognese arrived, it was pretty lukewarm andthen got cold quite quickly. Was fine, but I wouldn't necessarily come back.
No comment
No comment

Love the italian food and restaurant space! All the food I've ordered was excellent and delicious! Great ppl watching in trendy TriBeCa. I've benn here 3 times and the food has always been a hit! Always busy so get there early or get reservation.

Beautiful space, food I had was ok but very filling. The pasta my cousin had was pretty good and it looked like the steak tartar was good too that my friend had!  I think we had some type of chocolate dessert that was also delicious.

I love this restaurant.  It's great for special occasions and so far I've been very impressed with both brunch and dinner.  It's beautiful inside, and it's nice and spacious because of the TriBeCa neighborhood.  The menu changes seasonally but also keeps some of the winners always on.  The sheeps milk riccota is a must order, along with one of the pastas.  It's a little difficult to get a reservation, but I've most enjoyed my experiences for an early brunch or weeknight dinner before the crowds get too intense.

Great for brunch or dinner.  They do both their savories and sweets very well.  I've never been disappointed with their spaghetti all'amatriciana, ricotta pancakes or soft scrambled eggs, but my favorite by far is the fire roasted garlic chicken.  It's so good that I think I can eat it for breakfast, lunch or dinner!

Incredible brunch if you can get a reservation.  Come with one friend and grab a bar seat.    If you are an eggs Benedict fan, the Ouvo Modenese is simply the best you will have.  This is the place I go to in NYC if I'm craving an eggs Benedict - pretty scene is just an add-on with the food as the star attraction.
their bloody mary is a meal in itself. That and some european style scrambled eggs and i'm set for brunch!!!
Spectacular food, perfect service, excellent wine selection. Perfect for special occasions, that's for sure .... recommend making those occurrences happen on a frequent basis .... fun place to be.

Locanda Verde translates to 'Green Inn'. This is *not* my favourite place for brunch, but it's okay. I had a latte, poached eggs on a bed of sausage hash with toast and a side of bacon (very healthy...not!). This place is a bit on the pricey side, but the venue is very nice and the service is swift and courteous. I have only ever eaten here at brunch so I can't comment on it, but everything looks good quality - the coffee beans are Illy.

Total disappointment.  Terrible service and the food was awful.  We waited nearly 45 mins for a medium rare NY strip and when it was finally served it was rare and inedible.  The crab crostini tasted like watery frozen crab meat and was flavorless, and the asparagus side dish we ordered was nothing special and something I could whip up at home in minutes.  Very pretentious place and it struck me as one of those restaurants where everyone pretends to like it because they think they should or because they are following the crowd, when in reality the food really stinks.  It is a pretty place though, that much I will give them.  But the food and service were very poor and we will never go back.
No comment
Excellent  service, wonderful food and great Tribeca location.   Perfect business lunch or happening afterwork setting.  My new Tribeca go to.  Expected hype and instead got superb!
No comment

The reason why I give this place 4 stars is because the service was impeccably good.  We walked into this place with no reso and just decided to get some food at the bar.  The bartenders were very quick to ask us if we needed anything even though the place was packed!  The wait was kinda long but it was worth the wait.  The blue crab crostini was awesome.  The lambsliders were melt in your mouth good!  The mushroom ravioli was slightly salty but nonetheless delish.  It was a pleasant experience considering that we just walked in on a friday night.  Would def go back

Everything here is delicious! I would write more but my mouth is watering just thinking about my last meal here.  Really just go here and if you cant get a reservation, go at lunch or go when it opens on the weekend to enjoy their delicious brunch.  (getting reservations is almost impossible, my only gripe).  Also a shout out to Amy who's been my waiter a few times there, she's very nice!
No comment
Omfg...Best steak tartare I ever had. Scampish pasta was light and really good. Beets were incredible. Complimentary foccacia bread sprinkle in lemon zest was delicious.

I went to Locanda Verde couple of weeks ago.. I was very impressed..Its a gorgeous space. Ambiance was great...Now, the food,.. I have to say that ricotta crostini was great, so was salumi..the lamb sliders were very good.. Now, they bring you this delicious bread.. the only bad thing is, is that it was very oily and so was the salumi.. maybe thats why it was so good.. the lamb sliders were two tiny sliders for 12 dollars, a bit too expensive. The chicken for two was very good.. garlicky and oily but very good.. so were the roasted potatoes.. the wine list was very good and very affordable. The dessert was great too.. it was Fantasia, I think.. chocolate gelato with trimmings.. So, i will be back to try some pasta...

Five stars across the board. You walk into this place and it's like you walked onto a movie set. Yes, I understand that DeNiro is involved in the ownership, but this place rocks from the appearance to the food and to the drinks....I intend to visit this place on my next visit to New York.

A must go to on any trip to NYC.  All four people at my table thought it was one of the best brunches we have ever had.  The ricotta is really that good and worth being written up so many times.  The decor is also what sets this place apart from many other.  Such a good classic, yet sophisticated vibe.
The pasta is some of the best in the city. More inventive recipes than just traditional style.  Solid date spot.
I went for brunch and it was great.  The Pastry Mista was amazing.  Only complaint is that the coffee was too small.....I needed more it was so good.

You talkin' to me?  This place is SERIOUS.  I felt like DeNiro was eyeing me (and his super-professional wait staff) from some distant corner.  It's dark and moody, definitely an A+ atmosphere though it can get crowded.  Food really good, wish I had the ricotta appetizer vs. the so-so crab appetizer.  Pasta was perfectly cooked, delicious, and well-portioned.  Wanna come for brunch next time, it looks awesome.
Amazing on all fronts, I just wish  the menu offered more things, but well worth.
No comment

I agree with the other reviewers that the ricotta is exceptional!  For my main lunch course, I had the lamb sandwich which was just ok.  I didn't think the lamb itself had enough flavor, but the chick pea fries that it came with were delicious!   I recommend the very delicious toffee date cake for dessert.  The cookie sampler plate was a lot of fun too.   I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, our waitress was awesome, and to top it off super cute Jason Bateman was at the table next to us.
No comment

great food for brunch and for dinner. Love the ambiance. Favorite dishes are ricotta cheese with olive oil and bread, the chicken to share, and all the pastas.  Good selection of wine.  Well trained staff and management, which I would expect in a hotel restaurant.  The only frustration is how difficult it is to find a reservation for dinner.
No comment
No comment

I think I'll stick to dinner at LV, because brunch was a little off.  Most of the food was tasty - the pastries were nice, and the ricotta was stellar - but it didn't have the "punch" of the items I'd previously enjoyed.  Plus, our server was so obviously hung over that getting milk for coffee or our check or a fork was as difficult as getting legislation passed.  I'll definitely be back, but maybe not in the AM...

Review is for brunch only - which is good to excellent, but pricey.  The tre-stelle juice, for $7, is expectedly delicious.  Pancakes were huge, over the top, and very good.  My friend's egg dish was average.  For the excellent part - the ricotta appetizer with truffle oil.  I'm not sure what they do to it, but it truly is worth the visit alone.

Spacious relaxing place for brunch, was able to walk in on a weekday.  Ordered the sheep's milk ricotta per yelpers' suggestion and it was creamy but yummy, worth a try.  Had the pumpkin agnolotti, which was very good but was small portion.  It was just enough for me though since I don't eat a lot in one sitting.  The cappuccino was a bit better than average.  Would go back.
Loved this place! Great food, nice vibe and friendly service. I especially loved the sheep's milk ricotta with fresh oregano and served with crostini. I would definitely go back!

Purpose of visit: dinner with colleagues. We were 15 minutes late for our reservation but the hostess was very kind in accommodating us. Atmosphere was lively with the dining and bar area packed. We ordered appetizers broccoli rabe and mozzarella side. The mozzarella was silky smooth and delicious. Also tried the calamari with fried jalapeno peppers. Very nice and not as spicy as you would expect. Main course was branzino with spinach. Very light and seasoned very well. Service was attentive and unobtrusive. Excellent meal and atmosphere. Bring your expense account.

Honestly, had trouble understanding why this is such a hyped up place. I went for brunch on a Sunday and it was already bustling with people who seemed pretty local. The clientele was on the older side. Although the servings were large and the food was okay, I didn't think it was anything special. Maybe I just wasn't getting the right dishes.

Yes, order the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are really interesting, not too sweet, not too heavy. Perfect for a girls' brunch. The atmosphere is sophisticated and very Tribeca. I didn't like the super high ceilings... Made the whole place feel impersonal. The decor is almost too perfect and grand for my taste. Food is so good though that I would definitely return.

Really solid food and prices that will be slightly lower than you thought.  Definitely a trendy place.  I didn't see De Niro or anything but spotted a couple recognizable faces.  Lucked out and walked prior to a Tribeca screening and even though they were booked up she found a spot for me!  I felt very lucky.
No comment

Overall, dinner here was a great experience. The atmosphere here is really wonderful. The food tastes fresh and well seasoned. I started off with the sheeps milk ricotta. It was light and fluffy but I'm not as crazy about it as everyone else was. I had the chicken for two, which was moist and given in a sizeable portion. I would definitely come back to try some of the pastas.

As good as it gets for Italian in NYC. Service is always impeccable. Wines are well chosen. Food is consistently better than most Italian in NYC. I am a food snob, but this place rates. I only wish it were easier to get a table.
No comment
Alyssa is the most amazing waitress! The food was phenomenal but the service was even better!  Request Alyssa for the best experience of your life!   Alyssa makes the food worth while
Went back again and got the malted milk chocolate or rice custard gelato.  Insane. Perfect.
No comment

Good atmosphere and service. Beer selection wasn't spectacular. Started off with the mozzarella crostino with eggplant & pesto - very good. I then had Grandma's ravioli, also delicious. Topped it off with a side of brussels sprouts for those how at least want to sound healthy. Prices were NY average, portions were on the small side.
No comment
No comment

Despite a few minor things that I think are normal at a popular location (waiting a little long for our reservation and a busy bartender having a bar-back make my dirty martini, which he had to then make over) we had a stellar experience here. The appetizers were delicious and inventive and the meal was fabulous. I love the atmosphere and the staff is experienced, friendly, and knowledgeable about what they serve. The wine list is very unique and our wine was one of the highlights of the evening. After we were seated, everything was flawless. Next time I'm in town, this will be on my list.

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! This place really does have it all, great food, location, super friendly staff and a really good vibe. I treated my parents when they came to town as my dad is a huge De Niro fan and both are lovers of all things Italian so check check on both fronts. The restaurant did not disappoint. The wine list is phenomenal and they have a killer menu too. Here are a few reccos: blue crab crostini which is to die for, buratta, lamb ragu and for dessert the choc pistachio tort plus the lemon tart. That place is simply delish!

Go! Enjoy! We did! It was late brunch at the bar. Cool and elegant. Tripe was rich and satisfying. Scampi and grits (for my date) was very good (we asked for toast to complement it). However the gingerbread dessert after our meal was divine and I think there's no point in even trying a bloody mary at countless other venues if you've tasted the spicy, balanced, mortadella-garnished Mary here.

So the food here was actually really good. I had the citrus scallops which were cooked perfectly. The goat cheese antipasta had no flavor. My big problem with this restaurant is the snotty service. The maitre d' was an uber b-tch at the beginning and end of the night. The ambiance was cozy and well decorated, but they need to hire new staff and train them to be stewards of good customer service.

The food here is superb. I had the halibut special of the day, and my vegetarian friend had the pesto pasta dish. Only fresh herbs were used in the dishes. The decor is truly unique. I would say it is an industrial, masculine, New York version of a Tuscan villa, if that makes any sense. A lot of stainless steel, tufted leather banquettes, and pendant hanging lamps. The service was prompt, efficient and knowledgeable. My only complaint is that it took us an hour and a half to be seated on a Friday night. Word to the wise: a reservation is needed, especially on weekends.
No comment
